column6: No comment

Super romantic, French cuisine in the Atlantic Ave BK area. I came with my partner for a Valentine's Day dinner/ restaurant week dinner, and we thoroughly enjoyed our meal. It's been a little while since I've been there, but we actually enjoyed our appetizers more than our entrees. Who would've though that fried lemons were delicious?! (We got it as a part of a fried sardine appetizer). The duck entree was well done as well. A great cozy space in the neighborhood for sure.
No comment
I ordered the duck and was served steak, cooked medium-well, which the waiter insisted was duck. Absurd gaslighting nonsense

I've been frequenting Brooklyn more often and am glad that I have as the food is quite good there.  French Louie is a super cute French spot that I would highly recommend for brunch.  My friend and I just ordered some appetizers versus entrees as me being me, I wanted to try multiple different things.  We got the ahi tuna, steak tartare, and chicken liver mousse.  Albeit everything didn't have a "ton of flavor" so to speak, simplicity is sometimes what you need and everything worked for me.  Would definitely go back, but probably for brunch again because the ambience is very fitting for that IMHO.
No comment
No comment
No comment
This was the best meal ever. The mussels were so different and creamy and mustardy. The fries were perfect. And this is weird but the Mayo was fresh and so delicious

Had a lovely solo lunch here. Sat at the bar and had Moules Frites, and green salad, and a couple of glasses of Sancerre. The bartender was very kind and attentive. The salad, fries, and wine were delicious, but the mussels were a bit of a miss... not because they weren't fresh, but because the sauce was not my thing: cider, sour cream, and mustard may not be the best base for a mussel broth. If they went more traditional with it, it would have been perfect.
No comment
No comment
Best brunch spot! Although their tables are soooo small we enjoy eating here! Their pastries take you to heaven and their fries are spectacular! Please check them out
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great place. Very nice atmosphere and good service. The food is good, based on good ingredients. Everything seems in high standards, but nothing really that could be described as surprising, elevation or unexpected. A good conventional option.

Love this spot! A great neighborhood french restaurant that goes beyond the traditional formula. Great steak frites but go for the less traditional dishes as well. And equally important, amazing drinks! Try this place asap.
No comment

Came here on a Friday night and sat in the back patio area, which was very well decorated and a great date night spot. Waitress was very friendly and shared a bunch of recommendations. Started with the moules which were decent. We paired that with the gougeres which were a fun little puff pastry with a nice cheese flavoring. Next we had the steak tartare, which again was pretty good, I especially appreciated the cornichons that came with it. For a main I went with the steak frites and was disappointed. Ordered medium rare and was a little overdone, but the char on the outside just gave it an overpowering burnt taste. No real flavor, no sauce to go with it, just burnt and salt. My girlfriend had the trout which was a bit better but nothing special. Overall probably wouldn't go back with all if the other options around. Maybe worth checking out for brunch or grab a drink and small bites.
No comment
Great experience! Loved our drinks and everything we tried was delicious and a combination of flavor that surprised me.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Ordered a medium steak for $48 and it was well done.  Not happy about the cost.  Restaurant gave us a free dessert but the food was overall so so.
Beautiful outdoor garden spot. Food is very good. A little pricey for neighborhood but I would definitely go again.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Wonderful restaurant! One of my favorites. The fried anchovies and lemon slices are the best things my mother has ever had.
No comment

Not super French, slightly more than the fries, slightly less than the kissing style.  Makes up for it with a capable and friendly staff, a decent and well-priced wine list, and some decent nods to French cuisine.  I would have loved some more legit offerings, but the American-friendly fare was good.  Did I mention the bartender was a doll with skills for days?  Even with a busted arm, he was slingin like a champ.  Will go back!
No comment
Good flavor, great service, very accommodating. Small portions. Will definitely be coming back, just when im not that hungry.
No comment

I and my wife absolutely love French Luie. Besides is a gorgeous looking restaurant and the food is consistently perfect...it's such a versatile operation. We want there on dates, to brunch with friends, to recover from a very tough period. It always feels solid and just perfect.
No comment
No comment

Happened to come across this place while staying in downtown Brooklyn and it was the most pleasant surprise. The food was incredible. Each bite of our dinner felt like a new experience. The different flavors and textures of the meals blended so perfectly together. We ended up coming back for brunch a few days later and once again it did not disappoint.
Great food and super friendly staff! We sat at the bar and the bartender made us the best cocktails and recommended amazing dishes.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Loved this chic and romantic spot for my birthday dinner. Started with beautiful cocktails that made us feel fancy. Hubs and I both got steak frites - him the fancy and me the bavette. We both loved the one that we ordered more. Crispy fries and perfectly dressed salad on the side. I want more.
Place is amazing. We've had brunch their twice now and each time, the food is spectacular, good atmosphere, good music and good coffee!
Absolutely delicious brunch! The caramelized French toast was delicious and the huckleberry sauce was the perfect accompaniment. Decor is stylish and the service is attentive.
No comment
No comment
Love this place!! Fantastic service - comfortable and easy- yet- good date night out vibe - great food - great service- great wine -can't wait to be back!!
No comment

I think French Louie is an excellent restaurant. I have only been there twice, but I wass impressed on both occasions. The first time I went to French Louie was during  restaurant week. My friend and I ordered the mussels, pate, and steak frites. Everything was absolutely delicious. More recently, a friend and I came for brunch and we had such a lovely time. We ordered the eggs louie (benedict) and the creme brûlée french toast and let me tell you.... that benedict was sooooooo amazing. The hollandaise and the crab tasted so yummy together. I wouldn't be mad if they added more crab to the mix though ;) The french toast was something else, so unique and delicious with the sweet blueberry preserves. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal- I'm still drooling over that benedict.

We just had lunch in the back patio on a beautiful afternoon. Service was great and the food was fabulous. French fries are memorable. The steak tartare superb and the oysters perfect. Very very comfortable spot with excellent food. I can't wait to go back.
No comment
No comment
Sister and I both ordered the Burger Royale for pickup and almost broke our teeth multiple times on significant bits of gristle. Is this bone? An aquarium rock? You decide.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place was not bad! Very limited menu because of covid, but they had a cute outdoor patio in the back. The mussels were so yummy, just slightly spicy. The steak tartare was not my favorite but it's just a preference. I got the steelhead trout and that was delicious! The skin was super crunchy and seasoned well. The waiter was very friendly and accommodating, constantly checking on us and refilling our waters.

I discovered French Louie while googling one of my other favorite Brooklyn restaurants (Buttermilk Channel). I saw the menu online and decided to try the creme brulee french toast. And let me tell you, it is SO GOOD! Cracking the top was so satisfying, and the custardy middle is what dreams are made of. The whipped cream and the blackberry (I think?) sauce were wonderful additions. Also, I am in love with their backyard area - I will definitely be back!!

Awesome family friendly and kid friendly brunch spot! Took me back to Paris if you've ever been. Great food and service especially the escargot appetizer, a definite must try! The outside seating is alittle crowded and small but overall I would highly recommend and would for sure return especially for brunch!

Weirdly not French or bistro-y at all. Not the Balthazar or Boucherie of Brooklyn by any stretch of the imagination. A very ho-hum dinner spot that  me good enough if you need a sit down experience. Pretty pricey given how mediocre the food is. The menu lacks breadth so be prepared to choose between one or two attractive options
No comment
No comment
No comment

This goes down as one of my top 10 favorite meals in NY. Not only was the food phenomenal (yes, you really should get the bananas Foster dessert) but the service was excellent. Our server Caitlin was especially wonderful, but you can tell it's a team effort to make this place so enjoyable for patrons. Already pumped to return

A lovely dinner thanks to a host who had encouraged me not to give up on getting a table. It was Saturday, the weather was good and as expected a lot of NYers were out in force for a Saturday night dinner which meant that I likely had to book a table early. Something, that I did not do. My first call to French Louie was such a positive exchange that in my mind, I was going to continue trying to get a table even though the time slot - 7:00 - that I wanted was booked. Persistence paid off as I was able to get a table for 7:15 after trying several other places and failed to get an early slot. The food was great, the atmosphere was lovely and of course the host was terrific! This is going to be my spot for French food in Brooklyn.

Have you ever had the avocado toast with pickled green tomato!!! My mouth is watering all over again.  Completely and utterly delish.  I was so upset that the tomatoes were finished.  I also had the white wine oysters .  I have to admit nothing I sampled was nothing but delicious.  The waiter was attentive and it was a good vibe just go have a cool lunch or to just hang and grab a beer.  Can't wait to visit again.
No comment

Awesome brunch today.  We had buck wheat crepes with creme fraiche and Eggs Louie, which was eggs Benedict with crab over a croissant.  This was the most amazing eggs benny I've ever had!  We topped our meal off with warm almond madeleines with orange marmalade, which was delicious.  Coffee is legit and service is super sweet.  Atmosphere is great with a nice array of 80s music playing, and our waitress was terrific!  Highly recommend!
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment

My wife and I had at dinner at French Louie's last night, what a terrible experience. We both ordered the duck confit and it took over an hour to come. When I first asked how much longer the waitress talked to the chef and told us "4 or 5 minutes more". It finally came out 15 minutes later. To add insult to injury it wasn't even very good. Th duck was dry and lacking in flavor. The accompanying lentils were easily the best part of the meal.  We will not be returning any time soon, that is for sure.
Typical French Bistro. Nice ambiance and good relaxed vibe. Had the Duck Confit and it was solid. We would return.

It's delicious, rich sauce, fresh food, next time you have a chance to have dinner again.
No comment

I've booked this restaurant for our 2nd Wedding anniversary dinner. I must say it was a perfect little spot to celebrate and local to us too. We got greeted by a very pleasant girl on our arrival and wished happy anniversary which was sweet. We got offered a table outside which was perfect as the evening was rather pleasant. We decided to celebrate with a bottle of bubbly, oysters and fois Gras to start with followed by steak and moules. The food was very tasty although the menu could have been expanded a little bit. Our waitress was excellent. The highlight of our dinner was definitely the banana ice cream profiteroles, absolutely amazing! And they served it with a candle for us to celebrate. Cute gesture. Thank you for making our evening this special.

Oh my God, French Louie was truly impressive. Superb location. Steak Tartare was really magnificent, I have tried number of things here and Steak Tartare is my favorite by far. The workers were really nice. French Louie - A great spot to stop by when you're in the area.
Have been for brunch multiple times and have really enjoyed my meal each time. The outdoor patio is well set-up for a socially distant meal from other diners.
No comment
No comment

Beautiful garden in the back for COVID safe dining. Was already one of my favorites before the pandemic and they've done everything in their power to stay open. They have serious precautions in place, menu is reduced but still delicious, as are their drinks and cocktails.

Have been here loads for a few drinks and snacks at the bar and always had a good time. But came for the first time today for brunch and sat in their absolutely beautiful garden. The smoked trout scramble was amazing, the Cincinnati Kid cocktail was delicious and the service was top notch. We didn't have the fries but the couple next to us did and they looked amazing. Such a hidden gem on dirty old Atlantic Ave
No comment
Went for brunch with a group of new friends. The backyard patio is so cute! Servers were attentive and food was spectacular. The French fries are to DIE for.

column3: Town of North Hempstead, Long Island, NY
column6: No comment

Excellent food! I'm still partial to Buttermilk Channel, but this is a solid spot for homey French food. I had the grilled trout, a side of frites and a few bites of my friend's steak frites followed by profiteroles. My entree was just amazing, and the portion was huge. Perfect fries. Didn't love dessert but I'm not a huge profiteroles person. Awesome service and ambience, too!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Stopped by during a Monday night and ordered a steak & frites. It's just mediocre, not bad but definitely not very good. Won't come again as there are many better options.
Nothing to write home about. Came here during restaurant week and now my stomach hurts.

More impressed with brunch than dinner here (taken into account the price). The outdoor seating is very relaxing and less noisy. Every dish - eggs Louie, French toast, or the side of potatoes and cappuccino - although simple and traditional, is executed amazingly well, with a touch of their own spin. The Eggs Louie are served on a croissant - a perfectly crispy one - and the crab flavor is in perfectly. The French toast - crispy on top, soft inside, served with delicious huckleberry jam, and isn't too sweet - was delightful. The potatoes were crispy, well seasoned, flavorful and not too starchy. Service was fast and friendly. Plus it's possible to get a reservation ahead of time. Will be back!
No comment
No comment
No comment

We had brunch here, 5 people. Quite a nice place, the air conditioning needs to be stronger though. We ordered fried chicken, egg Louie, French toast, mimosa and etc. Fried chicken really had a lot of food, French toast also had a large portion, it is soft and creamy. I highly recommend egg Louie, it has pitched eggs, croissant, and very fresh, soft vegetable
No comment
No comment

Extraordinarily awful. We just had the Thanksgiving pre-fixe dinner and the service and the food were both bad. I've never had a server bluntly ask "Did you make any progress?" after sitting with the menu for 5 minutes and with no explanation of the menu at all. The food was weird. Best part were the oysters. The Autumn salad was bland and the mussels were totally strange. They were really cold and covered in a clammy mustard sauce. The Steelhead Trout and the Short rib entree were just ok and the dessert was average at best.  The host and the food runner were the only professional part of this dismal holiday meal. Really bummed this wasn't better.
No comment

No comment
No comment

A great French bistro with super friendly staff and an amazing patio!  Food is good quality and really tasty.  It's perfect for every occasion - a drink at the bar, a nice dinner, and weekday lunch, or brunch.  Always a good choice!
No comment
No comment
No comment

It's all a matter of what you're looking for.  For anyone outside of New York, French Louie is a perfect spot and has very good food.  I would encourage you to go.  For New Yorkers, I would still encourage you to go, but New Yorkers may also understand my frustration in posting this review.  Through the pandemic, French Louie remained open and offered an escape--one that a friend of mine and I took advantage of.  Even through the winter, we would support French Louie because we wanted to make sure it survived the pandemic and thrived on the other side.  This is true to the point that even now, the waiters know us and know our order before we put it in.  But that brings me to the disappointment I had today when we were rushed out because there was a line outside.  I get it--there is money to be made.  But it was a place we thought recognized what we had provided in tougher times and hoped in an odd way it would be reciprocated on the other side.  So it goes.  Despite the two star review, it is a great spot.  Just disappointing for New Yorkers who were there in the worst of times.  Fortunately, there are other spots close by for us!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I must agree with the masses of others that this restaurant deserves a 4. All the food we had was good, we ordered the mussels, soup, steak  frites, and profiteroles. The service was very attentive. The tables are packed close together, so you'll be cozy with the neighbors!

The food was everything I hoped for and more. Delicious. All of it. Great music selection for the ambiance. The wine was tasty and I would have had an entire bottle but it was a week night. I got a customized bag for my take away Dessert which was adorable. And the staff was sooo nice :)

So glad we found this place!! Me and my wife were looking for a new brunch spot and we decided to give this place a try. WOW! We ordered the burger royal, eggs Louie and the creme brûlée French toast. Let me start off with the French toast; hands down the BEST French toast I've ever had!! It's not even fair. I can write a book just about that French toast and it still wouldn't do it justice. Just try it, and you will see what I mean. The burger was prefectures cooked and juicy, the fries were amazing, and the eggs Louie was to die for! To top it off the service was great. Everyone was polite and welcoming. But anyway....why are you still reading this review!!! Get over there ASAP and get that French toast!!
No comment

This restaurant was so romantic. From the outside, it didn't look like much but their interior and patio was amazing! We made a same day reservation for restaurant week and we were seated right away on arrival which was great. They didnt have immediate seats in the patio but we were seated in a corner booth which was super cozy and romantic. Our waiter was extremely attentive all night. The food was amazing. For appetizers we chose the steak tartare and the moules, both of which were seasoned perfectly and tasted amazing. My steak frites entre was a massive serving, I actually gave half of it to my boyfriend. He got the swordfish which was very moist and tasty. We got both of the desserts, the banana profiteroles and the mint gateau. The banana profiteroles were super light and delicious! While the mint gateau was very tasty, the chocolate was a little too heavy for our tastes. Overall, we had an amazing experience and I would love to come back for more!
No comment
No comment

Our family came here to celebrate Chinese New Year's Eve, and we had a absolutely great time.  Food was great: the whole grilled fish was fantastic, my rainbow trout had a crispy skin yet tender meat, and my husband loved his steak.  I ordered a cocktail and was happy with the heavy dose of alcohol. The service was non-intrusive yet attentive.  Best of all, my kid was loving the burger on the kids menu and the desert that she generously shared with us (I mean, I paid for it after all?!).  So when Marie has a good time, everyone in the family has a good time!

Kinda disappointed. I came during restaurant week but I was surprised that there wasn't a bread basket or fresh pepper offered during the course of the meal. The salade de tomates was delicious and "Touraine" wince was very fresh but just a little let down by other expectations.
No comment

The Hot Toddy was a great drink to have for this cold weather. The heated patio area was thoughtfully and simply executed during this Covid Era (you still need to just warmly, it was 20 degrees outside that night). The restaurant had a great welcoming ambiance. I felt the food pairing was masterfully done, I had the soup and duck confit. My friend had the special for the night which was surf and turf, from the way she finished the plate I believe it was greatly satisfying for her. We did have dessert at the end, the chocolate tarte and house made ice cream ( not wise to have in the cold but still delicious). I will definitely come here again. We also had fries, they were okay.
No comment

Stopped here for drinks on a Monday night, as it was late and most places were already closed, yet French Louie was still going strong with a late dining and drinking crowd. Really enjoyed our drinks, service and a casual atmosphere. The decor is light and crisp, and the staff did not rush us out even though we stayed way past closing time.
No comment
No comment
No comment

At a slow time during the day I went for a late lunch. 40 minutes after ordering the server had not been by my table once. Terrible service! The food was fine once it finally arrived, but can't get over that first impression of no service at all...

Came here with my co workers for lunch. Great atmosphere as we walked into the restaurant. The servers are awesome and helpful. I got the steak frites medium. It came with fries and salad. The servings size was nice for the sides. The steak itself is what you could expect. Overall the food is wonderful. My coworkers got the burger and they were fat and juicy. The fries and salad were a nice side to go along with the meal. Overall I would definitely come back. Maybe give that 28 day dry steak a try that cost 40$.

I've tried French Louie a few times for brunch, based on the reviews and the fact it's always busy I kept wanting to give it a shot. All three times I've been, again for brunch only, have been a disaster. Overcooked poached eggs to the point of hard-boiled, clearly microwaved potatoes, and just lack of flavor all around. I might give it a shot for Dinner, but for brunch, I'm tapped out.

The minervois at $10 a glass is great.Loved the chicken liver pate.Sister restaurant is Butter Milk Channel, so you know things are done right. I had the Trout Po Boy but I think corn meal batter and fried would have made it tastier. The baguette was a little too hard, maybe they use same one for the lamb sandwich with the a jus. I think they need a different bread for the trout. My friend ordered the mussels which came in a white wine sauce which was delicious but not hot. Will definitely be back to have lunch and give it another try.

A lovely vibe with an interesting menu. I ordered the socca from the brunch menu and found it to be quite bland. My aunt had the scrambled egg with merguez sausage but spent most of the meal looking for the tiny pieces of sausage. We decided to treat ourselves, after lackluster mains, to the creme brûlée French toast. It was lovely and fluffy but again lacked any depth of flavor. The accompanying creme fraiche and berries weren't enough for the portion of toast. Lastly, in a restaurant that must have had at least a dozen families with small children at one time there was no baby changer in the bathroom. That seems like an easy fix, surely!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Went here for restaurant week, so they put a high emphasis on aesthetics and it worked well for them. I had a pan seared salmon and a steak tartare that were both light, fresh, and satisfying. Chocolate cake served with orange was also a treat.
No comment
Soooooo gooooood! Came here from Hawaii and Chef Souvi always rocks the grill! Highly recommended.
No comment

This is my 2nd visit to French Louie this time for restaurant week. Can't say I had the best experience nor was it awful. The food was hit and miss. The pate was delicious. Creamy and full of flavor. The escargots was great. Awesome sauce and great combination of flavors on the plate. Steak tarte was good but slightly underseason. The duck confit was pretty good. The meat fell right off the bone and the skin was nice and crispy. The Steak frites was nothing special. The Steak was very average and the fries fried nicely but to salty. For dessert the lemon cake actually tasted old and stale. Bread pudding was average. Now for the service. Not great. They were attentive but not friendly at all. I sensed snootiness.Our first server seemed to get upset with how we ordered and not specifying it was the restaurant week prixe fix. We also was never asked if we wanted go order drinks. In mid meal we changed to a different server. Again not friendly at all. She told us our choices for dessert was a lemon cake and chocolate gateau. We order one each. When it came we got tbe lemon cake and a bread pudding. When we told the runner we were suppose to get a chocolate gateau she said no you order bread pudding. It wasn't that big of a deal so didn't want to argue. When the server came with the check we told her you gave us bread pudding she said "oh yes they just changed it." I think the right thing was she should have informed us and make sure it was ok. It was almost as if since it was restaurant week they'll just get what we give. There was no care what so ever. Also, when I told her the fries were too salty she hust said ok. No apology nothing. During the whole meal no one came to check of us. They did do a good job clearing the table. Also the food was a bit of a wait between courses.
No comment

Good food! Nice ambience. Easy for brunch.  Went with a friend who rarely comes to Brooklyn so it was nice to go somewhere in such a nice neighborhood. It was nothing to write home about but I wouldn't be mad if I went again.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I throughly enjoyed my meal here. I came with a small group for restaurant week where I had the steak tartare, Le Grande Socca (chickpea flatbread), and pistachio parfait. I was looking at some of the reviews previous to mine saying it was nothing special, but I was amazed. The only thing I didn't enjoy as much was the chickpea flatbread mainly because I didn't like the flavor of the squash (that was just me personally). The steak tartare was delicious and the parfait I could distinctly taste the pistachio. I tried the steak from someone else's plate and I thought it was the best I'd ever had. I would definitely recommend it, despite that I didn't get the dish! And of course everything was beautifully exhibited as you can see from the pictures.

Came for Saturday brunch with a reservation, which is a must-have because the place was packed!  Tried one of the benedicts and the french toast.  Very tasty and impressed by the serving amount.  We're so used to leaving brunch hungry that it was nice not to for once!!  Great service too.  We will be back for sure!
No comment

Worst service. Our waitress (dinner on 5/12) was nowhere in sight for most of the night (had to wait close to 45 minutes to even order our food) and we had to flag down multiple other waiters for anything.
No comment
No comment
No comment

nice casual french bistro in boerum hill. came here for restaurant week (RW) and the menu is rather extensive compared to lots of other RW offerings around the city. specifically, they offer lots of items that are actually ON their menu. I enjoyed the generous portions of mussels normande to start. could really taste the mustard at times. I couldn't decide between the trout and steak frites, but I succumbed to the steak frites. the bavette steak was nicely seasoned and cooked to a perfect medium. can't say the fries were that great though, but they were decent. my fellow yelper peter y let me try some of the trout and it was delish as well. finished off with the profiteroles which were a nice light dessert. overall, great meal in a charming setting.

Best brunch in the neighborhood and the wait time let's you know it's true.  Cocktails so tasty, hollandaise on point, fresh everything.  To the trout poboy I say thank you.  Crab, salmon and all the fishes delicious.  Really happy French Louie is in the area.

Always delicious. Excellent staff, true pros. Their menu is not too huge, and everything on it is excellent including all the wines. Terrific back garden seating. Chic, simple decir. Full disclosure: we know the owners. But we wouldn't say this stuff is it weren't true.

I went there for Valentine's Day dinner, and the food was AMAZING!!!! it was beyond my expectations, very well mannered staff. I had the bittersweet chocolate gateau for desert and my partner had the blood orange cheesecake, absolutely mouth watering. Well worth it for the price paid.

Visited French Louie with an old friend as a recommendation. Could not be happier with the service, atmosphere and of course the food. Whole night was fantastic and would recommend a visit to this lovely restaurant.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is my favorite brunch spot in Boerum Hill/ Brooklyn Heights area. The pastry of the day was divine! Brunch was fantastic, went back for dinner one evening unfortunately it was less impressive hence the 4 stars.
No comment
Loved the food and drinks. Steak tartar was fresh and well seasoned. I also ordered cast iron roasted chicken and it was really good. Nice place to have drinks and dinner with friends!

Prices may be high but the place is very good! We have been here multiple times for brunch and the friends we bring really like it. The restaurant has a nice feeling. The food is really good. My fiancee enjoyed the scramble eggs very much. I am a fan of their burger. We all liked their creme brulee French toast. My friends liked an appetizer pastry I cannot remember the name. And my friends ordered more fries because they liked them a lot.
No comment
No comment

We were seated in the section at the back of the fairly empty restaurant at 2pm on Friday, September 13th and we were told that they needed the table back by 3pm.  We waited for over half an hour for a sandwich, avocado toast, and fries (which they initially forgot to bring but ended up being quite tasty) while watching several other customers coming in quite a bit of time after us being served their food before ours arrived.  We watched the server check on all of his tables however he rarely checked in on us and when he did he seemed inattentive and kept referring to my husband (who has long hair) and I as 'ladies'.  We weren't able to get our questions asked before he was leaving our table.  I believe he forgot to put in our entire order but I'm so confused as to why after half an hour no one noticed us sitting there without any food.  After half an hour we had to ask the I'm assuming 'manager' if our food was on the way.  At that point it took an additional 15 minutes to come out.  We asked earlier if the sandwich came with a salad and the server said no so we had ordered a side salad.  The sandwich in fact came with a salad.  At no point was there an apology for the wait or an offer to comp the unnecessary side salad or any of the other items.  We also had to ask for the check because the server continued to be unavailable to us.  A very unfortunate dining experience.  I have never written a review but I couldn't stop talking about it to my husband.  I just had to share my experience.
No comment

Tried French Louie for the second time. Not times underwhelmed. I had the steak frites and while the fries were good the steak was bland and flavorless. Was really looking forward to steak. First time was brunch and that was mediocre as well. Over rated and over priced.
No comment

No comment

Their cocktails are all cReative and delicious and they have a fried anchovy appetizer that Id travel the world for its so delicious. Everything else is always generally between really good and great.  Sometimes the sauces/salad dressings can get a little heavy handed for my taste and prices  are on the high end, but it's not enough to stop me from going back.  The dining room can  get a little cramped when theyre busy so tuck in and eat at the bar if you can.

Just not good. Trying to be French bistro with flair but it's trying too hard. Moules frites and steak frites should be the best on the menu at a French restaurant but steak was poorly prepared and moules were heavy, not fresh, and underwhelming. Also bavette was not bavette. Service was good except for food requests. No changes to the routine of the kitchen are allowed apparently. Also, check your bill. Charged for items we never had
Excellent place for a fine dining brunch or lunch. (Haven't tried it for dinner.) It's mostly French-inspired with a modern twist. They have an outdoor area which is very nice.
No comment
The duck potatoes & chicken sausage was delicious. The trout was good & my friend loved his cheeseburger.

Incredible service. Came here for a birthday dinner for my bf, and we were blown away by the excellent wait staff. Our waiter was patient and observant, and clearly very experienced. We never felt interrupted/intruded and always had our drinks filled at the right moments. I wish I caught his name- thank you for an amazing dining experience!
INCREDIBLE, adventurous food. Amazing. Super exciting menu. Winter foie gras dish was my favorite dish. Best food in BK.
Delicious. Beautiful space. Great service and wine. What more could one ask for?! Loved both of our dishes and will be going back for sure.
Good food... Perfect setting! Mike made magic in serving us!! This is definitely a Brooklyn gem...
No comment
No comment

While the food is delicious, it's heavy and the steak was not appropriately prepared. We got the sardines, mussels, 28 day steak, red rice, and chickpea pancake. While the sardines were good, there were only two of them. The mussels were in a heavy sauce that was a tad too heavy for my liking. The 28 steak was not prepared according to our request, and it was basically overcooked. Now, considering the price of the steak, I would imagine that the care for this meat would be better. The red rice was interesting as it was mixed with greens. The chickpea pancake was probably our favorite item on our table, and it was very original as well. The downside is the noise. In fact, the table next to us was so loud that my left ear was ringing the next day. The tables are on top of each other, and the couple next to us overheard us talking about the noise level. They agreed that it was unbearable. All in all, I have been to better French establishments in the area where food was prepared with more care and I was able to hear my better half.

I wanted to love this place but was a little disappointed. I was here for brunch and ordered the regular bloody Mary (virgin) and felt it was a little too sour. Maybe vodka makes a big difference. I ordered the special- duck hash with a sunnyside egg- pretty tasty but very small portion. I also ordered the creme brulee french toast. I thought that was pretty good but would be much better as a desert. I decided to add on the avocado tartine because I didn't feel satisfied with my french toast. The avocado spread was just like guacamole and they did put a lot. It also has a lot of citrus so the pickled tomatoes didn't really go well but it was really pretty. The bread was overly toasted so the edges were impossible to cut through. I cut out the center and scraped the rest of the avocado off. The table next to me ordered a sandwich and the woman was putting in some serious work to try to cut through her toasted bread as well. It might've been a bad day or batch of bread. I also had the side of chicken sausage. For $7 skip it completely. It was really dry and small- just order another plate for a few more dollars. Another thing I wasn't happy about was when I asked to move to the table next to me because I was going to order more food and the table was already full. This table was a little bigger and for two people. When I arrived one person was sitting at the table so I didn't think it would be a problem for my party of two to switch over. The server asked the manager and they denied our request. They said a bigger party will be coming. Well literally 2 minutes later the host walks over a party of two and seats them at the table. When the rest of our food came out the waitress wasn't even sure where to put the plate because out table was full so we literally had to eat with our plates hanging off the sides of the table.Pretty bummed about our experience especially since it has such good reviews.

Love this place!!! Definitely a neighborhood gem!!! We never had a bad meal here!!! Everything was so delicious!!! The only downside is the kids menu is not great, so if you got picky eaters, don't bring them here. My two youngsters hardly eat anything while we were there....so my husband and I decide not to bring them next time when we go, just do a date night/lunch.

This was an extremely overrated restaurant. The moules frites, the spring pea-mint soup, and the steak frites were exceedingly average. And the total was over $150. And to add insult to injury, the service was also thoroughly underwhelming. So nowhere near worth the price tag. Yet another spectacularly average Brooklyn eatery...

Went here for dinner recently with my bb, after making a reservation with OpenTable. It was a beautiful evening, so we asked if any outdoor seating was available. We were promptly told that there would be a long wait - funny enough, several groups were seated outside not long after we were seated... maybe you can request outdoor seating when making a reservation? Guess I wasn't clever enough to think of that, if so. Anyhow, the cocktails and food were both good, and we had decent-sized portions. Overall a pleasant experience.

This was a culinary triumph!!! I ordered the duck with was exceptional & my husband ordered the lamb. Perfect!!! Don't miss out on the Frau Gras, which was a draw for us!  Helped us sample & pair wine with our dish.  Attentive staff, friendly, clean!!!   Da' best!!!
Good drinks. Mussels were delicious. They came in an interesting sauce. The fries were perfect. Also had the Steak frites, the steak was tasty but perhaps a bit too salty.
Average. Maybe a smidge above average. Certainly not with coming back for. Had the scramble which was average brunch fare.

Every time I've been to this restaurant, all the food has been fantastic. Dinner might be expensive, but breakfast and lunch are not bad - expect to pay under $20/person. Service is good and the interior is very tasteful. There really are no flaws that I've seen.

As great as the food is at French Louie -- and it really is delicious -- it's the service that really makes this place so special. Casey has been our server the past few times we've been there and she never fails to make an already excellent dinner exceptional. Smart, attentive, funny, super knowledgeable of the menu and the wine list, she proves that people come for the food but return for the hospitality. Management, give her a raise. PS: the steak frites are the bomb and I wish that Gruner came out of my faucets. See you again soon.
The notion of hospitality is lost on this venue - a shame as the food and setting set it up for success. Won't be going back.

I ended up here during Restaurant Week just by chance. I was impressed by how many choices there were on the Restaurant Week menu (and the great price). I chose a salad to start and the steak frites. It was all very delicious. The space itself is very cozy. Dim lights, nice ambience. I had dinner with my dear friend, but this would be a great romantic dinner spot too.
Great brunch spot that takes reservations and the Socca is gluten free (without the freekah)! Highly recommend!

So cute! Came for brunch - can't wait to come back through for dinner. Got the Louie breakfast with crab and poached eggs on a croissant - so light and flavorful and delish! Also had the everything bagel infused Bloody Mary which was a great addition. Everyone I was with had a couple entrees and cocktails and everyone left happy. Had a bite of the French toast which was also SO good!
No comment

I'll keep things short - interior small and chic, food is delicious and savory, but small in portion. Bill comes out big. All-in-all, worth it for a romantic dinner with your significant other or a scrumptious lunch with a close group of friends.
No comment
Great food, great service.   This feels like my personal cheers.  Every dish I've had is GREAT.  They prove that Brooklyn must be the new Manhattan. I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!
No comment

I went here for a quick bite. They have a back area that is very nice. I had the steak tartar, and my friend got the mussels. Got picture of mussels, but sadly i dug into mi e before i remembered to take pic. Will have to go back and get a pic. Looking forward to it.
No comment
Very pleasant experience! Great staff, vibes and a nice backyard. And the smoky mussels are absolutely delicious.

Started with a delightful AF Dog of the South something tequila-based cocktail. I fully enjoyed my cod but you shouldn't expect to be filled by it. Mussels were a big hit. The BF was slightly disappointed by the Berkshire pork but appreciated the carefully selected seasonal produce. There were a couple of hiccups in service, but they were graciously acknowledged by the staff. Ambience was trendy BK and intimate. Would recommend to others!
No comment

Great food, great service, great addition to a neighborhood where you can never have enough French restaurants. I'd even go as far as saying that I enjoy it much more than Buttermilk Channel (though the two are completely different). Love their radishes with butter, brussels sprouts, and most of the brunch options. The cocktails are also delicious.

I'm a year late on this review, but I just want to say how much I love this place. The food is great, the people are friendly, and the atmosphere is just perfect. My husband and I come here regularly, but most notably, we actually got married here a year ago in their back patio! It was everything I had hoped for and more. The menu was excellent, the drinks were awesome, and Ellen was fantastic to work with for the arrangements. Although I realize people typically have more than 35 people at their weddings, I would absolutely recommend this place for a special event, like a rehearsal dinner, engagement party, bridal shower or whatever. It was beautiful and classic and I wouldn't have changed a thing.
Delicious food. Filling, rich, delectable dishes inspired by French cuisine from the countryside. This restaurant is under the same ownership as Buttermilk Channel in Carroll Gardens.

Happened upon this place and it was Restaurant Week (which usually makes me cringe as a former hospitality person). The menu was fantastic, dare I say the portions were a little big, but truly tasty and fresh. Unlike many restaurants they didn't "cheap out" on portions or quality. Everything was prepared expertly. Will definitely go back in the future. Highly recommend the gazpacho, mussels and berry dessert. Also, the sparkling Jura wine from Tissot never disappoints.

I love being able to go to a beautiful place and know that the food and service will be amazing each and every time. The reliability and consistency matters and is greatly appreciated! Thank you! The duck is always perfect -- you can tell how much your chef cares about everything. I've been to FL about 6 times now and it's basically my new favorite spot.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

It was our anniversary and I called ahead to make something special as a surprise for my wife.  I wasn't specific about anything other than mentioning it was our anniversary. The restaurant did an awesome job as they gave us a great table, mentioned our anniversary (points for me with the wife) and treated us really terrific.  Oh yeah, and the food was spectacular.  Really well prepared and thoughtful dishes.  The prices are super reasonable for the quality of the food, talented chefs preparation, and artful presentation.
No comment

Just was not impressed although I seem to be in the minority. I ordered the Moules Frites, and while the frites were find the moule were meh. Dry, rubbery, with no sauce to speak of. Ok because no bread was offered for dipping anyway. My wife's Pappardelle as likewise borderline unremarkable and just plain boring, with what was called a ragout on the menu was just some vegetables thrown over the top of the dry pasta.  Sorry, not for me.

Really good meal with one objection. The drinks were delicious and we ate mostly wonderful food, but would definitely advise anyone interested in the steak frites to go with the bavette. My husband ordered the dry rub which turned out to be about 1/3 fat and gristle, despite a significantly higher price. We mentioned something to our server, but they didn't make any adjustment to our bill. We overheard at the table next to us that the lamb chop was the same case with respect to being a mediocre cut, so definitely a pity. That said, the bavette was pretty much perfect, and we really enjoyed the pickles and fois gras to start!
Very nice and classy , went here for brunch  , service was good , good food but limited choices !
No comment
Pappardelle was horrendous!! Don't do it. The steak was fine. Brussels sprouts were not good. Service was good.

Completely delicious...i wish i could eat here everyday.every piece of the meal eas on point...i am a big fan of buttermolk channel and i was worried that it may not be as good..but was grateful to find out it is just as good but in a different way...i will most definitely be back!
No comment
The cod with kimchi was awesome! atmosphere was lively but still felt intimate and staff was really great! delicious roasted veggies as well- maybe the best Ive had!

I live in the area, so I'll be nice. If you like dijon mustard soup, then order the muscles and french fries. If you like eating an entire piece of fat and you like spitting into napkins all night (disgusting that I had to do this in front of my date) then order the Lamb Chop. The place is beautiful, outdoor area is great, service excellent... but I would never pay over $200 for a meal (for two) like that again. Shame on the cook.

Totally loved this place for a laid-back brunch! The service was exceptional, friendly and quick, and the place is adorable. I was expecting it to be busier on a Sunday morning, but we got a table easily, no wait. Pro-tip: order the madeleines. Warm from the oven with just enough spice to make them interesting, they're easily the sleeper hit/highlight of my experience
No comment

A very nice bistro with great service and food.  I ordered a hake dinner and my son ordered a duck dish.We both liked them a lot.  Service was quick and cheerful. There seem to be a lot of regulars here. The owner or manager spent time with some of the diners and gave us a very warm goodbye.  I would go again.
No comment
This place was great! Po' boy was delicious. Loved the mustard herb sauce and trout m. The staff was awesome and super friendly:-) always near by to save fallen silverware.

Such cute little spot, very date appropriate with its mood lighting :) I went here with friends, and it's definitely also a great place for small groups. Went here for the restaurant week deal which is 3 courses for $38. I ordered the butternut squash/sweet potato soup for my appetizer which was lumpy and didn't have a very smooth, soupy texture as it should so thumbs down to that. For the entree course I ordered the steak and frites, which was really tasty and was cooked medium (a tad on the dry side but it was tasty enough not to need so much steak sauce). My friend ordered the trout which I tried a little of - that was delicious. To finish off, I ordered the chocolate ganache cake with hibiscus mousse. This was slightly underwhelming...my friend ordered the profiteroles with ice cream which was spot on. I think there was some type of salted caramel sauce added because it had a malty, salty but sweet flavor to it. Service was excellent but I do have to minus the one star as I was disappointed with the appetizer and dessert.
AMAZING!!! Couldn't wait for French Louie to open and it doesn't disappoint!! The steak, the snails, the chocolate mousse, are delicious!
No comment

Pretty good although nothing to write home about, at least in my opinion. I have friends who swear by the pork chop but it's not my thing. The oysters are ok but not comparable with places that specialize in seafood and not cheap at $3 a pop. The food is not memorable in my opinion and it's not worth coming back given so many great options in the vicinity.

On my last business trip to Brooklyn, we decided to try French Louie. It has a great menu and every item we tried was made beautifully. I recommend the Lamb but I could have had almost anything on the menu. The service was excellent as well. It was a relatively casual place with truly fine dining.

Excellent dinner the other night! We shared gougeres, the radishes with olive butter and a delicious kale salad to start. The steak frites was perfection and the house steak sauce is to die for. Terrific dessert and great service made for a really nice dining experience..
Very cool spot with classic French dishes and pretty good wine list. Wish I made it in more often.

visited french louie 3 times in the last several months - group of 6 at 7 pm, group of 4 at 9 pm and my wife and i at 6 pm - and never had a bad experience. who else serves a bloody mary with half an okra, an olive and a piece of some root vegetable as decoration? genius. absolutely love their huge moules normande and their tuna or beef tartar. our guests ordered different dishes and all loved them. service is friendly and efficient. to reduce waste, they serve bread only when you ask for it. and as a bonus for this German, they have not one but 2 German - and several others - beers on tap, Gaffel Koelsch and Hofbraeuhaus Dark. only thing missing for my taste buds are a hearty french onion soup and a good bouillabaisse. however, their special soup of lentils and mushrooms last night was delicious too.
No comment

Last Sunday went there for brunch, atmosphere is really nice in there and the service was great. Even though it's brunch but still have a lot of choice to choose, also as a French brunch I think the price is very reasonable so definitely I will go back again
No comment
No comment

This was my second visit to French Louie, and Saturday Brunch was definitely better than dinner. The high prices are unwarranted, as both meals were not outstanding. There was nothing wrong with the food or the service, but the bill indicated that we should have had an excellent experience where it was just ok. We left feeling good, but with no plans to return.
No comment
Sunday Brunch was amazing!  Bloody Mary's were exquisite!  Made reservation on the way there,  was seated within 15mins. Will definitely go back whenever I'm in Brooklyn

We had a great time here and were taken care of with heart. I had the duck and my dining partner had steak frites. We finished it off with yummy goat ice cream and huckleberry sorbet. The only thing we couldn't make sense of was the radishes in butter. It was yummy starter, but a bit odd. We finished it, though, if that's any indication.
My friend and I had a stunning meal here. Each dish was more beautiful and flavorful than the last. Service was impeccable from start to finish. A treasured addition to Atlantic ave
No comment

Quaint, clean, airy and fresh...i mean the food and the atmosphere! Had the hake fish dish and it was tenderly cooked to perfection with delicate flavours and not overwhelmed with stock or salt. Loved this place and want to go back for more. Table mates ate duck which was so delicious and cooked also to perfection. The beef tartar appetizer was super fresh and I highly recommend it. Service was great and wait staff was friendly. Must go!!
Went for dinners during NY restaurant week. The steak frites was awesome! Although the duck confit came out too dry. Plating was gorgeous. Would try again.
No comment
So good.  Food is great.  Service is great.  Atmosphere is laid back and cozy.  The bartender is the man.   Loved it.
Very cute and friendly spot. Food is good and somewhat original. Decent wine selection. Great for local casual dining experience. Pretty outdoor seating. Will cone back:)

The food is good and the ambiance is excellent. The appetizers are gorgeous especially the foie gras and the mussels. And the steak is a must order with chips. I always order Old fashioned for a drink! I like sitting put doors but always bring a repellent unless you will be bitten to death.

Yum! We were here for brunch and it was delicious! The cauliflower soup was superb as was the apple turnover! We both ordered the Bloody Mary and whoa holy yum! One of the better ones I've had since living in NYC. We will definitely be coming back for more.
Went there for lunch recently and was underwhelmed with their food.  Got their burger and fries...nothing special. Service was attentive.

I am always happy with this scrumptious cuisine. Be prepared to wait the length of time it requires to prepare and cook as it is made just for the diner! I do not eat gluten nor dairy, but Love French cuisine. They have accommodated me the several times I've eaten there. The staff are quite knowledgeable and professional. Sharing is met with respect as is each request we've made. Enjoy. Give your tastebuds a treat! Subtle, refined and elegant. Taste, that is. Dress is comfortable.

Backyard is great, perfect for summer.  Service was solid.  The food just wasn't great with exception of escargot.  Smoked mackerel had no smoke taste. Lamb was pretty fatty (fries were great).  And snap pea salad ($15 by the way) had basically vines in it. They gave us a steak knife.  For the salad.  "I've never had to fight my salad," my wife said.  So much promise, we probably won't be back,

I've been here a few times and this place continues to impress me. The egg bowls they have for breakfast are fantastic- try the mushroom one it's great and the sausage one might be even better. The staff is always super friendly and the drinks are amazing. I've noticed that on the weekends between 10AM and 1130 is crowded, so before or after I've been able to pretty much walk in.
No comment

One of my favorite restaurants!!! Delicious, interesting food, beautiful ambience, etc etc. My one critique: went there for lunch yesterday and got the grilled trout po boy. The sandwich is served on a long baguette that is nearly impossible to cut through-- so hard! This makes it really messy/unfun to eat. They should really cut the sandwich in half in the kitchen, or use different bread. It was just kinda icky to get all the remoulade on my hands and squish the trout as I tried to saw through the sandwich.

Didn't even eat here. I asked a server to ask the hostess who was literally a couple feet away from him how much longer the wait would be, as we had been for like 15 minutes for a table outside.  He replied, "no, you can". It just seemed rude and I didn't feel like my business was appreciated so we left.

Not only is the food here amazing, but so is the service. Had my first experience here on a Friday night- it was packed. We were seated rather quickly for how busy it was and the hostess was so friendly and accommodating to my dinner date who is rather picky and not the best restaurant guest. We had the frenchie salad, the sardines, the pappardelle, the beef bourguignon, and my dinner date had the steak. All fo which were AMAZING. not to mention the plethora of cocktails that were executed perfectly. Don't be dumb. Eat here.
Had brunch here and it was delicious. Service was friendly. Make a reservation though, this place gets busy!

I be been here a few times before and it has always been good. Tonight was excellent. Amazing smoked mackerel app and trout main course. I've been to French Michelin star rated restaurants that weren't this good. Service was friendly and knowledgeable. Wine was selection was diverse and delicious. Also, reasonable. I was expecting the bill to be much higher.
No comment

Wonderful experience!  We didn't have reservations but able to get a table for Sunday Brunch.  Service is excellent and food was very good.  Everyone in my group was happy and would return when we are in the area.

With so many places to eat in Brooklyn/NYC, its not uncommon to say that I have been to a local place only 2 or 3 times since living here (7 years, where did the time go!?).  French Louie is different-- I have probably dined here 15+ times-- sometimes with my parents or large groups of friends, and sometimes just me and my baby, for a glass of rose and their gougeres.  The food is consistently great and service is usually spot-on.  Two very enthusiastic thumbs up.

My husband and I went out here on a friday night after randomly finding this place nearby us on Yelp and I gotta say that the food and service was great. The waitress kept apologizing about the wait but we only really waited 10min so it wasn't so bad (but I did make reservations). They were so nice and attentative the whole time. The fried anchovies were amazing so you must try this! We had their cocktails which were also very good. I had the bavette steak (delicious) and my husband had the pork and clams which was also a good and hearty dish. For dessert we had their homemade pistachio ice cream and pineapple tartin with coconut ice cream. We were in absolute heaven.

Boyfriend and I came here for brunch on a Saturday. Unfortunately, the server we had was horrendous and took forever to bring our food. The food was delicious but our experience was disappointing. Our server didn't even apologize ‍
No comment

Delicious but price is high...def a treat yourself spot. Great decor and there's outdoor seating. Had the fried chicken and at that point i knew my life was finally complete. Order the fried chicken, you'll understand.

Amazing food and great service by the staff -- had the gnocchi and pan fried skate with profiteroles as the dessert.  Waitress was very attentive and multiple people on staff asked us about our experience throughout the meal.
Staff was SO FRIENDLY.  Went for brunch. Accommodating, pleasant. Coffee was tasty. Eggs with goat cheese was a little rich. Will return.

High price, but still a good value at that price point. Food is consistently delicious, with multiple seasonal dishes on the menu. Service is consistently great. And ambience is nice. We keep coming back. And, based on how consistently busy they are, I think the neighborhood agrees.

Me and my native New Yorker friend popped into French Louie after my red eye flight from the west coast. It was Labor Day Sunday. We were promptly seated toward the back of the bistro. I loved the busy vibe and patio which we opted out of due to direct HOT sun that day. Our server was super nice and personable. I had the trout po'boy while my New Yorker had the Socca. With both dishes neither or us were disappointed. Food and service stellar and all worth the value. Would return sooner if I weren't so far away.

Food was good but our server seemed miserable and it made for an uncomfortable dinner. I went for my birthday and it was disappointing and tense. We were seated and then ignored for 10 minutes without getting water or anything. Questions about the menu were met with annoyance and fuzzy info. I had been looking forward to dining at French Louie for a long time, but can't imagine returning. For the price range, the service was completely inappropriate.
LOVE IT - avocado toast is amazing. The pickled zebra tomato was a great surprise. And the patio is perfect to hangout in summer.
No comment

Great spot for brunch. Nice and casual atmosphere with extremely friendly service. Came here with a group on a Sunday and didn't even have to wait for a table. Croissant French toast - need I say more!
Love this place.  Great energy, and great service.  Had the lamb which was delicious

Went before a Bruce Springsteen concert for dinner. Food was fabulous!!! Steak Frites was very tasteful and perfectly cooked. Steamed mussels are a MUST have. But most of all the service is AMAZING from hostess to server. Can't wait to go again.
Excellent scallop starter but the bluefish was not cooked enough. Service is excellent. Wines too expensive.

This place is absolutely delightful. My husband and I came here for our anniversary and the food and service was impeccable from start to finish. The scallop ceviche was light and refreshing. The gnocchi was insanely good and my husband got the 28-day steak which was delicious. We finished it off with the pineapple tart which my husband didn't want to share after he tasted how delicious it was. By the end of the meal we were deciding all of our friends who we wanted to bring here. This place is such a wonderful addition to the neighborhood!

Great spot! Love the low-lit, trendy atmosphere they created, food is of high standards and the drinks are well made. Plus they don't push you right out the door once you put down your fork. Loved it!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Review for dinner on a Saturday night.  For 1st-timers, we had a wonderful time.  Excellent service, very creative dishes and wonderful decor! Dessert and wine choices were amazing!   You had me at goat cheese sorbet and oh man how can I forget the profiteroles...simply delicious!

This was a great little stop. Very quaint. I would definitely go back. Really cool neighborhood. Great service. Tasty bites. Great drinks. 5 for ambiance and 3 or 4 for food. Had steak that was too well done and fatty. Muscles were okay.

Food and cocktails are delicious. Very fresh, simple and well-balanced dishes. Something for everyone including those with a refined palate. Great presentation and service. Bustling and louder in main space. Quiet and pretty patio space for warmer weather.
No comment

Absolutely delicious food - try the anchovy frites and the gnocchi - and great service. The waiter brought out two kinds of wine to try based on my request for a recommendation - loved the attentiveness and help!

French Louie is a French-American bistro from the owners of Buttermilk Channel. The menu offers a great selection of fabulous and tasty fare.  The owner is always so friendly and welcomes us each time. The bartenders are adept at making any cocktail one could request. The servers are warm and friendly and the backyard garden is always packed in the nicer weather.  This restaurant is on a consistent 'go-to' for me and my husband and we love to take friends there as well!
One of my most loved places to dine in Brooklyn. Great food, great service, great times. I highly recommend.... Sit in the garden if possible.
Came here with a big group including the bf and sat in the backyard.  Everything was perfect.  Apps, entree, wine, service, ambience.  This place is a gem.
Fantastic , brunch today with great food and great service. An attentive staff and all the food came out at the same time piping hot and delicious .. Thank yo
Incredible food, top-notch service, terrific wine list, all in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere.

we came here for restraint week.. the hostess was sort of strange... she put us (4) in the corner table right next to a couple. I asked to change tables just because it was too tight for four of us in the corner and secondly there a couple in the next table. its abit awkward if they wana be all lovely kissy touchy and we are ontop of each others. the hostess took some offense that I requested another table. LOL! but whatever over that hurdle... the appetizers were good start- mussels, beef tar tar, and beets. entree was delicious but not the duck confit.. its abit too sweet for our liking... the dessert was the pistachio. it was so sweet!! everytime u take a bite u need to wash it down with some water... dessert can be much better.. our check came out to be like 243$ plus a bottle of wine. they accidentally charged us a different wine price than the menu. the waitress was able to fix it. overall the food was food to delicious but i will skip the dessert
5 Stars for the Eggs Louie. Space is nice, garden is great, staff are cool. Nice addition to the neighborhood, and I hope they do well.

Very friendly service and they also have a nice garden area in the back for when the weather is nicer.  The snail appetizer was delicious.  It came with a side of house-cured bacon, grits, and mushrooms--all went well together.  I also liked the brussel sprouts side which was tossed in a yogurt sauce with some sort of grain.  I got the bavette steak (similar to a flank steak?) for my entree which was fine, but nothing spectacular.  Husband seemed to enjoy his roast duck.
No comment
No comment

Food was good.  Service was OK; nobody re-filled our wine nor water glasses nor served us bread even though some tables were having it.  I wonder it one has to ask for bread?  Not sure.  What's up with the dude who just drops the dinner plates onto he table?  For the overall experience, it's pricey.  We were at Le Coucou last month and paid only about $60 more for an absolutely special and stellar meal and service with comparable amount of food & wine for 2.

Go here! Everything was delicious. The fried date salad was unbelievably innovative and balanced.  I had the skate and my friend had the pork and clams for our main course. I don't know how I could go back and not eat the skate again. It was so wonderful, I would have licked the plate if no one has been looking.
No comment

Great spot for small and large groups.  The service is excellent. The anchovy frites were excellent.  The pan fried skate with crab "dirty rice" hit the spot.  We went with a group of 12 and they were very accommodating.  Excellent variety of French reds and whites.

I went there last evening for my birthday and though the food was great, the service was not stellar.  I did not feel welcomed, nor pampered, even though I told them it was my birthday.  Will not go again and do not recommend.
No comment
No comment

Bright cheery atmosphere.  Great music.  Friendly accommodating staff but why oh why does it take over half an hour to get your food?   Multiple visits continues to prove this.   Need more gluten and dairy free option.

One of the best meals I have had in a while. Started with the oysters and gougeres. They were superb! I highly recommend the trout- perfectly cooked! I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu though.

Had Saturday brunch in February at Louie. First off, the service was exceptional. We wandered in off the street and they we able to seat us in exactly the amount of time they promised. A rare feat. We had the salmon tartine, Eggs Louie, bacon and raw oysters. All very good. The wait staff was extremely attentive and well informed about the wines. I'll go back next time I'm in Brooklyn. Oh, also great people watching.

Wow! Beyond expectations! The snap pea salad which is a seasonal delight was amazing and I had the Bavette steak which was cooked perfectly and tasted unbelievable! The decor was stunning (um gorgeous terrace?!!) and the waitstaff was super knowledgable and friendly. Total hit!

I am sure by now you know that these are the people who own Buttermilk Channel, everyone's favorite brunch venue.  I was not skeptical at all about trying out this place because of their rep and I was not disappointed.  definitely great french cuisine.   I enjoyed the duck and the Lion's tail drink.    both great.  The setting of the restaurant is dimly lit, not intimate by quiet.  There is also a nice deck in the back.  They definitely put some thought into it.  Great date venue or classy, wine sipping spot for a group of friends

Lovely Brooklyn restaurant. The Eggs Louie were delicious. Perfectly poached eggs on toasted croissant. Nice wait staff and pleasant atmosphere. They have outdoor area but with rain I didn't have a chance to check it out.
The food was very delicious but their service was so-so. They must have been slammed. Would try again, especially in the spring and summer when the outdoor area is open!
This place blew my mind. One of the best meals I've had in New York. The decor is stylish and intimate. The staff are knowledgeable and polite. I will definitely be coming back here.

Horrible dining experience on Sunday April 9th.  The lamb special ($30) was served nearly raw.  When we asked for it to be cooked a bit more, the request was met with a dirty look.  When it came back out, it was still ridiculously undercooked.  A second complaint about the undercooked lamb fell on deaf ears.  They made no effort to accommodate us or mke it right.  Never again.
Best brunch I've had in a loooooong time. Get the eggs louie or whatever the eggs benedict dish is called. its amazing.
Excellent food (duck breast, frites, mussels) and really skilled friendly servers. The decor is lovely, minimalist chic, including the outdoor space.

Extremely salty from appetizer to entree, I lost my appetite halfway through because it was so unbearably salty. Shouldn't call itself a French restaurant - there's nothing French about the food and it really tarnishes the name. Service started out friendly but eventually left our water glasses unfilled for the second half of the meal.

I rarely compliment service, I normally don't care enough to, however I just had dinner at French Louie and was blown away by the amazing food and ambiance at this restaurant. What blew me away more was the service we received. I advise everyone who goes to French Louie to ask for Meredith. The service we received from her made me and my friends feel as if we were part of a "family". Meredith seemed to take a genuine interest in us and I could not be more grateful for that. She was so polite and kind it blew me away. Words cannot express how amazing Meredith made us feel. This was a great way to round out our vacation and I'll think about French Louie forever! I recommend the Le Grand Socca and Meredith!
No comment
No comment

Maybe it was an off-night, but I had dinner here and everything I tasted (the steak, the papardelle, fries) was oversalted. Service was pretty decent. and cocktails were strong I had high hopes for this place but don't think I will come back .

Based on the reviews here, seems like I dined at a completely different place. Only the wine, mint tea, and spiced chocolate pot dessert were passable. Scallop Ceviche too lemony. Gougeres way salty. Grilled Trout was just awful -- flavorless, layered over cold, hard, half boiled potatoes and a strange mix of radishes and cucumbers. It's not easy to swallow a very high price bill for bad food. Will not return or recommend.

I've been here now for brunch, lunch, and a beer. All three times have been without complaint. Try the creme brûlée French toast (brunch) or chicken paillard (lunch); they are to die for, and the staff are truly charming and friendly.

my lamb was perfection- tender, flavorful and so juicy the grilled escarole and omelette complemented it just perfectly  by far my favorite part of the meal. the steak tartare was okay - I'm not a huge fan of mustard seeds or pickles so wasn't really my speed -personally prefer to taste more of the flavors from the meat. at the end of the meal we had tea and I just loved it's presentation. nice decor, friendly service - excited to try more items on their menu!
Warm, cozy place. Interesting and  diverse menu, however some dishes fell a little flat. Overall good food though, and I will definitely return

My friends and I were happy to find this place after the restaurant we planned to go to was closed for a wedding. Lovely atmosphere - modern, unfussy, contemporary. Prices were more than fair. Great beer selection. There were two oyster selections and the ones we chose were shucked and cleaned nicely. We also had the heirloom tomatoes - a nice seasonal menu item. Everyone at the table enjoyed their entrees and the lime merengue tart was excellent. The house-made amaretto for desert was also a highlight.
No comment

French Louie seemed very inviting while we explored Atlantic Ave, so we couldn't resist having dinner there! The back patio did not disappoint. Smoked sardines were top notch, and so was the "roasted king mushroom". The bread on the grand socca dish was burned, but the gracious staff more than made up for it. The chef (or the manager?) came to our table to apologize and gave us extra attention. I've rarely seen this kind of courtesy in any restaurant.
Perfect brunch spot. Enjoyed the creme brûlée French toast and steak tartare. Both were real treats for the taste buds. Great atmosphere and service as well.

This is a wonderful French Bistro. Great atmosphere and excellent food. Seared scallop appetizer was delicious, mushroom entree was sublime, profiteroles for desert were only mediocre though. Despite dessert experience, this place is terrific - would love to return on my next trip from San Francisco.

A delightful place for lunch (haven't yet tried it for dinner) - everything so well prepared and fresh, with special compliments on the heirloom tomato soup, avocado tartine, peches melba, and butterscotch pudding. The staff is welcoming and accommodating, and the dining areas very comfortable. I'm usually not a fan of outdoor dining, but the patio at French Louie is lovely, with a large awning  providing protection from the sun.

Came here during restaurant week on a Wednesday night February 2016. It was packed and for good reason! The food is absolutely delicious with each plate invoking a myriad of flavors all melding together in perfect unison. Now, I  am not at all familiar with French cuisine but if you've got an appetite for something different than the usual American fare, try this place. The plates are smaller than typical places in that you probably won't have any leftovers to bring home but will be satisfied and full. The space is small too with tiny square tables packed closely together. It's a loud restaurant so don't expect to hear your dining partner very well. I heard older people (50/60s) leaving the restaurant saying the food was great but the noise was unbearable. I can understand that sentiment but it's not enough to keep me away! If you want to enjoy really delicious gourmet, artfully crafted dishes you must come. You truly get what you pay for here. This is quality over quantity. You won't be disappointed.

I've been five times in the past few months. The food is fantastic and the staff and service are terrific, BUT the sound level is literally deafening. I'd only go back with earplugs. It's really a shame because if you didn't come out deaf after having missed half of the conversation this would be a great place.

My husband and I ate here for our anniversary and it was fantastic! We started with the mussels Piperade and they were my favorite part of the entire dinner. We shared the cote de boeuf and it was so flavorful and perfectly cooked. Wine was great, service was great!

Had a birthday brunch here last weekend. There were 12 of us, mixture of adults and kids. Firstly they allowed us to book in advance which was really helpful. The food was delicious and the drinks unlimited and they even did me a custom menu with my name at the top. The staff were really helpful and attentive and the food was good (madelaines with a creamy sauce to start, mixture of mains including burger, poached eggs, vegetarian option and french toast) all of which were epic. Can' t recommend this place enough. Unfortunately it rained, but we will definitely be back here in the summer when the garden is open.

Brunch here was weird and horrible.  Bad, bad coffee--very mineral-ly with a strange aftertaste.  This was a red flag and we should have got out then.  Regrets.  We had the trout tartine and the cordon bleu--everything--I mean everything--had a sour, bitter taste.  The service was helicopter mom, every three seconds, we were being asked if everything was ok.  That's not attentive, we felt harassed  This was the worst brunch that we have had in many years and we go out a lot.
Excellent food and service.  I wouldn't take young children because it is a small space, but my teenagers loved it.

Had a amazing dinner here with fantastic friendly, on-point and enthusiastic service. Beautiful space and it will now be one our my go-to place. The combination of space, service, good drinks and food is a 5 star - really hard to find these days. Owner of Buttermilk Channel brings his impeccable hosting over. Awesome experience overall.

Love this restaurant. I've had brunch on weekends and dinner; both are excellent. The garden in the back is beautiful, quiet and shaded in summer. Inside can be a little noisy, as almost all NY restaurants do. Service is always excellent, knowledgeable and friendly. Reservations for my birthday dinner, even though I kept adding people one by one to the table on a busy Saturday, were not a problem at all. Brunch prices are surprisingly reasonable for the city. I'll keep coming back, with great pleasure.

I really want to like French Louie (really enjoy Buttermilk Channel and want another local go-to restaurant), and have gone there twice, hoping for good service and food. The first time was only okay, but it was their first week being open, so I cut them some slack. Last night we returned, and regretted it. A) my husband and his sister got food poisoning from the steak tartare, B) despite being completely empty at 930 on a Sunday, they seated our party of 5 in the back, crammed into a 4-seater with an extra chair and an incomplete table set-up, and C) the food was simply not tasty and the service lackluster.  I don't even want to bother going into the details of the food because it was so unmemorable. But I won't be returning unless they revamp their menu, kitchen staff, and service level.
Love French Louie! Good food and good people. They go out of their way to make customers happy!

OK, so I'm not sure what it would be like eating inside; the decibel level was 92-95 - similar to standing next to a jackhammer. The garden however, was quiet and lazy with a warm summer breeze wafting through. There's enough room out there so that there is no cramming in. That's just the beginning. The waitstaff was genial, jovial, and efficient - aand then came the food.
