My own dishes were the smoked sardine appetizer - perfectly smoky, slightly briny with a tapenade butter and whole grain bread accompaniment. My main, a dish of papardelle with 'smack your momma' merguez sauce was like a 4th of July fireworks display of flavor zings - and the bed of pasta perfectly al dente. A knockout! Our shared dessert selection of profiteroles and the lemon meringue tarte - neither cloyingly sweet) provided the perfect finish. With our Cotes du Ventoux wine at table, we could have been in Provence, yet we were in the heart of Brooklyn, with a perfect staffer from Long Island (she admitted it). We're going to wear this place out!

My boyfriend and I have tried the smattering of French restaurants along Atlantic Ave between Bond and Brooklyn Heights... French Louie is BY FAR our favorite. The food was amazing, starting with the octopus and "frenchie" salad and ending with the mussels (app), Bavette steak, and spiced chocolate pot de creme... Truly delicious! What really made our experience five stars was our server, Brian, who went above and beyond to make us feel special (it was my boyfriend's birthday dinner), checking in frequently, and making sure our wine was always topped off. Really, an exceptional dinning experience. Thank you Brian and French Louie!
No comment

One star for the short grumpy unattractive  hostess. We went hoping for a Table for 3. My 5 year old gave her a sticker and she literally looked at it as if he'd given her a used Kleenex. I hope to try an earlier hour next time. Really could do wo the sourpuss greeting. It can't be that hard to replace a hostess.
The food is awesome, but it's not surprising since it's coming from owners from Buttermilk Channel. The thing i adore about this space is the outside space. Always nice to dine al' fresco in NY!

The atmosphere is lovely. The service attentive but not cloying. Great wine recommendations too. But the food was disappointing. The chicken looked perfectly crisped but lacked seasoning. It's bed of lentils, also unseasoned, were soupy and bland. My friend's steak, although cooked to a perfect medium rare, also lacked any flavor. What a bummer. I'd return for wine and oysters in a heartbeat but will eat dinner elsewhere.

I had dinner at French Louie with my wife this past weekend.  The food, the service, the ambiance were all topnotch leading to a very enjoyable dining experience.  I highly recommend French Louie.  I had the duck and my wife had the flounder, both were superb.   In my opinion it is one of Brooklyn's best restaurants.  As other reviews mention the owners also own Buttermilk Channel.  I have been to Buttermilk once and thought it was very good but I prefer French Louie.
Well designed space, love the mountain scene on the wall, great service, great food. I recommend this place to local friends and those visiting from out of town.
Ate here the other night with a friend who knows the chef. Wow! Delicious, creative dishes and amazing wine. Highly recommended!

I went here for the first time for brunch with my parents, who were in town from upstate, and we all loved it.  The food was delicious, the service was great, and the space is lovely.  There have been a long series of restaurants in this space, and I really want this one to stick - don't understand any of the negative reviews.

French Louis is a very ambitious and well executed restaurant. I find myself wandering in late night for steak tartare and a warm basket of gougeres. This is an amazing addition to the neighborhood and I look forward to a long and serious relationship with the inspired smoked sardines.

Brought my mother here when she was visiting the city. Gougeres were perfect to start. We had the duck "allard" and dry aged steak, bravo on the house steak sauce. Profiteroles and pineapple tart tatin for dessert were a nice finish to a solid meal. I'll be back soon.

Showed up early on a Friday when everything seemed to be going against the restaurant. Food inspectors showed up for first inspection. We sat in the backyard. Very Pleasant. Guy gesticulating at the next table almost got me with a glass of red wine, then rain moved through and we took the rest to go. Throughout these bizarre events the staff could not be more pleasant and apologetic...even for events that had nothing to do with them. Great service and the food was excellent....but main dining room was loud!
No comment

I was so excited to try this place out for brunch after never being able to get into Buttermilk Channel. The first great part about this place is that they take reservations...I feel like no one takes reservations anymore, so I was super pleased about that. When I got there (without my date mind you) they immediately sat me and brought me water. My boyfriend was a little late because parking in the area is notoriously bad, but they didn't rush me at all which was lovely. We ordered the Eggs Louie and the Trout Po Boy. The Eggs Louie were absolutely fantastic! Rich, creamy, buttery, definitely not a health-kick meal, but really great for a treat. My boyfriend said the Trout Po Boy was delicious, and something like he'd never tasted before. We really enjoyed the food here, but there was one thing that really killed the mood, hence the -1...it's so dang loud in there!! I don't know if its echo-y ceilings, loud music, or perhaps this midwesterner still isn't used to the Brooklyn brunch crowd, but it was unreasonably loud. I could not hear was my boyfriend was saying and he was sitting directly across from me. When we were leaving I noticed that the front of the restaurant was much quieter, so try and get a table up there if you're looking to chat.  Overall the food was great, but it wasn't really what we had in mind for our romantic brunch date.

I am so lucky that I just happened upon this place. It was about 10:30pm and I was walking in the rain to find somewhere to get some grub. Not a huge American portion, but something made with thought that would leave me with a great memory. Found it here!  I walked in and was immediately able to sit at the bar. Ordered the duck breast with mashed potatoes and olive spread, "Allard." I ordered it medium rare. It was phenomenal!!  The duck was a nice portion and included the skin. And if you truly love duck, then you wouldn't want to miss out on the skin. It was tender, juicy and so full of flavor!  The potatoes were great. The olives left me with the desire to make a serious effort to try to incorporate more olives into my daily schedule. I almost settled up and left after that until I realized that they had desserts!!  Ordered profiteroles with fennel ice cream and a nice drizzle of sugary goo. It was the perfect dessert!  And it really represented French portions and flavors well. Not swimming in goo. Just enough to make you enticed to sop it all up with the flaky, croissant-like profiteroles as the fennel ice cream melted. I told the bartender who served me with a smile the whole time that if I could, I would have licked the entire plate clean. The ice cream was just delicious. Thick, dense, fresh ice cream that really left me satisfied. The only down point of the experience was when I left to walk back to the apartment we are staying in and realized that I could have been dining here since Tuesday!  But we leave to return to our home in Atlanta tomorrow. Wish I could have eaten here again and again. And I truly hope they remain successful for next time I am in town so I can eat the exact same menu items. Such delicious food!!  And with the whole meal mentioned above, the bill was about $35.00. This food was made with some serious thought and love. Cannot wait to come back!

I came here looking forward to a steak and martini dinner, which I have enjoyed a few times at French Louie. I was disappointed on a couple of fronts. 1. The martinis are no longer served in martini glasses. They are now using those thimble-sized little "coupe" glasses that so many bars are now using for cocktails. There is nothing worse than ordering a cocktail and receiving it in one of those offensively tiny glasses, especially a martini. 2. The steak comes with salad. What happens when you put a hot piece of meat on the same plate as salad? Not only was the salad wilted, but tonight, half the salad was actually rotten. Garbage. Had to scrape it to the side after inadvertently eating rotten salad with my steak. Overall, I am sad that I can't depend on my neighborhood go-to French Louie anymore, for a great martini and steak dinner. Especially for the price, it should be very consistent and reliable.

I loved this place! My friends and I went for some drinks on a Sunday before attending a nearby show, and we liked the vibe so much that we returned for dinner (and of course more drinks!) after the show. We had the mussels which came in a delicious mustard sauce, and also some fabulous fries. The food was excellent. I had the bellini, which was perfect, and my friends had cocktails and were very pleased. The staff was fun and kind and super attentive. I'll definitely be back. Thanks French Louie!!!

So I had kept seeing French Louie pop up on a the hot and trendy lists. I also saw that  they had worked out the initial kinks that new restaurants face. After finally eating there I have to say, I don't get it. We ordered the pork and rabbit rillettes as an appetizer, it had the consistency of tuna salad and didn't have much flavor. It even looked like it had rolled over onto its side when the waiter was bringing it out even though it was upright when it made it to the table. For my entree I had ordered the roast duck breast Allard. When it was served it was served with the grey side up which made for an ugly presentation. I had flipped it over to see the whole piece and there was a nice crisp skin that was sitting in the jus that would have made the presentation 100% better if it was served that way. Aside from the presentation I had also found it a little over cooked and tough. I had tried my girlfriends also, she had ordered the roasted king mushroom and while it was ok, it seemed to miss what it was aiming for, there were earthy tones but the sauce was overly salty sweet and sour all at the same time. She had also noted that the pieces of potato she had in there were under cooked. Aside from the food, the service was nothing to write home about. Our waitress came over and then disappeared for a extended periods of time. By the time we were done with our meal we were itching for the check and still couldn't locate out waitress,which after a mediocre meal can be frustrating because you just want to leave it all behind.

The good news is that, over a year later, French Louie has definitely caught on.  You now need a reservation for peak meal times, and may not get one in your preferred slot.  Based on my experience this past Friday, the place now gets super crowded and so, unfortunately, super noisy.  The food is still of high quality, the menu remains smallish but varied and challenging, and the wine list still includes a lot of good values.  The service on a busy evening is understandably a bit frazzled, and the noise level makes communicating with the servers a challenge, but the basics (food delivery and presentation, pick up of empty plates, etc.) are all handled professionally.  I certainly intend to go back, but I will try to find quieter times and avoid peak slots on Fridays and Saturdays, when the noise level makes normal conversation impossible and thus reduces your pleasure in a fine meal.  Or I'll come in the summer, when the delightful garden is open.

we came here for my graduation celebration and it was lovely. our waitress was so attentive and thoughtful - they even brought out a dessert on the house to help celebrate! the food was fabulous. our favorites were the hake and gnocchi. we ordered a bottle of the pinot from willamette valley and it was a perfect addition. we can't wait to go back!
Delicious meal. Delightful service and at prime time on a Friday night! I will definitely be back!

I live two blocks away and was so excited when French Louie opened, the atmosphere at first glance is inviting and they did a great job on the construction, sadly those are the only good things I can say about it.  The service was slow and inattentive  and the food was mediocre. I had the  steak which was ok, nothing to write home about and my date had the skate fish, bland fried fish that would be better suited for emergency frozen meals.  I was a little shocked that the waiter didn't ask if everything was ok, given she left most of it on the plate but he didn't seem to care.  You would think a place that hasn't been open very long would want to know what worked and what didn't..  In the end, while  I wish they would try harder, there are 2 other french places in the area that are  hands down better and worth the extra walk.

I eat here at least once a week, the staff is extremely nice and the food is amazing ( try the le grand socca) The lighting is nice and dimmed so it's perfect for a date. Outdoor seating is awesome and the wine list is really well thought out. You won't be disappointed!

They've beefed up the decor and come up with an unusual menu: the food is good, but some things (raw scallops) are better than others ("frenchie" salad). I had the skate (not bad, but not great, and could really use a green side with it) and my companion had the mushroom main course (tasty but small for the money). The service is very friendly but pretty slow -- perhaps relaxed, but really just a tad beyond that. And the noise is absolutely deafening -- you really just can't talk at all.

I was there recently and my partner ordered the duck dish on the menu but it was not up to snuff and we asked for it to be replaced with something else. Our server turns to us and says 'what are we supposed to do with this'? The owner/ manager obliged graciously though. Besides, the food was okay considering the $ spent. Not going back any time soon

I wanted to love this place.  The space is terrific, the ambiance is great, sepia lighting, etc.  The menu had so many things on it I wanted to try. Here's the bad part.  First of all, it took at least 20 minutes for a server to come to our table.  Granted, Saturday night, but there was an empty table right next to us so it's not like it was fully packed.  More importantly, the food was really disappointing.  I won't go so far as to say it sucked, but there was always something missing. In the case of the soup, it was incredibly bland. I must have used the salt shaker at least five times during the course of the soup.  And then I got a middle eastern themed vegetarian dish. Okay, maybe I should have stuck to French, but the description was appealing. I would have been perfectly fine but they kept throwing in weird flavors where they didn't belong.  The olives, for example, were overpowered by a strong orange flavor.  Bleck. I won't be going back.  Though, like I said, very pretty space.

Wasn't able to try the restaurant, but I felt compelled to write a review because of the service. We had asked the hostess if we could get something to eat, but the waitress said the restaurant was closed. Fine. So we asked if we could get a drink at the bar, but again she said that they don't serve until 5pm. However, she did give us a menu for us to take a look despite the restaurant not opening for another 45 minutes. Fine again. But as we were walking out of the restaurant, we could hear the hostess laughing with the other restaurant staff about how dumb our question was. Firstly I don't think any service establishment should allow staff to talk about their customers in that way, especially if the customers are still around and as a result I give this restaurant a zero for its service and I am sure I won't be back to try the food as there are just too many other choices in Brooklyn for me to choose from. My friend asked me for my opinion on the place as he lives around the area, guess what my answer will be.

We intended to dine at La Vara but lost our table thanks to the Brooklyn Bridge being closed to traffic. (No fault to the restaurant... we blame Mayor de Blasio and the MTA for being an hour late for our reservation!) So -- finding ourselves all the way in the area between Boerum Hill and the Slope in Brooklyn, we franticly scoured Yelp on our IPhone for something we could walk to with ease. On Atlantic Avenue was a place I had heard about from friends... French Louie. Let's start with the hostess -- as warm, friendly, charming a professional as one would hope to engage on a frustrating evening. She went out of her way to accommodate our party even though the place was packed -- and it was a Saturday night! Now let's move to the physical restaurant -- a neat bar, small, intimate, very "Brooklyn hip" without being douche, and a restaurant that is not overly loud, elegant without being pretentious, warm, inviting... we instantly felt very comfortable. (There is a large, outdoors back dining area that must be delightful in the summer.) Now... the menu. EVERYTHING sounded delicious... with the small-plates reading as inviting as the entrees. We shared an order of gougeres (small, cheese-filled puffs) and roasted brussels sprouts with grains in a harissa yogurt. Wonderful. The "Frenchie" salad was far more delicious than the simple detailing on the menu -- the bacon was hand-cut and perfect. Most of us opted for different steak/frites dishes -- the aged-steak was perfect and each of our meals came to the exact specification of what we ordered -- be it rare, medium rare, etc. We got what we wanted. The only disappointment was at desert... the spiced chocolate pot de creme with orange madeleines was insane... craving it now just thinking about it... but the house-made ice cream (that evening coconut) unfortunately had too many ice-crystals to make it stand out. That was the ONLY less-than-perfect aspect to this fine restaurant. Did I mention that the service was impeccable?  Attentive without being annoying. If you want a fine meal, an eclectic French menu, this is a wonderful choice.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place has some of the best octopus and best drinks I've ever had. This was my first time coming to this spot and I'm so glad I finally stopped by. The waiter was very helpful in explaining the menu and making sure that my peanut allergy was known to the kitchen staff. We had the guac, charred octopus, Taco De tromps, and the Pork Tacos. Just know that everything comes pretty small so you've got to get a few different items to get full. The only reason why I can't give this place five stars is because I absolutely hated the dessert option. It was basically a fried churro type thing with cream but I felt the cream didn't have enough taste and that the fried crispy bits had no substance but that's just me! I'd love to see a few more dessert options for the dairy sensitive people. Other than that amazing, amazing restaurant with great ambience, really dim lighting, and wonderful food.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The thing I love most about living in Williamsburg is that when I think I've been to any restaurant worth visiting, I'm proven wrong on every occasion. My friend recommended Aldama when for lunch after we had spent the morning at Domino Park. I hadn't heard of the restaurant but my friend only had glowing things to say about it. We walked about 10 minutes from the park to the restaurant which is located in south Williamsburg. Aldama is a modern Mexican restaurant that's ideal for a special night out. The spot is on the smaller side with a large bar and table seating around that. When it came time to order we decided to get the guacamole as well as an assortment of canasta and trompo tacos which were amazing. We also had the house margarita which was equally exceptional. Come here if you find yourself in the area with a craving for quality Mexican dishes!
No comment

unexpected, excellent intimate atmosphere with large outdoor area. great cocktails and food, especially loved the yellowtail ceviche and the poached lobster. the duck breast was fantastic, particularly the stuffed heirloom corn dough. best tortillas i've had.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Very cute ambience, good music and nice service. The food thought is a bit disappointing. Chicken with mole was just sweet and lacked some freshness in all the dishes. Some vegetables would be great. The tacos were tasty but again fresh pineapples would be better than pineapple sauce.

Pretentious and rude. We made our reservation a week in advance. The host seated us in a dark corner of the dining room despite the restaurant having only one other table occupied.  Our request to sit outside on the patio on a beautiful warm day was met with consternation. The host muttered about his seating chart while staring at his iPad. we requested to have the music turned down if we'd be inside. There was a loud speaker pointed directly at our table. I made the request about the noise again and no action was taken. The food was over-produced and gimmicky. The short rib was just okay and over priced. The waitress was curt and treated us like an inconvenience. I can only surmise that we were snubbed because we are out of towners. Perhaps locals are treated differently.  If you're visiting Brooklyn I recommend steering clear of this un-welcoming, un-nourishing, cold-shouldering hole in the wall that's trying too hard to be chic.

The dining room is zen boho like, the food is like I am sitting in Mexico City, and the drinks are unique. Really loved the service here and the food while celebrating my birthday here. That said they have a strict max on how long you can sit at the table which blows when you are with a larger party
No comment
No comment

Mmmmm. Meh. The drinks here are a little better than cocktails you'll get at most spots, but they're still not worth the $18 a cocktail costs at this point. It's also kind of silly that the Happy Hour only applies to the bar, but I just think that concept is lame in general. The food was tasty but what small portions! Their take on a carne asada taco was delicious, but overall there's nothing here to ever bring me back, unless my lovely girlfriend wants me to.
No comment

This place is pretty unassuming when you first enter, you'd think this place was just a small bar with a few seats but when you get taken through to the seating area you'll see there is more indoor and outdoor seating. My friend made a reservation for Saturday at 5:30 and we were able to be seated right away. All the staff was very nice, we really liked the ambiance and the decor, one thing that was funny was the little water cup, now they did keep our cups filled but it was just enough to take a swallow of water before someone had to come back around and fill it up again. Now this menu is very unique and besides some things like guacamole this menu looked nothing like I'd ever seen in a Mexican restaurant, now that's not really a bad thing because the food was really good and of great quality, we got the guacamole which instead of being served with tortilla chips was served with 3 tortillas that were of the same consistency of a chip, no complaints it was great and had a little spice to it, you can tell they didn't over do it with salt and instead used herbs and spices, that's important to me. We got the duck appetizer which was unique and good, we also got the Taco De Trompo which also was good but really $9 for a taco? Now it was unique I have to give them that but really overpriced in my opinion, we shared the Asado which is a 26 oz steak, it's served with some cheese with fig we think and tortillas also with a green sauce, now the quality of this steak is great, well flavored but not overly seasoned and can easily be shared by 3-4 people, you definitely pay a lot for it but it's good, what I didn't like is when we finished the tortillas and were offered more we expected that it would be complimentary considering the amount we paid for it but I was disappointed later to see that we were charged for it, now in comparison to the price of the total bill it was small change but it's the principle in my mind, this is a unique place that is very pricey but it's also unlike any Mexican place I've been to before, the drinks are pricey as well, it's a good place to check out but for my budget I couldn't come here too often.
No comment

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Come for happy hour!! Drinks are around 10$ and there are food specials as well! Otherwise wasn't too pleased with my actual meal. We ordered gauc and chips- the avocado was not ripe so there were big hard pieces in my gauc. Then for a party of 5 they gave us 4 chips. I also don't like these new "chips" which were small whole corn tortillas (so then you just break it up yourself). Didn't make sense for a big bowl of gauc. The mezcal based frozen drink was delicious but it went from 10$ to 14/15$? Same size, that's ridiculous. Come for happy hour otherwise not sure if it's worth your time. Nothing else we ate was really worth mentioning.

Great new addition in the Williamsburg area. Stopped by here with a friend to check it out and had a great time! The guacamole was outstanding and the cocktails were fantastic and worth trying. The happy hour was worth checking out, the server Vivian was very hospitable!
No comment
Excellent food! Amazing drinks , don't miss happy hours  high recommend, nice music good vibes
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Best tacos de trompo in nyc. Everything is super fresh and delicious. Definitely recommend
No comment

I came here yesterday for my friends birthday. I told the waiter that I had a peanut allergy, and he told me the only item we ordered that had peanuts was the guacamole. We ordered a variety of shared plates, including the cornish hen. I ended up having a horrible allergic reaction and had to go to the emergency room. We were supposed to go to a concert that evening that I spent 120 dollars on, but I instead could not go and spent 300 dollars on an emergency room visit. I am very disappointed in this service.
No comment
No comment

The food here is pretty good we had the lobster and chicken.  They drinks were good as well I had a Mt. Fuji similar to a Margarita.  Seating outdoor is nice however flies and mosquitos are a bit of a nuisance hence the reason for 4 stars.  Overall great vibe and ambience check it out!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This incredible meal is definitely one of the top restaurants in Williamsburg. Food highlights: Taco de Trompo, Hamachi and Tacos de canasta.  The setting and music were perfect and the staff was helpful and informative.

Aldama was truly an experience. The staff was more than generous and the food was delicious. They have devine vegan options and not to mention the guacamole and cocktails are to die for. Cannot wait to return again!
No comment

Let me start with the Daykon tostadas they were amazing and the service is tje best !   From beginning to end. Drinks are strong and delicious ! Great selection of mezcal, I love the decorations!  Special thanks to William for your hospitality. We did not have a reservation but he went out of his way to accommodate us!
Cozy place, great vibes, awesome staff, gourmet food. Willie was very accommodating to our needs and an excellent host.
What an INCREDIBLE meal! Wonderful cocktails, amazing food, excellent service. Prices are comparable to any nice New York/BK meal. Ambiance is great. Highly recommend!
No comment

This was probably the best Mexican food I have had outside of CDMX. We started with the tacos de canasta, yellowfin ceviche, and taco de trompo. All were phenomenal in their own ways, but the taco de trompo was probably the best taco I have had -- and this is from someone who adores tacos de trompo and al pastor tacos like no one I've ever met. Completely worth the price, was an experience that left me only wanting more, which in this case is a good thing. At the end I had to shake the chefs hands, because as many know, their creativity often goes unappreciated.
Sind at night was so welcoming!  Food and drinks is amazing bud service is wonderful. This is my favorite restaurant in Brooklyn. What a great experience. Thank you for a amazing dinner experience!
No comment

Top notch. I don't usually write reviews, but I can't begin to emphasize how good this meal was start to finish. Everyone who works here-A++++, the food-not just delicious, but filled with integrity, authenticity...the commitment to story.
No comment
No comment
No comment

thursday night with not reservation .. But they were very excited to have us. Mg and host were very welcoming!! food is amazing. octopus is a not missing plate. thanks for a great dining experience!!!
My new favorite gem !!!  Excellent service !!  Best chicken I'd ever had!!   Great selection of mezcal and the Asian hostess was nice and friendly. !!  I can't wait to come back for brunch

I absolutely love this place . I was there on Thursday with my boyfriend and we had a great time .  The food was awesome ,tasty  drinks and amazing service. I will be back to try their brunch . I definitely recommend this place . 5 stars from me and my bf. Keep it up the great work, Aldama

This place has a lot to be said in its favor: great staff, drinks, ambiance. However. Many vegans and vegetarians will come here for the vegan mole - which is a dish one basically never comes across, it's practically an oxymoron. This restaurant makes a big deal about this dish. It's the most expensive on the menu. And it is awful. Besides being almost nothing other than mole - a few tiny  mushrooms, that's it - the mole tastes burnt with a charcoal aftertaste. No one at my table found anything positive to say about it. And two of us found it repugnant enough to stop eating entirely. So disappointing!
Great ambience!!   Food is amazing!! Service is friendly and professional. Drinks :  try the sangre de mezcal !! Lo love the music !!

Underwhelming... Maybe since it was a soft opening ( I hope), I'll give them another shot in a couple of months.  I got duped by the nyeater article prior to visiting. "Despite his history serving drinks at top-tier restaurants, Reyes wants Aldama to be an approachable, everyday hangout. "I don't want to have a hundred different tequilas and mezcals on our wall," he says. Instead, the bar is focusing on 10 bottles of each, available for sipping from copitas with slices of oranges. A happy hour -- 5 to 7 p.m. daily -- advertises frozen margaritas and beer and mezcal shot combos for $10 or less.".....  There was no mezcal selection, only one cocktail list with 6 drinks ($14 each), one with mezcal....and it was frozen...I'd assume since the founder of the establishment is a bartender, the drinks would be more impressive...to each their own. Food menu was short as well and did not wow me either (and we ordered everything with the exception of the guacamole) There are only 2 meat options on the menu, both are small plates.  One is the cecina; thinly sliced, dried, crispy filet( think beef jerky meets chicharron) and the tacos- very good!  As explained by our server, the corn is imported de Mexico and milled in house! Growing pains... I'm sure they'll right the ship... Go here and you'll see what I'm talking about.
No comment
Beautiful place, good food staff nice and attentive and place was spacious. Will go back
No comment

If you are looking for a quick go-to italian restaurant that is classy, this is the place to go. The ambiance is romantic, yet also a place you can go to with friends. They have classics like chicken and eggplant Parm but also a creative side to their menu like a giant truffle and stuffed cheese meatball. I enjoyed every bite of that appetizer meatball and would strongly suggest that everyone try it when you go! The drinks were made to perfection as I had a mango piña colada (different, right?). This is the type of place where you would go on a first date and it won't break the bank but it shows you have class (I saw a couple nearby on a date). They have outdoor and indoor seating and I like that their outdoor seating was on the side of their restaurant and not out in the street. Parking is okay, I found a spot right in front but that isn't commons.

I came here the other night to celebrate my birthday. The food was delicious. Some of the best Italian I've had in a long time but the service was really slow. My mom also told them it was my birthday and then they brought dessert out and she asked for candle cause it didn't come with one.
No comment
No comment

The place is large, with indoor and outdoor seating. The service was good. The pasta dishes were average, the lobster ravioli did come with a good amount of crab. Ravioli ripieni was heavy on the mushroom and the filet mignon did not come through.
No comment

I really hate that I'm about to do this but I came here last night and had the absolute worst service! It took 30 min for us to even put our order in (and we had to call our server to actually put it in) and after that our food didn't come for 50 min! We were there for a total of two hours and no refills on a Diet Coke because nobody came around for us! I also hate to name drop the server but Yassine was absolutely awful and this is the second time I've come here and had issues with him! The first time he got into a full blown argument with my friend over a drink and that was around a month ago and I came back in hopes to not have him as a server and guess what! Just my luck. ADDITIONALLY, the table next to us had a horrible experience with him as well and actually complained to his face and the managers face! Now let me say this, the food is amazing. BUT I just don't think this can out weigh a server with an attitude and neglect. I came here to celebrate my birthday and once I realized we were somehow in his section i actually asked my gf to NOT tell anyone it was my birthday because I did not want him to sing. Anyways won't be coming back which makes me so sad cause the food is so good.
The food was excellent here with very reasonable prices. The ambiance was also lovely with very friendly staff.
No comment

Wanted to explore Williamsburg and found this place. It wasn't too hard to get a resi and I'm sure walks in would have also been fine. They gave some bread (which was very fluffy) with a red sauce. The sauce had a little bit of a red pepper flavor and was slightly sweet, but a delicious pairing with the bread. We got the Burrata Cheese as an appetizer to share which was also great. Then I got the fettuccine Verdi tartufate and my friend got a special they had which was called the mezzi rigatoni. She loved her dish and I also enjoyed mine- it was a little heavy on the cream which I had been warned about. The ambience inside was nice and the servers were very attentive. I would come here again- my only "negative" is that the vegetarian options are a little more limited.

This place is amazing! The dim light gives a cozy romantic vibe with candles lit on all the tables. They had happy hour drinks I had a margarita which was really good. The calamari was amazing!!!! My brothers mother in law ordered eggplant parmigiana I had ordered chicken parmesan with linguine, I feel it could've been more tasty if it had more flavor to it. It wasn't bad but ok could use more seasoning I will say it was very cheesy which I loved. I will go back to this restaurant but I'll order sacchetti Al peperoncino because it was amazing as well. Also the complimentary bread comes with a tasty sauce which is a sweet but with a hint of spice in the sauce which is amazing to dip the bread in. Overall the staff is friendly.

From the flavors to the ambiance and service, La Nonna was an experience to be had many times over. Put simply, the food wad phenomenal with portions that guarantee you will not leave hungry! Try it and prepare for your palate to thank you.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Love this place! Go for the food but stay for the drinks! The drinks are really good and pair well with the Italian classics at this place! The drinks are some of the best I've had in nyc! The atmosphere and ambiance makes this place a great date spot or dinner with friends spot. You also feel welcomed to sit alone at the bar and grab a drink and dinner from the bartender! Very welcoming and cozy place overall
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I've been here a few times and it never disappoints. I had the squid ink linguini and it was quite a generous portion and delicious. the menu is on the pricier side but the portions are substantial and the food is always great. I also recommend the margarita (either plain or spicy-both are great).
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I came to try this pizza place after my boyfriend discovered it and raved on about how good it was! Otherwise I never would have bothered even going inside. The place had me at krispy Krust - they delivered what they promised! The moment I had my first bite, I knew this spot was the real deal. The pizza was so crunchy that you could hear every bite from across the restaurant! It was thin crust, my favorite type of pizza. I absolutely loved the sausage pepperoni since it's a classic. The chicken bacon ranch was also good, but is on the heavier side. I will have to come back again next time to try their margarita slice! Excellent spot right by the pier in Williamsburg.
Lovely ambience, very tasty Italian cuisine not to mention very affordable. Ideal place to take a date or a special event.
No comment

This restaurant completely ruined my birthday. It was the worst service I'd ever experienced in my 32 years in NYC. The waiter who was rude when he took our order and then forgot to bring our order to the kitchen so we waited 2 hours for our food. By the time it came we were so upset and tired and angry that it wasn't even enjoyable. We had to even beg for our wine which finally came to us 40 mins after we ordered it. The meal was comped but I cried because it made my special day really depressing. The waiter needs to be fired immediately. Do not recommend and will never be back.

The food is exceptionally bad. There are so many better options in the neighborhood. We ordered the eggplant, and it was nearly inedible and sent it back. We felt terrible doing so, and told the server we'd be more than happy to still pay for it, and they gladly accepted the offer with no desire to rectify the situation or offer alternatives.

Lovely ambiance, delicious food & huge portions, great service, and right off the river near the ferry stop.  As a bonus they have lots of gluten free options, and even a vegan bolognese dish, so a GF + vegan option that was fabulous.  Such a charming find.  Loved it!
No comment
No comment
great service so kind. Amazing food i loved my experience here and the staff was so kind hearted.
No comment
Amazing food & amazing service. Best Italian food I've ever had!! Was at La Nonna for a work dinner and enjoyed every single bite of our meal!

Went here on a Friday evening with outdoor reservations. To start we ordered the scallops and fried calamari. Scallops were pretty good and cooked perfectly, beautifully plated. Calamari was also tasty but nothing out of the ordinary. For our entrees we got the rib eye steak and sacchetti al peperoncino. Both were pretty good and large enough that we took our leftovers home. Service was a bit slow but it really got bad at the end, after we finished our meal it took us almost 40 mins to get our waiters attention. At that point we didn't have time for dessert and just had to get the check. Overall a good experience but service could be improved.
No comment
Came here for our birthday last year; yeah it might have to be a tradition food was great experience was great would definitely come back !
No comment

First time here and it was great! The food was great! Everything tasted amazing ! The drink of choice was great(can't remember the name of it). Our waiter provided great friendly service also . And the desserts and cappuccino finish of the meal perfectly. When we were finish we took a walk on the north pier which is a few mins walking and the view of the city was amazing .

Perfect spot for date night, we went for Valentine's Day and the ambience was even better than I imagined. The service was all around kinda weird... which could have just been because it was Valentine's Day? But we seldom saw our server. And apps/bread were whisked off the table before we had a chance to say anything. Just some silly little moments. BUT! All of that evens out by how excellent the food is and how perfect the atmosphere is. Great options for vegetarians (the eggplant parm was exactly what I had hoped for) and the drinks are not outrageously expensive. I would definitely recommend :-)

I ordered the Fettuccine Verdi Tartufate to go and it was delicious. It was something different from the classic pastas. I wish they would have given me softer pieces of bread but overall enjoyed the meal.

Stopped by here for lunch last month. Really liked the upscale decor on the inside. We ordered a little bit of everything and it was all pretty good. Not amazing but still above average.  The paid parking at the garage down the street is the chef's kiss. Would definitely come back here.
Loved the Caesar salad. Good customer service. Great atmosphere.

Came to La Nonna with some family after nearby SeaWolf was closed for a wedding. I am SO GLAD we found this place. They had a reservation available online, and we arrived about 5 minutes early. The hostess got us seated, and we loved the outdoor patio. We started with some cocktails and a bottle of rose, which was a great way to ease into the meal. As far as appetizers, I ordered the burrata cheese for the table, which came with the burrata, roasted tomatoes, gaeta olives, and balsamic pearls with some bread. Very good stuff. My entree was the tortelloni al Pollo which tasted fresh and came with very tender chicken. Sometimes cream-based pastas can feel like an adult mac and cheese, but I can promise you this one many many cuts above. Service was a bit slow at first but it leveled out. They were busy and there is a labor shortage, so I won't subtract any stars for that. I can't wait to come back next time I'm in Brooklyn!

Visited for a birthday dinner. The staff were efficient and friendly. We ordered Gamberi alla Fiorentina, Frittura di Calamari and Gamberi al Limoncello for starters. For entrees we enjoyed Gnocchi & Vitello Tartufato. Everything was delicious!

Had a reservation for two on a Saturday night. We were starving. I knew I'd fill up on the complimentary bread as I was eating it (I added olive oil to it, it was delish). By the time my ENORMOUS pizza came I could only eat one slice! The rest was taken home and enjoyed the next day. Blood orange marg was very very very good. I had two! My husband said the filet was 5/5. I'm giving a solid 5 stars for the service. My husband had a coke in a glass and when he picked up the glass the bottom of the glass fell off (like, it just fell off, he didn't bump it or anything lol honestly kind of funny) and Coke went all over the table. So many waiters came over to help clean it up immediately and replace the drink. Really appreciated their service! Super friendly too. Bathroom was clean (but stall is teensy tiny). We are never in this neighborhood but I would recommend this place to anyone if they asked for a great spot in Williamsburg with a nice view of the city right around the corner.
worst "italian " food i've ever had in my life. the penne ala vodka was watery and had 3 tiny pieces of bacon in it

I was taken on a date here. It was a Tuesday night, not that busy. He made the reservation. We were sat in a corner in the back and it seemed as if the staff forgot about us. We sat and waited about 45 minutes to order and the food took almost the same amount of time. I'm not a local here but this took way too long  and by the time my food came, I lost my appetite. Maybe seat your customers where you can see them? Also the food wasn't that great to me.

A girlfriend and I ordered La Nonna on a whim while craving pasta. I walk past the restaurant all the time but have never had it until tonight. It was so damn good. I got the Rigatoni Ripieni Cacio E Pepe and my friend got the Cavatelli Bolognese. Both were really great. Also split the Carciofi Salad. Delicious!
No comment
No comment
No comment

This reservation started at 8 and ended at 10:30. This was not by design or because we were being leisurely. Yes we were a big party but we had reservations so they in theory should have been prepared. We had a variety of plates on the table that ranged from okay to good. I ordered the chicken parm with vodka sauce which I was excited about but it fell incredibly short. To be honest, NY is full of amazing Italian restaurants and this one just isn't it. I wouldn't recommend or return and to be Frank am being generous with a 3 star review.
I've always been tempted by their pasta and it did not disappoint! Unlike any other pasta I've had in NYC, truly. Pizza was so so but their main spicy pasta dish blew me away.
Great spot to go with a group of friends or on a date. The food is good with fair prices while the menu has a little bit of something for everyone.

Beautiful restaurant and amazing food! The decor is to die for. Went for my husbands birthday and they food and drinks were beyond amazing! My 2 year old loved the food as well. After you get to walk by the water! Great place for celebrations!

Been coming here for years, place is always great. Food is delicious, cocktails are on point and I have to say for the price point great bang for your buck. Advise getting a reservation because the place is always busy.

We tried this place for the first time via Uber Eats and it was delicious! Chicken parm with penne, cacio  e pepe, Caesar salad, and tiramisu - everything was super tasty! We can't wait to come in to the physical restaurant next time.
No comment

I enjoy the food here a lot but the in dining service is absolutely horrible. The staff is rude and not helpful. They took forever to bring out our food and we could not get anyones attention for 30 minutes and when I mentioned this they had an attitude. I will still do take out from here but would not dine in person in an establishment that doesn't know how to interact with customers.

Our favorite place to get Italian in Brooklyn. The place is very classy inside and the service is amazing! Employees are very friendly and hard working. The food is delicious and authentic. I would definitely recommend trying this place. You won't regret it.

Okay... I been coming here for Italian for like 4 years now. This place never misses the target when it comes to their entrees! Always ask for their specials since it is limited time only! But the ambience and atmosphere is amazing, for date night and a family outing! they add a sparkler candle when u say its your birthday, or anyones bday, (just hint hint) so this place is awesome, I will still explore more from them, keep posted for a new review this summer!

Great ambiance and attentive service but I was underwhelmed by the food and surprisingly I only thoroughly enjoyed the complimentary focaccia with the tomato sauce and olive oil. I would try again but I wasn't impressed with my initial visit.
Excellent decor, service and food. Classic Italian taken to a higher level. Prices are fabulous for Williamsburg. Can't wait to go again.
No comment
Service was excellent. The food was delicious and you can go for a walk by the piers after you eat!

Soooo good! First off, the bread they serve with some type of spicy/sweet marinara sauce was DELICIOUS. My friends and I were obsessed and asked for extra to dip our fried calamari in as well. Calamari was good, could use a little more flavor but was perfectly crispy, not too chewy. The red sangria was amazing, I would definitely recommend if you want something light and refreshing. I had the the Sachetti pasta very delicious! The server described it as spicy but it really wasn't that spicy at all. The sausage has a kick and there's a few peppers but not too many. Great meal at a great price. I would definitely come back again.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This spot was a last minute find. We booked through open table 30 minutes before arriving. We received a call confirming our arrival 3 minutes before the time we booked( we were walking in as she called) we were seated immediately. Our waiter, Juan Carlos, was absolutely phenomenal. He was pleasant, soft spoken and attentive. He provided great recommendations for our appetizer and entrèe, refilled out wine glasses and was overall great. The food was absolutely delicious! ( Get the apple tart for dessert) great experience and highly recommend.

Came here for a date night dinner and it was amazing. I absolutely loved the food. It was well cooked, warm, fresh, truly the best. We ordered a bottle of wine and two entrees and the bill came out to around $112 more or less. We made reservations and our table was ready as soon as we arrived which was great. The waiters were attentive to our needs and constantly asked if we were okay. This was my first time coming here and it definitely won't be my last. The restrooms were spotless clean which I appreciated. Excellent organization as a restaurant, especially during the Covid outdoor dining situation. Thank you for a great experience !!
No comment
Excellent leisurely meal! Sat in the outdoor area which was nice, spacious, and dog-friendly. Overall, highly recommend.
No comment
What a GEM this place!!! A must go when your in Williamsburg,or anytime for that matter...

Tonight we had dinner at "La Nonna". From the moment we walked we were greeted by the hostess and we asked to be seated at the window and she did just that. She was very pleasant! Next, our server, Alessandro gave us stellar service. He made suggestions for our drinks, appetizers and entree. He made us feel so welcomed. We dined at another restaurant prior to coming here, (Queensyard at Hudson Yards)  It was a terrible experience and we left before we could even order. Terrible customer service from the hostess to the server. But La Nonna turned our whole night around. I recommend everyone give this place a try, you won't regret it!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Couldnt leave review on Uber Eats. Sacchetti Peperoncino & Pete Salad are out of this world. One of the best meals I've had in a long time. Nice job

Not at all impressed with our meal here. Salads were fairly basic and over dressed.  The veal dishes we ordered lacked any depth of flavor and the meat was quite chewy.  Also be careful about making any substitutions. When I asked to switch out the mashed potatoes for the pasta that came with certain other dishes, I was told no problem and received a small portion of linguine on my plate. Surprisingly the bill showed an up charge of $4 without the waiter ever mentioning anything. Not a good business practice in my opinion.  Won't be coming back.

Love this place! Amazing drinks (deff go during happy hour) and the food is so fresh and flavorful! Our server was attentive and kind. Hospitality, food and drinks are all 5 star! What else can you ask for?
Very hood service very good good. That green pasta and chicken Marsala... do it! Hood combo together.
Service is very very slow, but good is very very good. Order the steak! It's delicious. They do need to work on their service though..... waited 20 minutes for water

3.5. Fine-Good service...old school ambience....solid food and martinis. Not too pricey//lovely if you're in the immediate neighborhood but I wouldn't go out of my way. Limitless spots for Italian all over the vastness that is Williamsburg that are worth a visit
Food was excellent, service was prompt. Price was extremely reasonable . Highly recommend

Deliciousness. Everything that passed by carried by the waiters had my head spinning.  It all looked and smelled so good. We started with this giant stuffed meatball. We also had a shrimp special that was wrapped in speck and a pineapple glaze. So delicious. For the main course I had the osso bucco that was served over risotto and my date had the lobster ravioli with shrimp & crabmeat sauce that was delicious. I wish I had room for dessert, but I couldn't do it. I will be back! The wait staff was very good and the Decor was warm and comfortable.

I've ordered delivery and been to the restaurant and both times the pasta was incredible. The best carbonara I've ever had. Decent lasagna but my favorite pasta of all time is the cavatelli bolognese. I tell everyone I know to go here because the pasta was so memorable for me. I have yet to try their other dishes though. Oh and the tiramisu was very good too.
Don't order the baked clams. What a joke, 7 littleneck clams for $14
No comment
I love this place the food is always great. The food is consistently on point. If your in Williamsburg you must come here.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The seafood pasta was absolutely disgusting. The pasta was way undercooked and the seafood tasted stale and over cooked. It literally tasted like they cooked the seafood days ago then popped it in the microwave and left it in for too long. It just tasted like literal rubber. This place clearly doesn't care about the quality of their food. I'm not super picky but it's clear that they put ZERO effort into this food. I wonder if they taste the things they serve. If they did I'm sure the whole kitchen staff would quit. Wanted to like this place but it was shocking how bad it was...
No comment

Great outdoor enclosed seating area with heated lamps. Reservations recommended don't forget they close at 10pm due to Covid-19 restrictions. Otherwise great food and staff! Great spot for a date night or g2g.

La Nonna is hands down the best Italian restaurant in the Williamsburg area. If you are looking for authentic real Italian food - this is the place for you. The staff is amazing and very professional - and the ambiance is nice too. This is a regular date night spot for me and my boyfriend and we always will bring friends to this restaurant as well - as we know we can count on the quality of service and you literally can't go wrong with anything that you order on the menu - the food is all so amazing!!
No comment

Came here for a double date and the food was to die for. The atmosphere was romantic. The outdoor seating was plenty and on Saturday night the restaurant was very busy but the service was immaculate. Every table gets complimentary bread and a garlicy tomato sauce for dipping. The cocktails were so yummy we each had two before our dinner even arrived. I'd recommend the fettuccine Verdi tartufate if you love truffle.

Ate at this restaurant tonight. So glad they are open and serving again with some seating inside and heated tents outside. I've given this restaurant a five star review in the past and I'm happy to say they haven't lost a step. The service is impeccable, the food is fantastic and the owners are friendly. I'm never disappointed in anything I order from here. All the meals on the menu are delicious. This chef is truly talented and I consider him an artist. The flavor profiles he puts together are simply amazing. This is definitely my favorite restaurant.
No comment

I went here yesterday to celebrate Father's Day expecting  exceptional service unfortunately I had to wait over an hour for my meal.I understand it was busy but this is not the kind of service I am accustom to receiving.The fact I had to wait this long I really did not enjoy my meal.The braised short ribs was good but I just loss my appetite.
No comment

I was a fan of the La Nonna pizzeria restaurant. This one wasn't as amazing as the person who recommended place made it out to be. The food was just OK for me. The bread was a bit stale and the pasta a bit on the salty side. But our waiter was attentive and friendly and everyone was following COVID protocol for the most part. The menu is made available by using the scanner at the table to limit touching.

Lovely restaurant . You feel very welcome when you walk in. Beautifully decorated with a great bar. Bartenders were great and drinks delicious . Menu is really nice with a lot of great options . We were very happy with our appetizers, main course and desserts . Only negative was the service . The waiter was very lacking . We had to ask for bread twice, my husband had to ask for another drink twice and when we asked for more coffee we never got it. It was busy but not crazy busy , he needed to be more attentive to our table . Will go back but hopefully will not get the same waiter.

This place was beautiful, the service was timely, and the food was super tasty! I'm not a fan of pasta, but I was convinced to give it a shot here... it wasn't bad at all... but my favorite were the cannolis!
No comment

A few years ago I would have given la nonna a 4 or 5. This is more like a 2.5 but even numbers are what I've got to work with. We have ordered from here so many times since moving to the building next door and the food has gone SO far downhill. The last time I was there I spent over $100 and could have had a better dinner from the grocery store. I was super embarrassed that my friends were in Brooklyn and that's where we got food. They always get the orders wrong over the phone, things are always missing in delivery and the food has just tasted weird lately. My recent eggplant parm has eggplant that wasn't cooked at all... it was super hard. I hate that we can't order from our old "go to" anymore but there are just way better places in the area.

They never delivered my food and when I called they said it was coming then it didn't. Then grub hub called and they didn't even answer the second time. I waited 2 hours and it never came!!! For $22 an entre I want them to bring it lol
excellent italian food and ambiance. Everyone had a ball and shared dishes. It was delicious and will definitely be going back!

Very nice place and service was on point. The complete order was great. Very clean. The only thing you must pay cash I don't understand with a nice fancy place they have a credit card service.

Great meal here. Had the chicken parm with spaghetti and also the bolognese. Both were delicious. The service was friendly, and fast. The setting was nice. We enjoyed the whole meal.
No comment

I've been here a few times, the food is always amazing. I call, or setup a reservation,  just in case. The staff is really top notch. The skirt steak for the table looks to die for. Eggplant towers, Calamari, the table bread, with basil, tomato sweet, lil kick of spice sauce is killa! Come here hungry, be ready to eat, the desserts and a cappuccino to end it are a must. Don't dare leave without it... Atmosphere is upper casual, to dressy. Omg, almost forgot the Penne Alla Vodka sauce with bacon is too melt in your mouth... Looking for great for, HERE, HERE, GO NO FURTHER!

I usually never write Yelp reviews but was very frustrated by this experience. We spent about 1000 dollars at La Nonna. The food itself was good but not sure if it was good value in terms of portions for the appetizers. What was upsetting was there was a lot of different tricks to upcharge us despite us already spending a lot of money per person. For example, they ask do you want still or sparkling water? We said still and they added on a $9 bottle of still water when usually you would just assume there would be free tap water. In addition, 20% tip was already pre-added to the bill and they did not mention this. So we ended up tipping an extra 18% on top of the original bill. Overall almost 400 dollars of tips for what should have been a 600 dollar meal. What's insane is that they failed to mention how we overlooked this. Was a good meal if you are super on your toes about not being upcharged, but really left a bad taste in our mouths based on sneaky practices. We will not be back.

Back a year later and I'm putting the star I took off back on to give La Nonna 5 stars. I still say the portions aren't big enough, I'm a guy who likes to eat, so I order a pasta as an app and then get an entree. Tonight I had the stuffed pasta with veal for my app and veal scallopini with truffle cream sauce as my entree. The veal was so so tender you can cut it with a fork and the truffle sauce was absolutely to die for. I loved it.
No comment

The place and the food are amazing but they're lacking on the service, they took 20 minutes to bring water to the table and even tho they have a good and extend wine list, the server couldn't even open the bottle properly, that's why I'm giving this place a 3 star rating

The restaurant is beautiful and in a great location. Food is ok. It wasn't special but good. The ravioli repieni, fried ravioli stuffed with Filet Mignon was pretty good. I would have liked it if the truffle sauce was just a drizzle. It was a little too much sauce and overwhemled the ravioli. The baby Kale salad was extremely fresh. The Kale seemed like it was plucked from a garden to the table. The salmon entrees were good but didn't wow. They could've used a little.more seasoning. It was on the bland side.  Service was very friendly and attentive.

Yesterday I went to this restaurant with some friends. It wasn't a busy night, and somehow we waited longer than usual for service. However, the bread they give for starters paired with the chickpea spread is outstanding. The bread tastes fresh and is warm, and the spread had a nice flavor. I ordered the black squid ink linguini with seafood (saying seafood because I don't remember the specifics) and it tasted amazing. Everyone at my table was satisfied with their order so that's always a good thing to say. The restaurant also is very nice and has outdoor seating.
No comment

I've been to La Nonna 3 times and I've always had a positive experience.  The food is fantastic and the service is good.  During my last visit, my party of 4 shared the octopus and scallops appetizers, which were cooked perfectly.  I had the osso buco for my main course and it melted in my mouth.  Will be back again when in Williamsburg.
This review is only for take out.  Good food but the order came almost an hour late.  Worth going to in person but not recommended for delivery.

La Nonna is my favorite Italian restaurant in Williamsburg. A sophisticated take on Italian classics, the ambiance is relaxed and inviting and the decor is gorgeous. We tried the Kobe meatball, it was extremely filling but also so full of flavor. For my entree I got the baked gnocchi bolognese, and it was delicious. Dying to try so much more on their menu!

Chose to celebrate my moms birthday here and it was beyond amazing. The atmosphere, the service, the food  even the music was set to create a mellow and relaxing setting. We had the veal piccata and the chicken Marsala; I do recommend. My mom had the ravioli Ripieni di carne and she loved it; my highlights of the evening would have to be the complimentary bread and Marinara sauce that comes along with it also the desert; the pistachio crime brûlée . My waiter Alex was professional attentive and went the extra mile to get my mom a special birthday dessert. Will surely be returning...soon

So sad that my chicken parm was not edible...  due to the fact of being deep fried twice if not more  it became the texture of rubber and chewy fat.   (Chicken was gray ,shinny and the bead was all falling off ) The pasta was ok but a bit sticky. The sauce was mind blowing . The chicken I threw out and ate the remaining part of my meal . I feel  sick as heck after wards .  Literally threw up in my mouth about a hour later . I wasn't going to  even do a review but now since  they failed to refund my money like I was promised .  Leaving this review for all  and the owner ..   note.  The lady who answered and offered to replace my meal or a full refund  told me you deep fry the chicken lol and that Uber eats wouldn't let  the restaurant refund me on there side of the app. I've written Uber and hope I get my  money back because you food made me sick .  Chicken parm is the most basic Italian food to make . How the heck did this get so rancid and poorly cooked ?

The ambiance in here is awesome! Very elegant and clean. The servers are extremely professional and kind. The food is amazing!! Everything was delicious from the salad to the dessert! Would definately reccomend for an intimate dinner or group dining as well.
Love this place! Fresh authentic Italian food with a fine dining atmosphere. Love the modern twists on some of these dishes especially the wagyu meatball! So delicious!
No comment

My belated Father's Day dinner: Gnocchi of the Day ( of beets in cream sauce). Like my tongue threw a party for my mouth!

Great atmosphere for a birthday dinner. Drink menu is available to view on an iPad with a hefty selection of wines and cocktails, our group chose the red sangria which came at great portions for the price. The bread for the table was a nice way to begin our meal and all of the dishes that my group had were delicious. A list of about 10 specials for dinner with something for everyone!
No comment

Recommended by friend. The restaurant has a very nice vibe, bartender (Tressa) was very friendly, professional, and knowledgeable. She recommended me the Fusili Pescatora. Very delightful. Perfect for this spring weather. Not heavy and very balanced. Would definitely recommend this place. Another thing bathroom was very clean which is a plus for me. Staff are very friendly and on point. Great place to host big parties.

We ordered food for pick up this evening and the order wasn't ready for 40 minutes after the confirmed time. There was no apology and the clam linguine was incredibly salty.

This place is yummy, the ambiance is nice inside feels like a more upscale restaurant but with good prices. We love the chicken PARM dish it's phenomenal
No comment

La Nonna was a cool place the servers was really attentive! The reason I came here was for a bday dinner with close friends! We had a pre fix menu so I had limited choices but from the choices everything was great..... it was a lil on the expensive side but hey you pay for the experience too. I didn't give the place 5 stars cause my entree dish the chicken pre fix was small!! And very thin and a lil rubbery for my taste but other than that if u want to impress a girl and some good Italian food this is the place to go!

La Nonna is a decent Italian restaurant located by the East River in Williamsburg. The wait staff are all very attentive and really understand their menu. When asked for suggestions or trying to navigate the menu, they are always on their game. The food itself is good, but I've never had anything that's completely blown me away. Everything is mediocre and pretty main stream. The ambiance of the restaurant is nice and there is outdoor seating during the warmer months. That being said, if you're looking for amazing Italian food, there are much better places in Williamsburg.

I had a great lunch with my friend this Week     Very taste seared scallops with risotto black ink nice margherita spicy  great bar man ..... efficient service and prompt  and net not tacky or fake ....  will definitely  be back if I'm at Brooklyn thanks Nonna staff ... simple tasty food

Great spot in Williamsburg for all types of dinning. Whether it's date night, a family gathering, or brunch, La Nonna is the spot. Super cute decor! They have outdoor seating in the warmer weather as well. The portions here are very generous and the food is delightful. The staff is super courteous and friendly too! If you need a phone charger, they will let you charge at the hostess stand. There's a parking garage around the corner on N 5th and you can walk around the waters edge on the board walk. Great views of NYC. Highly recommend!
No comment

One of the best Italian restaurants in New York City! Their Margaheritia pizza is the best I have ever tasted! One of my favorite places ever and service is always great. Waiters are very helpful and give good advice. I definitely recommend going to La Nonna Ristorante & Bar!
No comment

I've had Italian food in my life plenty of times but nothing and no one adds up to this wonderful,delightful and tasteful food that La Nonna provides. The steak and sea food down to the sauce for the bread provided for appetizers is amazing. The environment is so pleasant and peaceful it's amazing. The music is calming and the staff is great. They're there when you need them. This is my first time here and I promise it's not my last. The calamari and oysters are to die for!!!!!

Recommended by a friend, and they did not disappoint!  Likely the best dinner I have ever had, Cono is a absolute food artist and his creations are second to none!  This will be a stop every time I'm in NYC!

My amazing bf took here to celebrate my birthday and from soup to nuts it was fantastic. The dipping sauce for the bread was seasoned to perfection the bread was soft warm and fresh. The drinks were incredible -- premium liquor and ingredients! The appetizers and entrees were excellent. The customer service was world class! This is my favorite Italian restaurant in Brooklyn!

This place is bomb! Alex treats me like family and the food is always top notch. They always have amazing specials whenever you go. Great for a large dinner, intimate date night, of a casual wine and App night At the bar.

We took our mother for her 79th birthday and I was so impressed. The environment is so soothing, we never felt rushed to leave.  Our waiter Edwin was wonderful and so accommodating. The food was amazing, the drinks perfection and the deserts heavenly.  We will definitely return.  La Nonna, keep doing what you are doing this is a gold mine. Much success.
No comment
No comment

Highly Recommend this establishment! The place is absolutely stunning and the food is delicious! I came here for Sunday brunch and I have no complaints. Servers were very polite and attentive. Portions are very filling and you may order from their regular menu as well.
