No comment

Food is delicious here. It is a little expensive but was worth it for a special celebration. Baked clams appetizer was delicious although I was a little disappointed that the clams were so small - about the size of a quarter. Entrees ordered by us averaged $25 and appetizers were half that. Sangria was nicely flavored and welcomed on a very hot day. Service was attentive and bread was warm and refilled.

I've been here many times with family, friends and my ex too and even at their old location. The pasta and the pizza is great. My friend who's a vegetarian had good options to choose from. The wine is good too. I highly recommend it.

This place is absolutely outstanding! Me and my husband decided to have nice romantic dinner for two on a Saturday night, and that's exactly what we got! Service was amazing! From the hostess that greets you with a warm smile to all the staff on the floor. We waited for our table for a couple of minutes and the hostess suggested we have a seat at the bar! had a couple drinks there!!We had a super sweet attentive server, I believe her name was Catarina( i am not 100%sure) the food out of this world! You can definitely tell how much pride and work they put in running this restaurant! Great job La Nonna!
No comment
Great restaurant the staff is amazing the food is amazing everything is amazing. This is real fine Italian dining at its best. Highly recommend this place.

My first review here likened this place to Olive Garden which after repeat visits I admit was only partly true. In fact they serve a lot of good classic old school red sauce Italians solidly and with pleasant service at reasonable prices.

Had a business dinner at La Nonna, we had a number of dishes. Appetizers were fried calamari and a Mozzarella $ Pruiscutto special (fried) both apps were good, not great, but fresh, the calamari only had rings, which normally isn't the case in higher end restaurants, but either way it tasted fresh and wasn't chewy. A few of us ordered the pasta pescatore, was nicely flavored, the tomato sauce was a nice compliment to the seafood, but not a lot of seafood, was expecting more for price. My colleague ordered a risotto with salmon and didn't enjoy it much, the salmon was cut into scallop size pieces, very weird?? All in all a decent meal, but not great. I would give 3.5, but since yelp only allows full stars, I'll give them the benefit of doubt of 4 because the service was good.
No comment

The ambiance set the tone for one romantic evening. Very authentic Italian fine dining. Located in In one of Brooklyn's premier neighborhoods. Williamsburg. We didn't have reservations, unbeknownst to us lol. But the hostess was kind enough to find us a table. What can i say..... Great evening.

Classy, clean and VERY welcoming. I've eaten there 5 times already and enjoyed each & every meal. Love how their pasta meals range from Northern Italy all the way down to delectable Mediterranean dishes! Yum! This place shall NOT disappoint. Casual, but NICE clothing apparel, a must. Shoes & your top should not be 'street-like'. Very charming atmosphere. Place is always bustling, which means patrons LOVE it there! 2 thumbs up (and 5 starts), for certain!

Just finished a wonderful meal at La Nonna.  We were driving my son back to Williamsburg after celebrating Easter with our family in NJ on Saturday.  We had made reservations for 2pm on Easter Sunday for the three of us  and when we arrived we were promptly seated in a lovely outside area that we had requested on our reservation.  The food was truthfully amazing!!! The presentation of all of the food was beautiful, and the flavors of each dish were like little explosions of heaven on your taste buds.  The wait staff was attentive and appropriately engaging and the meal from appetizer and drinks to dessert and coffee was well paced and the three of us were comfortably ready to leave in 90 minutes feeling extremely satisfied with our first ever Easter dinner in a restaurant.  While we didn't sit inside, it was a beautiful setting and clearly set up for social distancing.   As an Italian-American myself, I can tell you that this is a must go to Italian restaurant.  It took the traditional cuisine to the next level and we will most definitely be back there to dine again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a great atmosphere, great food and lovely staff.
No comment
Amazing old school yet modern Italian restaurant. Food is lovely and so is the service. It makes for a great date night. Hard to find Italian restaurants like this anymore.
No comment

La Nonna is by far one of the top Italian restaurants in all of NY. Once you walk into this gem, you will notice the high ceilings and amazing decor. You will be greeted by the kindest people in the service industry. The hostess and wait staff are beyond phenomenal - I can't talk any more highly about them - they're simply the best of the best. Alex and Hans have been my servers the numerous times I've dined at this fine establishment. Now, what can I say about the food other then you will absolutely have your pallette dazzled. From starters to dessert and everything in between - AMAZING. I am so pleased and beyond satisfied every time I eat here. Some of my suggestions for starters: Polpettone di Carne & Burrata Deliziosa. For your main course: Pollo Maltese & Grigliata Mista. And, you can't go wrong with any of their desserts! One thing I would like to mention, listen to their specials! Their specials are beyond amazing and I highly recommend ordering one if it's your first time here. Also, their wine menu is amazing. If you're not familiar with wine, ask for a suggestion and they will definitely lead you down the right path. With all of that said, I highly recommend La Nonna!

I really wanted to rate this place higher since it's located in a chic neighborhood and had nice decor with good music playing in the background. The reason for my two rating is because when my chicken parm order came out, there was a hair on my plate right next to the food. When I pointed out the hair to the server, the first thing that was asked was if I wanted another plate?!?! Seriously? I found that to be a very odd question since it was a hair that definitely wasn't my hair since I just got the food. Then when the server brought it to the waiter's attention, the waiter stopped by and said it looked like an eyelash (gross!). Of course, I asked for a brand new plate, which took a few minutes longer to get. However when the new dish came, the penne wasn't warm enough. I honestly wasn't impressed with the level of service nor the fact that I wasn't offered anything else to offset the inconvenience or the hair near the food either. The food was okay but it's definitely not on my top places to visit again - sorry.
No comment

Last night was my 34th birthday. We went here because of all of the great feedback we get from friends around the neighborhood. Unfortunately, they didn't prep the table, we didn't have any flatware or proper dinnerware at the table, the staff was sub par, and our server decided to leave half way through service without a word. The drinks were great but my food was ok at best. I lived in Rome for a while so I feel that I know how Italian food should be. That being said, a plate of green fettuccini soaked in truffle oil has never been something I had overseas. It was advertised as a wild mushroom fettuccini but it was really over cooked pasta in a fake truffle sauce. Mushrooms were barely recognizable. I would not recommend and I am sorry I wasted my birthday outing here.

The food, the ambiance, and the service speak for itself. The chef uses nothing but the finest of ingredients into every single dish brought out and the staff serve it with such grace. At la nonna, you can taste why it deserves all 5 stars.
No comment

This place is beautiful. Expensive but honestly the food is amazing!! The serve you nice soft flavorful bread with tomato sauce which I want right now. The sauce was a little sweet for some I guess but I thought it was so satisfying. As far as the salad...I got the pear salad and I scrapped the plate. We also ordered burrata caprese and it did not disappoint. Our mains we're gnocchi of the day and I got a mushroom pasta dish. I couldn't finish either between us bc I filled up on bread but wonderful.our waiter was awesome and was tackling a 30 person party with 2 other waiters and he was with other tables but he was so on point for almost the whole time. In the end we waited for the check for about 45 minutes bc at some point they disappeared. The place really is a gem. Even the hostess who had a name I hadn't heard before was very kind.  Definitely recommend

First time visiting. Place is so comfortable, nice ambience, tables not too close. Decorated nicely and cute bar. The service was fantastic. Thanks to Alex and the rest of the guys for making a quiet birthday dinner special. Will be going back for sure!

Great for large parties. Friendly staff. Well sized apps and mains. Only complaint I have is the place is in the dark side. We ordered a series of apps and pastas and everything was tasty. Would def consider coming back with a big group as this place is more spacious and seating is more comfortable.
No comment

Lovely large venue with cloth napkins but no tablecloths.  Very good and very friendly service.  The food was good, but not exceptional nor memorable.  Pizza margarita had a very fresh tasty topping.  The biggest problem was the cracker like crust which wasn't able to hold up to being over-sauced.  The baked clams were ok, but should have been made with olive oil rather than butter that overwhelmed the clams.  The pasta was perfectly cooked and delicious.  It came with a broccoli rabe pesto and crumbled sausage.  Unfortunately, there was little broccoli rabe taste or texture, and the crumbled sauce was lacking in flavor and texture and lost in the sauce.  The tortellini special was over-sauced and too rich for the delicate pasta. The wine prices are very fair and the montepulciano I ordered was very good.

This place is beautiful but the service sucked in the food was the worst food I've ever had in my life the chef should definitely go back and talk to the grandmother to figure how to cook some real Italian food. He tried to pull a empanada off as a fried ravioli. The octopus was overdone it felt like it was saturated and vinegar. The bartender was dumb as a brick she didn't know shit about shine Nola. She didn't even know today's special the bitch passed me a written menu that she wrote Down her self.
Great food, authentic, Clams Linguini Vongola too delicious!
No comment
No comment
The best Italian food I have had in a very very long time . There isn't one thing that's good .. every thing is good! The cocktails are amazing! The service is top notch! The restaurant is beautiful!
Authentic Italian cuisine! My boyfriend and I had a nice romantic evening here with delicious food. Can't wait to go back.

Okay food, but really overpriced for pasta. The amount of specials the waiter had to recite was mind-blowing, he needed to fold open a piece of paper for all of them. Can't blame him, there are simply too many. No way guests can even remember everything he recited, further more, it's kind of suspicious that a kitchen has that many specials. Pasta was okay, but the prices for them weren't. The La Nonna on Bedford that closed down was great, this place doesn't feel the same. The chic dial has been turned up to appear upscale, but it simply isn't. It's clear they care about their food, but the quality and price match is not there. At least not for us, gorgeous ceiling height and space, hope it improves.

came here for a lovely anniversary, nice place but i ordered SHRIMP parmigiana because i do NOT eat meat for over a year and they give me chicken!! Not only was that bad but the waiter tried to justify it with saying it looked like shrimp bringing the same food back to the table, when he obviously saw it was chicken he left and never returned.. RIDICULOUS AND ABSOLUTELY UNACCEPTABLE! my stomach turned and i instantly wanted to vomit from sickness! whats the point of ordering when you're going to get what they "believe" is your order?! i will NEVER return and will never suggest this place to anyone!!

I stumbled upon La Nonna while strolling around Williamsburg with friends looking for a place to eat. When we walked in, we were promptly greeted, seated and served delicious bread with a tasty sweet and spicy tomato sauce. La Nonna is very nice and spacious inside, with dim  lighting that gives it a relaxing ambiance. Our waiter Alessandro was awesome! He gave excellent menu recommendations, thoroughly explaining all the specials. Our water glasses were continuously refilled and we were all given complementary glasses of wine with our YELP check-in. For dinner, I ordered the fried calamari as my entree and my friends ordered the Ravioli All' Aragosta and the Sacchetti Al Peperoncino. My calamari was tasty but nothing extraordinary. The best dish of the night was definitely the  Saccheti Al Peperoncino! Delicious little pasta purses with Ricotta and spicy ground sausage inside. Absolutely delectable! La Nonna also has a pretty strong dessert menu. The chocolate soufflé is a excellent choice! The presentation is beautiful and the dessert was quite tasty. Overall, this is a great place to have a nice intimate date or even a family dinner. Definitely 4 stars!!
These ppl know how to make pasta al dente full and fresh ingredients. Also the red sangria was great.

We had La Nonna for dinner last night. We ended up ordering because we didn't want to miss the firework display. I've been craving Italian food as this time last year I was living in Milan and had authentic Italian food at my fingertips daily.We passed La Nonna on the way home and it looked authentic enough so we decide to give it a chance. Perhaps dinner is better in the restaurant but I can't imagine it makes a world of a difference. He ordered the Calamari Marinara with Spaghetti and I ordered Pasta Marinara. While the food was ok.. it was just ok, hardly worth the $21 for the Calamari Marinara and the $14 for penne with marinara. Not to mention the 6- 2inch pieces of bread thrown into the paperbag with the containers of food. We were only able to eat half as the rest was hard as rocks. All and all I'd rather pay a lot of money for a little food that tastes amazing rather than a lot of food that is ok. I might be open to trying brunch but won't eat dinner from here again.

After taking the East River Ferry over to Williamsburg to Dumbo, my husband and I decided on a meal at La Nonna.  It's a huge restaurant with very high ceilings and had more of an LA (?) vibe than Williamsburg.  Anyway - the food was amazing!  It was so hard to pick what to eat but we ended up sharing a salad and each ordering the kobe beef raviolis (one of their specials). And considering the service was attentive and so kind, we agreed La Nonna is definitely a restaurant we'd like to go back to.

The epitome of fine Italian food. Literally the best Italian food I have ever had the pleasure of eating. This place is the best...the atmosphere, the food, the staff... it cannot be bested. Definitely come here with family, with a date, with yourself.

Delicious food, excellent service, great ambiance & fairly priced.  I highly recommend a pasta dish, amazing!! Also, order a pie for the table as an appetizer, you won't regret it.  P.s. Don't forget to check in for one free glass of their house red.
No comment
No comment
I had an amazing birthday dinner at La Nonna Ristorante and bar. All my guest enjoyed their dinner. The parking is a great plus.
Food is wonderful! The drinks are superb! Great decor and vibe! Our waiter Alex is the best. We will def keep requesting him. The skirt steak is delicious. Our new favorite!

Wonderful experience, we recently moved into the neighborhood and our friends suggested this place for dinner, food was yummy, ambiance is great and service is excellent. We had the lasagna and the lobster ravioli, both were delicious. One of our friends had the veal and said it was excellent too, just keep in mind that the veal portion is huge so make sure you have good appetite! :)

I really like this restaurant, it's beautifully designed and the food is delicious. Great Italian spot in the neighborhood! I was disappointed twice with their menu: the pizza was terrible and their brunch menu sucks. Other than that...the octopus appetizer is delicious, all the pasta dishes are great and the steak was delicious. The staff is really nice and they have great wine options.

I hosted a 23 person wedding dinner party here with my new hubby and they could not have been more patient and accommodating. The food was great and the restaurant arranged a huge table for us in a secluded section of the restaurant. A week before the reservation I was in constant communication with the owner herself and she even let us bring in a celebratory cake from outside which her team cut and plated for my family and friends. Amazing care and service. Can't recommend enough, especially for group dinners. The beautiful decor in the restaurant was an added bonus. They'll take care of you!

What I really loved about this place was the service. We stopped in for a quick bite. We just ordered one appetizer, 3 bloody Mary's. the thing was, they were amazing. The bloody Mary's were yummy. They did all the fine dining tweaks with us even though, we were in there a total of 30mins. I hope to go back & have a proper brunch or dinner.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

My friends and I had a very bad experience last night for dinner. Service was horrible. The servers really did not care about our experience at all. The only thing worse than the service was the food. Appetizers were ok. Pasta and lasagna tasted like it was microwaved. We complained about the food just to give direct feedback, no one cared. Horrible experience.
The food and service was great. The ambiance was very romantic. The shrimp Parmesan and crab crake was delicious. The white sangria was also delicious. I recommended this restaurant to my friends.

Been here a couple of times for dinner. Service is consistent. The gnocchi is simple but by far my favorite dish on the menu - melts in your mouth and plenty of sauce. Restaurant is pretty big. Nice spot for a family dinner, baby shower or even romantic dinner. It's a beautiful space. We'll be back soon.

My boyfriend and I absolutely love this place, we go here at least twice a month the food, the ambiance, and especially the service is always amazing. It's perfect if you want a more elegant and less traditional spin on Italian food, although be cautious because the portions are smaller than traditional Italian fare, and that is probably my only complaint, having larger appetizer & pasta positions but, that does not take away from anything else about the place just order one of their amazing pizzas if you're worried you don't have enough!

Not what I expected. Thought this would be an authentic Italian Restaurant but it wasn't. I had the Parmesan Bowl and it had no flavor whatsoever. I wouldn't go back it's definitely not worth the time or money.

This restaurant exceeded my expectations with the food and their excellent customer service. I just want to thank Anna and Hans for making my mom's special even more special, given the large party. Everything went seamlessly.

What an amazing wonderful experience I had last night.. First time and of course not the last, it was absolutely divine, from complimentary bread to the delicious mouth watering lasagna and pizza. Will be back soon and of course will make it a go to place. Ambiance and decor was romantic and a great place to celebrate anniversaries.
My favorite Italian restaurant in Williamsburg! Nice decor, beautiful scenery and the food is incredible. Loved the Cavatelli Bolognese an the Braided Shortrib

The ravioli appetizer is amazing prob one of the best I've ever had in my life the pizza is so delicious and the owner makes this gorgeous restaurant so welcoming and amazing one of my favorite restaurants in Brooklyn by far

I absolutely love this restaurant. We go as a family to eat at La Nonna and have been doing so since their original location on Bedford. Everything from the quality of their guest service to the great tasting and looking food they put out is great.

This is my favorite go to spot for Italian. Lots of room, nice ambiance and the food is always consistent and superb! The chicken franchise is my favorite dish and is sooo good. The staff is super nice, the hostess is always pleasant and very attentive! Can't recommend enough if your in the neighborhood!
No comment

What a wonderful dining experience!  We didn't have a reservation so we opted to sit at the very spacious bar. Mark was an absolute gem! He took such great care of us and had such a warm and genuine personality.   We decided to eat a bunch of appetizers after Mark told us that there was nothing he wouldn't recommend, and what an excellent decision that was! I highly recommend the cheesecake and the ravioli stuffed with filet Mignon. Absolutely delicious!
Great service. Elegant and cozy ambience. We ordered the scallops, Caesar salad, short ribs, and the prosciutto truffle mushroom linguine. Sooooo delicious!

This 1 Star review is for the manager who ruined our entire experience. The food was fine, not spectacular, not bad. The service was mostly prompt and the waiter was a nice enough guy. So far so good until we go to pay. I've got a $60 OpenTable reward and the waiter needs to take my iPhone to process it. He brings it back with the screen cracked. The screen was not cracked when I gave it to him. He tries to play it off at first, "oh it just slipped" but then comes clean. He says he'll get the manager out. So she comes out. And starts making excuses "this is why you should've gone inside with him- we can't be responsible for this" You've got to be fucking kidding me. No apologies, immediately with excuses. That is the definition of TERRIBLE customer service. I get it- accidents can happen. The waiter was rushed and the phone slipped out of his hand. I can live with it. What is not excusable is a) trying to cover it up and then b) not apologizing / making excuses when you do screw up. We sure as hell will not be back here.
This is the best fucking food I've ever ate in my life! Great service, beautiful bar maid,extravagant ambiance!!!
What an amazing Italian restaurant!! Very fresh and authentic. Great atmosphere and service. The Ravioli Nutella dessert was killer!! You must go it's so good!!

Wow am I so disappointed!  Earlier today I made reservations for my boyfriends birthday at 8pm.  Around 7 I called La Nonna to see if they possibly had room for us earlier.  The hostess was SO rude to me I was just shocked!  She told me that bc of rain I still had my reservation but tables were first come first serve so we might not actually be seated.  Hmmmm... Ok?  What's the point of a reservation? Do what you need to in this time.  However, a call would have been lovely so I could have at least made other plans! In addition the attitude of the woman on the phone was just beyond!! I decided to call my other favorite Italian restaurant  Baci & Abbraci (I highly recommend trying them, delicious & excellent service) and made a new reservation.  I called La Nonna back to let them know we wouldn't be coming and the hostess hung up on me once and the second call back just put me directly on hold and never picked the phone back up. I'm so sad! We love this restaurant but after being treated this way we will not be back!
No comment

I don't do many reviews but had to after I went to La Nona with friends last night while I was visiting NYC.  Absolutely the best Italian restaurant in my book.  The staff was personable and attentive and the owner, Cono (a true Italian), stopped by to check on us.  Cono personally selected our meal and we were treated to an excellent 5 course dinner.  I will definitely be back.
No comment

Service was okay. Food was good but nothing special. Had the house special veggie lasagna and it was good but not great.  Moscow Mule was perfectly mixed. Prices and portions were a bit on the expensive side for what you get (quantity and quality). Server wasn't super knowledgeable or attentive but not BAD. Just....meh overall.

Went here late on a Thursday evening.  The restaurant is beautiful and it also has an outdoor eating area if interested in that.  We sat inside, we were immediately greeted by the friendly manager who gave us a very good seat by the window.  The waitress and bus boy were very accommodating.  I was able to order my favorite caprese salad although it was not on the menu, it was far from disappointing.  The complimentary bread with spicy pamadoro sauce delicious.  My husband ate two baskets of the bread by himself and later regretted it but said it was well worth him feeling overly full.  I had the skirt steak which was superb and my husband had a pasta dish which he wolfed down.  Everything was delicious.  Definitely will be returning
No comment

I used to eat at their former location on Bedford Ave and was disappointed when they closed. Came to this location with family for a birthday and was impressed by the service and decor. Staff was super friendly and attentive. Gnocchi was amazing!!

Called in for a reservation for two at 6:30 and was escorted by the kind hostess to our table. The food was great but the service was terrible. I understand due to the circumstances of the pandemic, staff may be short and waiting times for drinks, appetizers, and entrees may be a bit longer than usual. However, as the party sat down it would've been nice to have been at least offered water or having been asked for a drink order within the first five to eight minutes. Nonetheless, our waiter could've easily introduced himself and let us know we would have to wait a bit for his service. Still, more than 15 minutes have passed by and we're sitting dry at the table. Finally our waiter, or I thought, comes to offer water and doesn't offer any drinks. You would think a four star restaurant may want to up sell their best wine or offer their unique cocktails but none of that was recommended. My brother & I ordered a bottle of moscato which took longer than I hoped for. Soon we ordered our entrees, that came within reasonable time and it was well worth the wait. My brother ordered the chicken Parmesan with penne and I order the chicken Frances with linguine. Phenomenal food and even better serving portions. Thank you Chef! My brother midway through his first glass didn't like the wine which was noticed by our second waiter (our waiters switched) and recommended a better wine suited for his pallet. After finishing entrees and the wine we were hoping for dessert but wasn't offered any so we decided to go somewhere else. The food and wine spoke for themselves and lived up to the expectation. The service however, had a lot of room to improve on. My brother & I happened to think it was maybe the way were dressed that had something to do with our treatment? Granted, compared to everyone else we were a bit more casual but the service shouldn't change based off these judgements. I've been a waiter before at two well established restaurants and walk in with expectations depending on the restaurant of choice so this experience was disappointing.
No comment

WOW WOW WOW.....Run don't walk to this great restaurant....Wonderful appetizers, main dishes and deserts....nice wine list....I highly recommend the pollo Maltese and apple tart....waiters are real pros...Prices are fair.
My favorite restaurant in Williamsburg. Love love love their service, wine and delicious food! I will continue to come back here any chance I get

Everything about La Nonna was an absolute pleasure. I celebrated my Engagement in their beautiful restaurant. I had scheduled 15 people to have dinner the night before because my previous venue was extremely unprofessional and I decided to change the night before without knowing what to do. My best friend had suggested La Nonna because of their amazing food and I gave it a chance on her word. The manager, Ana, was extremely professional, well spoken, very easy to plan with and an absolute sweetheart. The staff is overly courteous and spot on. I do not have enough good things to say about this restaurant. They made my night unforgettable. I cannot thank them enough.

Let's just say this place was amazing ! From the atmosphere to the food to the waiters. I ordered the lamb chops medium well and my boyfriend ordered the steak with Mediterranean sauce. It was soooo good. We will definitely be back

Delicious dinner in a gorgeous setting. This place has it all: family run, authentic Italian food, selection of great wines, beautiful venue, and great location and atmosphere. Would definitely recommend.
No comment

The meal was good, not bad. The service on the other hand was bad. The place was fairly empty and still bad. We were there probably an hour and I needed my drink refilled twice (small glasses) and both times I had to flag someone down. The staff looked directly at my drink several times that was empty and processed to ignore us. When I was in Italy they treat you like family but this nyc Italian restaurant lacks customer satisfaction. It's too bad because the food wasn't bad. Won't be coming back here again.
No comment
Great food, nice selection of wine varietals. Had a great time here. Service was excellent, will come again.
No comment

Love this place.  Everything is fresh and delicious! We go there at least once a week for our family dinner. The pasta is amazing and the skirt steak is our favorite.  We also get the grilled octopus which is nice and tender.  The owner is friendly and the staff is always accommodating.

First time coming here today and I loved it. We celebrated Father's Day here and I'm so happy we picked this place. The seafood ravioli was out of this world and the pear salad was just right for this warm day. The decor is romantic and intimate. The service was quick my waiter was great. I would definitely come back here.

We had a reeeally bad experience at La Nonna from beginning to end. I made a 7:30pm reservation for 11 people 6 weeks in advance to celebrate my mom & dad's birthdays with family flying in from out of town. When we arrived we were told the table for us wasn't ready as the party seated there was taking longer than expected. We had to stand there for 30 mins, with 4 very hungry young children, waiting for a different set of tables to be ready for us and were seated about 8pm. Strike 1. I immediately ordered 2 pizzas so we could get some food in the kids asap and those came quite quickly thank god, because we then had to wait for at least 30 mins for the 4 PASTA dishes we ordered to come...it was ridiculous.  No cheese was offered for the pastas, or drink orders retaken. Food was mediocre.  I had called in advance to give a heads up that we would be celebrating two birthdays and that we'd want celebration desserts to come out. Towards the end of the pasta course I sought out someone on the waitstaff to tell them the specific desserts to come out with sparklers in them, and at the same time we asked for the check. The kids were fading fast and we were dying to get out of there.  Then ensued another long wait, where major regret set in about doing a dessert course at all there! The two desserts finally came after my husband had a firm word with our waiter, but then we still had another long wait for the check. Strike 5? I've lost count.  Unfortunately for us gratuity was already included on the check, so we couldn't even tip appropriately for the crap experience.  I guess with a large gratuity guaranteed, there wasn't the incentive to provide good service.  I live across the street, but despite the convenience and the fact that Italian is our favorite food, we will absolutely NEVER dine at La Nonna again. I was embarrassed that I had selected this restaurant for such a big celebration with my whole family that happens only once or twice a year.

Love, love, love this place!!!! The food is amazing, the environment is nice and mellow and the attention is awesome. My husband and I are foodies and I must say they're hanger steak and ravioli are pretty awesome . And now they have beautiful outside seating which is great for brunch or lunch.

Delicious homemade italian food! We ordered 3 dishes- the grilled calamari, lobster pasta and flank steak. All were cooked exceptionally well and were flavorful. What was even better was a very affordable wine menu! Dinner was under 100$ which is always a plus! Def. will be back soon to try out some more dishes.

I have lived in little Italy for three years, I have lived in Soho and now currently live in Union Square....... The best part about living in Union Square is that I am close to the L train and that can take me to La Nonna's!!! I looooove Manhattan but I have considered moving to Williamsburg just to be able to eat here more. The food is a work of art and tastes as good as it looks. I come here with my wife and her family every time they come to town, this is the only place they want to go and they don't mind city in city traffic to get here. The staff makes you feel like family and I have never had a bad dish, just left there a little while ago and felt it was time to leave a review after the 30th time this year I have been there! The LOBSTER RAVIOLI! WOW!!!!! If you LOVE Italian Food, there is no better choice is all five boroughs in my opinion.
poor service and mediocre food. we had to ask for bread and cheese/pepper while our server was no where to be found. the food is bland and the plates could be cleaner. i would try somewhere else.
Very attentive service and terrific food. Great cacio e pepe and tomato bruschette. Will definitely come back here.

Gorgeous restaurant with incredible food. The service seemed questionable at first with our server taking forever to bring drinks and get our orders, but we loved the fact that they brought out the apps one at a time (so as not to clutter the table and to help keep things spaced out). It was like a constant flow of food once it started coming, and we didn't want it to stop! Everything we ordered (there were a few of us so we tried everything from the fish to the pasta to the meat) was delicious. 5 stars all the way

If you are the fries lover, you gotta tried the truffle fries . Wow amazing fabulous.. lamp chop is awesome . Seafood is seasoning well and very tasteful. The restaurant is inviting and I love the high ceiling. I will definitely come again.

This place is amazing!Came here with family and friends last week and couldnt be more pleased.Food was great,the atmosphere was nice and calm,and the staff were so polite and welcoming.I will definitley be coming back soon.

The food was SO delicious. The calamari was particularly tasty. We also tried the day's special - ravioli stuffed with flank steak. Ah-may-zing. The only thing that brings the review down is that the service was pretty slow. However, the waiter was fun and sweet so it pretty much made up for it. Will definitely be back!

Came from bike riding w my boyfriend & we decided to sit outside ... Seemed as though some of the staff was a little biased  to serve us at first , but I guess after they got over their initial reaction . Besides that the gentlemen who served us was so polite & sweet . The food is amazing & it's a very relaxing and calm view . Had the linguini Al vongole !!! I would definetly go again , hopefully with the same server .

Bad experience here. For a nice place... Their food is good but service is terrible. I had an incident with my food it spilled on the floor and they charged me for a second dish. The manager really has no idea what he's doing. I wouldn't recommend going here if you are looking for a place with good vibes

Loved this place! The pasta dish that list tequila as an ingredient is amazing! The food was so good that we went for my birthday on a Friday night and the following week we were back there again. The only thing we didn't enjoy was the special mushroom with cheese appetizer, we didn't know the dish would be cold and it wasn't that good. Something you should get is the fried ravioli that has mushrooms and steak in it, it's definitely worth the money. Also the octopus appetizer is a good choice. I would go back for sure.

Food was excellent, first time here and will be coming back soon!! Started with the Octopus, amazing - next was some Lobster and Crab Ravioli - cooked al dent, great flavor and super fresh.  Main course had a Rib Eye - rare, again cooked exactly as expected!  Desert was yum!  Lava cakes all around!  Great establishment and experience!
My favourite williamsburg Italian joint. Actually my favouriteNYC Italian place!! Great pastas and pizzas
No comment
The food was good, but the portions were small. Just be aware of that. The restaurant is really nice and clean, highly recommended for big parties!

The bartender was so friendly and accommodating. Once we sat down I have never been so disappointed in the service, horrible wait staff. The main course took so long to be brought out I had to take it home. The waiter didn't even have the decency to apologize.
I was in charge of coordinating our team dinner for nine.  one word ... perfection!  everything was incredible and delicious and according to the team, I am forever keeping that title!!
Good food but the manager could not accommodate us without a reservation. Didn't seem like he was trying. We ate at the bar though and the food was great. Will be back with reservations!

Drove in from Westchester County for an early dinner on a Sunday.  The place was packed!  Which is a very good sign.  I consider this place classy casual.  Marcus recommended an excellent wine and we ordered 2 appetizers.  My favorite was the Ravioli Ripieni Di Carne. They are fried ravioli  filled with filet mignon, mushrooms and covered in a truffle cream sauce - delicious!! I had the Pollo Maltese. The dish was rich and tasty. My husband had the Ravioli All'Aragosta and it was fantastic!  The other dishes were specials and everyone ate every bite. We are already planning our next visit and bringing friends
No comment
Great place ... had a wonderful evening.. drinks were amazing , food was very unique and different especially the apps .. that just melted in your mouth . Loved everything cant wait to go back

Unbelievably disorganized and poorly managed restaurant. We waited for our food for over an hour, and then when they brought it out they told us they had run out of half of the ingredients and gave us bread instead. I predict this place lasts six weeks
The staff made me feel a bit uncomfortable at first however, the food and the price quickly made up for it.

The place was amazing, we had our annual holiday party for about 20 people. She took care of us perfectly, plenty of food and drinks. The owners kept checking on us and everyone was very friendly. The place is decorated very nice for the holidays. Everyone who went loved it and we'll be back again next year.
No comment

this is an overpriced and kind of ugly, italian-american restaurant. expect the usual upscale family restaurant you might find anywhere in the us. had steak with macdonalds fries and whipped mash potatoes. desserts are diner compatable. williamsburg has much much better.

column3: Palais Royal/Musée du Louvre, Paris, France
column6: Amazing food, great staff and generous italian portions (something hard to find in NYC). Just come and make your Nonna pride.  I would suggest the tagliatelle, if you into green pasta; it's really a fantastic place to relax, have some amazing pasta & wine.

This restaurant was fit for the occasion. My boyfriend and I took our newly engaged friends here for dinner. It was a very cozy and romantic setting. The ambiance was great and the service was impeccable. Our friends were running a bit late but the hostess seated us anyway. I'm so used to having to wait until the entire party arrives, so that was a plus. Everyone found something on the menu they would enjoy but me being a picky eater made it a bit difficult to decide. The waitress customized a dish for me and it was great. My boyfriend had the steak and it was very good, highly recommended. I will go back again, we were well pleased.

Amazing , Amazing & Amazing .!!!!!! I've been going to la nonnas for over 5 years now. Every time I go I bring new people with me and they enjoy it so much . Hands down the best Italian restaurant. However I do wish they kept some of there older menu ideas on the new menu.
Always great service. Food is amazing. Never sit in a place like this where the owner consistently comes out to talk to you. Love the intimacy

great wine selection and food but the service is PHENOMENAL! I went here last night with my honey and it was a great experience. We never once had to ask for a thing because they provided everything we needed before i could utter a request. We shared a bottle of Spumante and I fell in love! It was romantic and a great way to spend our evening. Everything was fantastic. Try the fried ravioli filet mignon appetizer and the baileys creme brulee

One of the best Italian Restaurants in the city! The food is excellent, the pasta dishes are home made with incredible flavor. Service is always excellent! William, one of the servers there, is excellent, and very knowledgeable! Oh and there desserts are to die for, especially the Nutella Ravioli! We have invited our friend and family there and no one is ever disappointed!
Very fast and great take out ....  Best Mexican I've had in a while go here and enjoy it .... Chicken tacos
No comment

Visited La Nonna from Bridgeport,Ct on Saturday for lunch with my father.First time here after eating at the Bedford Ave location a few times.What a beautiful restaurant near the waterfront on Kent Ave.We started off with warm fresh bread.My father had Pennette alla Napolotana,with eggplant,buffalo mooz,tomatoe,s and pesto.He said it was delicious.I ordered Chicken Caponata,with eggplant,tomatoes ,pine nuts,and honey.Chicken was so tender,it was fantastic.Service was very good.We will be back.

Go to the Bedford ave location it's better and less expensive. The menu here is over complicated, over thought, and over done. It's also out of their league. Some of the items are unappealing and need to be made more simply. Look to Bedford ave

Awesome    I'm new in the neighborhood. And this is gonna be my regular place to enjoy my Sumer meals.  Genuine food.  Genuine service by William, nice n attentional server  definitely seeee yoouuu  again ...nona.

This place is so fantastic that I was just there on March 5th for a family birthday celebration and I am going again on March 11th with a friend for dinner to catch-up. Their Tuscan kale meatballs are the best. Everything I have tried is delicious. The calamari melts in your mouth and cooked to perfection every time. Their cucumber and mint drink is cool and crisp and goes down easy. The ambiance is inviting, the staff friendly and it's a spacious restaurant with comfortable seating and enough room so you're not crammed on top of other patrons. The owner of the restaurant, her father, used to own Valdianos on Manhattan Avenue. Only the old school Brooklyn people will know this one and his penne a la vodka was so good, I tried to pay him for the recipe! Great family and great food! Keep up the good work! My only critique is I wish they carried Rum Chata so I can mix it with Fireball! HA

Really had high hopes for this place- decor is beautiful and they have a cute little outdoor seating area- but those are unfortunately the best features of this restaurant. The food was just so-so. My crab cakes were heavy and tasted like they had been sitting in a freezer for a long time. Salmon potato pasta special was bland. Lamb chops were good but no starch or vegetable served with the entree, just meat.  Oh and our server didn't know how to operate a pepper mill. For the price, I expected a bit more.

WOW!!  Italian girl giving a review- WOW.  Excellent!!! We visited LaNonna in Wiliamsburg for the first time with our friends a few nights ago.  We had been to the original location a few times and loved it.  But we had never been to this location.   The ambience, food, service and decor were all top notch.   Being brought up old-school italian with mothers that did their own cooking from scratch, we have high standards for italian restaurants.  La Nonna met and exceeded those expectations.  So much so, that we will be holding a family dinner party at La Nonna in a few months! We know that our relatives and friends will absolutely enjoy the food as much as we did.  We ordered the octoput, eggplant tower, gnocchi, lobster ravioli and steak dishes. For dessert we had the pistachio brulee and tiramisu.   All of them were exceptional and delicious  Afterwards, we took a walk by the water and enjoyed the spectacular view of Manhattan.  All in all, we highly recommend La Nonna if you are going out for a casual dinner or if you want to invite those relatives from Italy out to eat, this is the spot.  They will be very impressed and you will be very glad you took them there!
No comment

I've been here twice and both times were fantastic. Amazing decor, modern feel with a rustic twist, it has a very comfortable and cozy vibe. Can't go wrong with owners who grew up in Williamsburg, you know you'll be getting quality Italian along with great hospitality. Always a friendly vibe. Keep in mind portions are smaller because you're dining at a higher quality. Great wine selection, I know because I've been in the wine room. Also great for big parties of friends and family. There are 3 different kinds of Italian: 1. Fast Quick Italian dishes 2. Hearty full sized Italian dishes 3. High End Italian dishes, this earns the High End Italian. It doesn't get 5 stars for me because if you want exceptional Italian you can do better, BUT I highly recommend you will not be disappointed.  Also, their desserts are lacking in originality. Very basic run of the mill. Other then that its great.
No comment

I LOVED this place! The food and service were amazing! I went for the first time on Valentine's Day 2 years ago. I loved it and returned last year in the summer. The food is great and so is the service.

I had my 21st birthday dinner here and was blown away by the food, service, and of course beautiful rustic/Italian atmosphere. We were 25 people and all of my family and friends raved about what a great time they had and how delicious the food was. Everything ran smoothly, I only dined here once prior to my event and both times were spectacular. Planning a party is not always an easy process, but Anna was very attentive to any questions or requests I had. I could not be happier with the overall experience. Whether you are looking for a nice night out or planning a party, the staff at La Nonna go above and beyond to meet your expectations. I highly recommend this restaurant; my family and friends are already saying they can't wait to go back! Thank you Anna and your amazing staff, you made this a night to remember.
No comment

Loved the Cabernet by the glass, loved the octopus and gnocchi. Did not love the spinach/potato side or the arancini special. The red dipping for the bread was way way too garlicky, couldn't even eat it. Bread is good, ask for olive oil for dipping instead.

This place is beautiful came in on sunday evening it wasn't busy at all service was good other than when the runner was serving us it was sloppy dripping sauce all over the table and the empty chair we had our purses and jacket on he didn't even clean it until we told him. Food was very good it's just too bad that the first few things we wanted to order they were out of, they gave us desserts on the house to compensate for not having what we wanted to originally order. The Tiramisu was really good. I will def be back!
No comment

I really wanted to like this place but unfortunately the food wasn't great.  The restaurant itself is big, clean and spacious.  The food was disappointing.  I was looking forward to an authentic Italian meal and this place fell short.  The stuffed ravioli appetizer were most disappointing.  They are huge and oily, appearing more like empanadas.  Everything from the apps to the pasta dishes were drenched in sauces.  I might as well have asked for soup.  I wish I could say everything was delicious but nothing stood out.  Service was also very slow.  Hopefully this is because it's a fairly new restaurant and they work out the kinks.
Bummed that they closed Bedford, but psyched they're still around. Such an underrated joint. I can't replicate their tomato sauce no matter how hard I try.

After searching for the perfect restaurant to accommodate a group of twenty guests, I found this perfect gem for the perfect birthday dinner. The food, a perfect ten, service, a perfect ten and such a beautiful ambiance. Anna, the beautiful and very friendly Chefs wife set up a prefix menu for our party at $50 per person. We started with calamari, a caprese salad and margarita pizza. Followed by our choice of an entree, pollo milanese, skirt steak or salmon. We had a few picky eaters at our table and not one guest was left dissatisfied. Alejandro and the waiters and bus boys provided such hospitable service, very attentive and personable. Clearly, there's only one word to describe La Nonna and that's "PERFECT!" :) Thank you so much La Nonna! We'll be back very soon! xo

I had the privilege of randomly walking into la nonna restaurant last Saturday night for dinner. I was walking along Kent ave taking in the smells of restaurants as I passed and la nona definitely lured me in. The restaurant was pretty busy so I opted to sit at the bar as I was by myself.  The bartender was very friendly and attentive and answered all my questions about the menu as I wasn't sure what to order.  The cocktail menu had a lot of tasty looking combinations on there but I ordered a virgin bloody Mary instead, virgin because I'm pregnant . Any other time I would've definitely tried one of their appealing cocktails.  The bloody Mary was very delicious btw! Spicy just how I like it and just a perfect balance of horseradish as I love the crunch it had. Practically a meal in a glass.  For dinner I ordered the salmon with veggies, don't remember the exact mane of the dish as there are a few salmon entrees on the menu. All I know is this was the best tasting salmon I've ever eaten! Seasoned to perfection, cooked amazingly juicy and succulent with the perfect crisp on top. With each bite, I ate slower to fully enjoy all the flavor of the salmon. The dinner also came with a home made bread basket with a to die for red sauce that you dip the bread into. Now I'm not a big bread eater but I finished every last piece of bread in the basket that night.  A couple was sitting at the bar with me and noticed I was kind of dancing in my chair as I ate. They asked me how I liked the food and of course I proceeded to rave about it. It turns out they were actually the owners of la nona, I think their names were Ana and Connor.  I was glad to have met them to let them know how much I was enjoying their establishment. Overall a very wonderful experience at this restaurant, I would highly recommend it to anyone. I'm looking forward to my next visit, definitely with friends so they can enjoy all that na nona has to offer.

DELICIOUS. I ate here the other day and my goodness the food was amazing. This is coming from someone who just spent a week in Italy eating authentic Italian food. This was better. The restaurant set up is beautiful, our table ordered four appetizers, all of them delicious, and my main dish, superb! My favorite appetizer was the eggplant. Thin slices of fried eggplant stacked with tomatoes and mozzarella. My main dish was a ravioli dish with ricotta cheese and a fried egg in the center covered in a truffle butter sauce. I'm drooling just thinking about it. The service was wonderful and I can't wait to go back!

I have been many times in this beautiful Italian restaurant and never disappoints ! the place is very cozy and clean ,the location is excellent and the food is really good . one of the best places to eat Italian !

After having a bad experience at the Bedford Ave location I was hesitant on this place. I'm glad I went though because the food and service were awesome. We started with the Frittelle Di Burrata which was a little difficult to cut into and portion out but tasted delicious. For my main course I went with the Raviolo All'Uovo. I was a little worried about the egg but it worked well. Overall the dish was really good and amazing!
Love the ambiance, food & service! We were a party of 15, and all our requests were accommodated. Great place to wine & dine!

What a great addition to the neighborhood. Went for dinner last and it was wonderful. Great cocktails and wine. Recommend the kale salad and meatballs - so so good! You can sub whole wheat pasta for any of the pasta dishes. And really attentive service. Can't wait to go back :)

I just celebrated my 26th birthday there last week. To say this place was great would be an understatement!!!! As a person who loves food and  trying new places I was a little nervous to bring a party of 12 people to La Nonna considering they only had 3 1/2 stars. We arrived at the restaurant, all 12 of us where we were taken into a private little area where a beautiful table was set up. We enjoyed some incredible appetizers that where accommodated in a family-style manner and following that I had one of the best Italian dishes. The food, the service, and atmosphere was all so perfect!! All my guests were raving about the food. Having happy guest made it all worthwhile. There are no doubts in my mind now that la nonna wouldn't stand up to other great restaurants.
No comment
Love the atmospher.  The food looks amazing and it's delicious.  Different plates that are so tasty.  Will be back!
This place is awesome. Those damn scallops are to die for and veal pasta dish. COME HUNGRY!!!!!
Perfect large personal pizzas. Very good. The lighting is very dark though. I know it's supposed to add to the ambiance but I had to pull out my phone to use the ow so I could read the menu.
No comment

We had the most delightful dining experience I've had in a very long time. The food, atmosphere, venue and service were superb. I drove over two hours each way to get there and home. Worth every minute of it. Can't wait to go again.

Very nice restaurant, excellent service ,good cocktails, delicious bread.  Sauce was too heavy strong taste of tomato paste. Eggplant parm very basic a couple of fried eggplant slices with a bit of mozzarella on top. NOTHING special
Amazing restaurant with delicious options. Super family friendly with a great atmosphere and outdoor seating. Will definitely be coming back again!

Fabulous dinner here last night....The menu selection is amazing....The food was absolutely delicious....The prices were moderate...The waitstaff was professional and extremely knowledgeable and pleasant. The atmosphere was warm and inviting. Can't wait to return!!!

Great food, very friendly atmosphere, we had a wonderful time. This a new place, the drinks are superb, we knew what to expect since we've been to the original La Nonna many times before, they did not disappoint, we'll be back soon:)
Omg this place was amazeballs. The food was incredible . I was annoying my bf with how good the food was. Yummy
food was great, service was great too, steak was well done, my favorite dish was the calamari appetizer.
Very good italian with a great atmosphere. Everything we had was solid and wouldn't mind going back after exploring some other options in the neighborhood.

I am very confused by other reviews here. We went with my jetlagged in-laws for the first time and ordered a few pizzas to quickly share and I don't think I have ever tasted anything as grotesque or similar to celeste or elios microwaveable pizza since I graduated college over a decade ago. It honestly tasted like someone took rubbery pita bread and put some toppings over it then tried to heat it up. Disgusting. I tried to joke/complain a little to the waiter about it and he ignored me as he was clearly aware of the problem and just could not deal. Worst pizza I've ever had served to me including in airports. Avoid!!!!
Great place originally on Bedford ave. great service great food. Place is the nicest place in whole Williamsburg. The pastas are very good
No comment
Great food and great service fantastic location a block from the river and the owners/managers went out of their way to accommodate me and my children. Go try it.
No comment

My friend and I came here last night and we had a 7 o'clock reservation and were seated promptly.  The restaurant has an upscale feel about it but everyone was dressed casually.  For appetizers we had the meatballs and being a meatball critic I wasn't impressed.  They were very soft and mushy because probably too much bread was put into them and they were baked.  I like my meatballs fried.   Then we had a special which was a stuffed Calamari with crabmeat with a delicious sauce.  This appetizer was delicious but a little on the small side.  For entrées I had a pasta dish that the way the waiter described it to me that it look like little money bags and it did and it was stuffed with ricotta and was in a spicy vodka sauce with crumbled sausage and it was delicious.  My friend had Orrecchiette pasta with sausage and broccoli rabe and they love their dish too.  For dessert we had a Nutella lava cake and the pistachio crème brûlée and both were good not great but good.  The service was very good and our waiter Hans was very attentive.   Overall I thought the food was very good and I would definitely go back because I can't wait to try some other dishes.
Great food, atmosphere and friendly staff. Had the squid and meatballs, and then gluten free pizza for the main. So good!

My girlfriends and I went there a few days ago and we were floored by the ambience, impeccable service, and attentive staff. The Burrata appetizer was one of our favorites. It was so fresh, light, and tasty. Another appetizer that I actually had as part of my meal was the sea scallops with crispy prosciutto. It was cooked to perfection! Massimo, the manager, was extremely helpful with recommending a trio of desserts. The tiramisu and the one with the pistachios were to die for! They were mouth watering and satisfied my sweet tooth without making me feel stuffed. I'm definitely looking forward to going back again.

And again my wife and I decided to have dinner at our favorite restaurant with our favorite people there. The skirt steak over the cream of spinach was perfectly cooked the way I wanted and not to mention my wife's dinner. Over whole the food, the time we spent was better than great and not to mention this young blond hair waiter with a thin beard made sure we were treated like VIP. We loved the entire experience.

I have been a fan of La Nonna since its old location on Bedford. Food is still the same (+ more) but no longer the old school family feel. I visit occasionally because I enjoy their lasagne but last time service was flat out poor- we sat in the patio area and felt like the red headed step child- no love from our server, the water, the food the bill all took FORever. I'm sure I will be back but for the price and atmosphere I was expecting more.
No comment

First time there last night.  Eighteen of us went for my son's Grad School graduation.  The place is beautiful, very roomy, the acoustics are great, you can here each other talk!  The service was excellent, right on point.  They served us drinks right away,  The wine was great.  The appetizers came out in a timely fashion,  Very impressive as the main course was served, each dish hit the table simultaneously!  The food was delicious!   Everyone in our party loved their dishes.  The owner was very nice and personable.  We will definitely be going back again!

Went on a Friday night with another couple.  Everything was excellent.  We were rushing to get in as parking was a bit difficult to find, concerned we would not make our reservation time.   Needless worrying,  they were so polite as we rushed in, they staff and owners were a pleasure.  We ordered clams, grilled octopus, arugula salad, for main course I had the Osso buco with gnocchi's,  my husband had black linguine , other couple had the bison rage, branzino.   Everything was spot on perfect, atmosphere was excellent,  staff was attentive, wonderful evening.    Next time will give myself more time for parking.

Now, I was a HUGE fan of La Nonna when they were on Bedford ave, they made the most delicious pasta dishes ever, absolutely anything you ordered on the menu was fantastic so, for Christmas Eve this year I thought why not try out the new one on Kent... Now I know why everyone should not try it. First, I ordered seafood salad as an appetizer. On the menu it said it had crab, shrimp, calamari and one or two other seafoods I forget, I think one was a mussel and a type of fish. When I got the dish, it was flat out huge chunks of imitation crab and shrimp smaller than your fried rice from the chinese take out spot. The dish was $17. When I complained to the waitress about the crab being imitation she said "well, we know its imitation but we wouldn't put imitation on the menu because no one would order it then" I was completely in shock that a waitress would basically say well we know the quality of food we are serving you is horrible and if we were honest about it on the menu no one would ever eat here. I was completely horrified at this point, I almost cried because La Nonna on Bedford was seriously my favorite spot ever and like much of the Williamsburg we all loved 4 years ago, it is now dead. I thought to myself okay well at least I ordered raviolis for an entree and La Nonna always made good home made pasta... WRONG I forgot I had ordered their Christmas Eve special of "Blue Crab Raviolis with Asparagus in a cognac creme sauce" What I got looked exactly like and tasted like the seafood raviolis from Trader Joe's... they barely even had crab in them, they actually were filled half with shrimp which was never once mentioned on the menu which is really scary of a restaurant to do when so many people are allergic to shrimp... and of course imitation crab and the best part, they only gave 4 raviolis! 4 SMALL SQUARE RAVIOLIS for $22! At this point, I told the waitress they tasted like Trader Joe's raviolis, the owner of the restaurant came out and instead of apologizing for the insane flip of quality on her food she starts putting the blame on me and arguing with me that "the only thing she admits is she put imitation crab in everything and at least the shrimp was real in the salad" The creme sauce never saw cognac, it also tasted like it was from a jar with no flavor and when I mentioned that there was shrimp in the raviolis the waitress started arguing with me, telling me that it probably was "dungeness crab" which I am not an idiot, I know what that is and dungeness crab has the exact same texture of any other crab meat, it is not a small pink spiral that tastes like shrimp. It really pissed me off that they kept trying to fool me like I didn't know what real food or any seafood is supposed to taste like. They only shredded one piece of asparagus on the ravioli plate and everyone else's dishes at my table were absolutely pathetic. If you want to spend a ton of money to sit in a pretty spot, have the rudest waitresses and owner who could give a crap about what they put in anyones mouth and get sick, go here, if not, you're better off at the other 200 Italian restaurants in the area.

Excellent staff who was very attentive and happy.  Food presentation was as good as it gets!  There are so many great options on the menu and the specials were top notch.  Extensive wine list ad great drinks!  I will gladly come back as often as I can!

Had a dinner date here and couldn't of been more impressed! Great food, excellent staff, nice ambiance, oh and can I say again fantastic staff!!!! My date and I were slow to order and the staff were as patient as could be and did not rush us like some restaurants do. Move on to the food delicious! We had salmon which was incredible and seafood pasta dish. The pasta was beyond fresh. Definitely a great dinner. Keep up the good work!

We went back,,,why I don't know.ill tell you this the food Is outrageous,I only had linguini garlic oil. Wife had clam sauce,,unbelievable fried calamari great,bread great,,the service is so bad,took my drink order 3 times that's right 3 times and still got it wrong,waiters never came to table,I understand it was busy,but they just ignored us.the lady I guess runs the place served us the staff was running around like chicken without heads,,terrible but that lady made it bearable,I think I'll return next year.they might no what there doin then,btw the decor is beautiful

Very disappointed in La Nonna on Kent Ave- The quality of the food has definitely gone down since moving from Bedford.Ave. It is a shame as the new place is very spacious and nice atmosphere. I will probably not go back as there are too many other choices in area with better quality and service.
No comment

This place is INCREDIBLE. We order delivery from them a lot (not on seamless, just have to call) and everything we've had has been amazing. Service in the restaurant is also wonderful. We've brought so many people here! You can't go wrong with anything you order.

I have been to this place a bunch of times. Anytime my family or friends come to Williamsburg, this is the only place they ask to go. The best part is, I don't even order off the menu often, the specials are INSANE always. Truly unique and incredible dishes. Everything just tastes homemade and the staff is incredible. The two owners are super nice and if you need anything, they are more than happy to do anything to make your experience better. I have been to a lot of restaurants over the years, 100's, and this one is a the very top of my list. If you appreciate quality food, I highly recommend.

Awesome food, as close to Italy as you can get. Just returned from Italy and it brought me right back. Awesome charcuterie and great egg/ricotta ravioli. Owners wife came out and was so helpful. Bartender could use a little personality but owners wife made up for it!! Definite try!
We had a wonderful dinner here a few nights ago.  Food was delicious, staff was attentive and funny and friendly.  We'll definitely be back!
Had occasion to eat dinner twice this week at the new La Nonna. Interesting and delicious food, great vibe, friendly and very accommodating service and terrific ownership. Give it a try.

We dined there on Sunday night and were not impressed. The food was average at best. The only reason we gave four stars is because of the staff! They were incredibly attentive and warm. Everyone from the manager to the busboys came over to us to see if we needed anything.

unfortunately this place is just not good. The food is not fresh... we were there recently for lunch.. ordered a pasta with chicken, it was cold, had only about 10 pieces of microscopic size chicken and the sauce was light pink watery and not tasty. really bad... a bus boy over heard us saying this so he called the manager who dismissed out concerns and then decided to offer  us another plate. we were hungry so ordered the lasagna.. but it was FROZEN on the inside.. we did not complain...just ordered more bread and filled up on that! of course we had to pay for the meal...awful, expensive and it is really too bad... we live one block away and cannot imagine ever going there again.
This is the new restaurant; they still have the pizza place on Bedford Avenue until their lease is up.  This restaurant is delicious, the staff are warm and friendly, the decor is chic and elegant.

Came here for dinner last night with my boyfriend, and it was soooo amazing from food, to service to the vibe. I had to come back today with my coworkers, we are big on going on to eat and I think we found our favorite chill spot. The food was delicious must haves are the meatballs and calamari! As my main we had the spicy sausage pasta BEST THING EVER! The service was exceptional I never had to ask for water, we got more of that sauce bread and we felt really taken care of. love love love it!
DE-LI-CIOUS!  one word broken, up in syllables, is all i have to say. Everything was good; the food, the service and the help.

La Nonna hit the nail on the head when it comes to beautifully presented, delicious Italian dishes. Had a couple of items from the specials menu which should really become permanent so everyone can enjoy them. One of those was a buttery jumbo shrimp appetizer that I am still thinking about 2 days later. Also notable: the octopus (from specials menu) and burrata with heirloom tomatoes appetizers. For the entree I ordered the sacchetti. The waiter did warn me that it would be spicy but I thought I could handle it. My mistake. It tasted really good but I just wish it were less spicy. That little hiccup didn't even bring down a star though because I was still so content with my appetizers. Also the waitstaff was super. Friendly, attentive, polite, made me feel like they really cared if I was enjoying myself. Oh and I can't believe I almost forgot to mention the best part of the meal... fried nutella ravioli. Just get it. No questions asked.
Great service and food. The decor is also really beautiful. During the warm months they have outdoor seating and it really feels like you're in a cafe in Italy. One of my favs in the area.
No comment
Best italian food in NY!! Service and food is exceptional. Family run and a great family feel. Strongly recommend. Certainly worth the short train ride from manhattan on the L line.

The steak, the wine, the food, the service, all wonderful. It's nice the owner and his wife and the manager ask how things are, stop by tables to chat. The owner is a talented Italian chef and you can tell by how the food tastes like. Excellent place! All the best to them.
Went on Saturday night for my birthday dinner. The food was great, service very good and the staff was very friendly.  Warm and inviting atmosphere. Can't wait to go back again!

DELICIOUS!  A favorite place for my boyfriend and myself.  We enjoy brining friends and family there who come to visit, because its always a great meal and wonderful service.  Cant go wrong with this place, food is always fresh, soooo many nightly specials.  It is authentic delicious italian food.  Italian approved!!
No comment
The food the food the food!!! All I can say is wow, tonight was my first night here and I didn't want to leave. Staff was very attentive. Pretty ladies made sure to say goodnight to us, very sweet.
No comment

I used to frequent their old location constantly. Probably 3 times a week. Now they only serve pizza there. HUGE mistake. I've been to the new location a few times and the food is OK. They should have kept their old menu for the new location, I know they would have better business!!! But their food is delicious!

Had an early dinner on Sunday afternoon and sat outside on a beautiful day.  The wait staff were very attentive and helped us with our food selection.  My cousin and I ordered the Burrata Caprese appetizer which was outrageous!  Three nice slices of tomatoes and three hefty portions of burrata topped by sun dried tomatoes.  Then we had Fried Ravioli (another appetizer) stuffed with filet mignon and goat cheese in a light truffle oil cream sauce.  Another winner.  We finished with a shared entree - a veal dish with mushrooms and mashed potatoes in a light white sauce.  Three nice pieces of veal and very, very tasty.  Also ordered the brussel sprouts as a side dish.  The entire meal was unbelievably delicious!  I would recommend anyone to try this restaurant ... you won't be disappointed.  I can't wait to go again!

Not that good.  Ordered Delivery. Two people= $67 + tip.  Chicken in pasta looked and tasted like frozen rubbery chicken from the grocery store and my boyfriend said his calamari was inedible.  The pasta however tasted fresh. Maybe dining in is better?

This place came highly recommended but one of the worst dining experiences I ever had.  We went with high expectations.  Initially the service was good - we got bread and drinks quickly.  The trouble started when my sister-in-law requested the remainder of her meal be packed to take home.  At that point, all service stopped.  When she asked where her food was - she was told that it was thrown out.  No attempt was made to rectify the situation.  Then someone else came to the table to tell us she had no authority to rectify the situation.  All this time over 20 minutes - no service - dessert, coffee etc.  Finally we spoke with the Owner who told us our waiter was busy at another large table - and was too busy to come to us.  She also told us as a co-owner with her husband she had no authority to do anything.  She only wanted to find out about the details and work out her personnel issues through us.  This kept going on - and finally we said - either comp us the meal or make another one for us to take out - eventually they did that - this leaving took over 45 minutes.  We will never go back - there are plenty of good Italian restaurants in NYC and this place was large and not full to capacity either.  With attitude like this why would anyone go there.  I only hope that this gets on yelp and doesn't get passed over.  This is no way to run a business
No comment

My boyfriend and I came here for our anniversary dinner. We were blown away by everything we ordered. It was creative, delicious, and presented in a way that was truly special. The scallops appetizer and the s'mores dessert was a huge highlight. We also thought it was so sweet they brought us another dessert to celebrate our anniversary. We'll definitely be coming back.

Been here a few more times since the original post and everything has been consistently good. I've enjoyed sitting at the bar counter as the bartenders have always been super helpful in choosing wine that pairs nicely with each dish. Also, just look at how perfect these wontons are! So crispy on the outside, silky smooth on the inside and just explode with flavor

Food was amazing, ambiance was amazing and service was wonderful. You pick 2 appetizers, 2 small plates, and 2 main plates. Then they time each plate to come out after you are finishing the last, and they did a heck of a job! Smocked duck and Pork collar were fricken amazing. You should 100% plan this in your next trip out.
No comment

We did a prefix menu with wine pairings. It was outstanding. The staff was so knowledgeable and helpful. I have many allergies and they worked around all of them. Definitely need a reservation. The outdoor back patio seating was really nice. The inside looked a bit tight when it was full. It's pricey but worth it for a celebratory dinner!

This hip prospect heights eatery has been getting great notices for years. Much of it truly deserved. The location is small and hosts a nice bar which you can eat at and watch the cooks work. Limited table seating is tight and reservations are highly recommended. The drink menu is great and the wine selection is lovely. The menu is seasonal and changes every so often. It's limited but it's focus is great. I was actually amazed the chefs are able to make this menu in such a small kitchen. The lobster crackers are a must. The som was nice as well. Crudo is tasty and light. I did find the pork dish over cooked but tasty. Staff is friendly and attentive. And the back garden is a must!

The food and atmosphere reeked of pretentiousness. Exorbitantly expensive for meager portions of food. I paid $88 dollars (with tip) for a thimble sized cup of soup, 1 crab rangoon, and 1 small duck deep fried stick plus the main meal of ribs...no sorry one rib wiht sauce). Not a repeat. Not even a matter of inflation. I'm just appalled.
Excellent meal, very innovative dishes and delicious cocktails. We sat at the bar looking into the kitchen. It was fun to see how everything was put together z

What an experience! Went here to celebrate my husband's 72nd birthday and a belated 30th birthday for our son-in-law.  They have a tasting menu that they accommodated for my fish allergy and son's shellfish allergy.  Our daughter and myself added the wine pairing and the guys shared a stout.  The menu changes with the seasons so we'll definitely have to return. We added the bread and short ribs with black garlic to the dinner. The appetizer had crab/kale Rangoon and a vegan choice with spinach. We tasted fried duck rilette, and artic char, pickled delicata squash and so much more. We finished the meal with vanilla orange ice cream with freeze dried cranberries.  One of the most amazing food experiences I've ever had.
No comment

A beautiful little "farm" feel in the middle of Prospect Heights! Really, one of those "only in Brooklyn" restaurants where you feel completely taken out of the city. Reservations here are pretty hard to come by, and I recommend looking for reservations at least 2 weeks in advance. We enjoyed sitting in the back patio area, and it seems that they can still accommodate walk ins but without real tables. The soft shell crab here was so good (although cost a pretty penny), as were the asparagus fries. Our gin cocktail was good and did not taste strong. Overall, great experience, and definitely somewhere to try at least once, but I don't think I'll be back again since it was just a little too expensive for the amount of food - and the area has great options for less as well.
