Had a great night at Olmsted. Got there early and ate at the bar, seems like you def need a reservation. The food was really good. Had the patè to start which was excellent. The pumpkin crepe was delicious as well. Not as expensive as I thought it would be. But I guess I was hungry bc when I got home that night I ate 6 slices of pizza(I was drunk)
This place is very unique.  You can order lots of different dishes from 5-8 and enjoy the symphony of exquisite tastes.  Highly recommend this restaurant. The bigger company the better.

Reservation is strongly recommended. We came here at 5pm (opening) hoping to get a table or at the very least a seat at the bar. No such luck! So we decided to have a drink and eat snacks in their garden where they grow herbs that they use in their dishes, so that's pretty cool. They also have  2-3 birds in a birdhouse. Nice and plump birds but we dont think they are meant for meals. LOL.  There are heating lamps and blankets on the benches so you wont get cold in the garden.  For cocktails we had the Matcha and Lavender - both excellent. The waiter warned us the Matcha was among sweetest drinks on the menu but we didn't think it was sweet. Snacks:  crawfish boil crackers - good but thought they could have given more knowing how inexpensive a bag of these are in Asian stores and then just sprinkle cajun/creole spices on then; golbi  cauliflower - excellent; duck mousse - excellent.  We put out names on the wait list for cancellations and we were lucky someone cancelled and we got a seat at the bar around 6pm. We started with the kale crab rangoon. Its nothing like the rangoon in your typical Chinese restaurant. Perfectly crispy on the outside and inside had this delicate tasting crab mix.  This was served in a Chinese takeout box which we thought was very whimsical.  We then had the carrot crepe. Wasn't sure what to expect but it was one of the best and most inventive things we ate there.  For mains we had the duck and rutabaga.  The duck comes in two parts and they recommend you eat them together. We agree!  The rutabaga was the best thing we had.  Incredible rich sauce but without the heaviness from eating it with your typical pasta.  Just incredible.  The service is excellent here.  We can't wait to come back!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I cannot say better things about this restaurant other than it is truly for those who loves quality ingredients, and sees food as an art. Everything is 5 stars - food, service, and atmosphere. From the moment we walked in, we were never short of 5+ service from the hostess, to our waiter, to the random people hanging around. The restaurant itself is beautiful - its a true definition of "farm to table". Walls were decorated with greenery, and although small, the space was very inviting. There's a bar area to watch the chefs create their masterpieces of food. We came for drinks, teams, and small bites. We ordered the oysters, cauliflower, and watermelon sushi, a bottle of wine, cocktails, and finally ended the night with tea and the honey lavender dessert. My favs were the cauliflower (great spice and fried perfectly) and the dessert. The cocktails are strong, and the teas are good but truly meant for tea fanatics. Expect to spend a while here, because you will not want to leave until you not only try everything, but also  the people itself make not want to step out and deal with the other half of NY. Highly recommended for food lovers - don't forget to say hi to the quails out back!

Thank goodness for reservations at this neighborhood eatery.  I arrived earlier than my party and was promptly seated.  My drink and appetizer of fried squash decorating branches of a tree set on our table  arrived at the same time as the others in my party -- what a great time had by all feasting on a delicious selection of many plates to share. I can still taste my rosemary drink with mezcal.  Yum. The servers all seemed to truly enjoy working at Olmsteads and they conveyed that sentiment at every opportunity.
Service was great, food was meh. So disappointed after waiting weeks to come here after all the hype. Honestly would go elsewhere for the hassle.

This is farm to table with pizazz. The food is inventive and offers up some creative combinations. Not everything was tasty to my palette, but I was genuinely intrigued by the flavors. The ambiance is just right, and the service was efficient and kind. This is a must-stop restaurant in Brooklyn and seems to be best suited for two people.
No comment

Mixed feelings about this place. Great value for money but the service was a little slow and scattered in our experience. The food was stellar and the space had a very cute ambience. Will definitely come back to this place in the summer again since they have an outdoor garden we haven't experienced. The most disappointing part of the evening was having to miss dessert due to the excessively slow service as we were running late and the chef could not have it packed for us to go. Will need to revisit this one!

Great ambiance and definitely had a unique menu with lots of creative and original dishes. Came for a birthday dinner with my family and we ordered a ton of dishes to try. My problem was we were still not full by the end of the meal. For the prices, which are high, I would like to get a bit more bang for my buck. Service was excellent though.

What a disappointment. We've eaten here at least 5 times. Showed up as a walk-in. The new hostess gave us a 45- minute wait. We showed up after an hour and waited for another 10 minutes to be sat next to the door. The hostess was fake and clearly didn't care to make our experience any better.  Will reconsider next time.
No comment
No comment

Best meal in Brooklyn during our week long trip to NY. Loved the watermelon sushi, kale crab rangoon, carrot crepe, scallops and more. Need to try the oysters and more main dishes next time. And even the kids menu pasta was excellent. Great service, too. Charming garden outside. Cant wait to be back.

It's pricey. But it's incredible. Small plates...creative infusions...the Lavender, Pine and Rosemary concoctions off the cocktail menu are inspirational. In the warmer months, the patio is pretty spectacular.

One of the absolutely best meals I have ever had. We got a reservation 30 days before when they open them. It's located in prospect heights a becoming trendy Brooklyn neighborhood. The restaurant is the perfect size, mostly tables of two and a bar. The outside is a shared communal table around their garden but closed in winter. The waitress was nice but quiet, timing of service on and off fast and slow but the menu is SO unique and so delicious and actually filling. Every plate that came was better than the last. Our favorite was kale crab Rangoon and their oyster dish. Reasonable for the kind of food and casual vibe with plants, mismatched plates, and wood interior. Highly recommend.

I'm so sad right now because I had been dying to try this place for a long time. However, I was massively underwhelmed. I will say, the cocktails are exceptional, the service was great, and the uni pierogis were frickin' incredible. Those are the reasons I gave it 3 stars. The rest of our meal was fine and unmemorable at best, and the trout was one of the most mushy and under-seasoned dishes I've seen. I'm glad I can now check this place off my list and not need to return. Unless someone wants to meet for drinks and pierogis.

I had been wanting to dine at Olmsted for two years and was so excited when I finally made the reservation. Sadly, my guests and I left disappointed, underwhelmed and hungry. The ambiance and service are nice. The creativity and concept are there. However, the execution, food, and flavor are completely underwhelming. I truly wanted to love each dish and when disappointed with the first, brushed it off and said the next will be better. I found myself at the end of the meal with no silver lining, a lingering appetite, and a $200 bill. We shared seven dishes for three people. The lobster starter was a centimeter of liquid and two centimeters of foam in a small cup with airy, crispy chips. The lobster flavor was indiscriminate. The squash were good enough but really only five slices of delicata squash. The beef tartare completely lacked flavor and textures did not come together well. The pierogis were good but not memorable, and just as good as any fried dumpling. The carrot crepe was probably the most disappointing. It was delicate and pretentious- almost insulting to call it a crepe. Again, we are open to creativity and invention but the flavor must be there and it just wasn't. We actually are light eaters, and did not go in expecting hearty steaks. We did expect flavor and being fed well though. After five small (very small) beginning plates, I still had hope for the two entrees. The scallops were inconsistently cooked- two soft without searing and three burnt/blackened (a burnt flavor not a delicious scallop sear). The rutabaga tagliatelle was okay but again needed much more flavor! I really wanted something to wow me, or at least hit the mark! I wanted to feel good about spending $200 and sadly couldn't justify it. I want to note that the service was good, ambiance nice, and cocktails great. However, I just can't understand how Olmsted is so highly recommended and rated for the food. Maybe it is because of our Instagram era and the slight whimsy and gimmick of it all, but even that isn't pushed forward enough at Olmsted to make this dinner memorable. Although still hungry and craving a win from Olmsted, we lost hope by the end to opt for dessert and left to go get dessert elsewhere. Ah well.
No comment

Love this place and everything about it.  The vibe is great.  Outside space is super inviting.  Drinks were phenomal and creative.  Food is well thought, tasty and affordable.  This is the restaurant you want in your neighborrhood cant wait to go back.

My fiancé was thrilled about trying out Olmsted. We were seated on time for our reservation and greeted promptly by our server and attending staff. Upon looking at the menu I was confused on what to order. The menu is split into several courses based on size. To be quite honest, they're all small and underwhelming in flavor. Our server suggested the amount of plates for 2 people and frankly I was baffled as the plates were on average $21. We're in Prospect Heights not Midtown. Know your audience. Sadly I didn't care for much on the menu. I had 2 won tons, half a falafel and some tempura kale. This of course shared with my very hungry fiancé. We settled our check and headed to Daly Pie to redeem the evening.

This place is perfect. There were an abundance of vegetarian options. The rutabaga ribbons with truffles, radicchio wedge and chicken fried mushrooms were some of the best things I've ever eaten. The frozen yogurt was a perfect end to the meal.

Was excited to eat at this semi hard to reserve restaurant. Brunch was ok, while the selections were unique/creative, i didn't fall over my chair. Restaurants looked was nice and crisp w an open kitchen concept. Where my review will go wrong is service. Waitress did fine up until we indicated to her there were live budancing in our food. (Notice the many plants throughout the restaurant) However the waitress had this "eww" look on her face (eww at me for pointing out something I need help correcting or the bug?). The shocker was no apologies comment/feedback from her (so I guess the eww was at a picky customer who don't like bugs in her food). She simply took the plate away and later came back w a new one. I thought this was a Michelin graded but that was an odd and I suppose rude experience....unless the bugs were part of the culinary experience.

Olmsted definitely lives up to the recent hype it has received. The space is stylishly Brooklyn, especially the backyard garden where I had a lovely cocktail among the sprouting baby kale. The food is delicious and creative: I especially liked the carrot crepe and the tempura scallops.  Service is warm and attentive, without being overbearing. And the price, although not inexpensive, is reasonable given the quality of the food: Apps were in the low teens and entrees in the low 20s, which is less than comparable restaurants in the area. All in all, Olmsted is a top-notch restaurant that is affordable enough so you can go even when it's not a special occasion.

What a farce! This is the most pretentious and overpriced restaurant I have ever frequented. Aside from minuscule portions of food, the way staff behaves more like used car salesman, figuratively strong arming patrons into ordering more food than they could sensibly afford. The pitch is that if you don't order lots of shareables, you will wait A LONG TIME for your food...and we did. My advice, stay away!

This place was so so good. We got the Cobb salad, pork belly, cacio e pepe, scallops & duck breast. The duck breast, cacio e pepe, and pork belly were my favorites though everything was phenomenal. Would definitely recommend making a reservation as this place was small and incredibly busy. We saw many people turned away at the door since the restaurant was out of tables.
Ok --- The service and the staff  were delightful.    The food was good and we had a great time  and some great laughs making fun of the food.   [ I can't really explain that ]

Small place, good ambiance, our go to place when in Brooklyn. The menu is small, delicious and interesting. Cocktails are well prepared and I really like the wine list. Patio out back is a good place to have a drink while waiting for your table. Go, relax and enjoy
No comment

Good cocktails, and the carrot crepe was our favorite dish.  We shared a bunch of the other dishes and they mostly fell flat in terms of flavor for us. We tried the duck, cod, trout, pork, yakitori, and apple donuts - mostly just ok and not memorable. Go for the cocktails and carrot crepe.

This place is bomb. I ate brunch here. And everything was on point. Flavoring was Amazing and balanced. Palamo was Defiently one of the best drinks I've ever gotten, so refreshing! Get the egg rolls without bacon. Sooo soo good!

Really wanted to love it. New to the neighborhood and spontaneously dropped in late on a weeknight. Lovely space, music not too loud, attentive service. Ordered the heritage pork which seemed salty and turns out it was brined, which was unexpected. A few measly pieces of broccoli rabe as accompaniment, left hungry. Underwhelmed by the food; will try again for brunch.

Completely agree with D s's review a couple down. Bad food. Mediocre service. Completely over-hyped and over-priced. You know when you leave a meal wanting to finish it off with a slice of pizza, then it was a bad meal.

worth the hype, the wait for the rezo and then some. the attentiveness and friendliness from the whole staff is just the right balance. i thought the carrot crepe was good but kind of freaked me out, also wasnt the biggest fan of the yogurt, but these are personal preferences and have nothing to do with quality or taste. my favorites were: the pear cocktail, crab rangoon(must and i dont even likecrab rangoon), scallops, but stand out of the night: tagliatelle. i mean WOW! thank you olmsted for an exceptional experience
No comment

Feeling disappointed...trying to make a reservation for two at Olmsted was very difficult.  After trying to make one on their website and being asked to contact them, I tried to call...the recording said to email for a faster response. It also stated that walk-in's were welcome as seats are saved at the bar for this purpose.  After a 30 minute drive from the city we were turned away at 9:30pm.  There appeared to be seats available but were told that getting in was "highly unlikely."  A better system for reservations or walk-ins is a must.  Waste of time and travel money!

Everything you've heard about Olmstead is true. After trying for a few weeks to get reservations, we decided to just aim for walk-in bar seats. We arrived around 7:30pm on a Thursday hoping for two spots at the bar, and were able to get in after about a 30 minute wait. The service was incredibly friendly, and every single thing we had was delicious - two snacks, two small plates, and one large plate was sufficient to fill us. The highlights were definitely the kale crab rangoon, the carrot crepe (which they sent to us accidentally, but told us to enjoy anyway), and the frozen yogurt. If you've been eyeing Olmstead for a while, hoping for reservations, the walk-in bar seats are a useful option.
No comment
We loved the brunch at Olmsted. The egg roll, the duck duo and the sticky cinnamon roll; pretty awesome.
The food at Olmsted is delicious and presented wonderfully. It is a tapas type restaurant so a party of two would need to order at least four dishes which can get pricey.
No comment

I really do not get these reviews.  We were so glad we had a late afternoon pizza before dining here. Left there starving and had to pick up another pizza on the way home!   We've been to many 'shared plate' restaurants but this was ridiculous.  Minuscule precious portions and no punch of flavor to any of them.  We had a party of five and pretty much ordered everything on the menu. The chicken yakatori was really good but you definitely need an order to yourself. then there really is nothing left to order after you've spent so much time waiting for all these teeny little dishes which look so pretty but two bites its gone.   The chocolate mousse desert was great.  The service was fantastic.  Cute place too.  But seriously needs some help in the kitchen.
No comment

Olmsted is somewhere I'd been wanting to try for awhile, and I must say it lived up to the hype.  Olmsted is a completely unique restaurant, and it works great in its Brooklyn neighborhood, where it can exist on a quieter street with an amazing backyard garden.  Each dish was delicious and very impressively put together - nothing was simple - and it was a very fun dining experience.  It was a fun way to try lots of new things, and I'd like to come back as the menu is always changing.  It's definitely worth making a night of the dinner and hanging in the garden afterwards for drinks and dessert.
No comment

Excellent dinner spot!!! We had the squash rings (delicious), trumpet mushrooms (YUM), summer squash som tum (very unique), rutabaga tagliatelle (sooo good!!!) and the duck (also very tasty). Only issue I had with the duck is it was very hard to cut through the fat, so maybe a sharper knife would have been useful. The frozen yogurt was insane !!!! Definitely order that. Such a wonderful place, I highly recommend it.
No comment
One of the better meals I've had recently, the egg rolls and breakfast burger are a must.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Food was excellent and the service overall was great. I would particularly like to thank Derek for going above and beyond. We visited on the evening of Saturday 10/5. He was working on the back patio and was not our designated server (she was excellent too). We brought our two year old with us to dinner and when she started to get antsy, he saved the day twice. First with a flower and some fish food when we took a walk out back. A second time later in dinner when he made crayons and a sheet to color on magically appear when she was starting to get upset. Thoughtful, supportive staff throughout the whole place.

The service was fantastic, we loved our waiter.  We had 6 dishes in the dining room, all of them were beatiful.  But - the flavor was very subdued in every dish, nothing wowed us.  We had dessert smores in the backyard, and that was lovely, the backyard area is spacious and cute.  I'd go back to try it again next time they change the menu.
Worst experience ever. I called them, sent email and text messages. Nobody responded. They let me out with my family after we got a couple of minutes late. Horrible experience.
No comment
No comment

Super cute spot and amazing food. Portions are small, but you order a couple and it'll be fine. The oysters were crazy good. There's a little garden in the back which looks cute, but it was too cold. The service was very attentive even though it was a packed restaurant.

I will never eat here, so this review is for the obnoxious hostess. I was going to meet a friend here for dinner. It was the Tuesday night after a long holiday weekend and I showed up at 6:40 to a mosly empty place. The hostess said to me, immediately, that they were fully booked for the night. I found that impossible to believe. Such attitude. She told me we could eat at the bar. Not interested. These pretentious places need to get a grip.
No comment

Wow. Just wow. Everything, and I do mean everything, was exquisite. This is the meal I'm continually searching for. We started with the cauliflower, which was easily the best cauliflower I've ever had. We moved to the duck and the carrot crepe, both of which I'd highly recommend. We finished with the rutabaga tagliatelle and the scallops and to say that I'm craving both again - minutes after finishing the meal - is an understatement. Go here. This is the best NYC has to offer. If you don't love this place, then god help you.

First, it's closed on Mondays, my bad.  Second, the food is great !!! Third, prices are moderate.  Finally , try the watermelon sushi!; carrot crepe; scallop dish... And OMG ... Choco mousse!!! This place has a backyard working garden making "food to table " visually verifiable!!!! They also serve great drinks: a nice wine list ...it's not a roomy place , you can feel cramped and thus the noise level can reach an annoying "black board" crank.
No comment

This was one of the most uniquely fabulous restaurants we've been to in a long time.  The menu is innovative and puts foods together you've never in your wildest dreams considered.   The "tagliatelle is the bomb and should be your last main course!!  Highly recommend for food, drink and atmosphere.

Easily the best restaurant I've ever eaten at in Brooklyn. Like the Brooklyn version of Estela. They make the best small, shareable plates I've ever had. The carrot crepe is so unique. The squash rings are so simple yet so incredible. The scallions with corn was so tasty and juicy. The sickest part was I enjoyed the dessert way more than the meal. The lavender and honey yogurt is the most refreshing dessert in New York City. The smores, though over priced, are so good. The peanut butter and jello is simple tasting but the presentation of it is great. Easily one of my favorite restaurants ever.

We often dine at Olmsted because we love the food.  Last night we had the most amazing server, Miriam.  She was amazingly helpful in guiding us through the menu and checked back periodically throughout the meal.  I am not sure we have ever had such a great server anywhere. Thank you Olmsted for the food, and making a great decision to hire such a stand out person.
No comment

I would give my overall rating at Olmsted a 2.5/5.  The food was 5/5 but the service is definitely lacking (1/5).  We waited in the rose garden for an hour before our table opened up (as walk ins on a Saturday night) which is fine, but we were not served even water for the first 25 minutes as it seemed the waiter had forgotten to ask us if we wanted anything and I had to get his attention by asking across the garden. The people next to me just left as they had been waiting over 30 minutes for their drink. The food was very good and worth a wait, but if you want drinks before the meal id suggest going somewhere else.

Believe the hype. It's small plates, so we tried almost everything on the menu. Everything we ordered was fresh and full of flavor. For such a popular and well-rated place, it's reasonably priced.  It can be really tough to get a reservation, but if you go on their website during the week, they seem to often have spots around 10pm for the same night.

I've been planing to go to Olmsted since the summer and I finally had the time to do it. And I'm very glad I did. Service was impeccable. The attention details can be noticed from the menu to the restroom. All the 5 plates I've tried are nothing less than amazing. I'm definitely going back to taste new flavors.
No comment

Great restaurant to go to for a special occasion. Try to get there a bit early to sit in the back garden with cocktails and delicious appetizers. Small portions but very memorable dishes. I had the oysters, grilled pork belly and scallops. For dessert we had the chocolate mousse. All of these were the best dishes I have ever had.
No comment
No comment

Unreal food experience! I love eating flavor blowout food but I also like to be a tad healthy.  The eclectic offerings here, which are not long on options, are so across the world and healthy I was blown away.  Our waiter and the host were very sweet and welcoming making it a top notch night!

Great first meal at Olmsted! The service was outstanding; they were very kind to us and squeezed us in without a reservation (but we did show up at 5:30 on the dot). The food was terrific- my three-year-old even ate the crispy asparagus and the scallops... What better review do you need? Very nice wine menu. Lovely setting. I hope they have a great opening week!
No comment

Excellent foods. I tried every single courses in the menu, even the easy thing like fried pickle or snap pea sushi are so flavorful. Carrot crepe are phenomenal. Main course grilled scallops and trout no word to discribe. Desserts old school chocolate mousse are yummy!!!! Absolutely come back!!!!
No comment
Cocktails, wine, food and service were all excellent and prices were very reasonable.  Best meal i've had in a long time.

Delicious and thoughtful food. We sat at the kitchen counter and it was amazing to see how hard the chefs worked to put together these magical and artful dishes. The owner (I think it was Greg but I could be wrong) checked every single plate that left the kitchen. The wait staff were all kind and helpful and swooped in and out with food and drink so seamlessly. Our neighborhood needed a restaurant like this and yes you need to reserve well in advance but at least they take reservations. Looking forward to going back and trying the rest of the menu.

My wife and I had an 8 PM reservation to eat here last Tuesday, May 15 to celebrate her birthday. We received a call 1 hour before our reservation, after we had made the trip over to Prospect Heights in an intense thunderstorm, informing us there had been an accident and the restaurant was closed for the night.  No further information was provided and no accommodation was offered beyond a vague offer to come back another time, without any meaningful way to follow up on it beyond trying our luck on Resy again. We then spent the evening trying to find a table at another restaurant in the rain instead of celebrating what should have been a fun night.

After waiting months for a reservation for two, we finally secured one at 10 pm on a Friday night! The garden was beautiful, and the cocktails really good. When we came inside for dinner I was impressed with the decor and food presentation. However, the food itself is over hyped. While we were impressed with a few dishes (namely the carrot crepe and watermelon sushi), the others were just ok, especially considering the price we paid for them. I would've given this place 3 1/2 stars, if Yelp allowed for half star ratings.

Great new restaurant! Loved all the appetizers - from the fried ferns to the gazpacho to the charchuterie pretzels to the oysters. So fun to eat these out back in the garden with a glass of crisp white wine and cold beer. Then, off to the inside for our main courses. Tried the scallops and the steak dishes, and both were amazing! So stuffed, but still ate the chocolate mousse and strawberry sorbet. Best we've ever had! Will definitely be back.
No comment

This place i so cute and fun. I recommend it to anyone. The food is playful and tasty. The starters are always delicious - it is hard to choose which ones to get. Occasionally, the scallops can be too salty but you really can't go wrong. The yogurt dessert is amazing. i wish i could have it every night after dinner
No comment
No comment
Beautiful plating, delicious food, and quality ingredients. After a delicious entree and wine we had dessert in the garden. Worth the $$$

was super lucky to get a last minute reservation, the restaurant lives up to all the write ups. everything was delicious and I recommend only going with people ready to share food so you can try lots.  My favourite was definitely the rutabaga tagliatelle.  Already made res for April to come back with more friends to taste more of the menu then!
No comment

Came here for a late dinner on a weekday. The place was still packed at 10pm! The ambience is warm and inviting, and I loved the wall of plants on one side. The service was prompt and welcoming. Cocktails were sensational; my favorite was the Turmeric. We shared a lot of different dishes among the table. Standouts were the uni pierogies, rutabaga tagliatelle, and trout. We also tried one of every dessert. All delicious! I'd definitely come back for another pleasant evening.

Came here for brunch. The Egg cheese bacon egg rolls were so so good. Loved them. The restaurant is very cute with good service. Everything else we ordered was just fine. The burger reminded me of a Big Mac and the donuts and potato latke were very average.
No comment

This place is brilliant. We sat at the bar and received excellent service from the bartender both for drinks and food. Almost every dish was novel and inventive, and certainly all were tasty. The cocktails were similarly fascinating and delicious. Plus the price was reasonable. They deserve their current place on various "top NYC eatery" lists.

Have lived in Brooklyn for 13 years and seen plenty of 'new Brooklyn' restaurants come and go. Olmsted is easily at the top of this trend.  Great room, garden, friendly service and delicious, inventive food. The guinea hen was the real standout for me.   Delicious

One of the best dining experiences I've ever had. Our son-in-law made dinner reservations weeks in advance. We got there early for a drink on the back patio, which was crowded, but we sipped amazing cocktails as we walked around the vegetable garden. The table before us took a very long time to leave, so the staff went above and beyond to keep us happy with food and treats. The food was heavenly and the service was first class, warm and friendly. I can't speak highly enough about our host, our som and our waiter (Emmanuel). I can't wait to go back.

Amazing food. Love the inventive dishes with local and seasonal produce. I love what they are doing here and think it's a great model for conscious cooking and eating! Service was attentive and lovely. The ambiance is amazing. We had the oysters, MNC spatzle, sweet potato pierogis, carrot crepes, lobster Thermidor, plum cake, housemade ginger beer, and the Lavender cocktail. Everything was wonderful! Our server let us know a couple times that our order was on the light side. I appreciate the heads up but I didn't need to be reminded. We were full at the end! It sort of felt like we were being encouraged to order more, but it wasn't too aggressive. Overall it was a great experience!

Went for dinner. I really wanted to love this restaurant, but the food was lacking a little. The service was great. I think i fell into the hype of the place and had too high of an expectation. You are recommended to order 3 dishes to share with table. I liked the bouillabaisse and the duck (its made 2 ways, only the breast was good). Food is creative, but the flavors were not there.
My favorite restaurant in Brooklyn, perhaps in the entire NY. The food was so delicious and the staff were so friendly. The best food I've had in years I think. Keep up the amazing work! :)
The food was very good and the service was excellent. The big downside was that the portions were a bit small for the price. Will probably return for a few light bites and cocktails.
No comment

This was the best meal my husband and I have had in quite some time.  We needed to make a change to our reservation and they were extremely accommodating.  The service , food, and decor were perfect.  I cannot wait to go back and try the rest of the menu.

Creative Gourmet in a friendly atmosphere. Yes, you must go here and be thankful that art can sometimes be edible. Delicious from start to end standouts were, Beer Battered Squash Rings & Rutabaga Tagliatelle. The carrot Crepe with little neck clams I would pass on even though they say it is a signature dish they are known for. Friendly service makes you feel welcomed a great contrast to other restaurant experiences in the same week.
No expectations going, super fun staff, go with Simon. Creative menu but food just tastes good. Garden in back for drinks. Seasonal menu. Get Froyo.
Fantastic! Too bad reservations are soo hard to get! Love that garden for lethal cocktails.
A decent place, but I was expecting more because one of my friends told me great things about it. Ok but nothing so remarkable
No comment

Beautiful room, excellent service, yummy and interesting food.  But their portion size is just laughable.  My wife and I split and appetizer, two entrees and a dessert.   (oh and the cocktails were superb).   our lamb was literally the size of two packs of gum stacked on top of one another!  so after we were done, we literally bought a slice of pizza each on the way home!  I don't mind spending big bucks at a restaurant.  In this case they should just charge more, and serve more food.  We had a good laugh about it later...it was like one of those  old movies when the blue collar guy goes to the french restaurant and they serve him one carrot on a huge plate!
Great service great music food was amazing!!! Chris was my waiter and he had such great energy and suggestions for what to order!!! Love this place!!!
No comment

I have been twice now, usually come in early and go to the bar. Small space, nice design, small open kitchen and back back yard. Was too cold to go in the back yard, but it looked nice, will try it out in the spring! Food & Cocktails are what I like best, inventive food, small but very nice menu. I suggest ordering a few things from each section of the menu and sharing, that is the best way to go, great flavor profiles and sold execution. Will be back!
The Chef is a genius. Amazing experience. Sublime food, easy going place. The service was spectacular. Nice and friendly. We work in the industry and this restaurant is now our favorite place.
No comment

Very friendly staff. Very nice ambiance.  Wonderful presentation of the dishes.Very unique flavors. We were able to get a table on a Tuesday night without  reservation.   They recommend sharing 3-4 dishes at once between 2 people. Our dishes came one by one, and the service was very slow. Since the wait between all dishes, we did not feel like we had enough for a light  dinner, and serving size appeared smaller and smaller with each dish. Leaving a restaurant a bit hundred is always a bit disappointing.  Also, although the restaurant is beautifully designed, and their dishes and cups are made of thing elegant porcelain that adds to the experience and atmosphere, the place is extremely loud. It is hard to have a conversation over diner.

Great experience! Whimsical interpretations of dishes that you already know. Staff was attentive but not at all intrusive. Overall, the place had a friendly, laid  back vibe. Food was delish! Highly recommend.
The staff isn't very pleasant. My service was so bad I wouldn't even eat there but the ambiance is cute.

I love this place. The backyard is heavenly. The S'mores are delicious. And the wine sommelier there, Swann, is an absolute treasure. Levi is also a good waiter. Haven't done dinner but the nibbles and cocktails here keep me returning. It is expensive but the ambiance makes for an impressive date.

Just had sensational brunch - I highly recommend the Duck Duo, very flavorful, and the egg rolls. Ingredients are fresh (some grown in their kitchen garden, which you can sit it out the back), staff are very friendly and the decor and layout are great.
Very small portions lacking flavor. I personally don't get what all of the hype is about.

So disappointed. I heard about that place for so long, it was a real satisfaction to finally get 2 seats at the bar on a random walk-in while hanging out in the neighborhood. The bar staff is amazing, cool and funny and they know their menu. Going to the menu, it first appears definitely original, the name and ingredients .. but soon enough, it was a disappointment. I don't even remember one impressive dish, may be a potato thing that you could find in any brunch places. There was this duck egg with sausage, what was so original there ? .. or some fried veggies that should only belong to a 2stars deli .. Overall it was still a good experience, prices are not too crazy, location is chill, restaurant design it cool (my favorite are the restroom), but don't go there for the food, it definitely has no-thing special at all.

Beautiful space, tasty food, chill staff - overall a really worthwhile dining experience for my wife's bday. The carrot pancake was bomb, steak terrific, broccoli rab grilled with a creamy-nutty tapenade. We had drinks outside in the garden first. Just two suggestions: the wine selection is so-so, and the music a bit too loud and incongruous with the rest of the vibe. Might consider some spicier, richer wines. But really enjoyed the place, am sure it'll be a huge success and deservedly so. And you won't end up with a huge bill.
No comment

Have been trying to get a reservation here for awhile, was very much looking forward to it. In NYC it's so hard to keep all of the hype about a restaurant out of your head & just go in "neutral". So of course I had high expectations, but was mostly just looking forward to a great meal. What  I found was that it was good. Not blown away by any means, neither was my dining companion. I had the bouillabaisse and squash rings, they were both good, not amazing. I mean, this is a good neighborhood restaurant but not something to be stalking Resy @ midnight to score a reservation for.

Honestly I want to give this place 1 star but I'm giving an additional star because the bartender tried to make up for the extremely rude hostess! I wanted to try this neighborhood spot as I love supporting my neighborhood..I didn't have reservation was just coming in for a drink and of the bat the hostess tells me there is a 2hrs wait to sit at the bar, really, since when do you need a reservation for that?? Ok, I'll stand as I wanted a quick drink maybe something to nosh on! 5min or so a guy comes in who had no reservation but asked if he can sit at the bar the hostesses  tells him "oh, it's first come first serve to sit at the bar!" Hmm okay so I guess she clearly makes rules as she goes! There was a seat available and I asked if I can sit there she asks me how many people? "Girl, are you that confused because I literally asked you for one seat at the bar when I walked in 15min ago?!" I explained to her that I'm a little confused as to why she originally told me its 2hrs wait, she tells oh I thought you said you were waiting for someone? Ok, you clearly don't listen! She then tells me in order for me to sit at the bar I must order food??? WTF!!? Really?? Since when do you "have to" order food to sit at a bar?? I've lived in this neighborhood for almost 17yrs and I found her behavior to be the upmost rude and slightly racist!! If that's how your business runs than put a sign but don't tell certain people certain things and others something else. Ugh!!! Annoyed
Amazing food and great service. Carrot crepe is a must! They gave us free drinks for "the wait" which we hadn't even noticed

This is a wonderful, magical experience that I won't go on too much about as I'm sure you can read others' reviews.  But I had a delightful birthday dinner at Olmsted.  It has a casual, neighborhood vibe with really delicious, delightful dishes that leave you with a smile on your face and a desire to return.  The dishes I enjoyed the most were the picked vegetables (fiddlehead ferns that day), Morgan's meats (a nice meaty pate with spicy mustard, chives and pickled cabbage), chawanmushi (intensely briney and delicious), and rutabaga tagliatelle (sooo indulgent and rich and a must order).  The duck chakna and carrot crepe were also tasty but less of a wow for me.  I know people go on and on about the carrot crepe and it was visually stunning and light and delicate and full of sweet carrot flavor but it didn't leave as much of an impression on me as other people.  My least favorite dish was the soft shell crab which was still good but I felt the charred ramps and sauce overpowered the crab.  To finish the meal, we sat in the garden which is outfitted with heat lamps and blankets and had the frozen yogurt lavender honey which was light and airy with just the right sweet floral notes.  The outdoor area is a lovely, cozy atmosphere where you can view plants that contributed to your meal and feel like you're in your own urban oasis.  The service was top notch as well.  Our waiter was extremely knowledgeable and believable in his recommendations and the wine he suggested was excellent.  The guy working the garden was the best sport.  I'm sure he gets the joke about eating the quails in the garden at least five times a night but he laughs politely and responds as if it's the first time he's asked every time so kudos to him.

This place is great! The food, service, ambiance, everything. We went for brunch and ordered the Gravlax, latke, Carrot Kathi Roll, apple strudel rolls, and the egg rolls. I especially loved that when the waitress heard I didn't eat bacon, she offered to make 2 of the egg rolls with no bacon for me. The carrot mimosa is also a must have! I defiantly want to check out for diner. Reservations are a must!
No comment

Was it a bad night at the kitchen?? I read many good reviews about this place so was very excited when we were finally able to get a walk in at the bar on a Sat night after a few try. Ordered oyster, carrot crepe, kale crab, trout and pork. The only dish that we were wow'ed by was the carrot crepe. The other dishes weren't bad but lack the exquisite flavors one would expect from a chef who has worked at top high end places. Maybe he wasn't there that night?? Anyway it was disappointing.

Very unpretentious atmosphere. Food was amazing. Especially liked the outdoor seating in the back for drinks before dinner and s'mores out there for dessert. Can't wait to go back, they are always changing the menu. It was better than $250+ tastings I went to, I'll just leave it at that.

I am sorry- I don't get it. We had an ok experience. Host at the door was rude, and didn't seem to know what she was doing. Service was nice, but not polished, certainly not as aspirational as the food. Food was good. Most dishes we had were just good- nothing reinventing the wheel. The Guinea hen was very good. I like the wine list being priced in the comfort zone, mostly 40-60, and the list has many good selections. I feel like the biggest problem with this place is it seems like no one is driving the boat in service. I watched a food runner come within inches of hitting a guy in the face with a plate, watched the host not really understand whether or not she could seat someone, no one really managed how the bar was sat- it was just sloppy. I hope they pull it together. I would hate to see yet another restaurant close on Vandy.

This place was amazing -- they change the menu often so what I liked is almost certainly gone by now, but if they have a cucumber cocktail, try it! And if you are on the fence about some ingredient have faith, this is one of those places that you can trust to make magic combinations even out of things you normally don't fancy.

I dined at Olmsted last night and wow, what a treat! First of all, the staff is so incredibly cordial that you almost can't believe people can genuinely be that nice! We had an early reservation on a Friday night and when we showed up on time we noticed how cute the back garden was.  We asked the host if we could possibly have a drink outside first. I prepared myself for the old "well we need your table back at such and such time, blah, blah,blah" and what I got was " of course! We also think it's special to have dessert out there" Now reservations at this place are almost impossible to come by but I never once got the feeling that they were rushing us out in any way. The cocktail list is amazing. I had the the Rosemary to start, mezcal, aperol, chipotle, lemon and black lava salt and it was perfect. We ordered the charcuterie pretzel puffs to munch on and I could have eaten about 10 more. The waiter outside was so genuinely warm that I just was all fuzzy and relaxed, again,  the service here is impeccable. When we did meander back inside we had a table up front by the window. This place is very small inside and it was packed but I never felt cramped. This is what we had for dinner. The carrot crepe with clams and sunflower. I would never order this combination if I hadn't read how good it is and all I can say is, order it. It was heavenly!!! Next dry rub scallops with corn and chanterelles. Another winner. The scallops are served in the corn husks and the corn on a separate plate. Luckily the corn plate was in front of me and I came awfully close to picking it up and licking the remaining bits. English pea falafel was next and although it was served with some very interesting accoutrements, it was probably my least favorite. The whipped peas and cardamom labneh it was served with were excellent I just found the falafel a touch dry. We decided to take our dessert, see inventive cocktail list, back outside to finish the night with the tarragon which was amazingly refreshing. The wine list is short and sweet with most bottles under $50, exactly how it should be. I already tried to make another reservation to revisit but alas, nothing available. I will hit open table on a daily basis until I find an opening, Olmsted is that good.

I don't often venture to the outer boroughs to eat, but Olmsted was beyond worth it. The food was spectacular. Had the monkfish popcorn, duck, and pierogies to start. And scallops and the guinea hen for entrees. Every single dish was outstanding, cooked to perfection and unique flavor combos I've not had before. And the lavender bourbon cocktail may actually have been the best permutation of an old fashioned I've ever had. Can't wait to go back and hang in the garden when it's warmer.

Have tried this neighborhood restaurant two times now, and found the food to be excellent and served with real professional aplomb by people who clearly are proud that they work there.  The menu is short and focused, so you are very much there to have the experience of this chef's cooking.  The chicken liver mousse that comes topped with a layer of honey and served with little crunchy brown toasts is really heavenly, and we had it both times.  A dish of root vegetables cut like thick ribbons of pasta, and sauced like pasta was also fabulous.  They only have three desserts, but one of them is 'smores cooked in their pretty backyard, which is really cool.

I will say the food is tasty....but, if you have heard of the movie Downsizing--I think they forgot to shrink us before serving the tiny portions.  We left hungry, and had to go home and make (a real) dinner.
No comment

Thank goodness we had a late afternoon pizza.  This was ridiculous.  Precious portions without very much even going on.  When yakatori is the main meal you'd better order everything on the menu first.  Left really hungry.  Service was very nice.  Definitely not worth all this hype.  The chocolate desert was delicious.  But wow, so silly.

Delicious food, top notch drinks and great staff. Kitchen can be slow at times, but impressive what they can churn out in such a small kitchen space. Outdoor space is lovely and a great place for a drink or dessert on a pleasant night. Rutabaga pasta, carrot crepe, Morgan's Meats and many of the other small plates keep us coming back. So glad to have this gem in our neighborhood!
Love it here! Constantly rotating dishes and great backyard, always a fun time! Crab Rangoon are a must, and Smores in the winter are a ton of fun.
Gorgeous garden in the back and excellent service. The food was underwhelming and overpriced, though.

Not sure if this is a big deal or not but the other night we were seated next to the kitchen were we got to see the amazing and unique plates being prepared, which was the problem. The process seemed normal until the plates were passed to a decorator who was garnishing the plates with their amazing sauces and unique herbs. We thought it was weird that he was cleaning the spoon after every time he used it by licking it and putting it in a tin. We thought this was ok and even funny until we realized that he was reaching into the same tin and grabbing the already licked spoon to plate the next dish. We saw him lick and use the same spoon for every dish he had to plate. I would just like to say the food was amazing but they should have stricter rules and double dipping in the kitchen.
Spectacular, inventive food and great service in a relaxed atmosphere. Go often and enjoy. World class!!!!
So F-ing good. Inventive and exciting menu with palatable prices and solid service. Come early for a drink in the back garden.

Really loved our meal here.  The garden in back is adorable, with clever little tables for your drinks and snacks.  I just wish we had arrived a little earlier than our reservation so that we had more time to enjoy the garden!  Yes, the portions could be considered on the smaller size, but I felt that the quality and presentation of the food (all of which was cooked to perfection) more than warranted the price.
No comment

I was visiting NYC for the weekend and looking for someplace new to try, I happened upon Olmsted, after seeing it listed by a number of publications as a "must try" place. It was far from it. It wasn't all bad, but it  just wasn't that impressive, and the hype is confounding. First, the good: great cocktails (a little pricey, but nothing outrageous by NYC-Brooklyn standards). I tried three different cocktails - two off the the menu and one which was the bartender's creation - and they were all outstanding. A rare meal where I thought the drinks were the best part. The space is also quite lovely. It does feel like a classic "date night" spot. Second, the mediocre: the food - really underwhelming with the exception of the crawfish boil crackers. Aside from the crackers, I had the gobi pakora cauliflower, carrot crepe, and grilled scallops. The cauliflower tasted like the last remnants of something you might scrap up from an Indian lunch buffet that was about to close. The carrot crepe was tasteless, and the grilled scallops meh. Even though I hadn't really enjoyed the meal, I hoped that dessert - a lavender honey frozen yogurt would soothe some of my disappointment. It didn't. It wasn't really bad. But it wasn't really good either. This is a relatively expensive place to eat, and it is difficult to justify the cost of this meal. I am sure the ingredients were all of the highest quality (and the care taken in preparing the various plates was obvious), but this just isn't very memorable. I was staying in the Financial District and went out of my way to eat here. Not worth the effort - cannot recommend.

Food, service, ambiance were all very good.  Was a bit disappointed by the fried monkfish, which was literally a few fried crumbs.  The backyard is nice for warm pre-dinner drinks, even in the cold, since they have heating lamps above all the seating.
World-class elevated farm-to-table cuisine available in Prospect Heights.  What's not to love?

Honestly, I was underwhelmed and disappointed. I was so excited to take my mother here when she visited me in Brooklyn because I'd heard such great things about the restaurant. I had to make the reservation a month in advance at like 9:30 am and even at that time there were only several time slots left, possibly because there were going to be 3 of us and that's an odd number.  When we got there, the decor was simple and the food really was delicious. I especially enjoyed the crepe, which is one of their most-known dishes. That being said, the experience was not good.  First of all, we didn't have one set waiter, which definitely led to inconsistencies. The first person who spoke to us recommended 3 dishes per person. The second person who spoke to us suggested 6-8 dishes total (for a group of 3). We ended up getting 7 dishes. It was NOT enough, even after we all ordered desert. Also, we got the first 5 dishes in the first 1.5 hours of our meal, in slow succession. After that, we waited for over 45 minutes with no food and no one coming to get another drink order even when I tried to flag someone down. At one point I did order a drink from someone and they disappeared and I had to wait another good length of time to flag someone else down for another drink. Then our last two dishes came and we ate desert in the backyard. It was pretty, and there were wool blankets outside which was cute. I really wish this had been a good experience, but I will not be going back again. We literally left the restaurant and ordered a pizza because my mom and boyfriend were still hungry. We definitely should have gotten at LEAST 3 dishes each!

Have to say they have upped their game!   Though the service could improve a little the food is truly delectable. .... Combination of flavor is well thought out. I had the oysters and dry rubbed scallops. Both of which hit the pallet in the most delicate way! The price point is also perfect (especially compared to faun down the road). Drinks wise - also a good place to have a cocktail.. I had them make me my own special cocktail which they did to a tee but then perfected with their own suggestion... Good place and glad it is a solid choice in the hood!

I have had two amazing dinners here, and Olmsted went directly to the top of my list of favorite Brooklyn spots. We ate at the bar both times, which is not a chore, since you get a good view of either the kitchen or the bar. The bartenders are friendly and kind and mix excellent cocktails. There's a decent wine list and the beautiful garden out the back is a lovely place to enjoy a glass of wine. The food though! I managed to try most of the dishes on the current menu over the two visits and every dish was creative, well-executed and downright tasty. I will be back as often as I can make that happen.
LOVED everything about this place -- the garden in the back, the service, the food and prices! The carrot crepe is a must and the pork neck was fantastic too! My favorite restaurant in Brooklyn!

Wow! As a vegetarian and a Bay Area native, I was blown away by all aspects of this restaurant. Dining during the last hour of service was relaxing and perfectly paced. I was excited about the new cocktail menu and received great recommendations from the bartender. The fiddlehead ferns are a must -plated beautifully and full of inspired flavor.  Calling them Olmstead's spin on a fried pickle doesn't do them justice. Though I was feeling close to full after the fiddleheads the fava beans, I decided to go for the English Pea Falafel as well and I wasn't disappointed. In fact, it was the best vegetarian entree I have had in a long time. With not much of a sweat tooth, I skipped dessert and happily completed my meal with the Rhubarb cocktail. The service was on point and the decor worth visiting for in itself. I will certainly be back the next time I visit Brooklyn!

This restaurant will probably be a one-star michelin restaurant. The food is very creative and the ingredient are incredibly tasteful. There is no set menu, it is better to order 10-12 dishes and share them. Few killers: the cauliflower, the carrot crepe with littleneck clams, the squid salad, the pork with raclette cheese. Not only the cuisine is inventive, the presentation is unusual. The restaurant has a laid back atmosphere, the decor goes well with the "farm to table" concept. The only flaw is the service. Waiters and waitress are all very nice, welcoming and smiling, however they seem disorganized. This is probably because the restaurant is still new and the waiters not experienced enough. Although they were late on their service, they remained very accomodating. If they improve the service fluidity, they will reach the one star michelin level easily.

We had such a lovely dinner here last week!  The food was truly delicious - everything was extremely well prepared and tasty.  The snacks, though on point, are definitely not the best value for the money (we had two of them and they disappeared in about 2 seconds) but the entrees were very hearty.  Great ambiance, great service, excellent wine, etc.  A wonderful addition to the neighborhood and miles better than its predecessor Cooklyn.

Ate at Olmsted last night. Upscale dining in casual atmosphere and reasonable prices. Food was unusual and delicious. The menu is arranged from smallest portions to biggest. The green gazpacho was so delicious but not enough! The carrot and clam crepe sounds really weird, I was surprised how amazing it tasted - favorite of the night. Roasted Hen was nice size portion served in 2 parts with stuffed breast meat and a bowl of dark meat confit with mushrooms.  Only miss were the scallops which were described as having a dry rub - just a spicy blackened rub that completely overpowered the scallops. (But the corn polenta a green garlic served with it made the dish worth getting.) Bonus is Ample Hills Creamery is right down the block!
No comment

After walking across the Brooklyn bridge this is a great market to get some food and rest. There are a bunch of different food stands so no need for you to argue with your group on what to eat l. I got the Nashville chicken and my friend got some ramen. The food was great and there is also dessert options too. They have two ground bars and a rooftop one. The rooftop one did have bad service. The bartenders were all on one side ignoring the customers on the other side. The views of the Brooklyn bridge are stunning here.

The Timeout Market is in DUMBO under tbe Brooklyn Bridge bridge area. It's a really nice concept with an indoor group of restaurants and easy seat yourself areas. There is a good selection of cuisines eg. Japanese ramen, Indian cuisine, Thai and American. We tried the dishes from a number of places and everything tasted great. Loved the Thai food we had a shrimp appetizer and pad Thai, at the Indian place chicken roti and samosas, mango lassi and Japanese ramen. Ordering was easy you pay and get a buzzer while you wait for your food. It does get quite busy and it's hard to get an indoor table. Overall great place for some fast eats.

Such a great spot to eat in the area. The lamb burger and lassi were delicious and tasted fresh and satisfying. The pad Thai was also so good! The noodles were soft and we added shrimp as well for protein. The bagel was good too, but I think out of all three the pad Thai was our favorite. Would definitely recommend it.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I really enjoyed this meal! I had never hear of Bark Barbecue or Dominican Barbecue for that matter before my visit to Timeout Market, but I am so gla I was introduced. They gave our samples online and that is how I was convinced to try the brisket. It was full of flavor and super tender. And I had to get the chicharones because... I mean just look at them. The were so crunchy without being chewy and they were delicious. The bbq sauce and the mustard were also amazing. It is slightly expensive but there is def enough food to share with a friend and even take some home! Ok look forward to going back!
No comment
No comment
Such a great place! A ton of options we ended up getting the pasta at felice pasta seating was very limited but a great place if you want to try something new
No comment

I didn't dine in at the Market but I had a great experience browsing through the local sellers stands. The Market is located in the DUMBO area, near many of the Brooklyn highlights. It's definitely worth checking out, even if you're not hungry there are several stands and shops that offer a variety of things. There was a girl that sold handmade earrings, another one that sold boutique-style items for dogs and art as well. The establishment itself is fairly new (from what I noticed) and has plenty of delicious options for everyone to try.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: No comment
No comment
What a fun experience. There are several food vendors and you can get anything you want and bring it up to the roof to eat. Must try - everyone can get exactly what they want!

This market is such a great spot to visit when in Brooklyn. They have a variety of restaurants to choose from and local small business you can support. They sell arts and crafts, candles, clothes, so many beautiful things!
No comment
No comment

Boy do I wish we lived closer to time out market or at least there was a Chote Miya in New Jersey. The atmosphere and location are spectacular and so is the choice of food you can pick from. Sandra and the girls had pasta dishes that were all reasonably priced and all delicious. I ordered from Chote Miya and so glad I did. The chili fried cauliflower is spectacular. The flavor and perfect amount of heat is incredible. The chicken khurchan is also delicious. Perfect amount of heat and flavor. They fry/cook mint leaves-OMG so good. Overall it's a very clean place with very friendly people working there and plenty of options that are priced reasonably for what and where it is. We had a great time and will definitely be back. Get there. Enjoy
No comment

Our favorite any day place!! Best fried chicken and oysters and everything else is a plus! Atmosphere works for brunch, last minute happy hour, relaxed or fancy dinner. The chowder fries are delicious, crawfish bread is hard to beat and the burger is amazing!

Super cute food market in Brooklyn with lots of options. Was disappointed that the main reason we went (Bark BBQ) was sold out for the day but was able to enjoy a few other vendors. They have options for any palate. They offered many American, Indian, Ramen, vegan and Thai cuisine. I did wish to see more dessert options as when I went on a Saturday night, they only had one dessert option open, but can't complain because the cannoli's were amazing. They also have one of my favorite restaurants in there, Jacobs Pickles. The lines can be long, but they move fast.

The variety of incredible options in such a nice space close to so much happening makes this an absolute winner. Classics like Jacob's pickles and sugar hill creamery as well as less known options ranging from Thai to street Indian. Lots of seating options too
No comment
No comment

This is my go to spot when I am in Brooklyn as there are a lot of options and so many seatings every time I go! It's a little pricey for what it's worth, but that also is just typical New York. Would love to try th other vendors in this place! It's also so nice to be able to just walk around or go upstairs to hear live music/the views (:
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great spot to spend an afternoon. So many different food options to choose from. I would compare this to a much smaller version of Chelsea market with more seating options. Communal seating is setup throughout the market and on a nice day the rooftop would be the perfect spot to hang out. I dined at Fornino Pizza and ordered the Calabrese Pizza. Pizza was tasty and made with fresh ingredients! Would love to go back and try more restaurants. Honestly one could spend breakfast until dinner here. Highly recommend checking this place out. Tip: Evil Twin Brewery is a few minutes walk away. Make a day of it and explore more spots in Dumbo!
No comment

I recently had lunch at Tie Out Market New York with breathtaking views of the waterfront. PAT LAFRIEDA dish I had was cooked to perfection and served with their premium prime cuts. The service was friendly and attentive, making for a relaxing atmosphere. The stunning scenery made the meal even more memorable. Overall, highly recommended for a delicious meal with a view.
No comment

Really cute market with a lot of different cuisine options! I specifically tried some wings from the Thai place as well as the garlic tonkonstu ramen. They both tasted good but they both didn't really stand out in any way. The ramen was very good and it was a decent portion - I liked the broth and texture of the noodles. As for the wings, I wasn't really expecting the flavor but it was still good and it was very crispy. Overall, I'm glad I was able to finally try some of the food from the market. I also ended up getting a prickly pear lemonade - not my favorite because I didn't really taste the pear and it was too tarty for me, but it did come in a pouch which was cool!

There are things I like and hate about the market. It's overcrowded beyond belief. Or at least when I came in this past Saturday afternoon. But there also was a holiday market going on as well as the World Cup so maybe that had some factor. Everything is a little bit over-priced. It's hard to figure out what you're getting the most bang for your buck but I guess if you circle enough times you'll find something worth indulging in. I didn't check out the roof top but I'm sure the views are worth it. It was pouring rain and I hastily ordered my food to dine in on china-ware so I figured out the hard way that you can't bring glass up to the roof when trying to meet my friend. Anyway, I ended up getting Jacob's Pickles' buffalo mac and cheese for $15 plus tax plus a heavily insistent that I tip, even though it's self serve. Oh well. I was torn between that and a ramen spot because that seemed like a hefty portion for $20-ish dollars and a great day for a huge bowl of it. But the portion size for the buffalo mac was hearty and huge. Enough so that I saved about half for today's lunch. My friend tried Bark Bbq that's brand new. I trust people with how delicious the bbq is but man are the portions small for how much you spend. She ended up getting 2 ribs, a piece of cornbread, and like 3 or 4 plantains for $21 or $22. Everything she said tasted great but maybe not the price tag. Ended our meal with Sugar Hill Creamery. They let us sample a few flavors before deciding. I went with the Harlem Sweeties which was a salted caramel ice cream with butterscotch and brownies and the other flavor I got was the peppermint bark ice cream cake. Man, both were great. They also serve your ice cream in a legitimate huge ass cone that doesn't cost extra. We will have none of those garbage tasting cones nonsense. Thank you. Giving Ample Hills a run for their money. It's convenient for having tons of options if you're with folks that don't want to eat at the same spot but seating is really hard to knab. Got to be at the right time and place and I guess that makes me a deer in headlights and annoys me. Dumbo desperately needed this though because it's been destitute of good bars and spots to eat for awhile.
No comment

Very nice place with plenty of space to sit. If you get take out you can even go up to the rooftop park (not bar) & eat with a view! Love that you have access all the well known restaurants in one place. Great for those visiting New York. For those from NY, the prices here in my opinion is too much & with limited options. For me I got three Al Pastor tacos with a lemonade from Ivy Stark Mexology & that came out to be $25. Travel down to Sunset Park on the N and you'll have more delicious authentic tacos for 1/4 the price. My husband got 2 small sliders also for $20 (no drinks, no sides). It was good, but not worth the price good. Otherwise, very trendy place. Will visit at least a year later when I'm feeling rich $$$ .

Such a great spot to eat at in the area. There are multiple restaurants sharing the building and there is something for everyone. A bonus is the rooftop which has an amazing view. We tried Wayla and were very satisfied, I especially liked their shrimp chips and thai tea, would definitely recommend.

We stopped by Time Out Market for breakfast and coffee when we were in NYC/Brooklyn for a long weekend a few weeks ago. While it's not the best spot for breakfast (only two vendors open early enough for breakfast), it's a great spot for later in the day. Tons of vendors: Clinton St. Baking Company, Little Neck Raw Bar, Pat LaFrieda Meat Purveyors, Fornino, Sugar Hill Creamery, Bubusan, Jacob's Pickles, and on and on... We got bagels from Ess-a-Bagel and took them outside. And that's really the highlight of Time Out Market - the view!!! There are lots of outside tables (and apparently a rooftop, although we didn't make it there) - and the view of the East River and the Brooklyn and Manhattan bridges is fantastic. It's a great market. Stop by if you're in the area, try some of the food or get drinks at the bar, and check out out the great location and view.

One of my favorite spots in the city. Brooklyn Bridge Park is a gorgeous area with cobble stone streets and incredible views. Time Out Market is conveniently located right in the middle. Amazing food, drinks, views and free wifi Time Out has it all. Don't forget to checkout the rooftop for more seating and restaurant options with better views or go for drinks at sunset.

It's very cool nice food court and rooftop which has a stunning view! The food is good but pretty pricey. Also there were so many people there!

I love that the market is located on the shores of downtown Brooklyn right along cobble-stones streets with a beautiful view of the water. The market offers a wide variety of food options including Thai, sandwiches, burgers, Indian, salads, and more. While there is seating scattered throughout the market, it may need to be expanded a bit more for those crowded days. I had a cheesesteak from Par LaFrieda and thoroughly enjoyed it, and was even quite full off of it. Overall a nice place and a good time.

Amazing area, I loved it I took a ton of pictures, I lucked out with parking, I won't tell my secret. Definitely need to visit again with a friend.

We arrived hungry after walking over the Brooklyn Bridge. We decided to eat at the Clinton Street Baking Co. We waited about 20 min since we arrived before opening hours and we were not disappointed. I had the seasonal apple waffle and it was phenomenal. My mom had the brioche French toast which was equally delicious and we shared a side of bacon. My only disappointment was the specialty coffees could not be made due to an issue with a machine. I opted for earl grey tea and it was good. I would definitely go back!

Such a great market. Walked over the Brooklyn Bridge and in a very short walk came to Timeout Market. I grabbed a bagel and went up to the top floor to get another amazing view of the bridges. Can't wait to go back and try more drinks and food.

Super cool food hall! I wish we had more time and bellies to try so much more of the foods. There are so many options to choose from and such a wide variety of different types of foods - sushi, chicken, thai, pizzas, bagels, etc. We loved the upstairs area where there's a full bar that made very pretty drinks. It's such a good place to hang out, super good vibes. While we were there, there was a performance with Brazilian dancers and that was really fun. The upstairs rooftop gives a great view of the bridges and the waterfront of NYC.
Finally walked over the Brooklyn Bridge and came in here for lunch! There are are a lot of shops and options for food and drinks. Seating is limited so get there early.

I love the markets in nyc bc it's a nice way to experience lots of different kinds of foods from top restaurants in a really cool environment! This market is right next to the Brooklyn and Manhattan bridges so the view can't be beat. I wish there were more restaurants but the ones that are there are great! We loved our Ess a bagel especially the most!

Indoor food market with a big variety of food vendors, both on the first floor and rooftop!! Types of food range from Thai, to Indian, to Italian, to American, to anything and everything in between. I like that most of the food vendors have a display case on the end of their stations to display popular items on the menu. Definitely try out this food hall- it's a lot like Chelsea Market, but way less packed!!

Really cool concept! It's basically a food hall that was curated by Time Out NY to bring together some of their top rated food spots in the city. I always love stopping by here when I'm in the area. Easy to bring a group and all get different foods. They also have a cool rooftop upstairs with outdoor seating

While in Dumbo, we were starving after sightseeing and found Time Out Market. My son wanted Mexican food and so we chose Ivy Stark Mexology. My son got carnitas tacos that were delicious and I got an amazing chicken salad! And the prickly pear lemonade was so good! The market and some great options, something for everyone!
Great hide away with a warm and inviting atmosphere and a wide selection of food vendors.
This place is huge! I liked it more than Time Out in Chicago. I got a salad at the Mediterranean place. It really hit the spot!

Loved the atmosphere here! The great food was a plus. I found most of the places to be a little pricey but was expected.

Spacious food hall in Brooklyn, right by the Brooklyn bridge and DUMBO area. Lots of stalls inside and plenty of seating. Make sure to visit the rooftop which has stunning views of the city and bridge. Food is a bit pricey for the portion sizes, so be prepared to spend about the same as you would at a restaurant. Ordered the Paneer Khurchan at Chote Miya. The paneer was very tender, loved the flavors in it! Quite spicy as well. It was a bit pricey though for the portions.
Great variety of food options, ambiance is intimate and elegant -- a feature not seen often in food courts. Highly recommend Time Out when you're in the Dumbo area!
Very crowded. Understaffed food vendors. Long lines. Gave up ordering anything due to long waits. Many food vendors had only one employee who both cooked and rang up the orders. Underwhelmed.

Wait a minute? Where have I been? Ohhh, inside.. COVID . The last time I was in this area, this did not exist. Time Out has an array of eateries all under one roof. There's some restaurants on the main level and then there's others upstairs. I walked around and there is a lot of variety. I saw a burgers and fries, chicken places, pasta place, pizza, ice cream, Asian food, Mexican food and a bunch of choices. I settled on Thai food and my friend got a vegan bowl. My plate was about $20 and I gave a tip. So my bowl of noodles ended up being $26. I went on a Friday and it was very crowded. A lot of people were inside and outside along the water line looking at the bridge and taking photos. They also a lot of people upstairs on the roof deck area. There's also a carousel near. There was a wedding party taking a wedding photos there. It is a cool outing to get some food and also to take in some of the visual delights. Just be prepared to open up your pocketbook a little bit wider than you normally would.
So many options to choose from! I had the pork belly bun in the ramen place. Great food great view but too many people

Ate a honey glazed chicken biscuit sandwich and Mac n Cheese at Jacob's Pickles. Food was delicious, portions were huge, and wait was not too bad. We were able to find a seat fairly easily, and then explore the roof top at night. Definitely recommend this place for a fun, cheap thing to do for tourists and locals !

Crowded and overpriced.  Went last Sunday at 1130 ver crowded and too cold to eat outside.  Ended up walking another block and getting excellent Pizza at a quarter of the price

Awesome place, so many selections with a lot of vegan options.. highly recommend.. no need to go to a fancy restaurant..

Great views and selection of restaurants. There's also a rooftop bar with amazing views of Brooklyn/Manhattan bridge. Definitely a great spot to spend the afternoon to eat, drink and hangout. Food prices are tad bit on the expensive side.

I thought it was so great!  The view is beautiful.  Additionally they had Irish Dancing by the Brooklyn Irish Dance Company perform for free for one hour.  It was very professional and well organized.  The place is clean and well kept.  Would recommend the place mostly to tourists but really just anyone for a relaxing few hours.

A bustling food spot for bustling New York. Filled with tiny stores giving a taste teasers for New York has to offer in terms of food, energy, and happiness. We tried the bao buns and they were incredible.
Porsha at Dough is AMAZING! She dealt with me being indecisive for nearly 20 minutes and helped so much
Lots of restaurant choices. You can eat everything from Mexican, Italian, Japanese and more. They also have beer and a nice view if you go on their rooftop.
Great views and great selection of restaurants. I tried the oysters, Indian place, Arab Latin place, sushi and ice cream. Be prepared to spend a lot of $$$$$!
Very upbeat place with great drinks!! Live music, beautiful sunset view, and some nice NYC lights

Absolutely loved this place! Such a good place to get something to eat if you're not sure what you even want to eat, or with someone who wants something else than you! Such a great vibe to even walk around & see amazing views of the Brooklyn Bridge!

I love this place!! It's a multistory market that over looks brooklyn bridge park and the Ferris wheel. We came on a Sunday and it was kinda packed but worth it! We went upstairs to grab drinks from the bar and go out on the rooftop and found that we arrived just in time to enjoy a live band perform. They have an awesome seating area upstairs with large windows that look out toward the city skyline, East river and bk bridge. It's sooo beautiful and it was such a nice vibe. This place is especially awesome in the summer when you can enjoy the rooftop outside and then come back in when it gets too hot (instead of sweating in the park for a picnic ... been there.. not it). Can't wait to come back here!

Man oh man the pancakes are a must! I mean a must, so fluffy and delicious. They egg scramble was good but the hash browns were a bit hard. The wait was a little long but the pancakes will get me every time.
