Ridiculous! Ordered food and a cocktail as soon as I sat down at the bar. 1 hour later, I don't have my food and several people sitting g next to me have come after I arrived, got their food, ate, drank, paid and left. If it does not come out perfect or if they do not compensate, I will reduce review further.
No comment

I had a great experience here. We came in on Saturday night and there was no wait to be seated outside. The host working was impossibly happy and super pleasant. The sushi was really interesting. Rather than rolled up, it was flat and rectangular. The portions were huge. The kale salad was really cool, too. It came with three different salts to flavor the white creamy dressing (?). I will be back for both!
No comment

Honestly, you can rave all you want about the food but waiting 45 minutes for RAW beef is just entirely unacceptable.  Painful dining experience.  The 2 of us got served a full 30 minutes before the RAW beef plate showed up for the 3rd person.  We complained and was told the beef was defrosting.  Huh? Worst of all, manager threw the waitress under the bus saying she was new...when in reality the kitchen is visible to diners and we could see that there is absolutely no urgency to getting food prepared.  A lot of effort though stoking those charcoal embers!   Place was mobbed when it first opened, and not surprised it was so empty last night considering the way they do business.  I guess the word is out that if you have 3 hours to kill this is the place to go.

Had a reservation on a Friday night and the table was ready when we arrived. Service was great. The appetizers we had, tuna avocado salad, wings and fried cheese really great.  I wasn't  a fan of the duck bowl or crunchy shrimp entrees. Duck bowl just ok, bit boring and have had much better shrimp roles in other places. The special martinis, saki cosmo also seemed a bit short poured.  If you use a small glass you should fill it to the rim for price. Good ambiance and nice to get seated quickly though.
No comment

Wow. My wife and I had a great experience here. The waiter was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. The bartender prepared us phenomenal drinks. Our food was delicious. We started with the Wagyu Carpaccio, Creamy Shrimp Croquettes, and the Shrimp Bacon. Each appetizer was great and I would order each of them again. For our main, we shared the Char-Grilled Wagyu Rib-Eye Roll and the Shrimp Crunch. Amazing. Good times.

I would say avoid this place for lunch, at all costs. We ordered a steak salad and a wagyu burger (med-rare). The food took an hour to come out, and the explanation was that the patty takes a while (really?? Medium-Rare?) The fries were clearly refried and held a ton of oil with that shininess that tells you they've been fried once too often. The steak in my wife's salad looked boiled, which is just a travesty for place that specializes in steak. Meanwhile, the person next to us got the steak salad as well. Got unappetizing boiled chunks for meat. Brought it up to the service staff, and simply got a "sorry, it shouldn't be like that". She did get her whole bill at the end. We offered her fries, but I think she was just done! I'm not sure if there was a drastic change in kitchen staff between the last review that sent us there, and our own visit, or if the E Team works on Saturday days. AVOID.
Salt and Charcol is one of the best dining experiences I have had in the neighborhood in a very long time. You can truly taste the quality of every ingredient and the service is equally excellent.
The food was delicious, the atmosphere was cool and the staff was great. I highly recommend the Waygu Rib-eye roll and the Waygu Soboro Meshi rice dish.
No comment

Good Japanese food! The drinks are very tasty as well. Very friendly staff. The restaurant is clean and you can see the cooks cook your meal through a glass window which is great. Great addition to the neighborhood!

I've never tried something at Salt and Charcoal that I didn't like. Any dish with their Wagyu beef is excellent. The Umami Chicken Wings and Shrimp Crunch Roll are my favorite. And even if you're "not a dessert person" you should try the Waffle Mochi Ice Cream. You won't regret it. While the wait staff is a little... eager, the quaint space is laid out well, with an open kitchen where you can see how robata-style cooking works.

This was my second round at this restaurant and it was well worth it. My first experience was so so but the staff and food quality truly shined the second time around. My specialist (waiter) Johnathan had some true knowledge about the menu and drink pairings for each dish he recommended. I even worked up the courage to try a damn sea urchin. Their twist on the urchin is flavorful and honestly worth a try. The octopus and steak was cooked perfectly over the Japanese charcoals but it's how the subtle ingredients are used with one another that make each dish standout. Here's the thing, I've eaten at many restaurants (high end + low end) and usually leave feeling a little robbed at times either by the quality of food or service. The people here care about the experience provided. I saw the chef watching me with anticipation and confidence from the corner of my eye as I took the first few bites of the steak he prepared. Open kitchen by the way so you get to see how clean things are at this place. I hate dirty kitchens. Hoping my next visit is just as memorable.

In one word: excellent. The food is superb. The ambiance is warm and inviting; very cool, very fun. The waitstaff is knowledgeable and down-to-earth. The beverage selection is intelligently compiled with great cocktails and fantastic sake. Prices are more than reasonable, especially given the high quality of food. I read some of the other reviews and did not find the same experience as those who wrote negatively. There are great deals here, like the Wagyu Roll for $15 (Wagyu!) and 5 appetizers in The Daily Starter for just $12. I highly recommend Salt+Charcoal and look forward to my next culinary adventure there.

great food and service. I had the wagyu mushi shabu (just great) and the kale tofu salad and friends had other menu items,  The food was fresh and full of flavor. They had Ice cream for desert (awsome) and I had the Shratama  cream for desert,  just excellent!

The food is awesome and the staff are rad. Wagyu beef dishes melt in your mouth... Get the salmon that's encrusted in salt, it's crazy good. Drink oolong-hai's they make you feel good. I come to this place at least once a week for my fix :)

Maybe it was an off night, but my friend and I were really disappointed with the food.  The edamame was burnt and flavorless and the mushroom appetizer was just boring.  I wasn't wowed by this place and I definitely will not be going back.

Love everything about his restaurant. Must admit it's on the pricey side but food was great. We got the tuna tartar and wagyu tartar and WOW blown away. We also got the NY strip and it was very soft and cooked well. The ambiance of this place was also great and had a lot of cool bars and dessert places for afterwards.

Was excited to try this restaurant after hearing good reviews.   Still sitting here after 2 hours waiting for some of our food to arrive.   Portions that have come to our table are very small and not inexpensive.  I will not visit this restaurant again.

I ordered eggs and Canadian bacon for brunch - when it came the bacon was actually pork belly - and VERY fatty pork belly at that (i looked it up online when i got home and it was clearly not Canadian bacon) - and the eggs were so salty I didn't eat them. The rolls were nice and the miso soup was ok. Our server was cool and nice and I left her a proper tip as it was not her fault that the food was poor. In our party of 5, three people were pleased with their meals, one was just ok and mine was a write off.
No comment

I am so impressed with this place. I would recommend it to any food lover. The sushi rolls were some of the best I've ever had. They make a beautiful salmon roll that is a million times better than any rainbow roll you've ever had --that's actually what I was craving. This place exceeded my expectations by miles. The NY strip was perfect. The sashimi so fresh and delicious. Great wine selection. Cozy atmosphere, candle lit. Great for date night. Great service. Highest recommendations!

I had dinner lasy night w a friend we both had the $60 omakase it was good, some of it excellent but the order of the plates should be different, me and my friend work in the industry he is a executive chef and im an agm, our server was attentive and knowledgeable but he was hiding for a bit and i dont blame him since we waited a very long time for our food, at the end they gave us a complementary carafe of sake which was nice, i really want to give this place another chance and i will be back.

My boyfriend and I came here and had amazing food. Our server was so knowledgeable. It's worth asking the server questions to learn about the cooking style and the type of food to expect. It's definitely a small plates style restaurant, but the portions were actually quite big compared to other small plates experiences we've had (especially in Manhattan!). I wouldn't say it's inexpensive, but you absolutely get what you pay for - great food. We had several small plates and a few cocktails each and with a 20% tip we still were under $200 for the night. We are already thinking about when to go back!

Contrary to many reviews, on a Friday night around 8:45 we had no issues with long waits for food - everything came out at a reasonable time. Service was friendly and able to answer our questions. We tried the cocktails - pretty good, the Yuzu Mule was a bit sweet but flavorful. The food overall was very tasty - especially the Ebi shrimp toast appetizer, so good! We had the Wagyu beef and Black Cod for entrees- while both were delicious as other reviews mentioned the portions were terribly small. $28 for the cod which was probably only 4 Oz. and some Quinoa on the side felt like a rip off. I would come back for an appetizer or the sushi but it's just too expensive for such small portions to come back regularly.

I guess I should have listened to the negative reviews. Portions were small and lacked flavor. The skewers were nothing special. Wagyu was delicious but it's Wagyu so it better be. Warm tofu was good too. Waiters were friendly but lacked knowledge of the menu. Prices were high relative to how unremarkable the food was. We tried it so now I can say I tried it and don't need to go back.
No comment
No comment

We had the porterhouse steak and it is really good but too big for 2 persons. And we felt stuffed and a little bit sick when we finished it.. If they offer smaller size like around 20oz, that would be perfect.

Loved it. Not in Williamsburg that much, but went with a local who lives close by.  She had not been there either. Inventive, fresh, Japanese cuisine. Not a sushi place per se, but has sushi offerings. We had smoked mackerel, sliced, on sliced daikon radish. Also al dente udon with minced pork in a delicious flavorful broth, unagi rock, a terrific platter of eel sushi and duck breast, each thinly sliced piece was wrapped with radish and carrot.  They have a full bar and service was great, I/we'll be back.

This place should get higher stars but the service was terrible. We dined early on a Friday evening. The waiter and staff kept wanting to take our plates asking 'if we were done'    The restaurant started to get a bit full but still wasn't crowded yet. We felt rushed the whole time. The food was just okay, the sake presentation was good and the downstairs bathroom was nice. There are too many options in the hood that I will not settle for bad service.

Uni Shooter appetizer is A MUST! A truly excellent restaurant in Williamsburg. The setting and decor are a bit intimate so I recommend it for dates or smaller groups. The food is delicious but I must give 4 rather than 5 stars because I don't think the prices are justified. There are great restaurants in the area that offer good food and are more competitively priced. Highlights were the foie gras and the cod. Their specialty salt+charcoal cocktail was spicy heaven!

Very good izykaya. The menu is extensive and everything we tried was amazing. I was with one other person and we wished we had more people with us so we could try more dishes. I always love seeing Chūhai on a menu! Wagyu rib-eye roll was delicious and presentation was lovely, came with a sesame risotto. The homemade soba was great, and the Shiogama Scottish salmon was one of the best pieces of salmon I've ever had, very tender, presented in a salt shell to preserve moisture and cracked table side. Will be back to try more!!
Excellent food and service.  Perfectly seasoned and cooked meats...Just need to work on the pace of delivery.  Slow is very in right now...

Went out for Halloween and found this spot by accident. Got lucky cause the menu is original, the service at the bar was on point, and the quality of the food/drink was superb. The variety alone will have us returning - we like Japanese robata style cooking while drinking at the bar, maybe this can be considered Japanese tapas? Anyway, this place is a gem and we're psyched to have found it. Certainly coming back.

This place is wonderful! Really! I came here last weekend with a friend and we started at the bar had a few cocktails made by a really welcoming bartender (Alexa?). The yuzu mule was sooo good! We had the shrimp crunch roll while waiting for the table and it was definitely one of the best shrimp crunch rolls I've had. Not your basic boring one but really flavorful! Once we sat down we had the warm tofu, the pickles, the selection of 7 skewers,  the chicken meat ball, and some soba noodles. Everything was incredible! The skewers where my favorite this followed by the chicken meatball. The restaurant was pretty full when we went but our server was so nice and accommodating. She made sure to explain a few of the items would take a while to cook, but that was no problem at all! We just sipped on some excellent hot sake while waiting! If you go definitely get the wagyu skewer! It was my favorite!

I came here for their Valentines Day prix fixe which was an incredible steal at $60 for 6 separate courses each.  My bf and I got the meat and fish choice. My favorites included the chicken nanban zuke, the rabataya rolled wagyu skewers, cod (didn't lie the grilled veg with it.. They were still too raw), the house made soba, shrimp roll, and the green tea cake and mochi and green ice cream.  I didn't like the wagyu roll (the jalapeño on it was overbearing). Our non Japanese waitress was very sweet and knowledgeable about the food despite how authentic Japanese it was ( the robataya uses charcoal and wood from Japan and the kitchen staff is Japanese). The space is beautiful and the open kitchen is very clean and had a great vent system... We sat right next to the open kitchen and we didn't smell like food at all!  They tried to seat us downstairs but I requested to be over by the kitchen booths. I wouldn't recommend downstairs for a date. It's better for a private party.  Will definitely recommend this restaurants to my friends and be back myself.

I went here with boyfriend. We had a great time. The food was great and waitress help us pick out wonderful food choices. I would go back again. The restaurant was clean and spacious. Music was great and food again was great!!
Amazing food. The best beef Wagyu rice and shrimp toast I have ever had.  The quail eggs are a must.  Our server Alexa and the rest of the staff were wonderful.  Highly recommend for food and staff.

Waited an hour and a half for delivery. When I called, they kept telling me it would take ten minutes. Then I would calle 30 minutes later and they told me the same thing. I don't know what it's like to eat here, but make sure you never order from them. Many other options in Williamsburg for good sushi.

I am so happy that this place opened because I live just a few blocks away form the restaurant. I walk by there everyday and I see the beautiful marquee sign. I've been wanted to try this place for a while, so finally we went in last weekend. My wife and I had an amazing dinner there. Place were nicely decorated and servers were very helpful. We chose Omakase for two. Start with hand made tofu, then Sashimi, Grilled fish, Grilled meat, Sushi and so on. Everything tasted amazing and very authentic. I am so glad that we don't have go in to the city to have this level of quality Japanese food. We will be back very soon!!!

Love this spot!! Great food- have never had anything I didn't like from the menu! The fried chicken is insane! Great drinks- watch out for the  Oolong hai! The staff is amazing- super friendly and efficient and the vibe is just right. Check it out for yourself!

Mellow lunch. Terrific service. Charming but not cloying atmosphere. Excellent unagi roll- the miso soup that came with it was good too. Haven't been here in the evening but I'm really impressed by the beauty and chill of this place - I work nearby and will make it a regular spot for sure.

i came back during opening week.  i expected service to be rocky, and it was.  all the food we ordered was good, but i felt it was really overpriced considering the portion size.  i'm talking like a regular mushroom skewer (nothing fancy like enoki) came out to over $1 per small, sliced piece.  the salt baked fish had excellent texture and flavor, but the portion wasn't even an FDA standard meat/fish portion (it was smaller than a size of playing cards).  i also wasn't in love with my small, pricy glass of sake.  one star off for the inflated price.  i'd definitely be a regular if they either lowered their prices slightly or made their portions bigger!

food was excellent, drinks are awesome and the atmosphere is exceptional.. the service was a little slow, took some time to get our drinks and food to be delivered and it wasn't very crowded, it is a Friday night but overall a positive experience.

I had never had a Swedish cinnamon bun before, and this was a great place to try them. Note that the cafe in the Church of Sweden is located in the basement and there are signs leading you there as well. The person running the cafe at the time was very kind and I could see baking trays full of freshly baked cinnamon buns right behind her (yum!!). The cinnamon buns were fresh and not too sweet and topped with a crunchy sugar topping. There is also coffee available!
No comment
No comment

Delightful experience; I was walking by and a friendly member welcomed me in and told me about the Christmas fair that was upstairs.  There was a good selection of Swedish food and crafts.  There's also a Swedish cafe, which I didn't visit (but will in the future).  People were fully bilingual, although they started by speaking Swedish to me (which I took as a compliment, as I am ethnically Swedish).  So nice to have a Christian-Swedish community here.

We had the opportunity to visit here for our friends wedding. The church is very cozy and conveniently located in mid-town. The service was great and the organ player was quite stellar! I was also quite impressed by the selection of treats at the Scandinavian store downstairs
No comment
No comment

I've visited the Grotto BK on several occasions and each time I've always been impressed with their food and service. My favorite dishes are the Escovitch Shrimp, Grotto Pasta with Shrimp, and  their Mac + Cheese is 10/10!
No comment
No comment

I enjoyed my visit to the grotto! My favorite dish was the starfish and bake. They do have bottomless mimosas here which will definitely sneak up on you! You can also purchase hookah here guys! The spot is small but once you go to the back there's more room.
No comment

If you're looking for great decor and even better drinks, look no further! Came in on a Wednesday for happy hour and enjoyed their fruit punch, 2 for 1 during happy hour!! We sat at the bar and were greeted by the owners daughter and then got a chance to chat with the owner as well.  Very down to earth family and service was great! Great set up with their DJ and hookah. The place gets packed very quickly so be sure to grab seats early, they have a variety of menu items as well! We'll be back for hookah!!

The food was okay. I've had better shrimp and grits, the mimosas will get you drunk but the service was REALLY SLOW. It took forever to get our mimosa refills and brunch is only 90 mins so we probably each got 1 refill. We spent $83 each for brunch and it was not worth it. It's $40 for the unlimited mimosas PLUS the price of your meal which is something that should be explained because we all assumed it was $40 per person plus tax & gratuity. Even getting our water pitcher refilled took forever. Getting cups took a long time too. I don't know if it'll be worth it to come back to this place again. There's only seating in their outside area, the inside area is strictly a bar so no tables there. Our server was MIA most of the time we were there,  yet when it was time to pay the bill she hovered over us like we would run out on her.
No comment
No comment

I had such a horrible experience there. The seating is located in an uninstalled extension of the outside. I wore my coat the entire time. Food took 2 hrs to come, plastic plates, no knives, Did I mention I was freezing, those outdoor heating lamps are not pushing out enough heat. No one has any hospitality training, however, the food was good but the overall experience would not allow me to recommend this place...
No comment

Food was amazing ! I had curry goat rice and peas with cabbage  . Also had the shrimp appetizers the Thai sweet chili shrimp and the escovitch shrimp that I would highly recommend! Service was great! I will definitely be coming back! Great experience!
No comment
The food was amazing. I had the Rasta pasta and oxtail delicious. They also have drinks at reasonable price and hookah. I tend to go out by myself and the vibe was just right nothing

Unassuming ... seemed so quiet. I was unsure if they was still open for the night. But i pushed pass my awkwardness  and headed to the back and the backyard was a vibe. The drinks are strong even though i don't see a full bar. The food was definitely made fresh to order and flavorful. I was craving oxtails. I had a decent serving for what i see places serve these days. I asked for my rice to side and ordered mac n cheese. Mac n cheese was good.  It was alot of rice and tasted really good. I'm not sure who created that meme that Jamaicans dont make good rice cause that's a damn lie. My sister got the jerk nachos which also came out fresh to order and tasted very good. I have been in the cut lately due to covida and glad i got to  experience a new spot

The wings &  mac & cheese was amazing but the service was TERRIBLE. Was going to order an actual entrée but the appetizers took so long that we didn't even want to order any more food from there. It isnt the servers fault since she was covering a bunch of tables but as the customer it isn't fair to pay an automatic 20% tip when the server was not attentive nor did she offer water or utensils for our table we had to keep requesting for something as simple as napkins. But they included tip automatically even tho it was just a party of 3. So yea might just order take out from here but never dining in. The ambiance was okay everyone was frustrated on how long the food was taking. A customer was saying how he waited over an hour for 5 wings :/
No comment
No comment

I went to Grotto with a few of my friends for brunch and I'll start by saying I left full and we all left drunk. My chicken and waffles was good and so was my boyfriend's French toast. Now on to the not so stellar things. 1. The shrimp and grits was literally soup 2. There is only outdoor seating, inside is only a bar no tables. 3. They advertise 90 minutes of bottomless mimosas for $40 on the brunch menu but fail to mention that the $40 does NOT include food. 4. The service was super slow. In the 90 minutes I only got two mimosa refills because the waitress kept disappearing. But when it was time for us to pay she made sure to HOVER over us. Also they serve Caribbean food but had American hot sauce (Tabasco) which I found strange. All and all I would not go back.

The food is absolutely AMAZING!!! The is the perfect spot close to home! Always great vibes and friendly staff! The Mac & cheese is my absolute favorite! Everything on the menu is excellent! Brunch on Sundays are a hit! Love here and it's walking distance

I love The Grotto BK!  Listen! It's like having your parents busting it down in the kitchen! The food better than  good, it is AMAZING! Authentic Jamaican food at it's best!  The staff is helpful and pleasant and make you feel at home.

Met up with my new friend here after work. First off the place is small there was only 2 tables in the front and they only seat 2 ppl per table. Next, they took forever and a day to come and take our order we sat at the table for at least 30 minutes before our order was taken. Nowwwww the wait for our food was longer than the wait for them to take our order and to make it worse they only brought out my friend food and I had to wait another 20 minutes to get mines. Lastly the drinks were pretty good  my we had the coconut Caribbean drink really good, I notice it was a popular drink because the little ppl they had in there had the drink. Moving on to the food my friend had Buffalo wings and fries she said it was good, I had Oxtails, white rice, cabbage and sweet plantains the oxtails was pretty tuff  they didn't fall off the bone I had to fight to get the meat off the bone however the gravy and everything else was good they even give you gravy on the side for your rice. And, lastly the music was good...
Tomatoes, Tomatoes... waited over an hour for food that never came. When I finally asked the waiter how much longer do we have to wait for our food, they said they're getting started on it now.
No comment

Very unique  relaxed outdoor dining on the Hudson. Really great atmosphere for summer outdoor dining. Limited menu, counter service, seemed a bit odd but worked out great. Views were fabulous. Casual atmosphere ,  burgers, fries, salads, even softshell crab on the menu. Some craft cocktails and craft beers on the drink menu, at reasonable prices. Great for outdoor dining, A very nice find on the water.

Pier 66 is still one NYC's unsung heroes for summertime outdoor dining. Located near Chelsea piers on the Hudson River, the biggest challenge may be location (it's tough to park and it's a far walk from the subways).  Different times of day (and year) determine the crowd; I prefer it for an sunny afternoon lunch. The food and drinks are solid, expectations in check, so if you expect pub/bar type menu with a few dishes a notch up, you'll be fine.  This is also a cool place to book a warm weather private party.

Great place to come and enjoy the gorgeous view! The evening that we went, it was kinda windy but we enjoyed it nonetheless. Food was alright and drinks were also alright. Honestly you come here to dine with a view. Also service was very attentive and I loved the bathroom!! Anyways I'd definitely come back!
No comment
No comment

We were here on a Friday. The view from here is great. Spent about 3-4 hours here. We ordered burgers and fries. It took about less than 15 minutes to get our food which was great considering how busy the place was. The drink here is expensive and wish they had more choices.
No comment
Hostess in the front outside at the pier (young, blond) is very unprofessional and not friendly at all. If you don't want to work, just quit? Instead of scaring customers away

Expensive food and drink on pier 66 Maritime but it is a nice place to sit and enjoy drinking and get drunk with your friends. I went to the place during the week that is why i have a chance to get in even that if i go on the weekend I cannot.

Cool place to grab an afternoon beer and feel like you're on a boat. Basic bar food with a seafood flare. Nice beer selection too. One of the only places I know in New York you can drink on the water.
No comment
No comment

Disappointing from the beginning. We arrived with a party of 6 and we were not let in as only one of our friends was underage (20 y/o). The bouncer (large man with weird ponytail) was extremely rude and completely ignored us. We were not even planning on having drinks, we just wanted lunch. If you even have one person underage to do not bother coming here. This place doesn't care about its customers, and it just lost a few more.

Stumbled upon this place looking for a place to have brunch. I ordered the mahi tacos and fried chicken sandwich. Both were very disappointing, the chicken didn't seem to be seasoned much at all and the mahi itself didn't have much taste. It almost tasted like tuna. The atmosphere was fun though, if you're looking for a fun social brunch and are willing to sacrifice the quality of the food, this is a good place to go. Keep in mind it is on a boat, and this may depend on the day, but it was moving a lot when I was there. Maybe that could save you money on drinks, which aren't cheap, but the beer is about what you'd expect ($9 for about a 12oz pour)
No comment

I enjoyed this place a lot! It was fun! Bar and restaurant are on the liver and ship. Food is just normal American, but that's fine. This place is best for summer and movie night at the next park :) enjoy your beautiful view and hung out with friends, lover!

Great place for the summer, with a lot of outdoor space, awesome views, and a good selection of drinks and food. It's overpriced, which might be the reason why it was always quite empty every time I went there.

We ordered fish and chips, crab cake salad, and mussels. Fish-and-chips was so good. The french fries were covered with cajun seasoning and they went so well with perfectly crispy fried fish. The portion was largest out of all the dishes we ordered and well worth the price.  For crab cake salad, the salad was not enough even for one person so we will not order them again if we come back but the crab cake was delicious. Mussels were also very good. The boat shifts a little so I felt like getting seasick at first, but I was fine and we enjoyed our food on the second floor watching beautiful sunset!
The venue is great,  food is decent.  I recommend it more of a spot for drinks rather that food.  Food can be a little bit pricey for the quantity you get.  But I overall recommend this place.
No comment

What happened to this place? I used to like it. Our food was simply godawful as was the noise and occasional whiff of an exhaust stink. Even the hamburger tasted like mush--inedible. How can you ruin a hamburger? Fish and Chips were rubber. My daughter couldn't get past two bites. Everything way oversalted and overflavored. Just a miserable experience. Big loss.
I love this place for its awsm view of whole city...enjoy the food alot over here. Service is too good. Must go place especially in fall at evening tym...cheers

I swiped my card to pay for a couple of drinks here. I checked my bank account after leaving NYC and found that the exact same amount was charged at another bar at the same time. Are they sending my credit card info to two places? Scam - not safe.

Great spot on the water with amazing views if you can get a table or seat near the water. We went about 6:30pm on a weekday and it was packed. After walking around we waited and got a table by the water edge. Good food. Food must be picked up at the counter. Drinks were good too. The price was good with all we had. Would go back again!

Came here on a Saturday, but they appearantly close the kitchen sort of early so we just got drinks and appetizers. The food tasted okay but was very expensive. Everything is also self-service. The bartender was nice but the drinks could have used with less ice. The view is the only thing really worth stopping in for.
No comment

The people who work here are the WORST! The bouncers are jerks and aren't trained to handle the crowds this place attracts, so as a result they end up pushing and shoving customers. Last time I was there someone I was with was pushed down the steps by a bouncer who was freaking out about too many people being in the upstairs area. I've had my entire purse dumped out for no reason by security at the front and the bartenders are so rude, they act like they're working at a 5 star restaurant and freak out if you don't move fast enough or leave a huge tip. The view is great and it's a fun place to go in the summer, but I've stopped going back because the people who work there are so awful. I've never eaten here, but I know a bunch of people who have gotten food poisoning from the seafood.
No comment

I give one start because of the cold fried chicken. Not acceptable I didn't complain directly to the kitchen because  in general when you do that they throw the food so please learn how to do fried chicken

The greatest things in life and those that are unexpected.  While tagging along with some friends to stranger's birthday party at Pier 66, I discovered something I think I would have never found on my own, a pier/bar/restaurant in one.  There appear to be a couple of docked ships here (one of which is the Frying Pan) where people can dine as well as a Bar + Grill area that serves way more than just bar food.  My friend and I were starving when we arrived and were pleasantly surprised to find such an extensive selection.  We both ordered the crab cake, which was delicious and spicy, although the avocado on my plate was incredibly under-ripe, I will forgive them this one time, as my friend's was not and she shared some of her avocado with me.  It was plated beautifully, not at all what I'd expect from a "bar." There was music and pitchers of beer and a pretty awesome view.  They're open all day long (not just nights) so you can enjoy lunch out on the pier if you'd like, and only during the warmer seasons, but I'm so glad that I found this place as I'll be sure to return another time.
No comment
No comment
Food BBQ ribs were raw and very bland. soda from the machine no carbonation taste just like syrup. fried Calamari was very dry and over battered
No comment
No comment

Went on a beautiful afternoon. There was plenty of seating and the atmosphere was light. The food was mediocre and the drinks were alright. Lots of room, and a decent place to hang out by the water. The staff was courteous, but be aware that since the establishment is on the water that getting seasick or wet during high tide is a possibility.
Conveniently located if you are on the Hudson River Greenway. Really nice views from the top deck. Mediocre food and service.

The manager: Brent wouldn't let our out of town siblings come sit with us while we ate dinner! Even though they were underage this place doesn't accept any underage people... such a shame! Will not be back and highly don't recommend for a good time! Wish they could have accommodated us by letting the underage have "X's" on their hands to identify as underage.
No comment
No comment

Very cool atmosphere! I came here on a Saturday right as the clock hit noon and it was not busy - within 30 mins the place was packed, so let that be a tip! Get a seat right by the water and enjoy yourself. Good food, but overpriced as expected. I loved the hummus and crab cake was really tasty. My friends had the burger and lemon chicken sandwich (both decent).
No comment
No comment

Great river view..on the river experience.  We were just there for a drink on a hot afternoon, purchased the beer at the bar and seated ourselves by the water.  It is breezy, but it felt great.  Lovely peaceful place and a nice change from the tall buildings of the city.

Whatever you do dont ride your bike to this place.  Especially if its a fairly nice one.  My wife and I road our bikes, locked them right  in front of the 2-3 staff people that great you when you enter the dock.  We returned about 25 minutes later after eating a mediocre veggie burger and my bike lock had been cut with bolt cutters and stolen.  It's a bridge and tunnel money making machine.  If your a real NYer you will most likely not enjoy this gimmick.
No comment

Took my mom to ny for a late Mother's day gift. Once she got up the courage to walk across the mini bridge to the restaurant we were greeted by a very sweet lady named Tara. It was our first time so we ot a bit mixed up and went straight to the bar. As we passed another sweet lady, Stacey greeted us with a great smile and comforted my mother in being on the pier, since it was hard enough to get her there! All was well until we approached the bar. The day was so lovely so I couldn't understand what the "sour lemon" face she was making. I asked her for a menu and she points upward and keeps doing what she was doing. No "hello how are you what can I get you". Then I ask if I can take it dpwn because I couldn't see it. She spat out something about company policy and kept standing there like we would get the menu thru osmosis and hurry up and order and quit wasting her precious time. Then she unravels a ball of paper and hands it to us. Suprise, a menu. We thanked her kindly and her response to our thank you was silence. I said thank you again...silence again. Then she stood there waiting once more. As my mom begin to order and ask questions she rolled her eyes and looked down for the rest of the order...pursing her lips as though taking our order was the equivalent of being forced to clean a restroom. Beautiful restaurant. We were hot, starving, tired and just trying to enjoy the breeze; however an attitude plastered on the face of some bar chic quickly soured the mood and though we cpuld have stayed, there is PLENTY more food in new york city. Pier 66 Maritime ought to have a few more staceys and taras cause im not sure where that young lady came from. Still starving..but folks should know none pf us are obligated to it with your restaurant. ...fix your face and serve if thats what you signed up for....and I promise, we tip pretty damn well ;-)

We finished biking along the Hudson River Greenway bike path today and wanted to get something to eat. My daughter wanted a place by the water so we came across Pier 66 Maritime on Yelp. What a great discover for us it was! Casual atmosphere with a beautiful view of the Hudson River and the NJ skyline. you can catch a great view of the sunset here. Very romantic. However Please note this is a place where you order and pickup your food at the counter and find you own table type of restaurant. No waiter services. Also food is served on plastic plate and utensils(I would have give it a five stàr if they provide real plates and utensils). It was prefect for my family to relax and watch the sunset after a day of biking.
Had the burger and fries which was very good.  Reasonably priced and a good spot right on the Hudson.  Good place to go with groups but usually packed.
No comment

This place is a lot of fun in the summer, but if you go when it's crowded, the lines are crazy. The main bar is reasonable, but the mixed drink/frozen drink bar has some of the worst bartenders in the city, and I think I waited around 40 minutes or more for some overpriced daquiris. Also, when we asked a waitress if she could ask some people to stop smoking, she gave us an attitude about it (even though it's illegal). The best thing about this place? The view is fantastic and it's pleasant to sit in the sun even when it's hot, since there's a breeze. It's best when it's not incredibly crowded.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I had heard great things about Aurora and it's possible I just ordered the wrong thing, but I found the squid ink pasta with shrimp to be relatively flavorless. I had quite high expectations and the rest of my party enjoyed their pasta dishes, so they may have been having an off night. I started with an espresso martini which was perfectly shaken, foamy, and delicious. Portion size could have been slightly bigger but the pasta is very filling. The interior and garden are gorgeous and are a great backdrop for a date night or upscale night with friends, and the prices align with the area. I'd be open to coming back and trying something else, but don't get the squid ink pasta!
No comment

Absolutely love going here. The ambiance is so romantic; whether is be on a date or with friends. Service is always catering you and makes sure you're being taken care of. And the FOOD is so tasty and changes often so I like that when I come back every now and then that there's always something new
No comment

Aurora is super cozy, warm, has dim lights, the perfect romantic setting. I made a reservation with my family and friends, they seated us right away once we had the entire party ready. I ordered the ravioli which is a popular dish there and it was the best ravioli I've had, the cheese, mushroom, and sauce made the dish even better. Our server Juan was so kind, polite, and patient with us. I don't drink alcohol and I asked him if they had mocktails but they didn't and he still suggested a pretty good alternative. I had some of the octopus appetizer as well and I highly recommend it. I'm not a seafood type of girl but it has an amazing taste.

We sat on their gorgeous terrace. The focaccia that was served first was absolutely unreal - it had the perfect amount of crunch. The pasta was fresh & delicious. Fingerling potatoes were cooked to perfection. Overall a 10/10 and I will definitely be coming back here

This place is a hidden gem. I loved that they served what I believe to be authentic Italian cuisine. I came with a group of friends. We decided to do family style by ordering different things and trying it out. We ordered the arancini, shishito peppers, calamari, and the kale salad. For dinner, I had the steak (medium) which was delicious. I cleaned my plate! Our waiter was also attentive and suggestive. I love when they know the menu. I can't wait to go back because everything was great.
No comment

We had a lovely dinner here while celebrating a friend's birthday. We had a reservation and it was actually quite busy for a Tuesday evening. The restaurant itself is beautiful, lots of character, intimate atmosphere - the patio in particular is very pretty. We shared some appetizers and each ordered an entree. I love that they constantly change the menu and specials. They do a great job highlighting seasonal produce. We enjoyed all of the food and the cocktails as well. The pasta itself, which is made in-house, was delicious. I would certainly recommend this place!

First time visiting after walking around Williamsburg neighborhood with Jordan (pictured). Off the bat, the service was great. I decided to start the order with dessert and the waitress was excited to help me choose and provided their dessert menu. I ordered a tiramisu ($9) and Meyer Lemon + ricotta cake ($10) because I couldn't decide between both. Safe to say they were DELICIOUS. Jordan ordered Prosciutto di Parma ($21) to share, honestly it was pretty good. Left feeling light and satisfied, will definitely come back.

I visited this restaurant for a birthday celebration, and it was the perfect choice. The food was exceptional, and the staff went above and beyond to make our night special. The drinks were also expertly crafted, and the atmosphere was lively and fun. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for any celebratory occasion.
No comment
No comment

First time at Aurora. I ordered the spinach omelette which was delicious. Our server Roberta was so sweet, charismatic, and attentive. We sat outside, which was a beautiful green house type of ambiance that I appreciated. It was a little warm (they had the heaters on high), so I recommend layering up. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Aurora.
The bone marrow appetizer was delish! I loved the combo of mushrooms with greens! The ambiance was inviting yet cozy!! Service was quick!! Absolutely loved the pasta I had!!

Absolutely everything was super delicious! For apps we had octopus, calamari and the squash (?) salad - so delicious! For dinner we had the steak for two which came with two sides and the smashed potatoes were mega Yumm! Drinks are strong and yummy too. All the staff were very kind- Def will be back!
No comment

The entrees here are all absolutely delicious! Cannot recommended the pasta enough. Absolutely cleaned my plate. Drinks were fine, but pricey, appetizer was good. I have to say I was very disappointed with the dessert. Interior is very pretty and I cannot wait to see their outside terrace/patio area in the summer. A good spot for a delicious and upscale feeling meal (while not totally breaking the bank).
No comment

Super cute with a good, relaxed atmosphere. The service is actually pretty quick once you order things but the staff lets you go at your own pace without rushing you. The food is good, I'd definitely recommend the pastas. I think the lemon ricotta cake could've used a bit more flavor but I was still happy with it. And the drinks are good for the price point.
No comment

i was wildly underwhelmed with this establishment with both the aesthetic and the food. It seems most people come for the outdoor seating which looking great as you walk by but when you actually are seated, it falls short of the charm it seemingly eluded. but the food.. lackluster and bland.

My friend recommended Aurora and I'm glad she did! Very pretty indoor and outdoor spaces. We sat in the outdoor dining structure which was cozy. They have an extensive wine list and I was happy to see they had (very reasonably priced) Soave so we shared a bottle of that. I ordered the squid ink paccheri that came with toasted breadcrumbs, tomatoes, shrimp, and most importantly sea urchin. I could eat this dish over and over again, it was so incredibly good! The seafood in the dish tasted super fresh and the flavors meshed so well together. My friend ordered the ravioli with burata and eggplant which she also enjoyed. Highly recommend!

No comment

Located in Williamsburg, aurora is a nice Italian restaurant with amble outdoor area and a little indoor area. I sat outdoors on a summer night with a group of friends. We got the Croquettes, Fried Calamari, pork chops and spinach tagliatelle. The pork chops were probably the best thing we had to eat. It was very tender and juicy and well seasoned. The tagliatelle was good but could have been a meatier portion. The appetizers were also really good. Would return for the pork chops for sure!!! Also had the Grand St. drink which was really good. Great for groups. Good outdoor area.
No comment
I came here for dinner for NYE night. Great food. The pasta good and the Bread pudding delicious. Really liked the fried Calamari. Will be back to try their brunch.
I LOVE the Croquettes and the restaurant's patio area is beautiful. The service was great and when trying all the dishes, I see the similarities between here and Evelina.

Father's Day brunch with my family. Beautiful day to sit in their patio. The brunch menu was just what we needed. The service was good if not a bit slow but I chalk that up to a holiday Sunday.
We had the greatest dinner and Levi was an exceptional server!    We will definitely be back for brunch!   ‍‍

column3: East Side of Stamford, Stamford, CT
column6: Go to aurora and ask for Levi! He's the best. The cacio Pepe is amazing. We'll be back for brunch

Aurora is one of the best restaurants in Williamsburg! This was my third time dining there and they have consistently shown their great quality of service and food. We had a reservation and were seated right away in their beautiful outdoor garden area. Our drinks came out quickly and were good portions. We ordered the croquettes with risotto and grilled artichokes to start which were delicious. Our favorite dish, the tonnarelli cacio e Pepe was amazing! We also ordered the ravioli with spinach, ricotta, and mushrooms which was great as well. One of our friends who is originally from Italy was blown away with the food. For that reason alone, it is clear the Italian food here is authentic and a must try restaurant!
No comment

5+ stars... Our server Juan José was nothing less than amazing and his attention to detail in accommodating our group for Jane's graduation made all the difference. The food is beyond delicious - literally everything was so good - with great great staff and service, and the out of this world food we will definitely be back. Aurora is a MUST try!!
Not only amazing food and drinks but the atmosphere and vibes are unmatched! Perfect for a date night or special occasion!
No comment

This place is jam packed on a weekend so make reservations if you're planning to dine here. I came for lunch and had a wonderful meal. The food is fresh, tasty, plated beautifully and well thought out. The employees were very sweet to our dog as we enjoyed the lovely outdoor seating. My best friend frequents the place and raves about it constantly. I've only been once but the food was delicious.

Great Italian restaurant with homemade pasta. The menu was very pecorino heavy but staff was super accommodating in replacing it if you don't like sheep cheeses. I had the burrata ravioli which was a really hefty portion! Restaurant is really cute and outdoor area is really nice!

Excellent food, nice ambiance, good service. Try the paccheri with squid ink, tomato sugo, lump blue crab, wild shrimp, chili, and rustic breadcrumb; or the Creekstone Farms NY Strip steak, with crispy potatoes, broccoli rabe, and hazelnut romesco. Accompany them with a glass of Pecorino Terre di Chieti. End your dinner with some Barolo Chinato or Amaro Averna. So why not give it five stars? The food came out suspiciously quickly, almost as if it had been waiting there partially cooked. But perhaps I'm just paranoid.
No comment

Amazing food and the atmosphere is great. The staff was very attentive and the experience was seamless. We ordered calamari and the several pastas and they were all delish, al dente, and seasoned well. Would recommend this restaurant to anyone
No comment

I have eaten here on two different occasions with the most recent being 7/17/2022. My girlfriend and I decided to revisit this place after we had come two years ago for my birthday since we didn't get to try the pasta. We sat in their garden area towards the back right of the restaurant. I will say, the pasta did not disappoint. However, the reason for my 1-star review was the rats that were running around behind us. I didn't get through all my pasta when I noticed them and from that moment I couldn't eat anymore. Some other guests there also noticed the rats and one of them even went up to the area where they were to try to get a better look. When I called our waiter over and discreetly mentioned the issue, he nonchalantly told us "Well, this is Brooklyn. There is nothing I can do about it". He then asked if we wanted to move inside instead of apologizing about it first. At that point, we just wanted to get out of there so we requested the check. For them to give us a response like that knowing that is a clear health violation that can get the business shut down is unacceptable. It doesn't matter what borough you are in. A visual sign of rats is a clear indication of what is happening inside the restaurant and if it has a chance to affect my food? No thank you!

Amazing spot in Williamsburg. Visiting from out of town and a friend brought me here. We had reservations. We shared (3 of us) the kale salad, calamari and prosciutto with burrata cheese. Then we each ordered a different pasta. The portions were perfect size. We also ordered the Domino cocktail which has watermelon. Great food.

Food is beyond delicious and servers/bussers are nice and attentive -but I've gone there a couple of times with reservations and the weekend host tries to sit you outside as if you're a walk-in. It's rude- ask if the reservation would like to- don't just assume it's ok to bring them to sidewalk seating when they went out of their way to reserve a table.

Can't recommend it at all. Indoor dining went way over the allowed 50% capacity, not to mention the outdoor space which was super crowded. The tables were ridiculously small and it was impossible to sit there comfortably. The music was super loud, we couldn't keep up a conversation as we couldn't hear each other. Out waiter was absolutely terrible: he spilled my cocktail all over the place, to the floor and onto the table then spilled the fries as well to my husbands lap an on the floor--it hasn't even crossed his mind to replace the fries with a new one given that the 1/3 of it ended on the floor. The food is mediocre, the burger patty was chewy. The cocktail was awful: it should've been a mix of different drinks (hence the name and according to what was on the menu) but I only could taste the very strong, cheap booze. A waste of money, not a pleasant memory whatsoever.

I came here with my friend for dinner as we were in the area and I had heard really good things about it. We were able to snag a table outside (even though it was on the colder side), it was pretty warm in the sidewalk setup. We both ordered the Cacio E Pepe and it was delicious! The service was pretty good, though we did have to wait a while to get our check. The ambiance was really nice and it would be perfect for a date or catching up with a friend. Would definitely come back here again!
No comment

This place was top notch from start to finish! Exceptional food, atmosphere and service. We split the croquettes that were filled with risotto, mozzarella, tomato and basil. This was probably are least favorite thing that we ordered but still good. My sister had the risotto with aged ricotta, mushrooms, spring garlic and stracciatella. This dish was so creamy, rich and extraordinarily delicious. It was like a warm hug in your belly. I had the ravioli with cherry tomatoes, eggplant confit, basil and aged ricotta. The sauce was fairly light but very flavorful and also very tasty. We did things a little backwards but had another appetizer for our dessert. The sourdough, whipped ricotta, roasted mushrooms, lemon curd and oregano hit the spot and finished it off. Our waiter was attentive and friendly and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. We sat in the terrace which was pretty. I highly recommend this restaurant....definitely worth it!

Aurora is a nice little new school Italian restaurant. It restored my faith in Italian food after the horrible debacle at Il Cortile in Little Italy. Let me tell you, nothing compares to fresh pasta, fresh bread, & great cocktails. My only complaint is service: Our waitress took our order and left the job site. If it were not for the bussers, we would've been completely forgotten.

Nice place with a cute atmosphere. Staff is great and let's you relax without pressure to finish fast which is nice. Food was well cooked and had a ton of flavor and the pasta was portioned perfectly. They have a big wine selection and the waiter was knowledgeable and able to help pick up the perfect match. Lots of daily specials that are to die for! Good place for a special occasion dinner or just a classy night! Pretty much all of the dishes can be made gluten free and they also offer gluten free pasta, staff is knowledgeable about cross contamination and it's safe for celiac people.

I'll give this Evelina (right) a 5 stars. You almost can't notice the second drink due to the pure radiance of the Eve. Although the rosemary was in my nosemary when sipping, it was worth it. Will return.
No comment

Their patio and indoor area is very pretty but unfortunately most of the times they won't accommodate walk-ins except for their sidewalk tables, and usually with a long waiting time. I've tried to come 3 times and only have been able to eat here once. We tried the ink calamari croquettes they were crispy outside and creamy inside. The kale salad was also good as a side dish. The grilled octopus has a good flavor but texture is hard and dry, the portion is a tentacle (regular portion of most restaurants) but cut in HALF. they only serve one half...so no, I wouldn't recommend ordering that. Order a drink instead they are good.
No comment

The staff are so nice, I can't remember the name of the dish I had but it savory with a little kick of sour very flavorful! And I pair this dish up with white wine suggested by staff so amazing! If you liked Italian cuisine I think you'd better try this! Amazing deco and very good service mind!

I forgot to book a table at Lilia, so I booked Aurora instead. I'm not sorry that I did. Aurora is a tiny restaurant on Grand Street that serves amazing food. There is a lot of outdoor seating, so don't hesitate to book. The menu is very small, but very well executed. Our Octopus was fabulous, as was our Tuna Tartare. We ordered Striped Bass as our Main course and it was fabulous. I'm cancelling our reservations at Roberta's tomorrow and coming back.

Stunning brunch setting on their beautiful patio. Super rustic decor made even more beautiful with Ivy covered walls. The service is impeccable and the food absolutely delicious! My family thoroughly enjoyed decadent plates like Eggs Benedict, Carbonara, and Brioche French Toast. I absolutely devoured the Cacio e Pepe made with Gluten Free pasta. All this and drinks to top it all off!
No comment

Tiny spot with exceptional pasta. Arancini were perfect. Had the strangozzi with porcini and sausage and tasted the pappardelle Bolognese. Oooofa tastes like Italia on vacation! Homemade pasta and super fresh, delicate and delicious ingredients create an exceptional and relaxed dining experience. Service is on point. Aurora is a must try!
The food here is simply wonderful.  Ingredient driven. Well done.  Nice setting.  I highly recommend

Super cute and warmly decorated place. Appetizers were ok - not great. Creative pasta dishes - menu appeared a bit slim but ultimately enough choices for all of us. The pasta dishes were great. Service was good.
Great food and environment. Price is a bit high but similar to other restaurants in the area.
This is a great spot. The atmosphere is great. The outdoor seating is always a plus during summer days. This is place is have a nice dinner, even brunch. Food is good and Wine always recommend.
Food was so good!!! Atmosphere was amazing, service was excellent! (Thanks Elliot!) I definitely recommend this place and it was also recommended to me by friends who live in the area! Love

Amazing Italian food and amazing hospitality. The staff here are incredible, the food does not disappoint. Highly recommend the octopus appetizer and the prosciutto and burrata are to die for. They also have this special focaccia with fresh herbs I believe was rosemary baked into it that is so good. Got the pappardelle and squid ink pasta. Both fantastic. All of the deserts were incredible, the pistachio ice cream was out of this world. Cocktails and wine selection was also amazing. The entire staff were friendly, service was super quick, staff wore masks all around excellent experience. Evr is incredibly kind and gives excellent recommendations.
No comment

I've had this place bookmarked for so long. Finally got to come with family and I have to say... overrated! Nothing special and overpriced. The ambiance and decor was super cute. But that's about it. I really wanted to like it. Just bland.
No comment
Great ambiance! The pistachio dessert was great and the pastas are fresh and delicious. Great place for a wonderful dinner!

Aurora is a neighborhood staple! Always and forever will be ordering the rice balls and black squid pasta with lump crab. Then do yourself a favor and try a special bc I've had plenty and they're always delicious! Staff is familiar and nice for the most part, although not incredibly accommodating (one time didn't seat my party during a snow storm b/c it was 15 min before their opening time). Other than that really nice place to enjoy an authentic meal.
No comment
No comment

Foods were ok, very noisy and crowded. I reserve them on open table but they checked me as no show so now my open table account is deactivate ugh.  Tried to call them multiple times but directed to reservation. Nothing special about the food just ok.
No comment

Stopped by for Saturday brunch and was able to be seated outside immediately without a reservation. Tons of outdoor seating, including a beautiful patio! Highly recommend the crab & avocado eggs benedict; it seems pricey ($20) but it's LOADED with lump crab and is definitely worth it. The toasted filone with ricotta and mushrooms ($16) was also delicious, but the crab eggs benny was still the star. The drinks were a little weak for the price ($12 mimosa and $14 cocktail), but tasty.

I've ordered from Aurora multiple times, & the food has always been amazing. However, I ordered the branzino on Monday night, & woke up with a bout of food poisoning at 2 am. To be clear, I have no food allergies, nor did the branzino seem off in any kind of way. I suspect whomever seasoned the branzino didn't wash their hands properly before handling it. It sucks, b/c it was honestly delicious, but I can't trust a restaurant that doesn't adhere to strict cleanliness guidelines.

Everything we got here was delicious. Good outdoor environment and great vibes all around. Got the rice balls, chicken sandwich, and meat tomato pasta dish - all delicious. One of the best dining experiences I've had in a while (:

Had a great dinner at Aurora. I had one of the pasta dishes, tuna tartare and chocolate cake for dessert. The service was great and very friendly. The ambiance was also great. Would definitely recommend for a nice dinner if you're in the area!
No comment

Cute restaurant perfect for date night or brunch! So in order to access their outdoor dining area, the restaurant has you check in with the hostess inside and then they bring you outside. The restaurant should just have the hostess outside. Extremely convoluted system. We started off with the octopus which I didn't love. My fiancé loved it. They left this chewy skin like part on it. I had the peach summer salad which was really good minus the mint & my fiancé had the burger with  fries!! The fries are the reason to go plus the cute outdoor dining. The staff is super nice and they have the mobile hand held devices for you to pay so it's easy. Def must check out.

Amazing eggs benedict! The service is great. The outdoor seating in the back is so cute!

Wonderful place. Lamb Lollipops were amazing. Staff is great and friendly. The chocolate martini is strong.

We came on a Saturday without a reservation and we were seated immediately outside! The exterior is so pretty and the outdoor seating situation is beautiful!! The cocktails were delicious and we ordered the French toast and eggs Benedict. Both were phenomenal, the French toast bread was Devine and sooooo fluffy and the berries were so fresh!! Def want to come back and try their dinner menu and would come back for brunch!!

Food was excellent!!!! Home made pasta with the right amount of sauce and lamb. The fried calamari was fried to perfection and fresh!! The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars was because the service was horrible and I'm being generous but only taking one star away. They have indoor and outdoor seating, best to make a reservation.

I enjoyed eating at Aurora. I had the Croquettes, squid ink risotto, lemon, fior di latte mozzarella and  I was pleasantly surprised. It was a delicious appetizer that was filling and the outdoor ambiance was nice as well. The food had fresh ingredients imported from Italy! My friend had the octopus from the brunch menu and enjoyed her meal as well.

Sat in the garden on a weeknight with a group of five and had a great dinner. Standout dishes were the delicate squash, ravioli and Tonnarelli Cacio & pepe. Also enjoyed the burrata and prosciutto, Montauk diver scallops, roasted sunchokes and mushrooms. Only thing I didn't love was the broccoli rabe (it's not my favorite anyway). Overall a great spot!

So good! Everything I have had here has been amazing. Patio is super cute. My daughter declared the burger the best she's ever had, and that's a high honor haha!

So we did not have a reservation but fortunately we were still able to get a table. My first impression of the place is that they have beautiful greenery but once I interacted with the host he was very snippy and I guess he had his friends at a table because I saw him go over there to sneak a sip to drink a few times. Anyway we were seated on the side walk which was still fine but it took the waitress awhile just to bring water to us and also to even bring the mixed drinks we ordered over. The drinks we had were nothing to rave about. We ordered the croquettes to start and they were delicious but the fried calamari we ordered was dry and oily. For dinner I ordered the ravioli and it was actually pretty decent, we also got skirt steak and it was good but the quantity of the dish was lacking. There was a few slices of steak on a plate but not much to eat. Overall I'm giving this place a 2 star because the hospitality was lacking, waitress was lacking, and food was just ok. At this price point the standards should be higher. A little disappointed but maybe next time my experience will be better.

Came here for brunch with some friends. Very few choices, not many things on their menu. I really liked the ambience, the garden, but I didn't like our waitress. She didn't have any patience and didn't know much about the menu. Also a bit too pricy.
The croquette was amazing and the scallops were on point. Made for an epic Valentine's Day with my special girl!

Looks great , food was a 2. Baby artichokes tasted like nothing and the pasta was so salty it was almost inedible.

A solid Italian joint. Nothing over the top and everything was very good. Service timely, wine list well curated a d reasonable as we're the prices. Had the Tagliatelle with Bolognese. Very good but not any better than what a good home cook would render and honestly, that was a little disappointing. Lacked the depth that I was hoping from from a sauce I don't typically make because of the 4 hours of cooking time.

Went on a busy Saturday night with reservations of course, food was amazing. It was a cold night but they had heaters all around. Great night. Great wine. Happy fat girl

We were there for brunch about a month ago. Thank you Martha for a woundetfull service. The food was amazing too.

We came here for dinner after having drinks at Westlight. The service staff was very attentive and friendly. The food was delicious. The burrata and octopus were amazing. My wife had the branzino (European Bass) and she loved it. The Tonnarelli Cacio E Pepe pasta was delicious and the sauce not overpowering. We enjoyed it and would definitely come back again.
No comment

The food is delicious! However the service is TERRIBLEEEE! We got there at 7:00 as a walk in. They offered us a table inside their garden patio but only if we were done by 8:30 becauSe they had a reservation for that time. We agreed. Although the curbside tables were not bad. My husband says if we would of ate at one of the curbside tables we would of probably had a better experience with a better waiter. We didn't see a waiter until 7:30 .. we sat there for 30 min with no water and no bread (and we're suppose to be done by 8:30) waiter comes... he was very stand off-ish and rude. We ordered the aged steak from the specialty menu ($98) it was amazing. We also ordered the skirt steak and the mushroom truffle parppadelle pasta. Everything was delicious. Also the burrata and prosciutto with rosemary flatbread was so good.We pretty much ate ordered dessert and was handed bill. We spent $350 in an hour and rushed out. Again, the food was delicious. But the service was not. Especially the guy they have as the hostess. He is so arrogant. He answers the phone so rudely.

Wonderful cocktails (loved the Evalina), wonderful food, friendly and helpful waitstaff.  They were also very accommodating when we asked for an indoor table to avoid the drizzle outside.  And by the way the outdoor patio is really nice!
No comment
No comment

My favorite Fried Calamari, food was amazing !!!Highly recommended!!! Definitely will go back there, service was little bit late but they understand and offer free desert, nice atmosphere!!! we got steak and Ravioli delicious

It's always a damn good time going to Aurora! Their menu was a little different than usual but that's ok because we are talking grade A delicious heavenly food, Jesus himself would take a bite look you in the eye and say "hey, who's hungry?" But i digress lets get to the food!! So i had the crab and avocado eggs Benedict the egg was so perfectly cooked that the yolk popped and ran down the plate like a beautiful waterfall. The crab was seasoned and tasted so succulent the greens were so complimented on the dish that it was as perfectly paired as a pb+j sandwich. My boy Sebastian had the short rib burger, looking at the juices flow on that bad boy i said I'll risk it all, Covid? Bring it! I bit in to that bad boy and fell in to a delicious sea of tenderness and perfect seasoning, it was as awesome as encountering your first burger, Revolutionary. The salmon eggs Benedict were also so delicious, the smoked capers placed on top were so crunchy and the tomato complimented the salmon perfectly! Aurora is definitely top 5 for me in food places i enjoy going too. If you're ever there for dinner try their Bronzino

The service was great, food was truly lackluster for the amount of people there I'm kind of confused if people just come here for the beautiful atmosphere? The calamari was like C+, the lemon aioli it comes with could have been creamier and less like just a whipped lemon, I don't know this place is kind of interesting, I hope no one thinks this is like quality/authentic Italian food.
No comment
No comment

I love this restaurant! The food is always fresh and delicious. The octopus is grilled perfectly and so well balanced. The lamb special OMG I'm so sad they don't have it daily because it's so good. The steak entree is also really good and the pork chop is grilled nicely but I still prefer the lamb over both. The spicy lamb meatballs are a must try and the burrata was a nice appetizer to start with. The grand st is my favorite cocktail, it's a mezcal, which I normally don't like but love this cocktail. The other cocktail is an old fashion which surprisingly my bf didn't like but overall aurora is a 5/5 for me!

Nice garden patio with good ambiance. Eggs Benedict were good, mezcal cocktail fantastic. But the staff is terrible. The host lectured us about having called ahead to tell them we'd be ten minutes late. The waiter then repeated this lecture and made the whole atmosphere very uncomfortable. He was some joyless, put-upon dude who detracted rather than added to the experience. Tried to rush us out so we hung around and chatted for another 20 mins on principle. Wouldn't go back
No comment

Great brunch spot! Their portion sizes are awesome and their covered patio was a pleasant surprise to our brunch. Service was very quick, but we didn't feel pushed or rushed: the food just came out super fast. Come here!

I been here precovid and during and it's still delicious. They have an outdoor area and there are heat lamps for chiller days. Food is delicious. I have had their bolognese and cacio e Pepe. Both so good and fresh ugh it's like I want to have more more. Service is good and i have always been seated right away but it seems to be busy.
Great food and great service. Felt very comfortable sitting outside for lunch during covid. The cacio e pepe was great.

Very average food I thought. I got the tuscan kale salad, croquettes and ravioli. Very light tastes. Not too much seasoning. Love the atmosphere. Service was meh/not very friendly or attentive. I would maybe come back?
No comment

Beautiful outdoor space. The food was extremely tasty and unique as well. We got something that looked like risotto (?) balls as an appetizer which were incredible. I was trying to be healthy so I got the vegetarian sunny side up egg on ricotta and veggies and it was sooo tasty -- zero regrets. My friends got the eggs benedict's which were also absolutely amazing. Only negatives were that two out of four of the dishes arrived way earlier than the others but we got two free drinks to compensate. The service was friendly, outdoor space beautiful and food delicious so will definitely be back.

Loved! Went there for brunch and their service was quick and friendly with GREAT food. I ordered the French toast and my friend had the eggs Benedict and they were both amazing. Been to my fair share of brunch places and this was one of the best meals I've had in a long time! If you're on the fence, give this place a try. You won't be disappointed.

This spot is a little overrated. I heard great things, but was a little underwhelmed by the food considering the price. It does have a cute ambiance and was a good place for date night, but the steak wasn't amazing.

Great Italian restaurant in Williamsburg. Attentive service, great starters and pasta entrees. Very flavorful and not too heavy.  They know how to make a dry martini and have the sense to offer serving spoons with shared appetizers (which most restaurants fail to do).   I'll definitely return.

Food and service on point! What an amazing restaurant!  They set us up at the outdoor patio and they were so accommodating of our dog and brought her water. The staff was on top of everything and worked like such a great team. Can't wait to go back!!! We will recommend to all our friends!

A great restaurant for brunch and dinner. Its always a great visit with a nice ambience, great service and good food. Ingredients are always fresh. Pastas are made in house and all are delicious. I love the cheeses so its good to try a plate. On this particular evening they had the Fried zucchini blossoms. Its something you don't see to often on a restaurant menu and the do a fantastic job here. Looking forward to my next visit.
Okay food, great ambiance. The outdoor heaters are great and the place is cute. However, if you are looking for quality Italian food, loo else where.
