WASTE OF MONEY!! I was so excited to try this place because the decor was really cute but the food and service was terrible. Not once did our waiter come and ask if we were ok or if we needed anything else. We waited about 20-30 mins before we ordered because our waiter was not around. We got the calamari to share, it was alright nothing special. We all got pasta, I forgot the name of the dish but it was absolutely awful!!!! It was soooo salty we barely could eat it, of course our waiter did not bother to ask how the food was. We all left our plate of pasta full because it was just honestly not edible, I could make the dish better myself. I am so disappointed and will definitely not be returning. Save your money and find a better spot. Way overpriced for the experience.
No comment
No comment

Deliciously authentic Italian food in a lovely, safe local atmosphere. Highly recommend the eggplant bolognese, ravioli, any of the meats they prepare, the fried calamari/shrimp, and the prosciutto di Parma plate. Looking forward to visiting again

I've been wanting to try Aurora for a while, because it looks so cute from the outside. So I walked in on a Friday around 7pm and was happy to be seated right away with no reservation. I sat in the indoor/outdoor patio section and that was definitely the best part. The brick walls are covered in vines and the overall setting/decor creates a romantic atmosphere. The rice croquettes are the paccheri were both good but most of the menu is a little pricey. Overall it's a really cute spot and I'd definitely recommend for date night.

This is my favorite restaurant in Brooklyn. The food and service are impeccable. My husband and I had the branzino and it was literally perfect! My friend had the tuna special and it was also sensational. I was there a few weeks ago and the duck  was delicious. I generally stay away from desserts, but the chocolate tart with pistachio gelato was wonderful. The staff was so accommodating and worked hard to get us a more quiet table, which meant we changed tables after the amazing bread and drinks were served. They aim to please, and they do a great job at it. I couldn't recommend Aurora on Grand Street more highly!
No comment
No comment

This restaurant really blew me away. The outdoor garden is so romantic and well spaced out. It's perfect for a date night, plus the staff is so professional and cautious given the pandemic. I felt very safe and comfortable. Also! The food is so good! We were blown away by the salad and our chocolate dessert. Can't wait to go back again!

My friends and I had the BEST time here. Very safe re:Covid, plus the patio was spaced out very well, and temperature regulated. I called to ask a few questions about my reservation, and they were so nice and took the time to answer me. Our server William was terrific and helped my friend have a great birthday. The food and drinks were fantastic. The carbonara gnocci + Aurora Manhattan warmed me heart and soul. I'll remember this meal for a long time, and can't wait to go back.
No comment
Really pretty garden seating. The menu had a good amount of options. The food was decent, service was good. Overall, a good brunch -- but nothing spectacular to make me want to return.

Cute spot -- they made an outdoor seating area that is rather covered and with heaters and plexiglass partitions so was actually able to enjoy dining there even on a chilly day!! Had the pasta with mushrooms in it which was really good and you could taste that is was freshly made!! Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the mushrooms were chopped in chucks n also kinda didn't match the quality of the pasta, but still good overall!!
No comment
One of the best Italian places, food is amazing, everything I tried was good, everything my friends tried was good, not one bad or untasty dish, also the vibe is always nice
No comment

The pasta here is unreal and the outdoor setting is gorgeous. I'm going to go ahead and be that guy and i don't give a shit - the tonnarelli cacio e pepe was the best I've had outside of Rome. Give this place your money.
Been there for breakfast before and i wasn't very impressed but i went again yesterday for dinner and i loved it, food was amazing. So will def become a go to spot for me

My friends have always raved about this place and I don't know why I have never been. Such a cute little restaurant in Williamsburg. Great location and the outdoor section makes you feel like you're in a French garden. We had the kale salad, the mushrooms and steak to share. The steak was the highlight - juicy, cooked to perfection. They took a lot of Covid measures to make you feel safe.
No comment
No comment

We booked this restaurant for our post elopement dinner, and everything from the booking experience to meal to the safety precautions was absolutely incredible. The service was impeccable and our drinks were always full, the food was absolutely delicious and all three courses came at just the right the time. The backyard garden was beautiful and we couldn't have asked for a better wedding day. Thank you Aurora team!

Went here for the first time a few nights ago. The backyard and ambience was super cool! The backyard has beautiful vines running down the walls and the tables were evenly spaced with dividers. There was a good selection of food, cocktails, and wine! This is a definitely a place to check out. I give it a four stars instead of five just because it felt like the staff was rushing us through our dinner. I understand it's COVID and restaurant rules and regulations are changing but still we wanted to feel a little more welcomed.
No comment
Great food and service, the whole fish octopus and the pasta was delicious! Definitely coming back and recommend this place!

Great atmosphere and food. Interior has a rustic, cozy vibe with brick walls and wooden tables. There was also an outdoor patio section which seemed pretty as well. We ordered different things off the menu-all which had eggs. I had the avocado toast with trout. Heads up: the toast itself was basically half a loaf of bread. Skipped the bread but the avocado and trout were yummy. Prices were moderate.

The food is okay and the drinks are okay. Ive been there twice and it usually take about 20-25 minutes to get a drink. It is a really fun place to go to, they have live performances and a dj so the ambiance is fun. I would recommend going there for a fun night out. I like that the tables are spaced out so people aren't on top of each other and you still have room to dance without being on top or too close to other people.
No comment

Came here for a date night. I had one of the pastas with pesto and tomatoes in it. IT WAS DELICIOUS. Also we were seated immediately and they have a beautiful garden. I do think the glasses of wine are a bit over priced (but I guess that's everywhere). Also the bread we were served had a bit of a weird taste to it, but our waiter was friendly and offered us more bread. Overall, would come back for their pasta.
No comment

A friend recommended them for a post wedding brunch. I made a Sunday Brunch reservation for 1145, we were seated quickly. It wasn't to busy, they had a lot of seating options for both inside and outside. We leave close to 1, and it was definitely busier. We chose to sit outside on the patio which is quiet and gorgeous! The restaurant is on the corner of a busier street, but we couldn't even tell when sitting outside. All the greenery, and ambiance You feel like you're in Italy! Very relaxed vibe from the staff, but we had great service! Excellent food we ordered risotto croquettes, the eggs Benedict, and ravioli. Everything was delicious!
No comment
We were a party of seven at Aurora last night. The food, the drinks, the service, the ambient - ALL FANTASTIC. Five stars!!!! We cannot wait to come back again!

We sat in the garden.  Garden seating is first come, first served.  You can request it, but no guarantee.  It was very nice and quiet.  Our table was in the corner edge abc this might explain the lack of wait service.  Recommendation to the owner - All staff should wear food safe rubber gloves.  It was a huge turn off when they put our glasses and plates on the table with their bare hands, touching the lips of our glass.  Aurora used plastic screens to separate some of the tables.  Food was excellent.  We started the meal with a Jameson and a blood orange organic soda.  Appetizer: Prosciutto di Parma aged.  Excellent.  The burrata was okay.  Dinner: Scallops and Skirt Steak.  Scallops were made perfectly!  Must try dish.  Shirt steak was very enjoyable.

So I was headed to little Italy for some good Italian when I came across this place right before the Williamsburg bridge. I am so glad I stop in. This place is amazing. The service from our waiter Aliyas was impeccable. His suggestions were on point (it's like he knew our palate scary!!!!). But I truly recommend this restaurant for an authentic Italian cuisine. Do the outside seating its beautiful.

I personally dont understand the positive review, went there on a saturday afternoon, they were not busy at all but service was extremely SLOW, the food was bland and very salty. The staff were very inexperienced ( waiter and manager) the price are way to high for the quality of food, had the pasta and burger. The food is not great but it is not terrible either, what make this place bad was really the staff who were very useless, waitress and the manager . Dont waste yr time and money in there

My girlfriend and I came here for dinner on a saturday. The restaurant was very busy yet they were able to seat us immediately. For appetizer, we shared a buratta and prosciutto board. It was simple yet high quality. For the main course, I had one of the daily specials: a lobster rissotto. The dish was aromatic and quite deep in flavor. I'd recommend it if it's on the menu again. The service was quick, friendly, and attentive. We had a great date here.
No comment
No comment
Amazing food, amazing ambiance and perfect decor.. such a cute date night spot.. makes you feel like you're dining in a garden

This was absolutely terrible. Bottom shelf quality food start to finish. They also completely fleeced me on the steak by saying the special was way better and not that much more and ended up being an extra $70. Terrible experience.
Excellent service and a great menu. The desserts are also very good! They have an excellent pre fixed lunch menu. I highly recommend this option. Their bread is delicious.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: I ended up tasting the majority of the menu, and each dish was better than the next. The atmosphere was lovely, the service was fantastic, and the food was to die for.
No comment

I want to say that this restaurant is really good. Delicious food, fair prices. Quiet enough that you can have a deep conversation, and they don't rush you to leave at all. A staff member did hit me with a huge bag of garbage he was carrying out to the curb and never said sorry or excuse me which is just bizarre and really rude lmao. I still recommend this place though. Will definitely be back

This is a cute restaurant in Williamsburg that did not disappoint. I came here for brunch and ordered the prosciutto eggs Benedict. I couldn't believe how delicious it was. It made me question why I had never come here before. The flavor of the prosciutto, eggs and truffles balanced each other perfectly. The home fries that came with the meal were also good. Next time, I want to sit outside. It was too hot and humid on the day I came here. I see myself coming back here for more brunches and dinners in the future!

The best pasta and octopus ever. I had recently gotten back from being in Italy for 3 weeks so I was worried to have Italian. But wow, it did not disappoint!! The bread to the wine to the food was SUPERB. I am so happy I took my mother, it was a gorgeous experience! I highly recommend.
No comment

Double check your statement after eating here.  Waiter decided to give himself more than what I tipped, which was well over 20%.  Its not so much the dollar amount but the principal and staff dishonesty

That's definitely one of my favorite restaurants in NYC. The outdoor seat is amazing, the food is excellent and the staffs are super nice. Everything is perfect. I ordered  octopus as our appetizer, duck breast as my main entree and a tiramisu. Everything is good especially the tiramisu, it's the best one that I've had. My bf isn't a sweet things lover but he grabbed my tiramisu lol. Highly recommended for everyone.

Great dining experience, great food, good service, and a super cute outdoor space.  Not sure if this is a farm to table place but sure tasted fresh!  Prices fairly to a little high for Brooklyn you will not be let down by presentation or taste!

Really surprised that this had good ratings. Maybe it used to be better. I had heard it was ok but probably had the worst service and dining experience in along time. I understand people have bad days and might be going through some stuff. But this server had the worst attitude and The server (didn't catch his name) but had a man bun or a top knot. He was the worst. Forgot multiple times about drink orders. We had to remind him about a second bottle of wine and to refill our waters. He then brought the 2nd wine bottle over and slammed it on the table without letting us try the wine. His attitude ruined the experience. And the mediocre food didn't save it. Sad :(
No comment

I was so excited to come here with my fiancé to celebrate our engagement and job promotion that we have been praying for so much. The moment we got there we asked for a table. We were told there was a wait. We were fine with that. The person helping us was Marcus. Not only did Marcus forget that we were on the waiting list but he was also completely rude to us. He literally threw the menus at us. Rushed us to order. It started pouring so we asked if we can wait to be seated in the yard. It was around 7:50pm when we asked and immediately he replied "nope, nothing until 10". We then went online and there was 2 availabilities online for 9:00pm. My husband and I unfortunately ended up getting a pizza around the house and took it back to the house. I'm a bit bothered and hurt because we drove all the way  from Delaware to have this awesome experience at Auroras and ended up with a huge disappointment. Very disgusted with Marcu's costumer service, did not expect it at all after all the great reviews my patients have given me. It's crazy how one person can ruin such a special night for my husband and I.
No comment

No comment

Awesome ambiance/dining area and food, great choice of wines, and delicious food. Pasta was served al dente and appetizers were brought out in good time but overall we received less attention due to a larger party also eating at the same time. Would recommend for a smaller group not in a rush, and would definitely come back!
The hostess was so rude and made us stand outside in the cold because we arrived at 5:55 and the restaurant opened at 6. Customer lost!
No comment

Great food ok service. I should've known that the service was going to be  ehhh. I made  my reservation online and called to see if I had indoor or outdoor dining. I got an attitude and was told it was first come first serve. I have a 630 reservation, and sat about 6:40. You need to put all your food in at once for the kitchen, fine. And then they asked us if we wanted dessert and we said no we're gonna have another drink. Shortly after receiving our drinks the waiter came over with the check & said he had people waiting for the table. With a full drink in front of me I paid the bill, The waiter came over twice and told us that we needed to leave. We weren't even sitting for 2 hours I felt rushed!!

I went to this place after my graduation to celebrate. We only waited about 5 minutes to get a table. The waitress service was a little bit slow but there was a lot of people that day. The food was good and we had a great bottle of wine to go with it. My parents and i really liked the feeling of sitting outside sorrounded  by trees.

No comment

Amazing atmosphere and delicious food. My only reason for choosing to give this four stars instead of five is the limited non-dairy options on the menu. The outdoor space is amazing and cozy even in winter with fantastic heating. I highly recommend it as long as you're good with having a dairy heavy meal.
No comment

Came here for Sunday brunch before going bowling. The outdoor enclosed garden area was great. Our party got seated quickly. Pomepelmo was a good take on a mojito. They give you bread while waiting for your entrees which was delicious. Soft inside and crunchy outside and were quick with refills. The entrees were tasty. I got the Parma eggs Benedict which the waiter said was the most popular dish and I can see why. Only thing is the side salad is useless. It's just a few greens with no dressing on the plate. Would rather have a couple more potatoes. Fiancé got the eggs florentine which was equally as good. Definitely recommend this place for a regular non boozy brunch in Williamsburg.

Service was extremely poor. From the time of seating at the bar, to getting transferred to a table. Not one server seemed interested in taking an order, serving water, providing bread or recommendations. After finishing our drinks we were never offered another refill on cocktails. We had to remind the manager about to please check the status of our main course. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
No comment
No comment

Made a reservation for 9:30 and we still had to wait about 20 minutes. It was still busy even at around close to 11 by the time we left but then again it's Saturday night in Brooklyn. The place is nice and they have a charming outdoor seating area. For appetizers we ordered the octopus which was great and fried zucchini blossoms stuffed with mozzarella cheese and anchovy which was amazing. Too bad it's only a special for the night because it was delicious. Sadly my squid ink pasta entree was terrible. It was so fishy tasting. It was overwhelmingly fishy. I forced myself to not breathe and eat a few bites because I didn't want to offend them if they saw that I didn't touch my food (I am way too polite at restaurants..Sometimes to my own detriment). I've had squid ink pasta so many times at so many different places so I have no idea why this one had such a fishy taste. Maybe it was the clams?? Ugh I don't know.
No comment

No doubt this is my favorite Italian restaurant in Williamsburg! I like their Squid-Ink Spaghetti so much. But be aware that they do change the ingredients in different seasons. I love the one with crab meat most.  In summer, their outside looks so green and nice. A must try Italian restaurant!

Had a great time for brunch at Aurora! The atmosphere is quite inviting.  The place seems like it gets really busy and while my friend and I sat there for a while - mimosas in hand and all - we didn't feel rushed by anyone.  The food was great! I ordered the Polenta con Funghi and absolutely loved it, creamy polenta and the crunch of the sprouts, and of course bacon makes everything better anyway! My friend ordered Cappellacci con coda and was pretty satisfied as well - I sneaked a taste and thought the meat was really tender.  All in all, a definite recommendation!

Came in with two of my friends and immediately loved the atmosphere it's very intimate with the exposed brick, plants, and lighting. We sat out in the "garden" which we all loved it was an enclosed outdoor space that was nicely decorated with lights and plants. The bread that comes out to the table was really good along with the olive oil they serve with it, which is always a plus when the bread is good. The 3 of us all ordered pasta and it was literally the best pasta dish I've ever had it was so good. I'll definitely be back to try more dishes.
No comment
Wonderful brunch. I loved the salmon with poached egg. The pompelmo is refreshing. I also greatly enjoyed the outdoor seating.
Sitting outside on a sunny Sunday morning. Everything is perfect. Benedict egg is absolutely great, and it is even a little much for a girl. Would come again. :)

My husband and I have dined here several times. The food is pretty good. However, it is quite pricey for the amount of food given and their bartenders and overall service are not as friendly as we would hope for that price range.

Dinner in AURORA has interesting menu, wonderful meal that was perfectly served by our waiter, who also filled us in on the local community. Table  service  was exactly on time, hot (not warm) food and oh so good. All in all, a perfect stay!!
No comment
Great food in a beautiful garden setting. Lamb meatballs, branzino, and pasta were all perfectly prepared.
Really yummy food, no complaints. Just a bit pricey for what it is. I had the mushroom ravioli and was not disappointed - very pillowy and creamy!
No comment

Love their outdoor seating area! It's a lot larger than I always observed while I walked by. The outdoor space transports you from Williamsburg! We got their Buratta, bruschetta and prosciutto to share. It was fresh and tasty. Not enough for more than 2 people. I got their chicken with sun chokes and it was delicious. I'd recommend this place!
No comment

Delicious meal with family on Memorial Day!  Homemade Tagliatelle with meat sauce and tomato sauce was delicious. Skirt steak meal was also great.  Generous portions.  Great bread. Nice atmosphere and great service.
Loved the service, pasta and cocktails. Planning on making a stop every time I'm in town.
Food was great. I loved the squash ravioli as a fall dish. The covered patio is beautiful and romantic, amazing atmosphere. Highly recommend as a date night spot.

My fiancé and i went here for our 2 year anniversary , the food was so yummy , we both had the fish special. I did not enjoy my drink so i had the wine instead , can not recall the name of the drink but it was very sour and not that great , i highly recommend this place . Ambiance was really nice also

I went to Aurora to get a pasta to go. It was delicious! Will literally go back for the food. Unfortunately like many other reviews the service was not up to par with the food so I can't give this place 5 stars. The hostess is there to Host and provide customer service. Unfortunately that was not my experience.

Such a special place. The food is absolutely wonderful. Every dish was filled with flavor and finesse. Ambience is beautiful. The service is cool vibe. Relaxed. The only reason I didn't give it a 5th star jd the attitude of the host. I see someone below had a terrible experience as well. Ruder than rude. Got a taste of it when I tried calling for rez weeks before but I wound up just making it online.  Then when we arrived and made the mistake of asking him to kindly telling our server it was my husbands bday and to put candle in dessert. He told me I needed too cause he has too many tables. I told him this was a 1st. Other than him - perfection.

DISGUSTING! FOOD IS SO BLAND! My friends and I came here for a birthday dinner because we thought we would try something on the fancy side. JUST BC THEIR DISHES ARE EXPENSIVE DOESNT MEAN THEY HAVE FLAVOR. The portions were also really small!!!! The squid spaghetti was extremely disgusting. No flavor at all. And the noodles were hard! Please do not come here just Bc they have a cool outdoor garden seating area with an expensive menu Bc their food does not taste good!

We found Aurora by chance, drawn in by the lovely garden, and didn't regret it for a second. We had fried shrimps and calamari- one of the best versions of this dish I have ever had (and since I love calamari, I have tried quite a few). Thin crispy batter, the right amounts of salt and super dense calamari. We also had the octopus, which was great in both flavour and consistency too. We followed with pasta. I had a home made saffron pasta with shrimp ragu. It had a distinct flavour of sea, in a good way, and the pasta was cooked al dente. A great pasta dish. My husband had spaghetti vongole- also good but it as memorable. The service was superb throughout. We got a wine recommended that was great with our food. The proof of how happy we where must have been that we returned for a second dinner during our five night stay in Williamsburg (which was just as good). Don't miss this gem!
No comment

Really cute garden outdoor ambiance. I was fairly impressed by this place. Didn't think there was something so cute tucked away in Williamsburg Brooklyn. We ordered a bottle of Italian red wine do go with our 40 oz steak. I have to say the wine and steak were both amazingly delicious. The steak was medium rare, thick and juicy. So tender it literally melted in my mouth. Only negative thing was there were so many mosquitoes outside, I was eaten alive. I definitely would come back to try a few other items on the menu such as the squid ink pasta.
No comment
No comment

This is my favorite restaurant in Williamsburg. Without fail, the food is always delicious, the atmosphere feels celebratory and upscale without being pretentious. In a neighborhood full of tourist traps, Aurora feels like a neighborhood spot. Service is always great. My girlfriend and I have done birthdays, anniversaries, and just plain date nights here. Came the other night and realized I've never left a review, thought it was about time.
No comment
No comment

Seems like a average place, food did not taste nor seemed any better than Olive Garden. Portion sizes definitely not filing, and prices are very high for what they serve, unfortunately I would not recommend this place to anyone who is interested in finding some unique taste.

Amazing dinner. One of the most comfortable places for phase 2 outdoor eating in Williamsburg.  The restaurant has a large patio/garden that is in the shade so it even is pleasant on a very hot day. I went with six people and we shared a bunch of appetizers and main courses. Our favorite was the summer squash with the peach and ricotta. The scallops were also delicious. I would make a reservation on a weekend night as it got very busy after 5:30.
No comment
Visited all the way from AZ Labor Day weekend. Wanted a Brooklyn experience and got it at Aurora! Beautiful, intimate restaurant with great service. Went during lunch time & our food was spectacular.

Grabbed a late (2pm) brunch w friends at this spot and found the crowds to be still in full swing. Despite that, we were seated immediately in the covered back garden. Unfortunately the day was warm so the greenhouse effect was ON, but we resolved with downing multiple pitchers of water. Our server was in full hipster regalia and yet his service was remarkably attentive and gentle. We ordered the strapazzate, frittata, l'inglese, and eggs norwegian - rounding out a bit of the brunch fare with Italian notes. The plates came within a reasonable duration, and were hot and flavorful - no complaints, and no leftovers. Price is right and space is lovely - worth a try if you're in the area.
man the food was incredible here but the irish girl who works here must've had a big night at house of yes the day before because she messed up our orders entirely!

Get the Lamb Chops - This place makes me feel like i'm back on the Amalfi Coast in my white linen suit, Giorgio Armani Aviators, sipping my Limoncello and skyping Roberto Benigni because LIEF IS BAUTIFUL!! BACI MILLE!!! I love you! I Kiss you!
Everything in the menu is good. I was here for a wedding and it was so beautiful. Inside was cocktail hour outside and dancing time, outside was the ceremony and dinner. Excellent customer service.
No comment

No comment

I've been here several times. The last time was for brunch with two friends. I love the decor. It's comfortable, natural lighting through large windows. The staff are down to earth, casually dressed, very comfortable vibe. There's optional outdoor seating in the summer...or a closed outdoor seating area in the winter. I think they make their own pasta in house. The flavors of their dishes are really well put together. For brunch I had a salmon dish. It came with avocado, cured salmon, goat cheese, poached egg on a whole wheat bread. Very good. Overall, they use simple but good ingredients to make outstanding dishes and I highly recommend. The prices are moderate. The bill was $95 for three dishes, one appetizer(heirloom squash it was sweet and salty), one drink(mimosa) and 2 lemonades. Lemonade was $4 each. Tasted fresh as if it was homemade. Overall, I would keep coming back to try everything on the menu (besides beef or pork).
No comment

One of the worst dining experiences. I normally never leave any sort of reviews but this diner being so bad has motivated me to leaving a post. We waited 45 mins for our dinner. We checked several times with the waiter  could not give any explanation for the delay. When the food finally arrived, it was the tiniest piece of fish for $28. We wanted to like Aurora but sadly with this shitty experience we will not be back
No comment

The brunch here was slamming. We were on the list for a table at Sunday in Brooklyn and walked a few blocks while we waited. We were surprised to find this place was not super crowded so went here instead and were so glad that we did. Everything was so good. Super friendly hostess and lovely waitress made us feel so welcome. All the food ordered was excellent. The eggs Benedict with Parma and ricotta was rich and delicious, exactly what you want for brunch. The polenta with eggs, kale and mushrooms was perhaps my favorite. Say yes to the side order of bacon, which was sliced and cooked to perfection. More like a tasty crispy strip of pork belly. Such an excellent balance of flavors. I cleaned my plate. Another friend had the burger which was perfectly cooked at medium rare and the truffle fries were awesome. The bloody Mary's were tangy and spicy. Can't wait to go back here.
Amazing. Every single thing I have tried here was outlandishly good and decently priced. Had the Bronzini last time I was there and it was prepared perfectly.a I will definitely be back soon.

This restaurant looks stand out from the outside. I love vines all around the building. Decoration inside is also wonderful and the garden is terrific. Food is delicious and variety. I already went there once and this is a second time for my mom BD. For appetizer we have Beef tartar, Tuna tartar, grilled octopus. For main course we have Ravioli is delicious , Saffron Malloreddus is too salty and Pappardelle is excellent. Service is kindda slow maybe because of Saturday night but I saw next table came later but gets service first and quickly with the drinks and food and the server comes to their to ask if they need anything often but our table I have to look at he many times. I told him I want a dessert with candle for my mom bafter meal he says ok but after meal we have to wait for a while and I was beginning to think he forgot it. Overall I love the decoration and food but some how I feel a bit disappointed with the service.

My sister hosted my baby shower brunch at Aurora and I must say the food and staff were awesome. The wait staff was attentive and the food was delicious. My favorite meal was the avocado crab toast!! Omg!! It was really really good. We had the outside area and with the decor of the shower and the plants the restaurant has throughout the outside area made it the ideal space for my whimsical baby shower. I was really happy that she chose aurora and we would definitely love to host another event there.

Loved it! Really nice and cozy place. We saw the photos on Yelp an decided to go. Best decision. Food was sooo good, wish we had more plates. The Calamaris were really good and savory. Pasta was fresh and authentic flavors. I'm not a tiramisu person and even though that, was really good. Looking forward to come back and tey more things.

Favorite brunch spot! Their thick cut bacon is so delicious! It's usually pretty packed for weekend brunch but definitely worth the wait especially if you can get a patio table. It's very family friendly and great for a date as well.

Amazing pasta!! The steak is also incredible. I've been here a couple times, you should always try to make a reservation cause there can be a little bit of a wait. That being said it's a great spot for a date and the wine list is really really something tot talk about.

Came here for a late Saturday brunch and was pleasantly surprised at the beautiful decor and sizable, green garden. The bread, olive oil and salt are some of the best I've had and for me that's a huge plus! I also highly recommend the kale and Brussel sprouts salad, totally yummy! The steak and crab meat pasta were also great.

Always a pleasure to visit this place. Good atmosphere. Nice food and good wine selection

Love it there. They offer a great lunch Prix fixe. The service is very good and the patio is beautiful.  Amazing bread,  pasta are very good too.  You can have a $3 wine with the lunch menu.  It became my favorite spot for lunch and at night the patio is even better if you look for a romantic spot.
No comment

Delicious! Great service and amazing atmosphere. I also had so great company :) There was multiple tricky food allergies (hello tomatoes, peppers and eggplant at an Italian restaurant!) and they were AMAZING about it! Fabulous lunch all around!
This place is balls deep. In pasta. Get your head out of the gutter. When you want a delicious noodle come here. Seriously it's a

Charming little Italian restaurant in Williamsburg. I came for Sunday brunch and had a pretty good experience. We originally chose this spot because it has a really lovely outdoor garden area, but it ended up being booked out for a private party. The inside of Aurora is very simple with dark wood floors and tables, brick walls, and minimal decor. I got the paccheri pasta with eggplant and mozzarella- it was delicious and I love how all of their pastas are made in house daily. That is quite a rare thing at most Italian restaurants in New York. The only negative is that there weren't that many exciting options on the menu. It was the very usual eggs benedict, frittata, and burger options. Aside from the pastas and burger, there were no non egg options. Would love to see them do something more creative and expand their menu for brunch, lunch, and dinner.
No comment

I came here today for Mother's Day Brunch and it was a great experience. From the rustic table bread to the creamy burrata and prosciutto to the squid ink pasta with main lobster and the filet mignon served with wild mushrooms to the affogato. Everything was fresh and delicious and the service was just as good.
No comment

Gorgeous decor, exposed brick and traveling vines, friendly staff and perfect for a truly romantic date night. My boyfriend and I were seated in the covered and heated outdoor area. Fantastic menu ~ my foodie boyfriend loved it and we're looking forward to coming back in the summer for the outdoor seating!
No comment

Portions a tad small but all homemade and delicious. Cheese cake with homage crisps and a side of cherries which was a nice touch. Had the cheese and tomatoes, both pasta dishes were excellent - one with cockles and a lovely olive oil and parsley sauce and the other other sea urchin and crab. Had the rose cider and white wine. Sat outside with the dog and they bought him a treat and bowl of water nice bar and very clean bathroom. Nice choice for a Father's Day meal.
No comment

Amazing dinner! The prosciutto and burrata are to die for! This place is very nice. The garden outside is perfect in any weather. The soft lights make it very romantic and perfect for a date night! I go to this place often and they always have something g special going on. The have a pre arranged menu for valentines day. You can pair your good with wines. It's was amazing.
Delicious food and great wines! The outdoor area is spectacular! They really did a great design with this restaurant and honored their name! Highly recommended!

A great place for dinner (or brunch) especially on a warm day when you can enjoy the outdoor dining in the courtyard. We came with a group of five and enjoyed sharing a few antipasti, two primi, two secondi, and three desserts. This is an authentic Italian restaurant with wonderful homemade pasta, fresh seafood (e.g., soft shell crab, branzini), and affagato. I highly recommend this restaurant for a leisurely meal with family, friends, or a special someone.
Came in on a Saturday night at 1030pm. The music isn't too loud, and it's not crowded at all. The outside area was well-lit and the food is really good. The prosciutto appetizer is a must!
No comment
The steak (lunch) which came with kales salad and cheese was absolutely amazing. Will def come back again and try more items!
No comment

Even though Aurora is out of the way in a major way for me I've been not once, but twice!  After going here for a dinner date I dragged my mother here (who never steps foot in Brooklyn I light add) as well because the food and service and ambiance were just that good!  The food tasted incredibly fresh and the wait staff were very attentive and helpful in recommending wines and dishes. I've never eaten in the garden outside area but hope to return to do so!  It's quite a beautiful spot.

Loved the outside space with a top cover romantic. The wait guy was great to me. I was more demanding. Shared the charred octopus with the hubby. Great sauce with a kick. Had parpedell with Ravi and ricotta . Delish

Great atmosphere and the food and service was awesome!  I ordered the ravioli, which was amazing and not to heavy, was actually on the light side.  My husband had the fennel sausage pasta, which he loved as well.  All pasta is homemade.   A definite must when in Brooklyn.
No comment

Amazing food in an intimate outdoor setting along the street.  The collaborative service model was great.  We were most impressed with Stewart, our primary server.  He was engaging and helpful as we made our choices and navigated a couple of dietary needs.   We can't recommend this wonderful spot highly enough.
Amazing food, beautiful place. Really nice for a big or small crowd to impress.
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of my favorite brunch places so far! Affordable good quality and creative food. Interesting menu, had the crostone and tried the Benedict eggs, everything tasted amazing! The hostess however wouldn't let us order until our table was full (we were 9 out of 10), which felt a little disrespectful (I mean, come on, we were only missing one person!!!!)
Went there for brunch and had steak and eggs! They were delicious and priced very reasonably. Great covered patio. Lots of natural light. Cheap wine! Will definitely be back!

My favorite Italian restaurant in NY. Real Italian food not Americanized. Their homemade pastas and raviolis are to die for.  Their Tiramisu and other deserts  are very yummy so make sure to have room for desert:) . Great vine selection too. If you like Italian food in Italy you would like this restaurant.
No comment

Poor customer service. The receptionist told us to wait for 40 mins. We called after 40mins and she said the wait time is another 40mins. She should not have told us 40mins or should have called us if the wait is longer. Very unprofessional and will never come back.
No comment

Belated valentines dinner. Food was great. My husband had the beef short ribs and i had a special which was risotto with maine lobster and scallops. We both loved our dishes. The only critcism i had was the scallops were a bit too salty but everything else great! Dessert was ok we had the chocolate cake. Nothing to rave about. We also enjoyed our apps wine was good as well. Service waa very goof
No comment
No comment
No comment

Absolutely delicious food. Home made pasta and burrata raviolis were a dream. This place also has an awesome, cozy, atmosphere...we sat in the outdoor garden space and really enjoyed ourselves. Service was great too. Can't wait to go back to Aurora!
No comment

Friend insisted this would be amazing. Blah...The portions were small, the waiter was condescending, tables were tight, They got my dinner order wrong and everyone was waiting for them to correct it. I told them to please start or their food would be cold. If you're vegetarian, don't bother!  ALL AROUND crappy place to eat.

Great food and great wine! Aurora is the perfect date spot if you want to have some great Italian food in Williamsburg. There menu had some great pasta dishes and the daily specials looked even better! Paired with a nice wine and the meal was a solid A. Sit outside on the patio while you still can!
No comment

As long as Aurora keeps serving the Amarena panacota, I'll never get tired of eating there. Great drinks, awesome food and upbeat atmosphere (music can be a bit loud), Aurora is a great option if you're looking for traditional Italian with a twist. Service is great - kudos to the servers with an Italian accent :)
No comment
Great food for veggie and non veggie humans. Server Stuart was fantastic, beyond great. Food was exceptional!

This place has a lot of character, cosy atmosphere friendly staff and good food. The black ink risotto was really tasty and the italian wine list has all the classics. Excellent to spend a pleasant dinner with our yankee friends

Came here for dinner and it was awesome! The pasta was so, so good. Restaurant is lovely and it was really nice sitting outside. We had a great time. Unfortunately the people sitting next to us were having a really drawn out, awkward, breakup-esque conversation and the chick kept crying. But whatever, not the restaurant's fault. Will definitely be back! Can't wait to try brunch.
First time here and will def. be back!  Had a great seat on the patio and the service and food were fantastic!
No comment
No comment

Ohh, love the outdoor area here in the summer.  It's so romantic and "secret garden" like if you will.  It is on the expensive side, but the food was delish and the atmosphere on the patio was the best part.
Didn't try much of the menu aside from drinks but the place is beautiful! The attention to detail not only in decor but also service is great.
Great ambiance- loved the outdoor seating! Service was super quick and great. We got our food so quickly after ordering and it was very tasty!!

Amazing brunch spot and dinner. I have come here 6 times now and the food has always been consistently good and delicious. Everything is fresh and hand made. One of the best Italian restaurants in Williamsburg.

Was walking around Brooklyn with a friend when we stopped in. They gave us a table outside. We got drinks in the form of a martini and I had a red wine. We both have the Prosciutto e Burrata which was amazing. I would definitely go back to try more food on their menu. Aurora is a great place to grab brunch if your in the Williamsburg area.
No comment

Came here for an anniversary dinner.  The atmosphere in the covered outdoor seating area is chill yet romantic.  The service was on point.  The octopus here was like none I've tasted before.  It was grilled and spicy which was one of the best combos ever.  My fiance had the cavatelli all isolana.  She did like it however after a while, she got tired of the taste.  I had the garganelli al sugo calabrese.  It was good especially with the spicy pork and the slices of pasta.  The only downside is I wish there was more pasta.  For dessert, we had the tiramisu and the ciabattino di frutta.  The fruit cobbler was apple and it was one of the best desserts I've had.  Pricing here was a little pricier than the typical italian restaurant but the atmosphere makes up for it.
No comment
No comment
This is one of my secret or not so secret favorite restaurants. The food is just tremendous and the atmosphere is very romantic but not overly. The one item not to miss is the buratta.
I've been coming here sporadically over the past 5 years. The food has always been consistent. I like going for brunch and sit in their outdoor/indoor garden.

My friends and I went here for a birthday dinner. The outdoor garden seats blew all of us away because of its romantic atmosphere . The food we ordered and the wine that the staff recommended were great, tasty. Definitely revisit shortly.
No comment
No comment

PRO: Food was amazing, ambience perfect. CON: my friend & I were the ONLY ones there, it took them FOREVER to bring out the appetizers and food. They never checked in to see how we were doing, nor told us the food was going to take awhile. Finished my soda, they never refilled it.
No comment

The 3 course lunch was great and $22. We started off with some soup with mushroom and potatos. For the entree we got the rigatoni dish, which was so good, and the paccheri (?). Then dessert we got affogato and pannacotta. Very cute and cozy restaurant too

This place is way too fancy for it's britches. The food was okay but the portions we're very small considering the price. It was a cute atmosphere and our waiter was attentive. Sadly, we won't be returning.
No comment

Very enjoyable. I had Gnuti which was the first time for me. I didn't realize it was potato gnocchi. It was okay, probably just fine for what it was but it was just not what I wanted. I ate about half of it and left the rest. The waitress asked me if I didn't like it, would I like something different. I said no, that it was fine, I just didn't like it enough to finish it. She persisted and was very nice suggesting that she could bring me something else. Once again, I said no. She said okay, but that she could bring me any dessert I wanted and not charge me. So, we had the chocolate tart and it was delicious. All-in-all, this was a very nice experience.

My friends and I wanted to try an authentic Italian restaurant and stumbled upon this restaurant aurora. We were greeted by a nice hostess and seated with the waitress Danielle. She seemed very nice, but that quickly changed. Her attitude was extremely awful and rude. We were new to the restaurant and didn't quite understand the menu. When asked for explanations of some of the dishes, she stated that we could clearly read the contents on the menu. After that ordeal we overlooked the attitude and tried to enjoy our meal. When we finished, and payed for our meal, we left a tip that we felt was appropriate. Danielle the waiter later confronted my friend stating that the tip wasn't enough and we should keep it for ourselves. I was very appalled at this and felt disrespected. NEVER AGAIN!! And I suggest you guys stay away from this establishment.
No comment

Food was amazing! I had the clam spaghetti and my husband had the beef rigatoni plus we shared the prosciutto/burrata plate and all was divine. The waiter recommended a great bottle of red and the vibe is warm and intimate. Wasn't too expensive either. Will definitely be back!
Love this place beautiful garden. Great eats breakfast lunch or dinner always consistently good.
No comment
Great Brunch place, food was delicious, service was great and atmosphere was beautiful. Definitely heading back for dinner.

It's a cool spot for brunch in Williamsburg. I love eating in their patio. They have fresh pasta which is delicious as well as typical brunch plates. Our favorite was strangozzi with mushrooms! It can be pricey.

I come to this restaurant every year or two an each time I look at the menu prices, I get sticker shock. But once I get the food I decide that I'm definitely coming back. The flavors are amazing. I enjoy every bite. The drinks are yummy and actually strong enough. I hate when places are chincy with the liquor. I would definitely suggest giving this place a try, but just a heads up, this is a $$$ restaurant not $$.
Consistently great food. Very solid wine offerings. Love both the interior and garden areas.  Service has been fine as well.

A true and authentic experience. The food was delicious, we had the Octopus starter and Mushroom salad, just divine! Went on to the pork pasta with truffle ricotta and the ravioli, stunning. Our server was kind enough to give my boyfriend and I quick wine tasting, even though she was very busy, and we went with he barbaresco red wine, SO GOOD. Can't wait to come back for round 2.
Delicious food. Good service. Very nice wine list. But so fucking loud that I wonder if I'll ever want to go back.

Great space, service and food. Went there for late brunch and no problem with special orders of the menu. Super cute, green outdoor garden. Family and stroller friendly! Try the affogato for dessert! Espresso pored over vanilla ice cream- so good!

Amazing, authentic Italian experience! All of the food was very fresh and simplistic. They make the pasta and cheeses in house. We ordered three different pasta dishes and all were delicious! The fish special of the day was also amazing, it melted in your mouth. We had both a kale salad and a prosciutto and mozzarella appetizer and they were wonderful, too! The portions are not extremely large, but highly recommend for the quality of food! The ambiance of the small restaurant is also beautiful and comfortable with soft, warm lighting!

I live in Manhattan but travel to Williamsburg just to eat at Aurora. I love everything about this place. Staff are super friendly and helpful. Very pretty outdoor space - mozzarella is a must and brunch menu is excellent
Cold carbonara special was a letdown, the wine and app were ok but for a 30$ pasta entree kinda a bummer. Better Italian spots in the neighborhood.

I could live here.  This restaurant was amazing, the staff was incredibly helpful and attentive, the food was beyond delicious, and the atmosphere outside in the courtyard was unbelievable.  I've never had better truffle-pasta and sincerely doubt I ever will.  To top it off, the panna cotta as as good as they come.  Definitely give this place a try.

column3: Hackensack River Waterfront, Jersey City, NJ
column6: Food is okay and service is disappointing. The sever was not helpful about the menu. I had questions but he kept walking by us it's like the others have more priority. They also automatically charge gratuity which is high like 20%. I dont really write reviews but this one is not worth its price.

This shouldnt really be referred to as a restuarant with like 6 appetizers and 5 pastas and 5 entrees on their dinner menu. Yet the drinks menu is like 5 pages front and back. I don't ever have an issue at any "Italian" spot figuring out what I want to eat. This was probably the worst dining experience I've yet to have. Don't go there if you're actually hungry and want good Italian food.

This is a really cute spot in Brooklyn. I want here for my friends bday and we sat outside in the garden area. Really fun ambiance. We had a bottle of Lambrusco and each had a pasta disk. I had the ravioli and it was cooked perfect. Flavor wasn't 100% so I couldn't give it a 5. The bread and appetizers were ordered though we're delicious. Definitely a spot i would go back to and try some other options.

Best real Italian food in Brooklyn. The ambiance in the outside garden is impeccable. Delicious wine list, as well. If I could eat here every night, I would!

We sat outside in the enclosed garden area. Our food was fabulous. The servers were very helpful. We were a party of 2. There were several large parties there as well. Our food was not delayed by the large tables ordering at the same time, often our server was speaking to another table and another server came over to check in on us. It was an excellent experience. This is an underrated restaurant.

Second visit without a Rez and we were seated immediately on a Thursday evening. I was equally impressed as when we had brunch here six months before. We ordered a truffle sausage mushroom pasta that was delicious, a superb salad and a great red wine. Service was great and  no line to use the ladies room. I'll be back.

This is hands down the best meal I've had in Williamsburg so far. The atmosphere is delightful, the wine is excellent and the food is the best part. It's not cheap but it's the perfect place for a nice date night.

Good food and amazing ambience although make sure to check your bill since I almost paid $72 for a bottle of wine that wasn't ours.

Their chicken and steak dishes never disappoint. Love eating in their garden, whether spring or winter (it is winterized). Services has always been attentive, I probably go every couple of months.

Cool space. Great menu very well executed. Service was excellent until my order came out completely wrong. It was comped and not tragic. The bread was good. The appetizers were terrific. A watermelon gazpacho was very tasty. The tuna tartar was delicious. The octopus was tender. The fig and cheese appetizer was unique, well done. Home made pasta was perfect texture. Clams were light and tasty. Dessert menu was limited. Great wine selection. Would go back, save for the fact so many great places to pick in Williamsburg.
No comment

Awesome spot that's stood the test. One of the early Williamsburg Go-to's that has stayed strong through the years. A true neighborhood staple. Best bets are the pastas...always fresh, always delicious.  Beautiful, rustic space with lots of reclaimed wood and brick.  Great spot for a date or a group.

I loved this restaurant. I just had my daughters bridal shower there. The place was gorgeous, the staff so friendly and so helpful and the food was outstanding. We had a great time and can not thank them enough, 5 stars is not enough!!!

The food was great but personally not worth the lackluster service. We arrived on a Tuesday evening and despite having multiple tables open both inside and outside, we were not allowed to be seated until our entire party of 3 had arrived. I understand why restaurants have this policy but when 2/3 of the guests are there and the restaurant is empty, I do not understand why the restaurant could not be more accommodating. In addition, when we were deciding on whether or not to get an appetizer the waiter stated "The chef doesn't do appetizers and insists the plates all come out at one time". Overall, I though this place was pretentious and I would
No comment

Possibly my new favorite restaurant in Brooklyn if not the entire city. We dropped in a rainy Saturday evening in December. Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the wine list and the menu itself offering his favorites when we asked. We started with risotto croquettes and a three cheese plate with figs and honey which were excellent. The white we paired was excellent, moderately priced and was recommended by the waiter. I ordered the butternut squash gnocchi which was incredible, best I ever tasted. I also tried the Montauk sea scallops which were also amazing. Each entree at the table was delicious. After the wine I had a Moretti Rossa which was perfect for my taste buds at that moment. For desert we shared a salted caramel pudding which was no surprise to us also incredibly tasty. It was a wonderful experience and we look forward to visiting again very soon!
Food was amazing, service was great and the atmosphere, especially the garden is beautiful. I can't wait to go back!

my favorite Italian restaurant in the city. every time i can, i like to come here for the great food that they have. my girlfriend too she is not Italian, but she start to understand very well the italian kitchen
No comment

I struggled if I wanted to give four stars or five, but ultimately, the bottom line is the food was really good. The service was great. The ambience (we sat outside) was beautiful & so welcoming. The prosciutto was so tender & not slimy which prosciutto can sometimes be. The olive oil they put on the table, on a silky note, was one of my favorite parts. They make their own pasta. I love places that do this. You can tell it to. It really is so much better than dried pasta. The two things I didn't like were the amount they gave you. We had a table of about 15. I looked down the table at the end & everyone's plate was licked clean. Yes, that means they like it, but it also means there were some people probably still hungry. For the price, I believe the portion sizes could be a little bigger. The second thing is the Williamsburg 'your lucky to be eating here' that some of the younger generations foster. Let me explain. They don't want to give you bread with olive oil because it makes the tables too messy and the menus get ruined. The menus are printed on a thick resume type paper. Really. Just print more. We were starving b/c our party got there at 7 & didn't order until 8:30. I don't know whose fault it was. It could have easily been someone at our big table causing the lag, so I can't point fingers. But if one end of the table is telling you they are starving, please oblige. It's a restaurant. This goes back to, 'no, we can't give you a side of fresh fruit even though we serve it as a side on another dish.' Mentality, that makes me mad. One reason people go out to eat is because of choices. Enough of my rant. I would eat here again. Although not if I was really hungry.
No comment

i have been here twice for dinner and it was good both times. the appetizers are great, last night we had fritto misto and the prosciutto and burrata plate. everyone ordered pastas and they were delicious. the garden area is closed in for the winter, it's a nice place to sit with string lights all over the ceiling.

What a beautiful, charming spot. The service was a little forgetful, but the food is phenomenal. I love the ambience -- and their mimosas are delicious. :)

Okay, this review is 2 years late. But I'm writing a review now because I have fond memories of it that just came back up when I think of which spots in NYC I love (I've since moved out). It's a delightful Italian restaurant in Williamsburg. The outdoor spot was so pretty and pleasantly bustling. I planned a friend's birthday dinner here (for ~6 people) and they handled it perfectly.

Definitely the best Italian in the area and some of the best we've had in NYC. The authentic food is consistently amazing and the impressive wine list leaves many options for perfect pairing. The brunch is particularly good for the very reasonable price. Several egg dishes come with the more subtle black truffle for a dynamite combination. The coffee is excellent. We've been back for dinner a few times recently and everything was equally as good. All enjoyed in their beautiful garden, summer and winter. The staff are always pleasant and knowledgeable. What more could you want?

Hosted my wedding ceremony and brunch here and could not recommend it more! The service was excellent, and management made sure to take special care of our guests. Excellent food and beautiful venue! Would recommend to anyone looking to host a small, private event.

This restaurant is perfect. The outdoor patio is very cute, the food is delicious the service is great, love the olive oil and bread to start, the pastas and finishing with the busino ! I come here often and bring all my friends for a combo white hotel rooftop + aurora restaurant. Make sure to book a table I'm advance!

This place had a 30 min wait on a week night for 4 people! Good thing it was worth the wait. There was a very cute semi outdoor seating area that looked like a garden. To start us off, the waiter was very knowledgeable in helping us choose a wine.  I ordered the Strangozzi Alla Norcina which was amazing - definitely the best dish at the table. My friend had seafood pasta, which he wasn't a fan of. But everyone else really enjoyed their dishes. Overall great dinner. Hope to be back soon!

Saw this place for years finally decided to give it a try on Saturday afternoon it was my wife and my anniversary ( 23 years) , didn't realize they close in the afternoon, to get ready for dinner crowd, we had 3:30 reservations, got there 3:45 it was all good hostess sat my wife as I went to park, great atmosphere, looks like everyone that works there lives in the neighborhood,  very casual we had to order from brunch menu again no big deal seems like there's a little something for everyone... we shared 2 appetizers the kale salad with roasted pistachios and some other stuff absolutely delicious we also had the rice croquettes very tasty fresh and hot ... love it for our entrees I had a angus burger with pesto mayo and avocado it was spectacular, and my wife order fresh pasta with smoked eggplant and mozzarella it was great , staff was extremely friendly and on point, will definitely be back and will bring some friends
Patio dining, perfectly prepared Risotto and Panna Cotta that will bring me back this week! What's not to love! Oh, and now accepts credit cards...heaven.

For Williamsburg, a 12 year old Resturant is hard to come by and for home made Italian food, even harder. Aurora is an absolute gem !!! Perfect for a Romantic evening date or family dinner. The Resturant is seasonal, so it doesn't always have the same dishes, if any of the following are on the menu, they better be in your table...Go for dinner,  MUSTS: Burratta, smoked Trout summer salad, Truffle ravioli, orecchie with tomato cauliflower and shrimp, tiramisu, caffe corretto. I recommend making a reservation.

We always love coming to this wonderful place. It's very cozy and the food is always delicious! Freshly made pasta and good wine. The service is great. Really make a point to go if your in Williamsburg! Excellent!

Came for dinner visiting NY beautiful restaurant.  Food was very good and all home made even the pasta was made there.  Overall I enjoyed everything and the ambiance is very quiet and chill.  Great spot to go on a date very romantic.  And all the food there is very authentic Italian!  Service also was very quick.

The food for brunch was fantastic but the service was subpar. Hostess was rude and the waiter couldn't have cared less. Mimosa pitchers turned out to be $40 each which was way too expensive for what it was. Not worth the visit and if they don't care about your. business them I wouldn't give it to them

Good service and nice atmosphere. Ordered the Ravioli, and must say it was a disappointment, 4 ravioli's for $22 not including tax or tip. Finished my meal in 3 minutes and couldn't help but think that each ravioli was $5.50 - on top of that the burrata filling was watery...

Ambiance and service were perfect. Food was good.  Nice wine selection. Sit outside before winter arrives!

Enjoyed this Brooklyn/Wilamsburg gem. Had the red snapper and Burratta with a friend and colleague. Staff was courteous, informative and attentive. Absolutely worth it.

Such a cute little place. Reminds me of a restaurant Flour + Water in SF. I had the Tagliatelle al Limone & it was sooo tasty!! We also had an artichoek salad which was alright. My friend had a meaty pasta I can't remember ( I don't eat meat) but she said it was good. We had flan for dessert which we normally don't care for but this was delicious! They gave us a little biscotti with the check. Reasonably priced and love the atmosphere. I'll be back next time I'm in Brooklyn.

What a joy is to have randomly found this place!! We were a group of 3 adults and 3 kids, which are welcome and very well trated, and they sat us down immediately. It did not take long for us to make our minds and the food arrived gracefully quick. I had  Morrel mushrooms and white shaved summer truffles pappardelle.... Im still speechless! Snapper was also to die for and the caramel compote with crushed dark chocolate was the final touch of excellency. Touché

my favorite restaurant, love everything about it, FOOD always standing and fresh, environment is so cozy, staff very nice and friendly. Very rustic look , love the decoration. I really recommend this place!! , i love every single dish one of the menu!

I always have a lovely meal here. The pastas are very well done and most made in house. The salads are always perfectly done, seasonal and on point. Love to go for their lunch prix fixe. I highly recommend this place. I return often.
