This place is amazing. One of the best meals I've had in a while. My girlfriend and I just moved to the neighborhood and have been trying a bunch of new spots, this and rabbit hole are tied for our favorite. The service, food and drink was perfect. And the portions were very generous which is rare in Brooklyn.

This is my staple go-to special celebration restaurant, because they are probably one of the few restaurants who does Italian fare like Italians. The food is fresh, pasta is fresh, wine list divine, atmosphere is enjoyable. Really like the place. The Aperol Spritz is also divine although I have since found a Manhattan competitor for this drink when I cannot make it across the river. Definitely go for the black truffle pasta, ragus, and the seafood mixta, and the tuna tartare. I've only been here for dinner, so my review is for such. Note my price includes a bottle of wine. Anything under $100 per head with wine in New York is as reasonable as it can get.

Tasty, delicious, seasonal, friendly, great look. Love the outdoor patio covered in vines. Love the changing menu. Good lives (I judge an Italian places based on their olive & cheese selection). A perfect spot for date night or catching up with a bunch of friends!

Had brunch here this afternoon - the dish was incredible, portion size was gigantic and flavor was intense. A little heavy on the grease/salt but that's also part of what made it so tasty so I can't complain, but I couldn't eat like that every day. We were given space to drink coffee and keep talking after finishing our food too which was nice. I'll definitely be back!
No comment

The worst risotto and restaurant. They say they put lobster in it, the lobster was not in it. If I was a lobster, I would get offended. The rice tasted like oatmeal, there was just one small little caviar. Massive plate with no food in it. Bartender was careless and unprofessional. He calculated the check wrong. There was a stem of a celery in the food. Procuitto was from deli, it said it is aged 2 years. Lies.  If you ever want to Italian food, cook it at home it would be much much better.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Amazing food. Great staff and service. You will never regret a meal here. Brought family from out of town and everyone is still talking about the meal. I was happy to spend $300+ here and plan on doing so again :)
No comment

Lovely late Saturday brunch. Had the scrabbled eggs with salmon and burratta, came very promptly and was as decent as other brunch spots in the area (so, average). Service was very good and prompt, and the outdoor covered seating with the greenery was pleasant.
Great food, we had an expired gift card that they still accepted.  would give 5 stars if they were on open-table / accepted reservations without a credit card.
No comment
Cute spot in the neighborhood, like the norwegian eggs.
No comment

This place is a solid 4 stars. Good food, good service, good ambience. we came in in a Saturday for brunch and there was no wait for outside seating ( lucky us!), so we got to bask in the sun while eating delicious Italian food. We'll definitely be here again!
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of my favorite restaurants in the neighborhood. Both brunch and dinner get five stars. The food is delicious. Service is always prompt and friendly, and the ambiance is great. I love the cozy inside and outdoor garden. It also never seems to get extremely crowded and it's actually a pretty good sized restaurant which I like. I hate sitting on top of people next to me. I hope they continue to impress me with their service and food because that's the key to having loyal customers.

2 weeks ago I had my Sunday afternoon wedding here.  I was looking for a rustic outdoor brooklyn wedding venue and found this on google.  The images I found from past weddings were so beautiful I had to check it out.  The food is all delicious and the portions are good.  The place itself is so pretty with the fresh ivy and exposed brick you don't need a lot of decorations.  I worked with Irene from their events team throughout the process and she was always there to answer any questions I had, plus she is super sweet.  My wedding was a perfect success and my friends and family couldn't stop talking about how lovely the place was and how amazing all the food was.

We recently had my son and daughter-in-law's rehearsal dinner here. It was amazing! I know it might be hard to believe but every piece of the puzzle was perfect. First, the seating was beautifully done. The waiter was attentive and patient, the drinks and food some of the best I have ever had. Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!
Went here for dinner not too long ago. Restaurant has a nice space in the garden. The pasta special and appetizers were tasty and drinks were good. Great date spot.
The owner called me up and made everything right. I'm looking forward to going back and eating off the regular menu. The burratta and fresh pasta are amazing.

We had our wedding reception here so of course I love the food.  Whenever we come, we get the grilled octopus.  The beet salad is good. The stuffed french toast is a must. The pasta/ragu is yummy. The risotto croquettes are ok; I guess they're not my thing.  Great servers. Pleasant setting.  The inside is beautiful but I also like to sit in their garden area
No comment

Went to Aurora Williamsburg with a group of friends after visiting Aurora soho for brunch a few weeks ago And reading all the great reviews about their dinner,upon entrance we were seated by a lovely hostess , we decided to sit outside in the garden area , we were greater by  Micheali our waiter who was wonderful , unfortunately it was kind of chilly so we requested to move to indoor seating , which was accommodated , we then had a new waitress Danielle who was horrible , she lacked customer service skills and she was very unprofessional , she treated us like we were illiterate during the whole dinner we were uncomfortable, she barely  checked up on us to see how we liked our meal, at the end when it was time to leave , we paid our bill and gave her a tip that we feel she deserved based on service, she berated us In front of the whole restaurant , stating "you paid $200 for a meal and this all I get?i don't want this " and handed back the tip , we were very shocked and then proceeded to speak to the manager who was very nonchalant  about the situation , I am very disappointed , after reading all of the wonderful reviews I thought this would be a nice place to have authentic Italian food, the dinner was ok , my friends weren't to fond of their meals, I had the lamb chops which were ok , portions are small we ended up having to go to a bar after and order food because we weren't satisfied, the pollo seemed to be the best meal at our table ... I definitely would not be coming back to this place again, It was a totally  different experience from Aurora Soho which was actually nice... Go to The Soho Location if you really want to try this place out!
No comment
Beautiful interior, nice wine selection and dinner as well, but I am just not a huge fan of nyc table next to table dining, and this place is like many others, close quarters.
No comment

Every time I have eaten at Aurora with a man, we have ended up in a hearty naked romp together afterward.  I'm not quite sure why this is, but it -might- have something to do with hefty wine selections, homemade pasta, and outdoors.  News like this is worth sharing.

Consistently great place. Fun environment, excellent food. The specials are truly special with real truffles in season, great wine list, I've returned many times and look forward to going back. This is what great casual dining is all about.

This is a really good Italian restaurant in Williamsburg.  I had the garganelli and my date had the ravioli.  Both were great dishes.  I love the spice of the sauce on the garganelli.  The pasta was cooked perfectly.  The pesto on the ravioli was awesome.  We also had a bottle of wine.  I'm not sure what varietal it was as my date picked it, but it was a red wine from Sardinia.  It was also pretty good and went really well with my pasta.

First, let me say that this place is very cute and charming and the people were very friendly and accomodating. The outdoor garden is very pretty and inviting and the service was fine. Having said that, I was very disappointed with the meal that my son and I had due to the portion size. My husband and I have had countless brunches in Williamsburg and have generally been pleased, and more often than not very happy with our meals. We often find them to be too much food for one sitting. However, our brunch at Aurora, which has excellent reviews, was not what we expected. I ordered the eggs and potatoes with a salad and when they brought our food, I immediately noticed that the potatoes were four small pieces (about a half inch or less each). I remarked that I guess they ran out of potatoes. The eggs were fine, but not great. I did see people around us with what looked like great pasta dishes so I would probably go back to try that. I have a feeling that they don't do typical American style brunch as well as their other meals. I have only written one or two Yelp reviews and have never complained about portion size but I felt that this needed to be noted.
No comment
No comment

I attended a wedding reception here. The food was fantastic--tasty servings of steak, ravioli, and salad. The desserts were also delicious. And to top it off, the staff were very patient with the rowdy guests, bringing us specialty cocktails and coffee drinks for hours! Would definitely recommend renting out the restaurant for events. The combination of excellent food, a beautiful interior/outdoor patio and great service is worth it.
No comment
Beautiful place. Amazing food. Good service. You can spend hours in the outdoor garden. Remember to try the espresso ice cream dessert!

You know those Italian restaurants that charge you a lot of money for not a lot of food... Aurora is one of those restaurants. That being said, the staff was very friendly, and the ambiance was great. The space is very beautiful... I only wished that I left feeling like I had gotten my moneys worth.

We ate here a year or so ago when my dad came to town and it was a real treat.  I raved about it.  That's why when Thanksgiving rolled around this year and everyone seemed to be doing their own thing, my fiance and I decided to sign-up for the $45 prix-fixe and let someone else cook the turkey for a change.  After a cold, small, sad and expensive (the cheap wine sucked, so we we forced into ordering the one that was $11/glass)  Thanksgiving dinner, we've decided it would be best to handle the cooking ourselves next year.

Aurora is a delicious little spot in Williamsburg.  It's a great place to take friends from other neighborhoods or your parents for brunch when they're visiting for the weekend.  Both the brunch and dinner menus are solid.  I really haven't had a bad experience here.  The vanilla and orange french toast brioche is heavenly and you can't go wrong with the eggs any style as well.  For dinner, I haven't met a pasta I didn't like.  I highly recommend a visit.

Great setting, great food, great prices!  Pretty simple yet seemingly rare combination in the 5 boroughs... Usually 1 of those 3 is lacking, but Aurora pulls it off.  Can't really think of anything negative to throw in here, yes the service can be a little laid-back at times, but I think it sort of adds to the whole chilled out vibe of the place. I have been repeatedly and look forward to going back.

Top notch Italian.  This isn't your red sauce Italian restaurant that plagues Little Italy and most of America.  this is legit,  home cooked Italian cooking.  Rotating menu depending on time of year keeps the food fresh.  Tagliatelle with the special ragu of the day is a winner as is the meat/olive/cheese combo to start.  Also a very nice wine list with helpful sommeliers.  Definitely hit this up, so much better than Al Di La.
Beautiful rustic place, excellent brunch. The french toast is extremely good.
No comment

Four of us had brunch on a hot Sunday. My wife said the Tagliatelle Ragu was sensational. The French toast was unusual but among the best I've ever had. Unfortunately, the bacon ordered with it, came 20 minutes later and was so full of fat it was almost inedible. The egg plate came with bacon, sausage and other goodies and was also very good. The place was interesting with brick walls, an outdoor garden area with tables and a bar in front. Very relaxing atmosphere and friendly staff. The service needs work. The carafe of water brought to the table was warm. The dinner menu showed Italian food & I'd like to come back and try it. Food was basically very good with some misses that can be cleared up easily if they want to.
No comment
No comment

First of all, the food here is really good (I could go for the watermelon salad with basil, goat cheese and olives at this moment) but it's a little bit pricey for the area especially given that there are a number of very good Italian spots in the neighborhood (I haven't been for a little while but seem to recall the wines being pretty expensive). Some of the staff can be removed at times (I've come across a few aspiring models/actors who, while very good-looking, could stand to be nicer) The decor is beautiful, though, and it's a romantic spot, perfect for special occasions.

Simply my favorite place to brunch, and when I feel like treating myself I go for dinner. The wine list is excellent. My favorite dishes are L'Inglese for and the penne with eggplant and bufala mozzarella.
apple compote-stuffed brioche french toast with VT maple syrup, candied hazelnuts and mascarpone-even better the second time around.
No comment

Aurora is by far my favorite restaurant in Williamsburg. Cozy atmosphere, friendly service and of course the food! Since they change the menu often you may never have the same thing twice. High quality ingredients and seasonal produce make for an exciting menu.
No comment
Great-looking place, romantic and classy, yet casual. It has a nice pseudo-outdoor seating area, covered glass, and a good wine selections. Mostly authentic and very delicious tuscan food.
Nice place, lotsa charm.  Burger was tasty but small.  Didn't get the chance to taste them but the eggs benedict looked fracking amazing!!

Great spot for Italian food. Ordered a sunchoke soup and sauteed clams with chorizo, saffron, tomato broth as starter and then a gnocchi with oxtail special and GF got the lamb shank with goatcheese croquettes. Everything was out of this world! Pasta is made fresh, portions are served in large plates/bowls which is a good trick on the mind. Our server was great, very attentive despite the busy weekend crowd. The decor is up my alley: dark woods, exposed brick, dimmly lit. I work around the corner from the one in SoHo and much prefer the ambiance here. Nice small bar at the entrance if you're looking for a quick drink before enjoying the rest of Williamsburg, but by all means a restaurant setting. If you're looking for an authentic Italian treat this is a nice gem in one of my favorite hoods. Great job!
No comment

3 words: Orange Vanilla French-Toast [you like how I hyphenated that to keep it in the 3 word limit? I'm so sly]  Brunch here is fantastic.  Like I've previously mentioned the orange vanilla french-toast is delicious and their burger is TOP NOTCH [if you don't like cilantro--maybe parsley--don't get it]  And the burger comes with amazing fries, what's not to like?  I've also had the baked eggs, not my favorite but I think it was an ordering mistake on my part.  I have a weakness for avocado.  Dinner is equally as amazing.  I've had the gnocchi, the steak [DELICIOUS] and the ravioli which I would reccommend.  And you can't beat the outdoor seating, very cool atmosphere.

From the week Aurora opened (yes, we remember W'burg from back in the day) the restaurant has excelled at the small touches - near perfect lighting, widely spaced tables, the gracious opening note of a complimentary amuse bouche. For starters, 2 can more than amply split the charcutier platter, though you'll both fight over the house-made smoother-than-silk pate and lucious mortadella. We tend to order exclusively from the wide selection of daily specials - favorites include a very tender octopus salad and grilled quail. Many extra bonus points for- post dining - the largest selection in Brooklyn of small batch and rare grappas.
No comment
No comment

This cash only restuarant has a large and fabulous garden area, which makes lounging over coffe and amari with a friends a delicious Sunday treat. While I love the sophsticated menu  (duck rag or saffron tagliatelle with prawns) each time I've been here, I always get the same thing - the scallops. Yummmm.... The price is a little higher than the rest of Williamsburg's dining options, but I find it's worth it. Make sure you be nice to the staff - they're all sweet, patient and very competent. This is great place for take your parents when they come to down or meet your blind date for that all important first rendevous.

Every place has it's one dish that you order and mine is the shrimp and pasta entree. Tangy and spicy, it is best eaten on the patio. That said the staff could be nicer and the cash only policy (yes, yes I know there is an ATM) makes me think of the mob.

My very first night in Brooklyn could not have been more perfect...all thanks to dining here at Aurora.  The atmosphere was beautiful yet relaxed.  The food was simply amazing...especially paired with the perfect bottle of wine -- or bottles of wine -- in this case.  I have yet to find a place here in California to compare to the experience I had at Aurora.

Our table of 4 started w zucca di fiori, which were stuffed w sweet ricotta, pate di fegato which was buttery smooth & topped w peppercorns, & a fig compote on the side, & 2 plates of Pulpo con ceci. All of which greatly exceeded expectations & I would highly recommend. For primi, one diner had perfectly roasted coniglio-absolutely succulent. Another had the pasta al Ragú, which was very good. The 3rd diner had the special chestnut pasta with pork and veal.-very rustic and again very good. The chestut pasta had a real nice bite to it. I had the agnolotti ai piselli w mushrooms, & pea sprouts. This dish was fresh & spring-like. Perfect for an cool early summer evening. All together, I think I found a new italian 'cucina' that makes it into my top choices list.

Aurora is such a great standby.  Adorable place, warm & friendly, good food.  Pastas are very good and decent wine selection.  I discovered brunch here recently and loved my experience.  Cute garden area, delicious french toast and friendly waitstaff.  Very affordable too.  Love it!
No comment
Good food and wine.  A great date place...very good ambiance with candlelight and brick walls.  I'd like to go back during the summer for outdoor dining.  Cash only though folks.

I had an excellent Friday afternoon at Aurora yesterday sitting the garden. They have some superb wines and the halibut on the menu that day was excellent; very well prepared. I also appreciated that they served food through the afternoon. There was not a point where you could not order off the lunch menu. I also enjoyed the service and am looking forward to returning.

How have I lived in Brooklyn for seven years and am only now discovering this place? Our plates ranged from good to fantastic. Everything we tasted was a special, and the favorite had to be the figs with ricotta. It tasted more decadent than ice cream. Well-priced wines were delicious, lemon torte was heavenly, and we even devoured the bread--there was something special in that dipping oil! Certainly not convenient to get to if you don't live in the area. Cash only is a pain at these prices, but the quality of cuisine is really high for the cost. A worthy splurge. Very well may be five stars if I can get back.

The best brunch place in Brooklyn, ever.  Don't you just love to have both juice and coffee for your brunch? The place has it. Fresh food, fresh juice and fresh coffee, all included in your entree.The place also recognizes your name after you made one reservation and you get the royal treatment! Thanks again for the greatest Williamsburg brunch experience.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Would recommend to all.  One of the very top Italian Restaurants on my list in NYC.

I had no idea this place was so popular, the gift certificate my mom got me for xmas last december sat in my room for 9 mos.  When my brother came to town I thought I'd take him and his lady friend out for a nice meal.  Wow was I surprised, this place was really good. especially the burratta.  duck 2 ways was really nice and my brother really liked the uni and red mullet linguine.  only thing i wasnt impressed with was the orrechiette with brocolli rabe and sausage.  where were the hot peppers in this rather soupy dish i mean way too watery.

Yummy yummy! I went here during restaurant week and had a fixed 3 course meal that was just delicious. The ambiance was great, dim lighting and a covered outdoor seating area made for a romantic setting. The service was friendly and attentive and we had an all around great dining experience.

This is one of my favorite places in Williamsburg. It is a rustic restaurant with a lovely rosegarden/atrium off to the side. The crowd tends to be a bit older than the typical Billyburg crew and the food is fantastic. Have eaten here twice, and both times enjoyed the food greatly. Just be prepared to wait 20-30 min beyond your reservation on a weekend. Last time I was there, I was pleasantly surprised by the tagliatelle a limone, which was a fantastic pasta dish. We had the rice croquettes as an appetizer, which were ok.  I have yet to try their dessert, but have enjoyed the cocktails.

The food is always good and it's a very romantic spot.  Go with someone you love and stare into their eyes for hours because it is SLOW FOOD, esp. if you order more than one course.  But if you have the time and the amorato, eat up.  Perfect garden setting.  Also, I love a place that offers a cheese plate for desert.  They do seafood nicely.

This place is most certainly one of my staple go to restaurants. The food is always spectacular, consistent and fresh. They have wonderful specials that change consistently. The ambiance is casual and romantic, a great place to have a date night. Dinner here is highly recommended, and during the week there is a great $25.00 prix fixe, which consists of appetizer, entree, dessert and a glass of wine. There pastas are great, and so are the fish entrees, and as for dessert I always go, either with the affogato or the panna cotta.
great food. service decent... really great outdoor eating during the summer. I have heard this place can be hit or miss, but I have yet experience the miss.

Aurora is one of the best kept secrets in Williamsburg.  I hate to even review it. lest people start taking the L train out and ruin it.  BUT it is definitely worth the trip for some excellent Italian fare with a terffic atmosphere.  In the summer you can dine outdoors.  Cash only.
No comment

I just had the prixe fix lunch here.  For $20, it was a great deal with wine, salad, main course (pasta dish) and a delicious coffee & ice cream dessert.  The atmosphere is rustic and charming and the server was personable and unobtrusive (we were having a business meeting so this was good.)  This was the nicest meal I've had in Williamsburg in years.  I can't wait to go back.

Incredible food.  hands down amazing food. Had the suckling pig last night.  all the pasta dishes are cooked to perfection.  the tuna appetizer, cheese plate and mushroom salad all blew us away.  wine is a bit hit or miss.  I was in love with the sangiovese by the glass.  we'll be back!

Went here last Saturday night for my husband's birthday dinner -- there were 8 of us, we were pretty high-maintenance and the wait-staff could not have been more professional, helpful and courteous. Food was DELICIOUS -- the gnocchi to die for. The bill took a while to come and it's a shame it's cash only but otherwise this is a winner in the neighborhood.
No comment

Had dinner there last night on a whim. everything we ordered was amazing. Fresh, interesting, and perfect portion.  Was extremely satisfied and wouldnt hesitate to recommend this place to friends.  Sat outside in the greenhouse portion of the outdoor space.  The decor is nice, typical well executed reclaimed industrial,  indoor and outdoor seating.  Oh, and for those reviewers that complained about small portion size, I suggest finding yourselves an olive garden, you may find the 'all u can eat' salad and breadsticks more along your line.  This place was a real treat and I look forward to eating there again next time I am out in the area
Went for brunch and really enjoyed it.  Good drinks and tasty food.  Corned Beef Hash!  Also the interior of the place is super cute.
Comfortable authentic Italian.    Prices good for the area, food was first class. Superb Italian wines at good prices too.   Pasta with truffles as good as it gets.

I first came to this place for brunch, was incredibly impressed! A few months later decided to give dinner a try here and was totally blown away! This place has a lovely ambiance and great service. The food is exceptional!!  Literally EVERYTHING is good. I would come back here again for sure!
No comment

Had a delightful dinner at the garden area, which is nicely shield from the sourrounding buildings, The appetiizer bread is awesome, moist and soft inside and slightly crunchy outside, I love to pair bread with olive oil. I tried 2 wonderful appetizers and both of them are made with very fresh, simple ingredients, and chesse revioli as main dish, it was too oily and solitary, I would prefer to have 2-3 pieces of olives or cherry tomatos, or paresly. Overall it is a great place, nice staffs, not too interruptive but helpful and serve with courtesy.

I've eaten here a few times over the years, taken everyone from my girlfriend to business colleagues, and they've all enjoyed. Really nice atmosphere, food is fantastic, paying with cash isn't a big deal because they have an ATM. It's nice because the place has top of the line food but it isn't super fancy.
I love their patio.  Summer can get a little hot but Spring and Fall and Summer evenings are wonderful.
Very charming atmosphere, perfect spot to tuck in for a quiet dinner.

I was doing a foodie tour with friends who happen to be Chef's from Italy and New Orleans and so the Italian wanted to hit this spot. I really liked the atmosphere, and the food was top notch. Worth the cab ride from the city. A sensational experience.
Went to this place for my bday nite and had an amazing excellent food and atmosphere- couldn't be better. I'll definitely come back soon.

The atmosphere and food here have been great every time I've gone.  I had one decent-but-not-great experience, but I'm chalking it up to an off night, because I've re-ordered those items since and they've been spot on. Go for the burrata for sure, and the Garganelli Al Ragù.

Ce here for brunch. Burger was out of this world-one of the best I've had (but pretty salty). Lobster salad was pretty good-could have had more avocado and something citrus (orange, grapefruit) would have been a good touch. Bloody Mary was great and refreshing. Service was very attentive.

I did not enjoy my experience to this place at all.  Decided to check it out for a friends birthday.  Can you get less bang for your buck than at this place?  Talk about overpriced.  You will pay $30 for about 4 square inches of food.  Also add on top of that, the food isn't all that good.  The best part of the meal was the onion bread they served before dinner.  We got there and tried to order two different appetizers (the flatbread and some cheese dish) and they were out of both of them.  It was a Saturday night at 7 p.m.  How could you be out of them?  I tried a bunch of different dishes the pork sausage ($12 for 2 inches of food), the ravioli which was not cooked to be tender, and the pasta with bolognese sauce which was also not tender.  I don't think I will be going back here.

Think intimate and romantic rustic Italian food when coming to this Williamsburg restaurant. The charming restaurant is ideal for a date, with warm corners and an elegant garden. They have this creamy fresh burrata that is served with eggplant and chunks of salt in it that is incredible. in addition, the branzino is also spectacular. They have a rather extensive wine list, but it's summer and we fell in love with rose this season. Of note, like most places in Williamsburg, this place is cash only! There is also a location in Soho, but the Williamsburg one is the original and in our mind the best (though they do take credit cards and reservations).
Nice terrace... Great food!! Some of the better Italian in NYC!!
Very good brunch, and  excellent service.  The sun room is also very pleasant to eat in.  Would go back any time.
No comment

Great place.  The menu is solid...but it didn't blow me away.  The wine list was average - but it did contain 2 names that I truly enjoy.  What makes this place worth going to is the quality level of service and the very classy atmosphere.

First let me say that I have had a few good meals here as well as a few so-so ones.  The service has always been decent and fairly knowledgeable.  Last night's experience was less than stellar.  In NYC, 10:30 on a Saturday night is too early for a restaurant to run out six dishes on their small menu, yet somehow they managed to do so. At  least two specials, three of their pasta dishes and one of their mains were finished for the night.  So basically diners like my wife and myself were left to order other dishes- that in the end, weren't even prepaired that well.  The best thing I had  was the mixed olive, cheese and meat plate($18) and my $12 glass of wine.  Just a big bummer with a big price tag.

Had the pumpkin ravioli - nice. The gnocchi was good too. Prices are reasonable. If you go back sometimes the menu changes and you cant get the same thing. Wait staff was a little too quick even though no one was waiting for tables. And on a Friday nite at 8pm there were quite a few toddlers. You had to walk past a lot of baby carriages to get to your table.
DELIGHTFUL!!!  Every time better and better!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I feel  bad when a place I being enjoying over the years drop their standards in order of keep functioning . The place is the same very warm dark wood tables , and a yard you could really enjoy . But the food have suffered the effects of economics , some of the ingredients that make them distinctive on past are now missing .

Beautiful interior, nice waiters, fresh products, I definitely recommend Aurora's brunch ! Very good value for money ! The freshly-squeezed orange juice coming with my Eggs Benedict was excellent. I loved the black truffle on the top of them, it was just perfect!

aurora is refreshingly unhipster. it's quaint and feels very real italian and the service is nice and attentive. the food is also quite delicious. i think all the dishes we ordered were specials and they felt very special.

Loved it so much that we went again last night and unfortunately didn't have the same food experience. No problem with service however. Ordered the pizzette and instead of speck was prosciutto. Normally this would be fine, but it was flavorless. It needed the speck, and in hindsight I should have said something. The grilled octopus was a small serving and just okay. No one ordered pasta and perhaps this was the problem. I ordered the fish special branzino, and while good and filling, it didn't wow me. The beer was flat, so they removed it from the bill. Overall, just ok. I would stick with the pasta next time.

I met a friend here for brunch today and was thoroughly impressed. We took advantage of their brunch special - $15 for eggs benedict and 1 strong ass bloody mary. My friend's eggs were WAY overdone, which made me feel a little bad because my shit was perfectly done and fucking delicious. Service was quite good, and oh mah gawd, the space is GORGEOUS. Can't wait to try this spot out for dinner.

four stars but with a caveat.  the offerings of wine by the glass left something to be desired.  the porchetta entree was flavored deliciously  but was essentially a pinwheel of pork fat.  you might carve out 4-5 bites of fat-free pork if you are lucky.  my wife disagrees with my flattering take on the porchetta-- she pushed back her plate after two bites and declared the main feature and accoutrements "greasy and inedible."  i just loved my orecchiette with sausage, kale and fennel pollen.  just pure comfort food at its best.  creamy cheesy goodness. aurora's riff on tiramisu was average.  skim milk is not available for cappuccino.  while it is still warm, definitely take advantage of the patio.  the twinkly lights and temperate breezes provide a perfect backdrop to usher in fall.  cash only.

I would say this place deserves 3.5 stars. I live around the block and came here for brunch with a friend who was visiting from out of town.  We ate in the garden, and it was fine...enjoyable, but nothing to rave about.  The menu is pretty limited and when my friend asked if they could prepare a plain omelette, they weren't accommodating.  I understand that not all places can accommodate special dietary needs, but it's something to keep in mind if you plan on going here. The food was fine, but like i said, nothing to write home about.  There are so many brunch places in the neighborhood, so I probably won't be returning.

Loved this place. Cute, cozy, rustic. We had reservations, seated immediately. Ordered drinks. Oddly, this little Italian place doesnt sell Sambuca. We ordered apps, which included: Burrata with Prosciutto and tomato bread,( which I duplicated in a better version of Tomato Jam with a Rosemary Olive Drizzle). Anyway, that was delish!. Burratta was fresh and creamy. We also orderd Lobster Mushroom Salad. Yes, I thought the lobster was missing and nitifed my waiter to find out its the type of mushroom and I shall NOT be getting lobster. Deliscous tho, with Grilled Radicchio and Shaved PArmesan drizzled with Truffle oil. We ordered the Special of Pan-seared Halibut on top of some puree, dont know what, which was on top of SOinach, finished with Rosemary olive oil drizzle and roasted garlic. Su-fucking-perb!! I never order fish out, but I will again. Dessert was so-so, no biggy. But, I dont go out to dinner for dessert. Staff attentive and friendly. Will go again!

I'm Italian, a life-long Williamsburg resident and definitely not a hipster. My mom and I have eaten here twice and enjoyed it both times. The burrata & prosciutto app was fabulous if pricey. We ordered the white wine from Ischia since my dad's family hails from that gorgeous Italian island. It was decent. I had the pasta with the pork ragu which was very good but very spicy.My mom had the pasta with osso bucco which is more of a meat sauce than normal osso bucco. Service was very good & friendly. An excellent choice for modern quality Italian in the neighborhood alibet expensive.

Aurora is my absolute favorite place to eat in Williamsburg. The ambiance, wait staff, and food are phenomenal. For dinner, the goat cheese ravioli with mushroom sauce is fantastic. For brunch, the Eggs Florentine is by far the best I have ever had. They have a comprehensive wine list and delicious desserts. Their outdoor garden is beautiful. I have yet to find a place in Williamsburg that compares.

went for lunch on a weekday.  food was excellent.  had 3 appetizers and each was very well flavored and texture was excellent.  we had the artichoke hearts, chestnut soup and flan with mushrooms.   my entree was phenomenal ... it was a braised beef with flat pasta... portions are adequate.  my friend had the gnocchi which was also excellent.  the atmosphere is also very nice...service excellent but we were there when it was pretty empty.

pasta ragu.. nuff said :) 1 star off only cause it can get expensive and they won't wrap up your leftovers to take your noms home.. but usually not a big issue because it rarely happens. but when it does.. I should be able to take it to go.

Me and a group of friends attended aurora thinking we were going to try a nice Italian restaurant for dinner. When we arrived we were first greeted by a great waiter micheali who was so pleasant then things quickly changed when Danielle took over she treated us so unpleasantly I've never in my entire life felt so uncomfortable at a restaurant. Most of the dishes  on the menu are in Italian one of us asked her to explain whats in the dish she said "You can read it, its written right there" she behaved as we were an inconvenience to the establishment no smiles, no good customer everything about this restaurant turned me off at this point. To put the icing on the cake we gave a tip we taught was appropriate and as i was walking out she screamed "Hey Hey" i stopped and she said loudly in front of all her colleagues and several other customers  your bill was $200 and this is all you leave as a tip i explained to her in a calm manner that's what i found appropriate your customer service was horrible she literally said well this isn't enough you can keep your money and handed me back my tip. I Requested to speak to the manager and he was very nonchalant  defending her saying she just came from India and all these other things. Never EVER Again! I Would never Recommend this place to a Soul. Your better off attending the bar right across the street!

awesome.  We used to live in the central village and would frequent the much hyped mario batali restaurants (Lupa, Babbo, Otto).  We discovered Aurora Soho and it was an immediate fav....surpassing all others in our opinion.  We're newly poor now and living in Williamsburg...regulars at aurora here.  The advantage in Williamsburg is that everyone else is poor too, and there are plenty of tables without hassle.  Don't even think about it, just go.  Before writing this I read the handful of negative reviews.  Morons.  Ignore.

Great food.  Been here a few times, just had my favorite meal ever last night which included the calamari and lamb stew.  Got to be sure to call ahead though.  Those without reservations could wait for hours, especially once the weather's nice.

their sqaush soup was delicious. but besides that it wasn't really worth the money. the main dinner was lacking in size and taste, but the bread is delicious. maybe we just caught them on a bad day considering the rest of the reviews were great.

i cannot believe this place got such a good review here and on zagat.  I went to two of their locations and their food sucks.  The place was completely empty when we first got there and they told some people it will be an hour wait, where we sat down for dinner but nobody arrives for another 2 hours.  The food is certainly not worth the price.  Really bad italian food.  try scopello.
Ate there last night. I have always had a great experience there. The risotto was horrible. Undercooked and very watery. Stay away from it.
Amazing food, authentic, crazy wine list, romantic, love the specials
good lunch time spot in the spring or summer they have a nice out door space food is tasty but the service is very slooooowwwww!

The wife and I ate here on a gorgeous night and had a fantastic meal. I started with an octopus appetizer that really worked for me. The octopus had just a touch of char on it that I really enjoyed. It went well with the mixed herbs, roasted tomatoes, and olives that accompanied it. It wasn't amazing, but it was definitely very good. For my main I went with the mint, English pea, ricotta filled pasta. I found this dish to be outstanding. Each little ravioli was a packet of yum. I worried it might be a bit heavy, but I was way off. The mint gave the filling a very light taste and the sauce was just perfect for a summer night. Plump warm cherry tomatoes and thinly sliced squash helped lighten things further and added to the overall fresh feel of the dish. I loved this! My wife ordered a three milk cheese for an appetizer (which our friendly waitress suggested after my wife showed an interest in the cheese specials) and it was knock your socks off good. Her main was a pasta dish with pesto and mozzarella. She enjoyed it. I tried it, but liked mine a lot more. Besides our food, the waitress was a sweetheart and the timing was superb. We never felt rushed or pestered. Overall, pretty darn impressive.

Very nice restaurant. Very good service. Food was certainly good and menu offered unique flares. Bar was lacking in selections as they would prefer that you consume wine over their fare. Nice patio area but interior seating is just as nice. Would definitely recommend
Been several times now and have not been disappointed.  Although the fish was a bit dry on my last visit, the pasta and primi have always been great!  Quality ingredients and great wine selection!

I've been going to Aurora for a few years now, it's always been consistent. Good brunch, good dinner, good ambience. Menu is changed seasonally. One of the few places where dessert is not a complete afterthought.

A long time standard bearer for Williamsburg. Great rustic Italian food and an excellent outdoor garden. Perfect outdoor dinning if the weather is not too hot. Only complaint he last time was the server was a bit slow.
No comment

We've been here a few times for brunch, and once for dinner.  The brunch is really fantastic, especially if you can sit in the greenhouse room.  The mean we had for dinner was really tasty, maybe a little bit on the salty side.  Great restaurant, and we will definitely be back.

I have been here for dinner before, very delish, love the wine selection, but finally went here for brunch yesterday.  It definitely hit the spot.  The garden patio was filled with warm sunlight and I got the eggs benedict which comes with coffee and brunch cocktail for $15, can't beat it!  Coffee was really good, eggs benedict with an Italian twist was totally satisfying and the bloody mary was spicy but not too overwhelming.  I will definitely be adding this to my regular rotation of brunch spots. Thank you Aurora for consistently serving up deliciousness!

This is the best restaurant in Williamsburg. I eat there 3 times a week (probably a bit much;). But, they're constantly changing their menu with seasonal / local and organic food, amazing quality, and the chef and staff are fantastic. Check out the specials... always amazing in addition to the regular menu.

Great place with great service!  I went there numerous time and always was happy, although my friend complained that portions are rather small and cash only!  Food is good, wine is good.  Last time we sat at the bar, ate some appertizers and salad with wine, it was saturday night and the place was packed.  Definatelly make a reservation!

I absolutely love everything about this restaurant. From the appearance to their great service to their delicious food. I went there this Valentines day with my boyfriend for the first time. We had reservations for 9:15. At 9:25 we didn't have a table yet so they gave us each a glass of champagne and apologized. At this point I didn't even mind I was waiting. Once we got our table a little while after the waitress was very nice and caring.  I ordered chicken and my boyfriend ordered steak and they were both delicious!

Aurora is a very special place for my husband and me. We have always loved the incredibly delicious food, beautiful, rustic decor and great service. This past July we celebrated my parents' 42nd wedding anniversary at Aurora and 2 weeks ago my husband and I got married in Aurora's picturesque outside space. Jessica coordinated the entire event and was able to create the most beautiful, intimate, chill wedding. We wanted to have a small, laid back, beautiful wedding with good food, good wine and celebrate with our dearest friends and family and that's exactly what Jessica created for us. She surpassed all our hopes for our special day. Everything was so easy and lovely. Perhaps I'm a bit biased, but it was the most perfect, beautiful wedding I've ever been to. Jessica worked with my lovely friend who did the flowers to make sure that the tables and lighting and garlands looked perfect. Emanuele oversaw the food and wine and made sure that everything came out smoothly. Everyone who attended raved about the food, wine and ambiance. Thank you, Aurora for giving us our dream wedding! We feel very lucky to have started our married life together with the loveliest, most memorable evening of our lives.

The food was very good as I expected, however the service was very inattentive.  However, I decided to try dessert because I love a great tiramisu and this one was AMAZING!  I also had a cup of tea with it that went perfectly.  I would recommend the tea to anyone who is looking for something great to go with their meals, this tea is amazing!

Went for a lovely evening's dinner with an out of town visitor.  Not needing an outside table we were graciously seated indoors.  The place was hopping.  After placing drink orders we waited around 20 minutes and finally asked if we might be served some bread as we perused the menu.  Selections were made from a very ambitious menu.  A shared order of pan fried seafood was delicious.  Salads likewise.  All pasta orders were off.  A special had vegetables, notably zucchini which was so bitter and off tasting that it had to be pushed to the side of plate.  The other dishes - so salty - and would've been sent back, had anyone bothered to ask how the food was.  We did not have dessert and departed.  Later that evening two out our party of three were sick all night.  Will not be returning no matter how charming the decor, garden and the staff.  The kitchen needs to tweak up it's efforts both in it's preparation and quality of the food - which was way overpriced for what was served.  Having gotten sick on cooked food I am happy that we didn't eat anything raw there.  Also noticed a staff member use an ice cream scoop that was in the wash up sick to scoop some ice cream onto a pie just before serving. UGH!!!

Have been wanting to come to Aurora for quite some time, and finally stopped by this morning (6/15) for brunch.  It was a beautiful day and while their patio was pretty packed, there were still open tables outside and many more inside.  We asked to sit on the patio and the hostess said it would be 5 minutes.  After a few minutes we said that we would just sit inside, near the open windows if possible.  The hostess looked at us blankly and in a dead monotone replied, "well we don't have any menus for you, so there is no point in sitting inside if you can't have menus."  We then asked if we could be seated, regardless, and she again blankly stared at us and coldly said, "what is the point of sitting if you have no menus."  My boyfriend asked her why, when there were about 15 tables open inside, the restaurant had already run out of menus.  She responded "because the outside is crowded" and subsequently turned her back.  I am not one to create scenes or walk out of restaurants, but that was enough for us to walk out.  Aurora seems like a good spot (great menu, nice bar area, nicely decorated outdoor seating area), but I have no interest in supporting such poor customer service (or really, people skills).
food was ok-price was crazy- i just dont understand the hype
No comment

We came at a down time around midday for the restaurant week deal. The ambiance was really nice and neat with an attractive theme to the restaurant. I loved the wood and metal theme with warm lighting. The food was good but nothing spectacular, it seemed that a few things were not top of the line for a place that is 3 $$$ on google so thankfully the restaurant week deal made it seem more appropriate. The crispy chicken for example wasn't crispy as with the side fries, the tortilla for the tacos also seemed mediocre. Service was solid. If I were to ever go back it would be for the atmosphere.

Stayed at the hotel and dined here for breakfast. Unfortunately the meal was just very meh. Coffee was very light and watery, grapefruit juice as good, my egg sandwich entree was disappointing. I asked for eggs over medium but it came out pretty runny. Bacon in the sandwich was undercooked and chewy, and the sandwich had a strange mix of sautéed vegetables on it? Side of potatoes were also bland. Restaurant itself is nice, bright and inviting. Unfortunately the food didn't match the ambiance.
No comment
No comment

Meh. Went for lunch, and was underwhelmed. First off if you're gonna charge $20 or more for a main plate it better be better than the $6 Gyro on 8th street and 3rd. BTW that's a high bar as far as I'm concerned as I am a big fan of street meat.   Anyway, it wasn't. The presentation meh. The food meh. The service meh. The prices waaaaaaaayyyyy to high for what you get, and the atmosphere meh. So meh meh mehhy meh. It wasn't bad; it just wasn't worth it. Not going back, but will go to the gyro guy on St. Marks and 3rd.
No comment
Food was amazing!!!! Also service was on point Michael was our server and was very attentive and gave great recommendations 10/10 would recommend!
No comment

I wish I could rate the service and the food separately. For the service, I would give a 1, and food a 4-5. We came in on a Wednesday, about 10 of us. We had a reservation, and the place was pretty empty. It took 30-45 minutes to get a drink, and the food was slow too. The server didn't seem to care about taking our orders, or cleaning anything up. He just kept leaving everything on the table, so we ended up having a big stack or dishes and glasses just sitting there. The humus, fries, sundae, and pizzas were very good though. Don't order a margarita or Cosmo, both were very tart.
No comment

I went with my friend, and we ordered two appetizers and one main to share. All three, Roasted Brussels Sprouts, Roasted Cauliflower, and Branzino, were amazing and cooked to perfection. I would order the same three dishes again if I go back. Brussels sprouts were well seasoned and cooked thoroughly, leafy part tender and center part still retaining the texture. Cauliflowers were juicy, complemented by the garnishes. I was pleasantly surprised to find mayonnaise as the sauce, but great nonetheless. The only complaint I'd have would be the portion size for branzino. While I'm aware we shared a single main dish, but if I were to eat the whole thing by myself, I'd still want a little bigger size for the price. Still it was grilled well, the outside crispy and inside soft and juicy. I'd recommend this place for a fancy dinner spot. The cocktail was good too, but the food was definitely more worthy.

Nothing special here brunch wise but it is great if you want to make a big group reservation last minute since the place is nice and isn't too busy. The food is simple and plain but overall totally fine. Wouldn't come again most likely.

The bar was nice. Drinks were fine. Food was terrible. Granted, I only had two appetizers, but they were awful. Don't get the meatballs, they must be made out of rubber, not only with the consistency but the flavor. And as for the fried chicken appetizer, I've chewed on jerky more tender. Definite no. You can get their bar anywhere else in the city.

A good meal if you're in the area.  The room is spacious, located on first floor of a hotel.  The cocktails were surprisingly good. The entrees were tasty and the service was attentive.  We might return if we're in the area, but nothing stood out.
No comment
No comment

A beautiful space right next to the Hyatt House. I came to Bowery on two occasions, once for dinner and once for breakfast. I had the chicken sandwich for dinner, which lacked much flavor and were it not for the quality of the meat would not have been a good value. The huevos rancheros for breakfast was much better. The service was also great, and there were very few customers both times.

Came in last night with 8 of my friends for after dinner drinks and were turned away it seems by a Eastern European woman manager.  She said, "we are not accepting walk ins at this point."  It was around 9:30pm and the business in dining room and bar seemed to be slowing.  I have been in the hospitality business for over 20 years working for organizations like STARR, Jean George and other chef driven groups and we would never turn away extra business.  I just saw a 10 top at the back of the bar, against the wall clear and that could of been an ideal place for my party.  I also noticed at least 5 tables cleared and not sat so I felt they didn't have any other reservations on the books.  There were also at least 3 barstools open at the bar with the walkway cleared.  I am generally not a bad review person, but I felt this needed to be brought to attention as most of my party was Asian and some of them feeling it was because of that we got turned away.  I am currently a Director within the hospitality community in NYC and will be letting my colleagues know about this experience.  Please do better Bowery Road.

THE BEST CHICKEN PAILLARD! Dinner last night pre-movie I had eaten at the location when it was something else, so I wasn't sure but did it for convenience. Service was great food was terrific. I will make it my go to spot when I go to the movies! And will probably order the same dish. The apple crumble was right up there too.

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

Surprisingly excellent gourmet meals at a reasonable price. Recommend salmon, Bronzino,chicken Pollard, crispy chicken sandwich.  Service was very attentive.  More people should know about this jewel.
Place was empty but the skirt steak was one of the best I've ever had. So tender and well seasoned. My friend had the rigatoni and said it was really good. The tuna tartare app was just ok.

I came here with a friend, the vibe was casual, low key; one table was having a work meeting, it's a good place to meet friends. I got the Pina Brava which was like a spicy pineapple margarita, it was medium spicy, delicious. We shared the zucchini chips, it was good, but on the small side for 2 ppl to share. I also got the Bowery Burger with sea salt fries, it was excellent. I saw some negative reviews of the service but it seemed fine to me.

i gone here for a dinner, and i liked the soy ginger fried chicken very much . Grain Bowl is filled with healthy nutrition . they maintained good food quality and unique taste . The Service was good by staff while eating. Great restaurant . must visit .
No comment
No comment

The hang over from Saturday nearly killed me! Bowery road saved me!! I needed food, was so hungry! Came across this place. It is an amazing cute place. The place is clean and the service was fast. The food was great.
No comment

No comment
No comment

Great experience with Bowery Road for a bridal shower. The food and service were incredible. Jacqueline responded quickly to all our questions before the event, and Shira and Hannah went above and beyond during the party! Would definitely recommend having an event here.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

By the time you see this review, I'll have stayed at the Hyatt Union Square for 83 nights and have had breakfast/brunch at Bowery Road dozens of times. Besides the free Globalist breakfast, what really keeps me coming back are the thoughtful, caring and attentive set of staff you've managed to hire. Mayte has been nothing but kind and her presence gives me something to look forward to on every visit. It's obvious that everyone respects her and I'm looking forward to visiting once I'm no longer a hotel guest!
No comment

I came at an odd hour between going to the bookstore nearby and a show, it was nice to get off the crowded streets and into a quieter space.  It's pretty spacious with a large central empty area, a little hidden luxury.  I needed something quick so I got the burger and fries which was maybe trashy but so very good, I was in and out in under 45 minutes which was great for a sit-down place, efficient service, great food, filling (pre-pandemic)
Finally they're open super nice friendly staff delicious new menu all dishes over the top fast service all drinks are bottled and waxed so cool not a plastic cup finally

This was our first time here. The food was all fabulous and our server was amazing. We loved her. She really elevated the experience. As far as food goes, we split a mushroom flat bread as an appetizer. I had the red snapper entree. It was cooked perfectly. My boyfriend got the skirt steak entree and he was obsessed. I had a bite too and it was delicious. Not pictured but we split the churros for dessert and those were great too. Amazing experience from start to finish. Can't wait to go back!
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment

Stumbled in here for a quick bite and drink before an event and I'm glad I did so I can go back. This is a great space for many occasions and I believe I saw them all when I was there, girls night out, date night, welcome home party, etc. I had the butternut squash soup, which was delectable, so I'm sure the rest of the menu is worth trying. The staff was also so sweet at the bar and made you feel at home. Great spot in the area.

This is my go to brunch or lunch spot. It's great that this is one of few places serve lunch until 4pm. I almost don't want to tell people since I want to keep it myself... Food is always consistent and service is nice. A few outside table is a big bonus for a nice day on this surprisingly quiet street near busy Union Sq Park. The lunch menu is a bit healthier side for my taste. Try the avocado dish or Tuna salad if you want to have something light!
No comment

No comment

Great restaurant! Excellent service a d delicious menu. Very close to union square. Has outdoor seating and indoor tables close to wide open door. Will definitely go back if in that neighborhood again.
No comment

Bowery road was such a find. Hostess Victoria was SO LOVELY as I had to chaotically switch gears from dining in to takeout due to a last-minute work change. The food was delicious, highly rec the spicy rigatoni and pita/hummus. Divine dining and great service. Will definitely be back!

I was looking for a quick dinner spot in the area and came across this restaurant that does have outdoor seating available. We were seated immediately and chose to sit outside. For the appetizer I tried the hummus which came with flatbread. The flat bread and hummus were delicious. We also ordered the steak tartare which is a small plate item and Creekstone skirt steak entree. I wish I had taken a pic of my entree it was delicious and the skirt steak was made exactly how I like it and was flavorful as well. Everything was fresh and delicious! For drinks i ordered a Cigar City Jai Alai IPA on draft and my friend ordered the Blackberry smash. The blackberry splash wasn't that strong in my opinion. The service was great and my experience overall was great as well. I will definitely come back.

Quaint spot in the hyatt union sq. Great bar, really good spicy bloodies. Brunch service was great and the food was on point. We had the tartare, which was nice and fresh with some homemade chips and shaver cheese. Thought it needed a bit more seasoning and was missing some egg yolk but still a good take on tartare in my book. We then had the shrimp and grits. So good. Really peppery with well cooked shrimp and immaculately poached eggs. Absolutely polished the bowl. Lastly the eggs sandwich which was nice and large and came with a side of potatoes that blew our minds. Crispy and salty and homey. They were worth getting all on their own. Overall great meal, fair prices, great atmosphere, and it wasn't even too crowded which was nice. Will def be back again.

No comment

Bowery road has a nice, upscale vibe, and good food, but the service was definitely lacking. I got the pre fixe menu for dinner, which is $39 for a small plate, entree, and dessert. All the food was delicious and I feel like it was a really great deal for the quantity of food and quality of food. Highly recommend the crispy rice small plate. My main issue was the server was so slow. The people sitting next to us sat down 10 minutes after us, had a different waiter, and had their appetizers before we had even been asked to order. I felt like there were 30-45 minutes of sitting around waiting for him to take desserts, being refills, or getting his attention for the bill. I had the wrong menu (lunch is different than dinner) and couldn't get his attention for a new one in the first 10 minutes. Luckily my friends let me borrow theirs after selecting what they wanted. The food was good enough, I'll definitely give it another shot and hope my service was a one off.
Loved the high ceilings and spaciousness - rare in NYC restaurants. Prix fixe menu for an appetizer, main course and dessert for $39 was a great deal. Good service. Good food. Would come again.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is my favorite place in the area. I usually come here for drinks and have been serviced by the one and only Cesar at the bar. He has a great personality, wonderful service and is very accommodating. During my visits I have also had the pleasure of getting serviced by Mayte, just ask for her too. Amazing barista in LES, very friendly and polite. I make sure to come when these guys are working. It's always a good experience when they're here! Great ambiance and even better food
No comment

Came here two days ago and ordered the octopus, lamb, steak tartare, and brussels sprouts. Everything tasted AMAZING. The lamb pretty much fell right off the bone, and I don't think I've had any lamb like that since I've moved here. Would definitely recommend!
No comment

Really enjoyed this place. Was looking for a classy, reasonably priced restaurant for a birthday dinner and this met my expectations. Cocktails were also decently priced for Manhattan and were unique. Had the squid for appetizers and skirt steak for entree. I would go back. There is a large space on the lower floor, good for large groups.

Great casual Saturday brunch with a friend. Both had coffee, and the server did an amazing job of making sure our cups were never even half empty. I had the frittata and it was delicious, filling and the perfect size. Friend had the pancakes and they were divine. Price is very fair for the area and amount of food. Easy to make a reservation on open table and in a great area. Very nice restaurant space, would definitely return!
No comment

Very good food and service. James our server was attentive and accommodating; he recommended pretty much our entire meal for the evening and we got an excellent experience! The burrata was one of my favorites, as well as the mussels which were very fresh and super tasty. For the main course we ended up getting the steak which was cooked to perfection. The branzino which was one of the best I've ever tried, super good with that chimichurri sauce that it comes with. I would highly recommend this restaurant to everyone. Good service from the hostess welcoming greetings to the servers great attention.
No comment

This is an update to a previous 3-star review. I was invited back to the restaurant for dinner and had a wonderful experience. The food was flavorful and the service was excellent. I'm glad I was able to give the restaurant another chance!
No comment

We went to brunch here on a Saturday morning at 11am and enjoyed the ambiance but the experience could have been better. When we arrived, we didn't want to order right away and the waiters asked about 7 times if we wanted to order. I never enjoy feeling rushed to order at a restaurant. For brunch, I ordered the huevos rancheros (gluten free - corn tortillas) which was ok. The temperature of the eggs/food was a little cold which I didn't enjoy. It was also a very small portion. My grandmother really enjoyed her French toast (only 1 piece). My boyfriend liked his egg sandwich and the potatoes were fabulously cooked and tasty. Overall, it is a very cute restaurant but I wasn't thoroughly impressed.
No comment

Excellent place for after work drinks and bites.  The ambiance is very nice and the service is very friendly.  The food items I have had here are delicious and pretty generous.  I've had both apps as well as entrees.  The food is solid.  I would have never known about this place, but my friend's cousin stayed here and it's how I was introduced.  A solid place for drinks and food.
No comment
