Very delicious small plates here. Everything we ordered was super well prepared and very tasty. I highly recommend the sweet potato pomegranate hummus, crushed avocado and roasted cauliflower. Great wines available too. I was a big fan of the Cab by the glass.
No comment
No comment

Went for a night out with friends. Ambiance was great even though it was in a Hyatt. What gives this restaurant five stars is the foods and drinks.  We had a vegetarian and a pescatarian and the food was like a work of art. Plated well and taste even better. I had the fish and my friend had the farrow veggie dish. Though most mixed drinks included fruit- the taste was sophisticated and not too sweet.   The only area that would need improvement is the service. Waiter forgot items we asked for.
No comment
No comment
No comment

My boyfriend and I came here for Valentine's Day dinner. We paid the $65 a person menu. We were a little skeptical coming here for the first time just like going to any restaurant. But I do have to say the food was amazing, they accommodated my boyfriend who has a nut allergy and me who is a vegetarian. The staff was amazing, and the overall restaurant is very romantic. We definitely will be coming back
No comment
No comment
No comment

Pre covid, I've eaten here a few times and always had a good experience. My wife and I ordered take out from there earlier this week for the first time. Our usual go to for ordering in is sushi, Chinese, Thai, stuff that you think would definitely travel well. I was hesitant to order actual restaurant food but I'm glad we did. The food was excellent, we ordered the restaurant week special and had the spicy salmon crispy rice, whipped eggplant dip, crispy chicken sandwich, and the rigatoni. I very highly recommend.
No comment

Stopped in for dinner. We had a party of 4 with a multitude of dietary needs. The menu was diverse enough for everybody in the party to get appetizers and entrees. The food was fantastic, the ambience was superb and cozy. The service was perfect, our server Brian was attentive and knowledgeable. The drinks were creative and delicious and left us wanting to explore the entire menu. Special thanks to Alex, the manager to coming over and checking on us. Great job!!!

Will not come back here. Food was decent but they were unable to accomodate a meal for my girlfriend who is vegan. I also just checked my credit card statement after the meal and they tipped themselves more than I left them. Sketchy stuff guys. I'll make sure my friends know to stay away from this place.

I went to Bowery Road for food and drinks yesterday and I had a fantastic experience. Everyone I interacted with was friendly and the atmosphere was warm. I sat at the bar and enjoyed their happy hour (4-7pm), ordered shishito peppers and pork belly sliders. The flavor of each of these was perfect. I had never eaten shishitos with anything more than lemon and salt, but the sauce was an excellent addition. I could have eaten 3 more orders of pork sliders, they were recommended by the bartender and he did not steer me wrong! I will definitely recommend Bowery Road to others
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here for Sunday brunch with a couple of friends. We easily made a reservation on OpenTable the night before. The place is very cute, located inside the hotel near Union Square. The menu has some pretty unique, moderately priced items and fun cocktails. I got this basically alcoholic iced coffee that was tasty. For my entree I got the breakfast sandwich that came with yummy crispy potatoes. The portion was very filling. My friends got the Chicken or the Egg, which looked somewhat small at first glance but ended up also being very filling and tasty. We were overall very satisfied with our experience. Friendly service and good value. Definitely a spot to try!
No comment

Most delicious meal I've had in a while! They have a delicious selection of wine, but the cocktails truly knocked my socks off. Service was impeccable -- I have a severe nut allergy and every meal on the menu we ordered was customized for me! Will go a million times again.

Beautiful decor and vibe here. The central location is perfect. The food was so good, I love they have a wide variety to choose from and lots of healthy dishes (and some unhealthy depending on your mood lol!) we were celebrating my brothers 17th birthday. They customized our menus to say "Happy Birthday Eric!" And brought him a dessert and card from the staff which made him feel really special. Awesome service from start to finish. They had us out the door just in time for our movie (which was playing right around the corner) will absolutely be back
No comment

I ordered from this restaurant for the first time during restaurant week and I honestly can't wait to order again. The campanelle is absolutely amazing, my partner doesn't particularly like carbonara and practically ate the entire thing. The gentleman I interacted with was so kind and the interior is stunning - we're hoping they reopen for indoor dining in a few weeks with the rest of the city so we can properly check it out.

The granola and Greek yogurt was life changing!! I have never had mint in my parfait until today but now I don't think I can go without it. The granola was soo good too. We also got the ricotta dip and it was so smooth. The only thing that wasn't that great was the burger but I think the sauce was just too much. I would suggest asking for that on the side.The fries were good though thin a crispy.
Delicious healthy food and great service. The portions are good too. We sat outside which was nice.

Great low key restaurant on the ground floor of the Hyatt Union Square. The food was great. The drinks were great (Distilled Spirits is next door).  We had Pat LaFrieda burgers which were delish and started with the crab toast and potatoes, both of which were stellar. If you want understated hotel Elegance away from Madison Avenue or closer to NYU you should give this place a shoot for dinner and drinks.
No comment

5 star for the service , ambiance, location and reasonable price for weekly goers . Hyatt truly represented the best hotel and facility in all cities . best timing on summer or nice day out to do brunch at their outdoor seating . 4 stars for the menu , hope they can change seasonably with more choices inspired by healthy meal , organic and Japanese fusion at the same price range that fits to the scene , People shall appreciate to be regulars . Highly recommend this restaurant . Beautiful , elegant , comfortable classic setting inside out , my type . LOVE

Loved the place. The decor is modern and chic!  The service is friendly and timely.  Loved the food.  They have a tapas flair to unique dishes.  Everyone loved the squash, pork, burrata, crab toast, the tempura mushroom and the branzino w corn and salsa verde (my fav).  I thought the avocado and chips was just ok.  Not a fan of the chips and thought the avocado could have had more flavor.  Everyone loved the specialty cocktails- my fav was the refreshing and tart Westside.  They have a farm to table approach and it is very fresh and tasty.  I highly recommend this relatively new place before the word gets out!
No comment
Skip the main dishes, share lots of apps and get some fun cocktails!
No comment

I walked in to Bowery Road feeling very much like it was a Monday...and on Good Friday, no less! But then my bartender, Fiato, made me the best whisky drink. Just like that, my Monday mood turned into an epic Friday night! Great service, better food, amazing drinks! Ask for Fiato, he's a wizard with drinks!
No comment

Brand new restaurant off of the Hyatt Hotel at Union Square. Food was amazing. Everything we tried was full of flavor and great. The service was top notch and the interior design was about as good as it gets. There are so many new places opening all the time that it is hard to find places that stand out and this definitely did. Highly recommended.

Loved the design and location. Less liked service and food. Take very long time to make an order and for food/drinks to be served. Made our order wrong and took a long time for them to make it right. Wouldn't come here again.
No comment

Came here for lunch with a reservation (probably not needed on a Monday). I had the beet salad and warm grain bowl while my friend had roasted cauliflower and ricotta toast. Everything was really tasty, service was attentive and we got to sit outside on a nice day. Cauliflower and beets were my favorite dishes. The first waitress we spoke to said we couldn't do the 2 for 20$ lunch deal with 2 small plates, it had to be a small plate and a bowl/sandwich which seemed nonsensical since the total a la carte price was going to be less for 2 small plates. The waiter who actually took our order applied the deal for my friend's order of a small plate and a toast. If I had known this was an option, I would have ordered differently.

Had brunch with a friend. Tried Union Square grain bowl and Buratta cheese with olives, tiramisu as desert. All tasted good (except for a part of tiramisu was not softened enough yet). They have a good selection of cocktails, micro breweries beer, wines for drink. Food menus are also relatively extensive for brunch. Service was a bit laxed and took a while for us to order drink and food. Nice decor and relatively quiet. Shared burrata and desert, ordered separate main, one cocktail each and coffee and tea, costed about $100 for brunch, not including tip.

We really like the library next door. Their service is amazing especially during off hours and the mad rush is over. But the restaurant leaves alot of room for improvement especially the hostess. I understand Friday evenings are crazy but we were able to reserve a table on opentable for 7:30p. Instead of making an effort and suggesting a drink at the bar though she has no tables, she said open table has issues and that's not a real reservation because she doesn't have it. Real nice.
No comment

Horrible service.  Decent food. High prices. This is a hotel restaurant (attached to the Union Square Hyatt) and it feels like it. Unless you want to wait 40 minutes for your food and get your drinks finally once you're half way through your lunch, go somewhere else.
The avocado toast was decent but needed seasoning. Service was friendly but hard to track down.

Worst service ever. Hostess incredibly rude and unhelpful. Disgusted by the way she treated HOTEL GUESTS. Food looked disgustingly unappeatzing. Will never be dining here or staying at this hotel again.

Small menu. Very noisy atmosphere. I had the Beer Can Chicken and it's good. Service was friendly. I have no real complaints, but I didn't think it was remarkable either. I may wind up rendezvousing with friends here again soon ... or I may never go again. Who know? It's just one of those kinds of places.

An unexpected gem in the Union Square area. The atmosphere is upscale and modern, but still relaxed and welcoming. It's a great dinner spot for a date or with a group of friends- not too loud or crowded, with plenty of space to accommodate larger groups. The food was all delicious, and very well priced considering the great presentation and overall ambiance of the restaurant. We got the ricotta to start- super simple but well prepared and accompanied with crusty country bread. I got the steamed branzino for my entree- it was super light and fresh, and came with bok choy and in a pesto sauce. The trumpet pasta and steak also looked delicious. I highly recommend this place and would definitely return!
No comment
Great foods and great atmosphere! Love the dessert, chocolate chip cookies and tiramisu are amazing! Also, connected to a bar called The Library that has great drinks.
No comment

The food is amazing! Drinks are great, the interior and atmosphere are very nice! We loved it so much the first time, we came back again. Told our friends about this place too. Everything we ordered was really delicious !

After coming here again courtesy of the general manager, Anays, our experience was 1000X better. We were situated at the front by the waiter station, received service from multiple people, our waiter was so lovely and attentive, food was excellent and fresh just like last time and Anays came over at the end of our meal to thank us for coming in. Appreciate Bowery Road for making things right and taking care of us!

If they seat you in the upper corner nearest to the lobby, you should ask to be moved--there's a freezing draft coming in from the exterior door even when it's closed, and the bright fluorescent light coming in from the apartments across the street cancels out the candle lighting. We just put on our coats and dealt because the restaurant was full and they were nice enough to let us in, but if atmosphere and temperature matter to you, that's something to consider. Food was good, no complaints except for that the size of some entrees could be bigger.
No comment

Very flavorful dishes. I'm gluten, egg, and shellfish intolerant and staff was helpful in navigating the menu. I got the Pork Adobo - so many flavors, and we had burrata and Brussel sprouts for apps. The apps needed a bit more seasoning but were tasty.

Arrived late on a saturday night. Interesting, different vibe. I came with my parents, and they were not a fan. The service is pretty slow. Also, the menu is small and the restaurant was out of the black bass, which is what a portion of our party was planning on ordering. For appetizers we had the crushed avocado, asparagus, and grilled squid. All good, but portions were small. As my entree I had the grain bowl, and added chicken. This was very good and a large portion. The group had positive reviews on the salmon as well. We ordered the desserts on the menu, they were avg and I would pass on in the future. The blueberry smash drink was delicious! Bathrooms are funky, unisex sinks.
No comment
Service is wonderful and the food is outstanding. Multiple visits confirm consistency. Additionally the pricing is moderate and that makes this a top notch choice for any occasion.
Great lunch special. Butternut squash was delicious and served with a great crostini. Good service
Came here for brunch. Sleek interior design and subdued fancy brunch crowd. Went with the short rib benedict - short rib was good and crispy, eggs were the star. Will return for dinner.
No comment
No comment

FANTASTIC meal! We loved everything we ordered. Don't let the three dollar sign fools you--this place is specifically affordable for lunch. They have a $20 special for a dip plate and entre--and the dip plate is a meal in itself. We had the ricotta and the hummus and both were exceptional--though I'd say the hummus and flat bread was top notch.  My husband loved his burger. The rigatoni was also cooked a perfect al dente. Service was also fantastic. We are here on a quick visit, but if ever back. I would come again for sure!

I can go on and on about how much I enjoyed myself at Bowery Road! Best hummus in the world!! The food and service was amazing! Chef Maurice even cared so much he came  to our table to make sure our food was just the way we wanted! Not to mention how the restaurant ambience is to die for!! Whenever I'm in the City I will be stopping in!!

I recently had a breakfast meeting at Bowery Road. The food and service was very good. It was an early meeting so it wasn't very crowded. I would love to go back on a busy night to experience more of what the atmosphere is like. It looks like it would be a great place to get together with friends or have an event.  Also, it's in the Union Square area so conveniently located close to several forms of public transportation.  I'm looking forward to going back.
Perfect mix of the fancy-casual vibe. Food was vey good and reasonably priced. Also several bars around the area. Great place to go to dinner before hitting the city on a Saturday night with friends.

From the atmosphere to the staff to the food, Bowery Road delivers an all around great experience. I think I first felt it right when I arrived. You're greeted by the huge ceilings, modern decor and a smiling my host. On my recent visit, I sat in the back part of the restaurant. It's a bit cozier than the front, but it offers less people watching. I suggest the area if you're on a date or even want something a bit more away from the bustle for a meeting. Along with great staff and a nice atmosphere, what really sold me on the 5 stars for this spot was the food. Everything was delicious - from the beer can chicken to carrots to my friends steak and the cheesecake dessert. I think the menu here is great because it's super versatile. If you brought a group of friends that all have different flavor preferences, I truly feel they'd be satisfied and happy. Plus, to top it off the cocktails were delicious. Rarely do I rave this much about a spot, but I was truly impressed.

After the restaurant rebranded from The 4th to Bowery Road, the menu changed for the better! There are now several menus depending on breakfast, brunch, lunch, dinner, or weekend. I ate there at least 5 times so far; and each time their service and food were consistently good! The hotel atmosphere and interior design is contemporary and comfortable. I even made them a spot to dine with friends and everyone's enjoyed their experience there too!
Party of 4, we opted to grab a few small plates and entrees, food was all great but the best part was the impeccable service throughout.
Everything at brunch was great! Child's grilled cheese was big enough for an adult! Also enjoyed the chicken and waffles.

The food was mediocre. It deserves 3 stars at best. Do not be fooled by the positive reviews. Not only this, the restaurant incorrectly charged me for my entire party of ten people. David the manager promised to refund me for the entire amount several times which he not only did not do but proceeded to give me much grief with my credit card company. I have spent hours on this nonsense since our dinner last November. Do not visit here unless you want the same poor experience. I have never been so mistreated by a Manhattan restaurant and regret selecting it for my friends birthday. There are plenty of places with stellar food and service. Visit blue ribbon brasserie instead. Run!!!!!

The grilled squid was excellent, and the brisket was melt-in-your mouth delicious. My friend had the black bass, which was fine, but not remarkable. My one complaint is that it was really dark in the restaurant.

Great food and ambience, even better service. We had a few small plates to start for sharing, and then the salmon and rigatoni for our entrees. The dessert was my favorite part of the meal! Definitely a place to try.

Excellent service! Everyone is warm and attentive. The food is beautiful and well balanced. There's not one item on the menu that isn't reasonably priced. Everything is fresh and local. Definitely make a reservation!

Really enjoyed my experience here. Beautiful space, really nice servers and every person we came in contact with were very pleasant. We had the mushroom, beer salad, Brussels sprouts and burrata. They were all so good. The chocolate cake was great too

I was so pleased to find this gem last night.  The outdoor seating right there on fourth was perfect for people watching, and the wine selection was excellent.  I especially enjoyed the melon and tomato salad.  I'll be eating here again!
food is ok. ambiance ok. noise level too high. service horrible. you will wait for ever.
No comment
No comment

I passed by Bowery Road about a million times while I was at NYU, but never stopped in. When all of my other go-to brunch places nearby had a wait this past weekend, Bowery Road was empty. So my friend and I decided to chance it and try it out. We both had the beef eggs benedict and thoroughly enjoyed our meal. The eggs were perfectly poached, the hollandaise sauce was light but still flavorful and savory, and the beef just fell apart when you cut into it. Our waiter was attentive and friendly, and the food came out super quickly (we were in and out within 45 minutes).

I was invited to go back to bowery road for dinner, and my experience was excellent. My friend and I had the burrata to start, which was delicious. It comes with raspberries on top, which was a perfect addition. We then had the cauliflower and squid - the squid was really tender, and the cauliflower was so flavorful (with pine nut cream, which was a great combination). For our main course we had the salmon and the burger. The salmon was so soft, with a crunchy crust- it was super flavorful, and the sauces went really well with it. The burger was really good too, but if you don't like pickles, be aware that there are pickles on the burger (not listed on the menu). The fries with the burger were amazing! Super fresh and crunchy, I was really impressed. The drinks were also delicious, we tried the Andalusian G&T, which was sweet and flavorful, and afterwards had the mad men and the devils daughter at the library of distilled spirits next door. Both were really well made. Overall a great experience!

Fantastic! We've been here twice and not only is the service is impeccable, but the food AND drinks are great. There are so many tasty cocktails, I'd have to come back at least five more times to try them all! The menu is an appropriate balance: you can do a collection of small plates, or treat them as appetizers and order main dishes. My only complaint is more of a worry--my boyfriend and I have come twice now and there has been almost no one in the restaurant either time! Either lucky for us, or worrisome for Bowery Rd....

I really like this place. The grilled squid was excellent. I had the endive salad which was also excellent. The service was super friendly. And the drinks were great. A little pricey. But that's New York for you. The Manhattan was definitely a great strong drink!

Such a wonderful dinner experience! Lots of great options to satisfy a range of dietary restrictions at the table (my favorites were the blooming mushroom, the ricotta, and the buratta). The servers were also very knowledgeable and helpful as we read through the menu, providing suggestions that did not disappoint! We were celebrating a friend's birthday, and the manager (Anays) stopped by to wish her a happy birthday and ensure that we were enjoying our meal and experience. The design of the restaurant was also great: and there's a private dining room downstairs that has a really impressive chandelier that hangs from upstairs in the restaurant, definitely very cool. After finishing our meal, we went next door to their library-themed bar, which was a very cool experience. Loved the setting, and had very tasty, creative drinks. Looking forward to our next visit again soon!
No comment

Really surprised by how good this place was. The drinks were very cool and the food was great. We split a bunch of the small plates, the beets seemed to be the favorite. Service for the drinks was pretty slow but the waiter def made up for it by bribing us complimentary desserts.

Delicious upscale brunch spot with reasonable prices and a wide variety of trendy food options. Great atmosphere and service for a work lunch or to catch up with a friend. Had the prix fix and it was a lot of food! Highly recommend for an easy go to.

This was the worst experience I've had with a restaurant group . They are a deceitful greedy group and their food is a joke along with their service. We're actually suing them. That's the fun part as they deserve to be taken before a jury of their peers. Caveat emptor!

Home run across all of my pillars: Atmosphere, Food and Service. Bowery Road has the feel of a larger New York restaurant, but one that's meticulously crafted and well operated. I love vegetarian options and IPAs; it delivered on both. And the adjacent bar in the same hotel (not the restaurant bar, which is also great), is an excellent spot for a pre- or post-meal drink.

I had made a reservation to take my friend and I there for her birthday. Once we got there we were greeted by who I believe was the manager. He was extremely rude and instead of sitting us at a table, he unhappily pointed us to a table to sit at. He made us feel like we were being an inconvenience and it wasn't even busy there. If you're that unhappy with you're job then you shouldn't work there anymore. Needless to say, after 3 minutes of sitting there my friend and I were so uncomfortable we left the restaurant. We will never be going back.

You Must Come Here and ask for Fiato at the Bar!! He's such a wonderful human and his drinks are incredible!! Pretty sure he made this one up so I don't have a name for you but it was excellent and I'm so grateful for his kindness and amazing service! Major thank you to the manager George as well! Will definitely be back! Two thumbs up! Excellent atmosphere and the hummus was fabulous!!

I was suspicious of the 5 star rating given it's been open a few months and somehow has exclusively 5 stars reviews... (tbh I am still suspicious and think some might be planted, new restaurants tend to do that), BUT my real life experience here was actually quite wonderful. The food is great. We shared the hummus to start and it was seasoned excellently with salt and flakes of chili and came with pita bread that was incredibly doughy delicious and salty. So good. I had the beer can chicken and it was amazing. I never like to order chicken at restaurants because I think I should order something special when eating out, but this dish was indeed special. My friend got the grain bowl and enjoyed that too. I would definitely come back.
Fantastic in every respect: food, service,  drinks, pricing, decor, you name it. Lamb ribs a must!!!!!!! Hihhtky recommend.
Wonderful dinner. Our server was very helpful. I have food allergies and she helped modify some of the dishes for me so I would enjoy my experience.
No comment
No comment

I gave this place another shot and stuck with all veggie options this time and was very impressed! Would highly recommend the cauliflower, beets and Brussels (epic)...you could easily make a whole meal of those dishes! They also had Chardonnay this time so I was able to try the white wine/grape/pisco cocktail and LOVED it. After dinner I tried the cocktail lounge next door which was very swanky but not crazy pricey, so a great option for a more casual but still impressive setting. The manager Mei was so sweet and accommodating and I really appreciated my experience coming back here. Will definitely be returning!

Booked a reservation here with a group (6 adults, 2 children) for Thanksgiving. We were seated quickly, the service was very attentive, and the food was delicious. It was a prix fixe 3 course meal, and a much better value than most other places we had looked at in the city, including a less expensive option for children. We tried a few of the seasonal drinks on the menu and all were very good. Overall we had a great experience here, owing as much to the great service as to the food and drinks. I would highly recommend for a holiday meal, and I would definitely come back here to experience drinks or dinner on a regular evening.

Everything was absolutely delicious!!!! I recommend the rigatoni the Bowery burger the toast and ricotta the crispy potatoes and the secret something drink!! I forgot the term. Oh and the Brussels sprouts! Also the salmon tartare.....it's all amazing, cool atmosphere too and fairly priced for that area. My girls in my bridal party and I went after a bridesmaid try on session and I'm so glad we did I'm still thinking of it. And when I should bring the husband...

I have a bunch of food allergies, and they took excellent care of me! If you're wondering, yes! there is food here without gluten or canola oil! Antoneta  was really sweet and attentive... so much that we went back a second time! Food and drinks were delicious!

We had a reservation for 6 people and they would only seat us in the front casual section. We wanted a nicer table towards the back and they made a huge deal about how inconvenient it would be for the waiter. It was literally 2 steps up from the other tables and the place was basically empty so it's not like it was such a stretch to have them serve us there. We had to offer to pay the waiter an extra $20 just to get them to agree, which they never should have accepted if they are running a customer focused establishment. I thought the salmon was good but my friend who got the beer chicken had to spit out her food because it tasted so bad. They ran out of the branzino which was odd considering the it was not late and the place wasn't crowded. And even though the restaurant was not busy, someone had to ask the waiter 3 times for a seltzer before he remembered to bring it over. Not sure why everyone is giving so many high marks, maybe brunch is the way to go here because thumbs down for a dinner venue.

Awesome spot for Lunch in USQ!!  Whenever I am in this area, I have a hard time finding a good place to sit and have a decent meal without spending a crazy amount of money.  Bowery Road is the answer!! Most of the lunch items range from $10-$18 (which will barely get you a salad at the chain place across the street) and for $20 you can pick two menu items as a pre-fix which is an amazing deal!!  The service was polished, friendly and nicely paced. Our server was very attentive but we also didn't feel rushed at all which was nice.  The atmosphere is very pleasant as well, taking you right out of the city into a relaxing but chic environment. The food was very fresh and comforting without being too heavy. Also highly recommend the desserts - we shared two and both were delicious! I was personally there on a business lunch but will definitely return thanks to the great hospitality!!

Had a great time at Bowery Road. They had a load of selections of spirits in a leather bound book. The single malt and Bourbon selections are great! My colleague and I had the ricotta to start. I ordered the Pork adobo, which was amazing my colleague ordered branzino. The manager James came by to check on the table. He was knowledgeable and super friendly. The atmosphere and service was really chill. I will definitely come by again and try their cocktail lounge.
Approachable menu that has something for everyone. Very reasonable price point, welcome addition to the neighborhood.
Very bad service experience . There last Sunday night , seated , no one came to table , after 12 minutes i walked out
Last night we went there for Mother's Day, we were six, and each one of us had something different. It was all superb, we can't wait to go back.

Shout out to my friend and manager of this great restaurant and recommending that I come here to have the French toast!! It was the best French toast I have had in a very long time and the service and atmosphere is amazing here too, a place that u definitely want to check out!!!!

This is a really excellent restaurant in a very convenient location near Union Square. The ambience is lovely --  it's tastefully decorated, lively, but not over the top noisy. Service was impeccable, and the restaurant took good care of a dining companion who had a number of dietary restrictions. I enjoyed the beet salad and steamed bass. The steak got a thumbs up as well. Also, my tequila cocktail was dangerously delicious.
From terrible food to unbelievably slow service to more than one long curly hair in our salad. This dining experience was a disaster.

Great drinks, attentive service & delicious food! We enjoyed everything, especially the grilled squid, roasted cauliflower, beets & faro plate. It's a comfortable setting. Nice ambiance. Small & large plates. I can here with my teenager & adult son. We all enjoyed the evening!

Just right, just right.  I had the short ribs benedict for breakfast.  The muffin is perfectly toasted, the hollandaise sauce is just right with a hint of mustard.  Staff is warm, friendly and helpful.  Tasteful decor and informal brasserie.  I can just relax here.  I don't usually write reviews but this time I'm compelled to.  It's just so pleasant here.

I have had eaten in this restaurant for brunch many times. But till today I just realized that they manipulated the tips I signed!!!! It is totally unbelievable. I signed for 18% tips but they got 30% tips from my card. This should not be tolerated

The food we ordered, which sadly we werent able to get pictures of the Eggplant Parmesan, USQ Market Grain Bowl, Grilled Pork Chop, Roasted Broccoli, Pumpkin Cheesecake, and Chocolate Pot de Creme, because we dug right in. They were all just tasty, perfectly seasoned & balanced, for lack of a better word to describe the flavors mixed in together. The braised cabbage in the Grilled Pork Chop, for example, was truly braised well and just enough that it still retained its crunchiness. There wasnt a lot of white bean fondue, but it was good enough mix of flavor with the bacon mustard vinaigrette, which satisfied my cravings for bacon without actually eating pieces of bacon at breakfast. They were just enough mix, and oh the pork chop was delightful. I could eat a whole order by myself. Full disclosure - i am a carnivore, and i go for meat over seafood & veggies eap when that meat is flavored incredibly:-). I knocked off a star (would be half a star knocked off if that was possible) because i found the Market Grain Bowl kind of dry:-(. It had a flavor, but it wasnt memorable for me. But then that was probably because the pork chop and eggplant parmesan, which had an unbelievable tasty tomato sauce in it, ruined my palate for the salad hehehe!

Superb! Great food and enjoyed the decor of the restaurant. Waitstaff was very attentive. Lamb ribs, blooming mushroom and hummus apps really good. Pork adobo, skirt steak and grilled branzino were amazing. I had a great time eating here with my friends. Will definitely be back!

This place was completely overrated. Food was good but not great - just fine for nyc standards. The server was super pushy on drinks. And I ordered a decaf coffee, and confirmed it was decaf when he brought it (server confirmed yes) and yet, I am sitting up at 1 am , still not tired (I know I was served caffeinated coffee at the end of our meal).

Awesome place. This is an exceptional restaurant with consistently excellent food, drinks, service, and ambience. I've been to this place several times alone or with friends since it recently opened. Everyone has left feeling very pleased with everything. The menu is different. It challenges your taste with creative options (The salmon with beet and berries rocked my taste buds: Delicious!!!). The place is sexy - dim lights, loud enough to have a nice vibe, cool lounge music and a modern feel to it. Great team too: Rafael, the manager, introduces himself, makes sure every detail is well taken care of for you and your group. Helping Rafael, a sexy and friendly hospitality crew (Max, Jeffrey, Antoneta, and, at the bar, Eduardo) makes everyone feel at home.

We had a delicious brunch here- the food was fantastic and the service was top notch! We had great dishes such as shrimp and grits with poached eggs, west coast toast and a big juicy burger. Cocktails were inventive and refreshing! For dessert we had a slice of moist coconut cake with a creamy frosting sprinkled with toasted coconut flakes, and a refreshing citrus pie. This place is well-run: service was perfect- the hostess, servers and manager all worked together to anticipate everything we needed. Highly recommended!!

Go here! Yes it's next to a hotel but it is NOT hotel food! Sooooo delicious and not to mention awesome service. Truly one of our family's favorite brunch/lunch spots. Haven't had dinner here but imagine it'd be equally as amazing!
Had a great experience at Bowery Road! The service was impeccable and the ambiance was beautiful. I loved the burrata toast and the carrots.. not expected! Will definitely be going back there.
Went for a girls night - great food! Best service! And don't forget to enjoy a drink in the library before or after dinner.

I went to Bowery Road for a girls dinner two weeks ago and ended up staying for 3+ hours. We started our night out at the bar with delicious gin cocktails and were then seated once our table was ready. The bartenders and waitresses were very accommodating and even the manager came over to check on us throughout the night (nice touch)! We started with a round of appetizers - Burratta and Avocado Toast, which were both delicious. One of my friends has a severe nut allergy, and they were accommodating and cautious about that, which not every restuarant in NYC always is. Dinner itself was delicious, Ipersonally had the steak and it was thin and to my liking. Overall the ambiance was awesome and made for a perfect girls night. I'd go back for a date night too. Oh, and the bathrooms were clean and easy to find/get to. I'd absolutely go again!

Where do I even begin with this place? For starters, the service is exceptional. We made a reservation for three in advanced but at some places that still requires a long wait. We were seated immediately and our waitress was not only incredibly polite, but super attentive and gave us a ton of very helpful recommendations. We went for dinner and started with some of the dips, spreads, and small plates. My dairy-eating friends had the Lioni Burrata, which apparently was incredibly fresh and delicious. The crushed avocado was delicious and had a pinch of chimichurri in it that really gave it a nice kick. the market salad might sound basic but it was everything but that and the buttermilk dressing really took it to another level. I highly recommend the Roasted Ora King Salmon even if you're not a fan of salmon. It's hard to find a place that does salmon right but this salmon wasn't just tasty but also super smooth and juicy. The brown butter vinaigrette gives it so much flavor and keeps it nice and moist. Let me put it this way, the food is so good you basically want to take your time with each bite. Sure, it might be a little pricey but it's definitely worth it, especially if you're coming for a special occasion or on a dinner date. Now let me get to the drinks. The cocktails here are great. We all had the Andalusian G&T which I was surprised that I liked because I'm not normally a fan of gin. It was strong enough without the gin overpowering the cocktail's sweet flavors. Now let me get to the ambiance of this place because it really is part of what makes this restaurant so special. It has a very romantic industrial feel to it. It's also intimate enough where you can actually have a conversation and hear each other speaking, which is a plus for me when it comes to dining. It's such a pretty place. Like I said, I highly recommend this place for dinner out with friends or for a date, for sure. I plan on coming back soon because I heard the brunch is amazing!

Where do I even begin? Had dinner there with 4 girlfriends last night, it was a SH*TSHOW from the moment we sat down. It was freezing, and there was a flurry of activity around whether or not they could turn the AC down. In the meantime, we ordered drinks. The waiter had to ask a few times what our actual drink orders were. Then they were going to move us to a nearby table. Then one of the waiters gave it to another party. Took another 15 minutes to get our drinks and only one of them was right. We sent them all back. Then the fire alarm went off. By this time, we thought we were being Punk'd. Luckily, the food was decent. But that did not make up for the total cluster that is this restaurant.
Absolutely loved this place. The food was delicious and the service was great. We sat outside, which was lovely. Would highly recommend coming here!
My friend chose Bowery Road and I'm glad he did.  Neither of us had been here before.  The food was excellent.  I would definitely recommend.

Followed the recommendations of those before me and they were right. Avocado smash was great, grilled squid excellent and the fluke ceviche was nice but could have used a bit more acid. Had one of the vodka and lemon specials which was an easy drinker. Would absolutely come back, might skip the ceviche and try a couple other things including the black cod. Nice wait staff and she convinced me to try dessert (she just asked really)... panne cotta with sherbet. Save room for it.

Excellent Restaurant!!! This place came highly recommended by my brother Maurice when visiting NY and let me say it did not disappoint. We had a bridesmaids dinner here after dress shopping and although we originally planned on going somewhere else, we would have sadly missed out on this gem. We did not have a reservation, but they were completely accommodating. We had a group of 6 women, all very hungry and one pregnant and we all agreed there was not one thing we ate, we did not enjoy. As a group of foodies who have traveled all over and had great food, we all agree the food was PHENOMENAL!!  The mushroom, grilled squid, salmon tartare, crab toast and hummus set the stage for a great dinner.  The rigatoni reminded me of being back in Italy. Top notch!! The food was so good, that a day later we are still talking about it. We are looking forward to returning on our next trip to NY. The ambiance was very modern and chic and the servers were great.  I highly recommend this restaurant and only regret that I didn't try those delicious looking croissants, but don't worry, I will be back soon.

stopped in randomly for brunch and it was great! i had the egg gruyere swiss chard sriracha aioli egg sandwich minus the bacon and it was amazing! the potatoes it came with were beyond! my friend had the pancakes and loved them too! great place!
No comment

I had to update my review to a 1 STAR and I will NEVER be going to Bar Crudo again - even for just oysters. I took my boyfriend and his family for his 30th birthday because of how much he loves oysters and I had faith in crudo and decided to give  it another chance HORRIBLE MISTAKE!!!! The staff COMPLETELY ignored our table of 6 - not to mention they sat us by the door (a big party who will be paying a big check?!!??) and we all froze. To top it off - there was a hair wrapped around one of our guests lobster cabonara - GET THIS - they offered to replace the disgusting hairy meal with a new one - nice right? WRONG because THEY CHARGED US FOR THE MEAL!!!! And continued to IGNORE OUR TABLE! DO NOT I REPEAT DO NOT BOTHER WITH THIS SPOT. SOOOOO NOT WORTH IT FOR MEDIOCRE HAIRY FOOD AND HORRIBLE SERVICE/ATTITUDE !!!

Amazing service. We went for happy hour, the deals were good. Oyster selection is great. I will definitely visit again!
No comment

My friends and I came here for our friends birthday and her goodbye trip. The waiters were very sweet and nice. Food was good, the drinks were really good. rice was on the dry, but everything else was good. There raw bar of oysters was really good, got about 48 oysters. We did make reservations when we came.

I was actually pretty surprised by how empty this place was during happy hour. I made a Resy reservation for 6 people at 5:15pm for happy hour on a Wednesday and it wasn't necessary as all since the place only had a couple of other guests. The service was amazing. Our group got a couple of rounds of drinks, poutine, mussels, and a three dozen $1.50 oysters. The food was good and the vibes were chill. I wouldn't say this is a standout place but certainly a good place to enjoy happy hour.

My absolute favorite spot in park slope for drinks and food, love ceviche and seafood here, and just when I thought it couldn't get any better - I tried Brazilian cheese bread and omg I'm in trouble. I've been back a couple of times already just for that warm fluffy cheesy heaven and had to order a second portion today it was that good!!

Came here for our anniversary, and everything was outstanding. We ate the Brazilian cheese bread, scallop ceviche, escargot, and grilled fish and chips. The latter two dishes were really standouts. The team also provided us with a glass of wine on the house in honor of our anniversary, a gesture that was very much appreciated. We'll be back, and soon!
No comment

Great seafood place! The shrimp appetizer was very good, the shrimp actually had a seafood-y taste. We ordered the paella with lobster. All of the seafood was cooked perfectly! Except the lobster was so tender it didn't have any texture. I thought the rice was too salty. The service was great, to the point where someone came to our table 6-7 times to refill our water which was unnecessary. Highly recommend the cucumber cocktail and change of seasons cocktail
No comment

I usually don't leave bad reviews but I ordered some stuff by Door Dash.  The seafood pasta $34 and ceviche $18.  Everything tasted great so I can't complain about that but the portion size for the ceviche is ridiculously small for $18.  And the seafood pasta was pretty expensive considering there were only 2 clams in there and one of them was unopened.  Plenty of mussels though.  The oysters I have to say are very good.

Nice seafood spot in Brooklyn! Food is a little on the pricier side but I was overall happy with the quality. Cocktails were kind of meh though. I had the seafood paella which was smaller than I thought it'd be; great flavors and they don't skimp on the seafood though. My sister had the octopus which was delicious and really tender; that being said, the portion size was pretty small. Oysters are decent, nothing particularly noteworthy.

Great place for oysters and drinks....bartender Wayne is amazing... shrimp dish and crab cakes are Ok.... we will be back for happy hour oysters..

We came by because I'm a ceviche fanatic but they portion just wasn't big enough for my tummy . My date wasn't pleased with the portion they served the paella either . It was however tasty, and the staff was friendly . I think I would give it another try, just not when we're hungry .

Really great service and had a wonderful meal! We ordered the tuna ceviche and it was really fresh, ask for extra plantain chips. The seafood paella had all sorts of treasures in it and was fun to eat. The highlight of the meal was the fish and chips. I loved that instead they serve the fish as a grilled branzino. It's so flavorful and delicious and I love the grilled taste. The fries were also seasoned so well didn't even need the ketchup. Would definitely recommend trying!
All the food was delicious. Wonderful location in Brooklyn, super chill with a great happy hour menu ( oysters!) Strongly recommend the ceviche and empanadas but everything was amazing.

For the last few days I had been craving oysters and was about to make the trek to sheepshead to dine at one of my fav spots for oysters. But I was in need of a different atmosphere and remembered I had this place saved for quite a bit. Glad I did! Walked into this cozy lil spot and was greeted by smiles and a friendly staff. Sat down and got the ball rolling. Jessica who is probably one of the best servers I've ever met new the menu and told me exactly what to get. Started with the Passion Pisco which was really good but I couldn't get past the frothy egg thing so I had Prosecco after. The oysters which are their signature oysters were really good and we had about 24... they were perfect in size. Crab cakes were moist and crispy. I always find people over salt crab cakes to grab flavor and this was not the case. They were perfect. The poutine was for for 2 and I absolutely loved the devil eggs. I enjoyed the carrot cake but it had a weird bitter taste. Still demolished it.. everything was great and the staff continuously checked up on us and I mean the whole staff not just our server Jessica. We got there exactly at the start of dinner which was empty and by the time we left there was def a crowd. Will be back again!!!!
Mediocre and overpriced. Staff was attentive but the food was lacking in flavor. Oyster happy hour would be the only reason I go back.
What a great happy hour spot. The staff was so friendly and nice. My fave was the ricotta app.

I noticed too late people weren't finishing their cocktails and once I got mine it was apparent why. My cocktail, Diego, was super underwhelming with no flavor profile. It left me wanting even a scent of flavor. The oyster shooter didn't come in a shot but a small goblet cup filled with a tremendous amount of underwhelming liquid (I had no spoons so fished out the egg/oyster with a fork. It was challenging yet the best and only good thing about that). The poached octopus was keeping up with the theme of just being edible. They reminded me of canned octopus. Not the budget/affordable kind but the pricy kind (definitely use the lemon, it adds much needed flavor). The snails are to die for! Hands down in the top of best creative take on escargot I have had thus far, brava  (stars for this and the excellent service). The paella was also just meh. The rice was slightly over cooked but the mussels, clam and squid were nicely cooked (not chewy at all) however the shrimp and chorizo were quite tough. Overall I'm glad I get to tick this one off my list of eateries but it is not a go to joint for seafood.

Very happy w tapas and oysters! Friendly and attentive service! Great addition to park slope!

$1 oyster at happy hour... can't beat that!  The service was attentive. Front of the house seated us quickly and gave us flexibility on where we felt comfortable sitting. The oysters were fresh, clean tasting, and again at $1 you just can't go wrong. Ordered 36 between 2 people so we obviously were big fans!  My main was the Mariscada, which is a delicious Green herb clam soup served with mussels, calamari and shrimp. Perfect soup that eats like a meal on a cold day. Would order this again and come back for another happy hour. My brother ordered the fish and chips but swapped out the fries for a salad. He loved his meal. The fish was pan fried branzino which is a solid play and substitute for the beer battered fish. I would order this next time.

Great seafood paella! A bit on the expensive side but worth it. Plenty of seafood - the shells took up a lot of space and didn't  leave a lot of room for rice; they should pack it with a bit more rice added. Highly professional service & delivery. No complaints except want more.
Amazing, unique cocktails and wonderful food. Service was top notch. All of the seafood in our paella was perfectly cooked and the oysters fresh.

Wonderful oysters and friendly attentive service. Loud music and some fried food that was oily cost it a star- but the oysters were worth it.
Service was great, food came quick but I don't feel like there were enough seafood options

Went here on a whim on a Friday early afternoon. It was quite and I was attended to immediately. They serve complimentary sparkling water which I love. I only got oyster and it was happy hour so they had a great seat. The oysters were delicious and fresh I ended up getting a second dozen! Definitely recommend!

Went here with a group of 5 for drinks and oysters. Their happy hour food items and drinks really aren't that much of a steal, but the oysters are excellent. The escargot was a good volume for the price but was SO garlicky it was difficult to eat much. Octopus was delicious. Someone at our party requested substitutions in the paella and they had no problem accommodating.

Wow!  Recently visited our son in Brooklyn and we had brunch here on Sunday.  Live jazz, great bloody mary, authentic Spanish food!  It was superior!  Two of us had the Huevos Rotas and the other two had Paella (one regular and the other breakfast).  Absolutely outstanding!  Bring a friend to share the Huevos Rotas!  Three perfect sunny side up eggs on a nest of the most delicious fries accompanied by thin slices of real Spanish Jamon!  The Paella was not too saffron forward and packed with seafood and spices.  Wonderful experience!

Love the people here. Everything here was great. Of course the happy hour sign caught my attention $1.50 oysters didn't know the city was still doing happy hour. Oyster were fresh and juicy! Also had some spritzers it wasn't for me. The frozen red sangria was good. Will def come again especially since they have a full bar now.

Perfection. Wonderful customer service from the door. The host was so nice and pleasant. Our server, Amanda, continued the experience and made our entire night special. The food is exquisite. We had the Seafood Tower with half lobster to start. Delicious and fresh. We moved on to appetizers and enjoyed the Duck Toast, Deviled Eggs, and Crab Cakes. All were delicious, especially the Duck Toast with the whipped Ricotta. The Brussel Sprouts were perfect for me and my wife as they were crisp and delicious. Lastly the drinks were perfect. We will be back to try the paella and Fideua Negra. Thank you for a wonderful date night.

This place is so dope. From the food to the service. Came here around 9 on a Saturday night with my boyfriend and friend and were intrigued by the cute outdoor seating. All the tables for outdoor seating were already full so we opted for the table by the door. The food was so good and I am so sad I did not get the seafood paella but I'll come back for it! We got the scallop ceviche, shrimp pesto pasta, fish and chips, and the habanero plantains. The plantains and the fish and chips were the best. It's not fried fish!! Love it. So flavorful. Will definitely be back!

Great HH selection and oysters were super fresh. Ceviche and mussels were delicious but the seafood paella was slightly underwhelming because it was bland. I will definitely come back and try other things. Wines were also nice too.

Stopped by on a busy Monday night and were wonderfully surprised, or maybe we were just very fortunate.   The kitchen was overwhelmed but between their hard work and an excellent waitress we were treated to amazing Beausoleil oysters, well crafted paella, and tasty crab cakes.   All dishes were fresh and excellent!   I am not surprised that the restaurant was crowded and others around were empty.  Care and a high quality, and attentive service go a long way!

Although my oysters were great this was unacceptable only person I want to see at the bar that close to me is someone offering a drink... not a four legged creature. I wasn't compensated just took a drink off for saying it look like I need one on the walk in (ok). Bartender was sweet just didn't appreciate a manager not coming out to apologize for that.

I come here for  the Oysters, which are pretty good. I normally opt for take out I Never actually dined in, however the menu options are appealing.

4 stars from me means it is definitely worth checking out the place. 5 stars from me means please make a trip to come check out the place! We checked out this place in one of the terrible weather days (which could have negatively affected my review due to bias) however, I am giving this place 5 stars still because of taste of foods alone. Probably one of the best Spanish/Sea foods I have had in awhile! I will definitely come back to try more foods when the weather is nice! Can't wait.

Inspired by NYC restaurant week to go we decided to try a takeout order which included a choice of appetizer and entree. The first course options were a beet and lentil salad or deviled eggs. We opted for the huevos and were not disappointed. For the main we got the seafood paella. Vegetarian paella was also an option here. They have outdoor and indoor dining options which looked cozy. Would return in warmer weather for a springtime seafood treat.

My partner is big on seafood so I was excited to take him here, but I am not as big of a seafood eater. However, I was so surprised and excited to see so many wonderful vegetarian options. The patatas bravas were 10/10 and I really enjoyed my vegetable paella. Drinks were great too and our server was super sweet!
Great happy hour food is always good very cute place with out door dining and friendly staff

This place is so friggin delicious. I went with my mom to try the food and drink after hearing all the great things about it from coworkers. It did not disappoint. The drinks were tasty, the appetizers were both unique and delicious. I am vegan and they have a secret vegan fish and chips or paella (I ordered the paella) and it was seriously as good as the ones I had in Spain. My mother had the octopus pizza and said it was wonderful. I'd come back a million times for the paella alone!

Every time we eat here it is a wonderful experience. The seafood is fresh & mouth watering, delicious combination of flavors.  We have never had a dish or any food we didn't enjoy immensely. The owner Ronni is friendly & personable, he enjoys watching his customers enjoying their food selection. The mixologist is superb, she makes the most fabulous mixtures that are incredible that you want to try something different all the time.  This is one of our favorite restaurants.  It is a treat to enjoy delicious food. And the staff is friendly, helpful & welcoming.

I've been coming to bar crudo for a couple years now and their food never disappoints. The seafood paella is a must and you can get it without the sausage if you dont eat pork which is nice for a person like me. Lovely staff and great food. Perfect for a date night or for a group of friends!

Just found this Patagonia style seafood and grilled food stunner. Feel like you slipped into Chile or Paraguay. Thanks

The food options are great, I go for the seafood mostly. Pleasant staff, happy hour is a plus. I didn't favor the outdoor seating that was directly on the sidewalk with no barricade....pedestrians brushing past me was such a trigger.

The seafood is fresh. The service is warm, fun, and friendly. The drinks are delicious! The happy hour from 4-7pm is a great deal!!! The menu has a lot of rotating selections. The vibe here is young and fun. Cocktails are original and creative. This a fun date spot--there's enough foot traffic to people watch and the good food and drinks create a very nice atmosphere.

came here last night since i was around the area and let me tell you is the best decision i made, starting from the oysters, it tastes amazing, they farm their own oysters and it only cost 1$ during happy hour, also tried their paella which would also recommend, looking forward to visit again from queens!

Loved this place! They had an amazing oyster selection (my favorite food!) and the duck prosciutto toast was a lovely light brunch. The staff was incredible. The bartenders made me feel so welcome and were so fun to talk to and gave great recommendations.
We came here for our wedding anniversary and it was the perfect spot for a celebration! Warm service, nice ambience, and tasty food. Loved the scallop ceviche and paella. Will definitely be back!

This is my first time visiting this restaurant and the service was so disappointing that my party of 10 people did not get a chance to eat here. The problem I have with this restaurant is their lack of professionalism. On new years evening 2023, my party of 10 was already seated at 6:15pm and the hostess informed us that we had to leave by 7:20pm because they had another party coming in. Let's be for real, we were receiving weird vibes since we walked in. I believe because we were black, they did not want to serve us. We were not a rowdy group, we just wanted some good food while celebrating our cousin's bday. If this place had a party coming in at 7:20pm, why bother sitting my group down at 6:15pm. This place is racist and I will never spend a dime here or recommend anyone come to this establishment. This place need a lesson on racial discrimination and learn to treat all patrons with dignity and respect regardless of a person's skin color. This is sad that Bar Crudo is starting the new year being discriminatory.

Thank you for explaining regards to this oysters species, hence, updating my review.  The 2 missing stars are for the person that shucked the oysters.  Let me further explain, in the photo, some of these oysters were ruined due to the shucking process.  The meat was all cut up. Kindly let me know if I'm mistakenly describing them.

Sunday Brunch. Bloody Mary was great. Jennifer was high energy and personable. She helped us make good choices. Good looking out. The crab cakes were good even for the second day. Can't wait to try the ceviche new to the menu. Will be back soon.

Had a bunch of small plates and everything was great. Oysters were fresh. Ricotta with duck prosciutto mmm outta control good. The energy is relaxed and chill. The music was a bit loud and I had trouble hearing convo at the table but the food made up for it. Steak frites was okay with a fresh green salad on the side. Drinks were sturdy and service was excellent.

This place is a staple of the neighborhood. The best seafood and drinks in the area hands down. Just leaving a review of this place makes my mouth start to water. Not only that but the staff is super kind and attentive. Highly recommend.
After I requested them to change the hip hop music, everything was great.  The atmosphere, service, and food were great.

Randomly found this place last night while in the area. Great ambiance, lovely service. Our waiter was Xavier super friendly and attentive. They have good cocktails i had the namesake cocktail. We had the crab cakes for appetizers. They are hand made and we're so tasty and flaky. For my entree i had the burger with extra orange jam on the side. The chorizo adds some really tasty flavor. Price point is about $$$ but it is worth it. I will return.  It would be a great date spot too. Lastnight it was just 2 of us ladies i seen quite a few sets of ladies nights gatherings.

Great happy hour and service! Very friendly staff, good music, overall nice vibe. Couldn't ask for more!

Came here for brunch and sat outside in front of the restaurant, which was great for people watching. Overall we had a pleasant experience. We started with the ceviche, which was very good, though could have used something to go with it to add a bit of texture. I had the salmon cubano, which although it was not quite what I was expecting, it was delicious. Huge portion too. Fries were cooked perfectly and the mustard sauce it came with was very flavorful. The octopus dish my girlfriend got was also huge (definitely a good bang for your buck) and it too had a ton of flavor. Drinks were good, server was super friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend.

I had my eye on Bar Crudo for some time and finally made it during happy hour - on a weekend! I could have totally filled up on the $1 oysters and clams, they were nice and fresh though on the smaller side. The wine specials at $9/glass aren't bad either. The mains we ordered were very good overall. I appreciated the execution and attention to detail but less so with the flavors. I was actually most impressed with the sandwich my husband ordered- it was served on a fluffy ciabatta roll, I don't know how that's even possible- but the charred lemon aioli with my octopus was really interesting as well. Just based on happy hour alone though, 5 stars!

Amazing service and great food. The vide was so chill, the food wait staff welcomed me and made me feel at home. I believe the owner's name is Ronny, I pretty much let him give me whatever dish. I had oyster (which  is local grown), escargot, and octopus... also too much wine.

I am not big on reviews but this  place is worth talking about. The staff the food the ambiance all five stars. The price isnt bad either. This is a little Diamond sitting right in the middle of park slop. I prefer to sit at the bar and talk to the Bartender. The only thing i would change is putting a TV at the bar that way people who watch Sports while eating can sit there and watch whatever they want (or that's popular that day) and enjoy an incredible meal. Sometimes i want to watch the yankee game or Nets gave while im eating, i choose other places cause they have TV's and this little place doesn't...

My wife and I went for our anniversary. Amazing hospitality, amazing raw bar, amazing cocktails! We'll definitely be coming back!

I grabbed dinner with my friend here the other night and had a pretty good experience. We got the oysters which were pretty standard in my opinion, I think two that we ate felt not as fresh though? The cheeseboard was super delicious, not a lot of places will give you as much fruit as they did. It really does make the board more enjoyable for me, so I really appreciated it! Friendly staff but I don't think they had AC so beware. It can get hot and sweaty.

Really great, can't wait to come back and try more. The burger was epic!! Bacon and chorizo on a burger? Sold.

Food is delicious, love love love this place. I just wish they had a bigger wine selection. It would be nice to have more options, even if it was by the bottle.

I'm so happy I came here!! Food was so fresh and got to take advantage of happy hour. This team has their service on point. I did not have to wait on anything and all the guys were super attentive and friendly. I hope to be back soon. Thank you Alvaro and the rest of the team for making my visit a stellar one!

Giant portions that are worth the money! If you're familiar with typical Spanish tapas, the portions here are far larger. It's not 100% authentic Spanish cuisine, but it's definitely enjoyable (and I am very picky when it comes to Spanish food!!)

The drinks, oysters and duck toast were excellent. Service was very slow, but I can't fault the wait staff. It was very busy and he was very attentive. The entrees were ok. I had the octopus. The plate was just too busy for my liking and one of the sauces was very mustardy which drowned out all of the other flavors. The fish and chips were underwhelming. The fish was cooked well and was tasty, but nothing really special about it.

Chic new bar and restaurant in park slope. We came with a party of 4 on a Sunday night. Great atmosphere and music. Very modern interior design. The owner is the same owner as the successful Mexican restaurant next door (Chela). They had a extensive menu with seafood specialties. On Sunday there are $1 oysters all day so we started off with a dozen. Usually $1 oysters can be a hit or miss but their pick was delicious and not too small. My group ordered the bronzino, seafood bouillabaisse, and I had the NY strip. The food was absolutely amazing with lots of purées in the dishes. The price is ok for the area. Service was attentive and fast. They have a good wine and drinks selection. Overall a great experience. My wife and I look forward to returning to try some of the other dishes.

It's been one week and I still can't stop talking about AND craving the food we had here. I won't leave a lengthy review here but wanted to just say, If you're contemplating this Restaurant and are hoping these reviews will give you a sign THIS IS IT! you won't regret it.

I met my husband here for dinner after work one Friday. We ate outside at a table for two on the sidewalk. First impression was that the staff is super friendly and attentive. We arrived during Happy Hour and ordered a bunch of oysters at an amazing price. The oysters were fresh and tasty. For dinner I ordered the Fideua Negra (which is basically seafood paella with pasta instead of rice) and my husband ordered the seafood paella. The food was scrumptious!! Our waiter warned us that the dishes we ordered would contain a lot of food (he was correct) but we decided to order them anyway since we like leftovers. I will definitely be back!
